title: 3 Profitable Stocks We Steer Clear Of
summary: This article identifies three profitable companies—IDEX (IEX), CooperCompanies (COO), and Agilent (A)—that StockStory advises investors to avoid despite their current profitability. title: 3 Growth Stocks to Add to Your Roster

title: JFrog (FROG) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: JFrog reported a strong Q4 and full-year 2025, exceeding guidance with a 24% increase in total annual revenue and 45% growth in cloud revenue. The company saw significant expansion in its security core products, which now represent over 10% of total ARR and 16% of RPO, driven by increased adoption amid rising software supply chain threats. JFrog also strategically built out its MLOps platform to support AI workflows, securing partnerships with NVIDIA and Hugging Face, and expects continued durable cloud growth and adoption of its bundled security solutions in 2026.

title: QUALCOMM Incorporated $QCOM Holdings Boosted by LSV Asset Management

title: Arista (ANET) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Arista Networks (ANET) reported record Q4 2025 and full-year 2025 revenues, driven by strong growth in AI and cloud networking. The company raised its 2026 full-year revenue guidance to $11.25 billion and increased its AI networking revenue target to $3.25 billion. Despite ongoing supply chain cost pressures, particularly for memory and silicon, Arista is expanding its product offerings, increasing capital returns, and strengthening its position in the evolving AI and networking landscape.

title: Aehr Test Systems stock soars after securing AI processor burn-in win
summary: Aehr Test Systems (NASDAQ:AEHR) stock surged 15% after announcing a key production order for its Sonoma systems from a leading hyperscale customer. These systems will be used for production burn-in of next-generation, high-power AI processors for data center applications. This order validates Aehr's Sonoma Ultra platform for demanding AI processor testing and is expected to lead to significant future expansion.

title: Brady Corp stock hits all-time high at 95.0 USD

title: Arteris Network-on-Chip Technology Achieves Deployment Milestone of 4 Billion Chips and Chiplets
summary: Arteris Inc. has announced that its network-on-chip (NoC) technology has been deployed in over 4 billion chips and chiplets, marking a significant milestone in the AI era. This growth is largely driven by increased adoption in AI-enabled systems, where Arteris's technology addresses the rising demands for compute density, energy efficiency, and chiplet integration. The company's NoC IP is crucial for complex semiconductor designs and is seeing accelerating adoption across various industries, contributing to its variable royalty revenue stream.

title: Why Vontier (VNT) Stock Is Trading Up Today

title: Should You Buy the Invesco QQQ ETF With the Nasdaq Near a Record High? Here's What History Says.

title: Owning Bitcoin Through an ETF: Scale or Lower Fees With IBIT and HODL

The choice between them depends on an investor's strategy, with IBIT favoring those who trade frequently and HODL suiting long-term buy-and-hold investors.

title: Nixxy, Inc. Announces Strategic Partnership with PayToMe.co to Accelerate Telco + Fintech Convergence

The partnership seeks to create high-value revenue streams, enhance customer experience, and automate compliance for cross-border transactions and mobile commerce.

title: Text, talk, then pay: Nixxy and PayToMe tie payments to messaging
summary: Nixxy (NASDAQ: NIXX) has partnered with PayToMe.co to integrate embedded payments, invoicing, and AI-driven compliance into its global telecom and messaging infrastructure. This collaboration aims to create new revenue streams by enabling payment-enabled messaging, invoice-to-settlement workflows, and cross-border compliance within communication channels. The partnership leverages PayToMe.co's connections to 12,000 financial institutions and major tech partners like Stripe and NVIDIA.

title: 3 Reasons to Avoid EFSC and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: This article advises investors to avoid Enterprise Financial Services (EFSC) due to lackluster revenue growth, a declining net interest margin, and weak EPS growth. Instead, it suggests looking into "high-quality stocks" that have historically outperformed the market, highlighting specific examples like Nvidia and Comfort Systems, and encourages readers to explore StockStory's curated list of market-beating stocks.

title: This High Dividend ETF Keeps Investors Out of Harm's Way and It's Soaring
summary: The Invesco S&P 500 High Dividend Low Volatility ETF (SPHD) is gaining traction, up 7.4% year to date and recently hitting a 52-week high, outperforming the S&P 500. This ETF focuses on the 50 highest-yielding and least volatile stocks from the S&P 500, offering a 30-day SEC yield of 4.54% and monthly dividends. While it aims to reduce risk and provide income, it may lag the market when growth stocks are in favor.

title: Insider Selling: Benchmark Electronics (NYSE:BHE) CEO Sells 25,000 Shares of Stock

title: Citi Remains Bullish on Seagate Technology Holdings (STX) Amid Stable Demand
summary: Citi has reaffirmed its 'Buy' rating on Seagate Technology Holdings (STX) and increased its price target from $460 to $480, citing stable demand from enterprise customers increasing data center capacity for AI workloads. Seagate's recent earnings report projected higher-than-consensus third-quarter revenue and reported strong second-quarter results, driven by the growing need for high-capacity storage fueled by AI-driven data creation. The company specializes in data storage solutions, including hard disk drives, catering to enterprise, cloud, and consumer markets.

title: Analyst Sentiment on Arista Networks (ANET) Remains Strong Ahead of Fiscal Q4 2025 Results
summary: Analyst sentiment for Arista Networks (ANET) remains overwhelmingly positive, with 90% of analysts bullish on the stock ahead of its fiscal Q4 2025 results, anticipating a 27.5% upside. Recent upgrades and "Buy" ratings from Piper Sandler and Melius Research highlight the company's strong position due to enterprise adoption, AI exposure, and its superior networking solutions for hyperscale users. Despite competition, analysts foresee a "Year of Refresh" in 2026 for the company.

title: Walmart Inc. (WMT) Price Target Increased at Oppenheimer as Firm Eyes Solid Q4
summary: Oppenheimer analyst Rupesh Parikh increased the price target for Walmart Inc. (WMT) from $125 to $140, maintaining an Outperform rating, based on expectations for a strong Q4 and solid top-line momentum. The firm anticipates management to guide sales and operating income growth in line with its long-term framework, possibly falling short of current Street expectations, which could create a buying opportunity. Walmart recently achieved a $1 trillion market valuation, driven by its ability to attract diverse customer bases, expand its online presence, and invest in AI and supply chain automation.

title: Strengthening Fundamentals in Mechanical and Electrical Contracting Industry Drive Analyst Sentiment on EMCOR Group (EME)

title: Quantum Hype vs. Profits: Do NVDA and MSFT Have the Edge?
summary: Pure-play quantum computing stocks like IonQ, D-Wave, and Rigetti Computing are attracting investor interest due to technological breakthroughs and stock movements, despite early-stage and speculative financial fundamentals. Conversely, established tech companies like NVIDIA and Microsoft, with diversified business models and quantum divisions, offer a more stable investment opportunity. These companies are actively investing in quantum R&D and integrating quantum capabilities into their existing platforms, providing indirect quantum exposure with less financial risk.

title: Noble Corporation (NE) Price Target Raised by $7
summary: Noble Corporation plc (NE) saw its stock price increase by 16.28% between February 2 and February 9, 2026, after BTIG raised its price target from $35 to $42. Eifler emphasized how these backlog additions indicate strong demand for deepwater drilling and will improve fleet utilization and future earnings.

title: What Are Wall Street Analysts' Target Price for Akamai Technologies Stock?
summary: Akamai Technologies (AKAM) has underperformed the broader market, with its stock declining 6% over the past year, although it has seen a 9.2% gain year-to-date. Despite mixed earnings surprises, analysts generally rate AKAM as a "Moderate Buy," with a mean price target suggesting a 6.7% premium from current levels, and a high target implying a potential 41.9% upside. The company's Q3 2025 results showed strong growth in Cloud Infrastructure Services revenue and positive future guidance.

title: Tower Semiconductor Q4 2025 Record Revenue and AI Photonics Surge Drive Earnings Beat
summary: Tower Semiconductor (TSEM) reported record Q4 2025 results, significantly surpassing Wall Street expectations, primarily driven by a strategic shift towards high-value analog solutions, especially in silicon photonics and AI-driven data center infrastructure. The company confirmed its critical role in the 1.6-terabit optical transceiver market, scaling production for NVIDIA-ready networking protocols, and is investing $650 million to triple its SiPho and SiGe capacity by mid-2026. This performance and strategic positioning suggest a multi-year growth cycle, differentiating Tower from traditional foundries.

The stock currently trades at a discount compared to its industry average, suggesting it may be undervalued.

title: LSCC Q4 Deep Dive: Data Center AI Drives Growth, Physical AI Gains Momentum

The growth was driven by robust demand in data center AI and physical AI applications, with increased adoption of its low-power FPGAs and record design wins. Management anticipates continued AI-driven demand, new product growth, and disciplined investments to expand FPGA leadership, despite potential supply chain constraints.

title: LG Display Speeds Up OLED Production with NVIDIA AI Tool

This tool, developed in collaboration with Korean startup Alsemi and NVIDIA, significantly reduces development and production schedules by minimizing trial and error through AI-based predictions. By leveraging this technology, LG Display expects to accelerate the derivation of optimal process conditions and plans to expand it into an 'Agency AI System' for complete panel development and manufacturing optimization, aiming for improved yield.

summary: Marvell Technology is positioned to benefit significantly from major AI-related capital expenditures by Amazon and the enterprise scaling of Anthropic's AI models. The deepening partnership between Amazon AWS and Anthropic, with its commitment to Amazon's Trainium and Inferentia hardware, suggests sustained demand for Marvell's silicon as autonomous AI workloads grow.

title: DA Davidson Raises Modine (MOD) PT to $265 Following FQ3 Beat, Exceptional AI Data Center Momentum

B. Riley also raised its price target for Modine to $250 from $190, noting the company's transformation into a high-volume, pure-play climate solutions manufacturer with higher-margin products through data center capacity expansion and the spin-off of its Performance Technologies segment. Super Micro continues to develop and sell server and storage solutions globally.

title: VV Handidly Beat the S&P 500, And Only Charges 0.04%

title: U.S. Says Nvidia Must Follow Rules on China AI Chip Sales
summary: The U.S. government has mandated that Nvidia Corp. must adhere to strict licensing conditions for selling its H200 artificial intelligence chips to China, as confirmed by U.S. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick. These restrictions, stemming from a previous agreement, allow limited sales in exchange for a percentage of revenue, and are part of broader efforts to control AI chip exports amid national security concerns. Nvidia's shares experienced a slight dip following these remarks.

title: Freedom Holding Corp. reports $1.7 billion in revenue for 9 months of FY2026

A significant development was a strategic agreement with the Government of Kazakhstan and OpenAI to provide ChatGPT Edu access to 165,000 teachers.

The article suggests that AMD might be the better bet due to its potential for more significant runway, though NVIDIA also remains a strong investment for those confident in sustained AI growth.

title: Cadence Pioneers New Frontier in Chip Design and Verification
summary: Cadence Design Systems Inc. has launched the ChipStack AI Super Agent, an agentic AI solution aimed at revolutionizing front-end silicon design and verification. This tool promises up to a 10X productivity improvement by automating coding, test plan creation, regression testing, debugging, and issue resolution. Already in early deployment with major chip companies like Altera, NVIDIA, Qualcomm, and Tenstorrent, the ChipStack AI Super Agent leverages AI orchestration and integrates with Cadence’s existing EDA tools to address the growing complexity and talent deficit in semiconductor engineering.

While the company is well-managed and strategically important, the stock's recent rally and inherent cyclical risks suggest that future returns might be modest unless there are further improvements in industry conditions or margins. A Motley Fool Stock Advisor team has identified 10 other stocks they believe have higher potential returns.

(NASDAQ: FIVN) is facing weak share price momentum, with its stock declining over 60% in the past year, hitting a 52-week low of $16.10 on February 3, 2026, due to broader SaaS sector headwinds. title: STMicroelectronics unveils first automotive MCU with built‑in AI acceleration

This MCU aims to simplify vehicle function consolidation and enhance applications like predictive maintenance and real-time monitoring through its Neural-ART Accelerator. Production for the Stellar P3E is slated to begin in Q4 2026.

title: The 5 Most Interesting Analyst Questions From 8x8's Q4 Earnings Call

The company's management addressed key analyst questions regarding Fuze churn, operating margin sustainability, voice AI adoption, and channel partner strategy. Future catalysts include AI product adoption, channel partnership expansion, and the normalization of Fuze customer churn.

title: Applied Materials Unveils Transistor and Wiring Innovations for Faster Chips
summary: Applied Materials has introduced new deposition, etch, and materials modification systems designed to enhance the performance of advanced logic chips at 2 nm and beyond, crucial for AI computing. These innovations include the Viva radical treatment system for precise GAA transistor nanosheet engineering, the Sym3 Z Magnum etch system for creating angstrom-level 3D trenches, and the Spectral ALD system for reducing contact resistance with selective molybdenum deposition. These technologies aim to accelerate chip roadmaps by improving transistor efficiency and wiring for next-generation AI chips.

title: Xylem Inc. (NYSE:XYL) Declares Quarterly Dividend of $0.43

The stock has been volatile, and this move indicates the market views the news as meaningful, although the stock is still up 14.3% year-to-date.

title: The 5 Most Interesting Analyst Questions From The Hanover Insurance Group's Q4 Earnings Call

title: The Top 5 Analyst Questions From Sonos's Q4 Earnings Call

title: The Top 5 Analyst Questions From Super Micro's Q4 Earnings Call
summary: Super Micro Computer Inc. reported robust Q4 CY2025 results, exceeding analyst estimates for revenue and EPS, driven by strong demand for AI infrastructure and data center solutions. summary: KLA (KLAC) stock dipped approximately 0.6% despite announcing the expansion of its R&D and innovation hub in Chennai, India, focusing on AI and software. Despite short-term hurdles like delivery delays, the company's shift towards AI, re-entry into the discrete GPU market for inference, and partnership with SoftBank for Z-Angle memory position it for long-term growth. The article argues that Intel's stock is undervalued, trading at historically low levels, and is protected by government backing, NVIDIA's investment, and a strong balance sheet.

title: 5 Insightful Analyst Questions From AMD's Q4 Earnings Call
summary: AMD's Q4 earnings call revealed strong revenue growth and margin expansion, driven by high-performance computing and AI products, with CEO Lisa Su highlighting accelerating GPU deployments. Catalysts for future quarters include product ramps, supply chain execution, and growth in the embedded segment, while regulatory and inflation concerns remain relevant.

title: Cadence Unveils AI Agent to Accelerate Chip Design
summary: Cadence Design Systems Inc. has introduced the ChipStack AI Super Agent, an agentic AI solution designed to automate and accelerate front-end silicon design and verification, offering up to 10x productivity improvements. This technology helps engineering teams manage the increasing demands for rapid architectural iteration and frequent new chip generations, particularly by streamlining the time-consuming verification phase. Built upon intellectual property from ChipStack, which Cadence acquired in November 2025, the tool uses a "mental model" to ingest design specifications and guide AI-powered workflows from test generation and execution to debugging under human supervision.

title: 5 Blue-Chip Stocks to Buy as Dow Hits a New Milestone

title: Cadence announces ChipStack ‘Super Agent’ system for chip design and verification
summary: Cadence Design Systems Inc. has released Cadence ChipStack AI Super Agent, an artificial intelligence system designed to revolutionize front-end silicon design and verification. This "Super Agent" aims to significantly boost engineer productivity, speeding up coding, design, and testbench creation by a factor of 10, while also automating test plan creation, regression testing, debugging, and issue fixing. The multi-agent system, which includes specialized IP design, verification, and debugging agents, is intended to act as a "junior engineer" to tackle the increasing complexity and verification bottlenecks in chip design.

title: Cadence Releases AI Agent to Accelerate Complex Chip Design Processes
summary: Cadence Design Systems has launched Cerebrus AI Studio, an agentic AI platform designed to accelerate complex system-on-chip design processes by employing intelligent AI workflows and autonomous agents. The platform aims to improve power, performance, and area goals while allowing single engineers to manage larger designs. Cadence also acquired ChipStack to integrate AI agents for chip verification, significantly reducing verification times and reinforcing its Intelligent System Design strategy and partnerships with NVIDIA and TSMC.

title: Cisco Releases Silicon One G300 Chip for Gigawatt-Scale AI Networks
summary: Cisco has unveiled its new Silicon One G300 chip, a 102.4 Tbps programmable switching chip designed for gigawatt-scale AI networks. This chip features Intelligent Collective Networking, including a large shared packet buffer and path-based load balancing, which Cisco claims can achieve 28% faster job completion times. The G300 will power new Nexus 9000 and Cisco 8000 systems, available in both air- and liquid-cooled versions later in 2026, aiming to significantly improve energy efficiency and challenge competitors like Broadcom and Nvidia.

title: 2026: Chipotle Must Prove Traffic Weakness Is Cyclical, Not Structural

title: Concentrated ETF Bests S&P 500 With Active Stock Picks
summary: The Alger Concentrated Equity ETF (CNEQ) outperformed the S&P 500 in 2025 by over 14 percentage points, returning more than 32% due to its focused portfolio and strategic stock picks centered around artificial intelligence infrastructure. The ETF, managed by Dr. Ankur Crawford, invests in 30 or fewer predominantly large-cap companies identified through fundamental research as demonstrating promising growth potential and "Positive Dynamic Change." This active management approach allows CNEQ to pick companies like NVIDIA, Microsoft, Amazon, and Nebius Group, which are positioned to benefit from the anticipated surge in demand for compute capacity driven by "agentic AI."

title: Iambic could earn almost $2 billion in new Takeda deal

Takeda will utilize Iambic's NeuralPLexer AI platform for small-molecule drug discovery in oncology, inflammation, and gastrointestinal diseases. This follows a recent $100 million funding round for Iambic, which claims its combined AI and physics approach offers more accurate and data-efficient drug discovery.

title: Micron Stock Can’t Stop Going Up and Goldman Sachs Knows Exactly Why
summary: The technology sector is experiencing a significant shortage of high-bandwidth memory (HBM) chips, largely due to the high demand from AI data centers. This "great memory crunch," identified by Goldman Sachs, is driving up prices and reducing production for device manufacturers. However, it's greatly benefiting HBM producers like Micron Technology, whose stock has surged due to its crucial role in supplying HBM for AI and other electronics.

title: 3 Reasons to Avoid BGS and 1 Stock to Buy Instead

The company's 2026 outlook is highly dependent on its MI400 Series & Helios AI accelerators, which are expected to compete with Nvidia, with some experts suggesting AMD could achieve a trillion-dollar valuation if it executes well on AI and data center growth. Investors are currently focused on the sustainability of AI demand and AMD's ability to capitalize on the AI chip market.

title: SK’s Chey, Nvidia’s Huang explore deeper AI collaboration over beer and chicken

This meeting comes as both SK Hynix and Samsung Electronics are making significant advancements in HBM4 production and supply, indicating intense competition and strategic partnerships within the high-demand AI chip market. The discussions underline the critical importance of memory technology for the future of AI.

title: Inside Astera Labs’ new Israel hub tackling AI data bottlenecks

Industry veterans Guy Azrad and Ido Bukspan will lead the engineering and ASIC efforts, respectively, with planned collaborations with Israeli universities and the venture ecosystem. This expansion is a strategic investment in the region's semiconductor ecosystem to accelerate the development of next-generation connectivity solutions for AI infrastructure.

title: Blackstone Leads $10B in Debt Financing for Aussie AI Data Centre Startup Firmus

The investment highlights Blackstone's focus on digital infrastructure and the significant buildout driven by the AI revolution.

title: Bitcoin miner Cango cashes out $305M in BTC to fund AI push

Cango will continue its Bitcoin mining operations while focusing on integrating AI capabilities.

title: Quantum computing stocks bounce hard: IonQ, Rigetti, D‑Wave rally as traders reset for a data-heavy week
summary: Quantum computing stocks like IonQ, Rigetti, D-Wave, and Quantum Computing Inc. saw significant gains on Friday, rebounding from previous sharp declines, as the Dow Jones Industrial Average surpassed 50,000. This rally occurred ahead of a data-heavy week featuring postponed U.S. jobs and inflation reports, alongside upcoming earnings from IonQ, which recently faced a short-seller attack regarding its Pentagon contracts. Investors are closely watching these developments and the broader market's risk appetite impacting high-growth tech.

title: Insight Enterprises Balances Record Margins With Cautious Outlook
summary: Insight Enterprises reported record profitability and expanding margins in its Q4 earnings call, driven by a strategic shift towards higher-margin cloud and services, successful acquisitions, and disciplined cost control. Despite these gains, revenue faced pressure from declines in on-premise software, partner program changes, and subdued large-enterprise spending, leading to conservative guidance for 2026. The company emphasizes its focus on profitability, cash generation, and strategic positioning in AI, data, and security.

title: Rigetti Computing Faces Competitive Pressure in Quantum Sector
summary: Rigetti Computing has seen its stock plummet 70% from its peak, indicating low market confidence. The company faces stiff competition, particularly from IonQ, and is lagging in technical advancements for larger quantum systems. These challenges and investment risks, including potential bankruptcy, highlight concerns over its future performance and funding capabilities.

title: nVent Electric plc (NYSE:NVT) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: nVent Electric plc reported record Q4 and full-year 2025 results, with sales, EPS, and free cash flow growing at or above 30%. The company's portfolio transformation increased its exposure to the high-growth infrastructure vertical, particularly data centers, which accounted for approximately $1 billion in sales in 2025. nVent provided strong guidance for 2026, expecting continued record performance driven by investments in liquid cooling capacity and a robust order backlog, especially from AI data center build-outs.

title: Cboe Global Markets, Inc. (CBOE:CBOE) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Cboe Global Markets Inc. (CBOE) reported record net revenue of $671 million and adjusted diluted EPS of $3.06 for Q4 2025, beating expectations. The company saw strong growth across all segments, particularly derivatives, and outlined strategic realignments including divestitures of Cboe Australia and Canada, and the closure of Cboe Europe derivatives exchange (FedEx). Cboe also discussed new product initiatives like event prediction markets targeting a Q2 2026 launch and expanding trading hours.

title: Morgan Stanley Downgrades Himax Tech (HIMX) from Overweight to Equal Weight
summary: Morgan Stanley downgraded Himax Technologies Inc. (HIMX) from Overweight to Equal Weight with an $8 price target, citing weakened demand in computer, smartphone, and automotive sectors, gross margin pressure, and rising memory costs. This decision follows a recent collaboration between Himax and Vuzix Corp. to introduce a new optical component reference design for AR glasses at CES 2026. Himax is a fabless semiconductor company operating globally in Driver IC and Non-Driver Products segments.

title: Why the iShares Semiconductor ETF Rallied 12% in January
summary: The iShares Semiconductor ETF (SOXX) gained 12% in January, continuing a strong rally into 2026. This growth is attributed to the ongoing AI buildout, which has broadened beyond just Nvidia GPUs to boost demand for memory chips (DRAM, NAND flash) and traditional CPUs. Despite a slight dip in February and mixed performances from some major holdings, analysts project continued strong growth in AI infrastructure spending throughout 2026.

title: 13 Most Promising Future Stocks to Buy Now
summary: This article identifies Broadcom Inc. (NASDAQ: AVGO) as one of the most promising future stocks due to its advancements in Wi-Fi 8 technology and AI-ready enterprise networks. Broadcom recently launched Wi-Fi 8 access points and switch solutions and received an upgrade to Outperform from Wolfe Research, which cited strong demand drivers in its AI-focused semiconductor business and an expectation for doubling AI revenue by 2027. The company specializes in semiconductor and infrastructure software products, serving various markets including networking, broadband, cloud, and cybersecurity.

title: Teradyne (TER) Rockets 24% as 11 Analysts Hike PT After Strong Earnings
summary: Teradyne Inc. (NASDAQ:TER) saw its stock rocket by 24.5 percent last week, reaching a new all-time high after a strong earnings report and 11 price target upgrades from analysts. The company reported a 2.2% increase in full-year net income to $554 million and a 13% rise in net revenues to $3.2 billion, driven by semiconductor and product testing as well as robotics, with AI-related demand fueling Q4 growth. Susquehanna was the most bullish, raising its price target to $335 from $275.

title: Why Is Broadcom (AVGO) Stock Soaring Today
summary: Broadcom (AVGO) stock jumped 7.6% after Wall Street acknowledged the significant revenue potential from Google’s announced AI infrastructure spending, with Broadcom securing $21 billion in orders for custom AI accelerators. This positive development led Wolfe Research to upgrade the stock to Outperform and Jefferies to reiterate its Buy rating, despite the stock experiencing volatility and recent declines due to geopolitical tensions impacting chip exports to China.

title: Stifel Sees Upside for Teradyne (TER) from AI and Semi Test Share Gains
summary: Stifel analyst Brian Chin has raised the price target for Teradyne (TER) to $325 from $280, maintaining a Buy rating, citing upside potential from AI and semi test share gains. This revision follows Teradyne's updated guidance, which indicates that over 70% of its semiconductor test business is now tied to AI applications. The company has also adjusted its mid-term target model based on the semi-test total addressable market, targeting $10.25 EPS on $6 billion revenue for a $13 billion TAM.

title: J.Safra Asset Management Corp Acquires 28,565 Shares of NVIDIA Corporation $NVDA

This makes NVIDIA the 17th largest holding for J.Safra, representing 1.2% of its portfolio. Various institutional investors have also modified their holdings, and analysts maintain a consensus "Buy" rating for NVIDIA with a target price of $263.98, despite recent insider sales and regulatory uncertainties.

title: Texas Instruments Executes a $7.5B Deal and an AI Strategy Pivot
summary: Texas Instruments (TXN) is making a significant strategic shift, acquiring Silicon Labs (SLAB) for $7.5 billion to fill its new 300mm wafer factories and reduce production costs by 40%. Concurrently, the company is capitalizing on a 70% year-over-year surge in data center revenue, driven by AI infrastructure demand, which is offsetting slower growth in its industrial and automotive segments. This pivot, combined with a significant increase in free cash flow and benefits from the U.S. CHIPS Act, positions TXN for aggressive growth and continued dividend increases.

title: Raymond James Raises its Price Target on Cameco Corporation (CCJ) to C$165 While Keeping an Outperform Rating

The article highlights Cameco's strong market position as a major uranium supplier and ongoing supply agreements, such as a potential $2.8 billion deal with India.

title: WRD Stock Rallies 7% On Robotaxi Fleet Expansion In Middle East With Uber - What Does Retail Think?

title: Google, Amazon, OpenAI and the race to find alternatives to Nvidia
summary: Major tech companies like Google, Amazon, OpenAI, and Microsoft are actively developing their own AI chips to reduce their dependence on Nvidia, which currently dominates the AI chip market. While Nvidia's market share is not immediately at risk, these efforts aim to provide alternatives and leverage in negotiations, potentially impacting Nvidia's long-term growth. Google, in particular, has seen success with its TPUs, training its Gemini 3 model entirely on them and securing deals with other AI startups.

title: INTC - Intel Corp Stock Price and Quote
summary: This article provides a detailed overview of Intel Corp (INTC) stock performance, financial metrics, and recent news. title: The Truth About One Stop Systems: Is This Quiet AI Stock About To Explode Or Just Cap?

Construction is hoped to begin before June, following the issuance of a building permit and design review.

title: U.S. shares higher at close of trade; Dow Jones Industrial Average up 2.47%
summary: U.S. equities closed higher on Friday, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average, S&P 500, and NASDAQ Composite all making gains, driven by strong performances in the Industrials, Technology, and Basic Materials sectors. summary: Tower Semiconductor has announced a collaboration with NVIDIA to advance AI infrastructure using its silicon photonics platform for 1.6-terabit data center optical modules. This new solution is designed to double data rates compared to previous generations, significantly boosting bandwidth for AI workloads. Analysts currently rate TSEM stock as a Buy with a $152.00 price target, highlighting the company's strong technical momentum and strategic growth in key areas.

title: nVent (NVT) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: nVent (NVT) reported a record Q4 and full-year 2025, with sales exceeding $1 billion, organic growth of 24%, and adjusted EPS up 53%. The company's strategy has shifted towards infrastructure, particularly data centers, which now constitute 45% of sales and are projected to exceed 50% in 2026, driven by strong demand for liquid cooling and power products. nVent anticipates another record-breaking year in 2026, with forecast sales growth of 15%-18% and adjusted EPS growth of 20%-24%, supported by a robust $2.3 billion backlog primarily from AI data center builds.

title: Analog Devices stock sits out chip surge as AI-spending nerves keep traders jumpy

Traders are focused on Analog Devices' first-quarter fiscal 2026 results and guidance on industrial and customer demand, expected on February 18th.

title: Is Appian’s (APPN) AI‑Led Public Sector Momentum Plus Pegasystems Windfall Reframing Its Investment Story?
summary: Appian (APPN) is experiencing significant momentum due to its AI-led low-code platform being adopted in the public sector, notably in Australia and with a large US Army agreement. The company also stands to benefit from a US$500 million trade secrets judgment against Pegasystems, which could improve its financial flexibility. Despite ongoing losses and negative equity, these developments are reframing Appian's investment narrative towards its role in AI-driven public sector modernization, though funding and execution risks remain.

title: Credo’s Blue Heron Retimer Targets Key AI Data Center Bottlenecks

This product addresses the challenge of maintaining signal integrity over longer copper links in dense AI data centers, offering an alternative to more costly optical solutions. The success of Blue Heron will depend on its adoption by hyperscalers and its ability to compete with other connectivity providers, playing a key role in Credo's positioning within the evolving AI infrastructure market.

title: How Investors May Respond To Prologis (PLD) Pivot Toward AI-Focused Micro Data Centers

title: |‘One of the All-Time Great Investors’: How Fidelity’s Will Danoff Proved Active Management Can Still Succeed
summary: |Fidelity Contrafund manager Will Danoff is retiring at the end of the year, leaving a significant legacy in active management. Morningstar's Russ Kinnel highlights Danoff's consistent outperformance and his unique ability to process vast amounts of information to identify growth opportunities. His co-managers, Asher Anolic and Jason Weiner, will succeed him, with expectations to continue the growth strategy, and investors can learn from Danoff's continuous curiosity and engagement.

title: Prediction Markets are ‘Logical Extension’ for Cboe
summary: Cboe Global Markets sees prediction markets as a logical extension of its existing strengths, focusing on financial and economic contracts with regulatory clarity from the SEC and CFTC. The exchange plans to launch "all or none" style contracts related to S&P 500 options, leveraging its expertise and trading volumes. Cboe also reported record financial results for Q4 2025 and the full year, driven by strong derivatives and index options performance, while strategically divesting from certain non-core businesses.

title: Tower Semiconductor stock jumps again on Nvidia 1.6T optics tie-up as earnings loom
summary: Tower Semiconductor's stock jumped nearly 9% after revealing details of its partnership with Nvidia on 1.6-terabit optical modules for AI data centers, using silicon photonics technology. title: Coherent stock jumps on AI optics demand bets as Wall Street lifts price targets
summary: Coherent Corp's shares rose about 7.3% after analysts increased price targets following the photonics firm's quarterly earnings and guidance. Despite the positive movement, industrial demand lags, and increased investment in capacity could strain cash flow.

title: Why Amtech (ASYS) Stock Is Down Today
summary: Amtech Systems (NASDAQ: ASYS) stock plunged after the company reported mixed results for the fourth quarter of 2025, with a significant earnings miss overshadowing in-line revenue. Adjustable earnings per share were $0.03, falling 57.1% below analysts' consensus, and an increase in inventory days outstanding raised concerns about weakening demand. summary: On February 6, 2026, Nasdaq experienced significant trading activity, with Jet.AI Inc. leading in volume. Cryptocurrency-related equities, including iShares Bitcoin Trust ETF and Coinbase, also saw substantial movement, mostly trending lower.

title: Form DEF 14A Dominari Holdings Inc. For: Mar 04
summary: Dominari Holdings Inc. has filed Form DEF 14A for a Special Meeting of Stockholders on March 4, 2026. The company is seeking approval to amend its 2022 Equity Incentive Plan to increase the number of shares reserved for issuance by 10,000,000 to a total of 21,720,750, and to clarify the calculation of its annual "evergreen" increase provision. These amendments are crucial for attracting and retaining talent, with a significant portion of the additional shares intended for special awards to CEO Anthony Hayes and President Kyle Wool in recognition of their contributions.

title: Powell Industries stock reaches all-time high at 573.37 USD
summary: Powell Industries Inc. (POWL) stock has reached an all-time high of $573.37, marking a 146.21% increase over the past year due to strong investor confidence. Cantor Fitzgerald also raised its price target for Powell Industries from $427.00 to $481.00, maintaining a Neutral rating, reflecting positive momentum for the company.

title: IEMG Offers Broader Market Reach Than NZAC
summary: This article compares two ETFs, IEMG (iShares Core MSCI Emerging Markets ETF) and NZAC (State Street SPDR MSCI ACWI Climate Paris Aligned ETF), highlighting their differences in market reach, costs, returns, risk, and portfolio composition. While IEMG offers broader emerging market exposure, a higher yield, and lower fees, NZAC incorporates an ESG screen focused on climate alignment and has shown better five-year returns due to its exposure to US-based tech stocks. The choice between them depends on an investor's priorities regarding diversification, income, and sustainability.

title: Battalion Oil Corp Jumps 380% on New Gas-Treating Deal
summary: Battalion Oil Corp (NYSE American: BATL) saw its shares surge by 380% in pre-market trading and 11.25% during the market open after announcing a new gas-treating agreement with a large-cap midstream partner. This strategic move, which involved ending its contract with Wink Amine Treater, is expected to enhance gas processing capacity and has already led to an increase in oil production by 1,200 barrels daily. Despite some volatility in recent financial reports, the company's robust operational cash flow and high gross margin indicate resilience and potential for sustainable growth, driven by renewed investor confidence.
authors: Tim Bohen, Ben Sturgill, Ellis Hobbs

title: Zscaler stock hits 52-week low at 164.65 USD
summary: Zscaler Inc. (ZS) stock recently reached a 52-week low of 164.65 USD, marking a significant downturn for the cybersecurity firm with a 17.06% decline over the past year and 41.45% over six months. title: Is It Too Late To Consider Microchip Technology (MCHP) After A 55% One Year Rally?
summary: Microchip Technology (MCHP) has seen a 55% rally over the past year, leading to questions about its current valuation. title: IQV Q4 Deep Dive: Market Cautions Despite Revenue Beat and AI Strategy Emphasis
summary: IQVIA (IQV) reported strong Q4 CY2025 results, beating revenue expectations with sales up 10.3% year-on-year, and emphasizing its AI strategy while facing market cautions. The company plans to focus on AI-driven solutions, strategic acquisitions, and a simplified business structure to drive future growth, though higher interest expenses and operational costs are expected to impact near-term profitability.

title: POWI Q4 Deep Dive: Industrial and High-Power Segments Stand Out Amid Inventory and Consumer Headwinds
summary: Power Integrations (POWI) met Wall Street's revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales down 1.9% year-on-year to $103.2 million, and a non-GAAP profit of $0.23 per share beating analyst estimates. title: Breaking the Memory Wall: Tower Semiconductor and NVIDIA Unveil 1.6T Silicon Photonics Revolution
summary: Tower Semiconductor and NVIDIA have partnered to advance 1.6T silicon photonics for next-generation AI data centers, aiming to overcome the "memory wall" bottleneck. Tower's PH18 process with 200G-per-lane signaling and a shift to 300mm wafers are key technical advancements. This collaboration is set to significantly improve data transfer speeds and power efficiency in AI infrastructure, positioning Tower as a major player and enabling NVIDIA's advanced AI architectures.

title: SEALSQ Corp Addresses Quantum Security Implications of Advanced AI Developments
summary: SEALSQ Corp announced that recent advancements in classical AI, such as Anthropic's Claude Opus 4.6, do not change the quantum computing threat landscape or the need for quantum-secure cryptography. The company emphasizes that classical AI models cannot execute quantum algorithms and therefore pose no new threat to current cryptographic systems. SEALSQ continues to focus on integrating quantum-resistant technologies into its semiconductor solutions to safeguard critical systems against future quantum threats.

title: Micron Rallies 315% in a Year: Is the Stock Still Worth Buying?

The company's strategic focus on AI, high-performance computing, and resilient verticals, coupled with strong financial performance and a relatively low valuation, makes it an attractive investment. Analysts predict continued growth, further supporting a "Strong Buy" recommendation for MU stock.

title: Monolithic Power Systems, Inc. (NASDAQ:MPWR) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Monolithic Power Systems, Inc. (MPWR) reported strong Q4 2025 earnings, beating expectations with an EPS of $4.79. Key growth drivers included non-enterprise data end markets, which grew over 40% year-over-year, and significant expansion in automotive and data center applications, with increased confidence in enterprise data growth for 2026.

title: Gorman-Rupp’s (NYSE:GRC) Q4 CY2025 Earnings Results: Revenue In Line With Expectations
summary: Gorman-Rupp (NYSE:GRC) reported Q4 CY2025 earnings with revenue of $166.6 million, in line with analyst estimates, and a non-GAAP profit of $0.55 per share, beating consensus by 27.9%. title: 1 Volatile Stock on Our Buy List and 2 We Turn Down
summary: This article identifies one volatile industrials stock, American Superconductor (AMSC), as a buy due to its strong revenue growth and positive free cash flow. Conversely, it advises against Tecnoglass (TGLS) and Great Lakes Dredge & Dock (GLDD) due to muted growth, contracting earnings, and cash-burning histories, respectively. The author stresses the importance of avoiding costly mistakes in volatile markets and suggests exploring their "Top 6 Stocks" for high-quality, growth-oriented investments.

title: Ambarella, Inc. (NASDAQ:AMBA) Shares May Have Slumped 26% But Getting In Cheap Is Still Unlikely
summary: Ambarella Inc. (NASDAQ:AMBA) has seen its share price drop 26% in the last month, contributing to a 24% decline over the past year. Despite this fall, the company's Price-to-Sales (P/S) ratio of 6.8x remains higher than most of its Semiconductor industry peers, which average around 5.3x. Analysts forecast a revenue growth of 15% per year for Ambarella over the next three years, significantly lower than the industry's predicted 30% growth, suggesting the current P/S might be unjustifiably high.

title: 1 Safe-and-Steady Stock for Long-Term Investors and 2 We Ignore
summary: This article recommends one safe-and-steady stock, EXL (EXLS), for long-term investors due to its strong revenue growth, share repurchases, and market-beating returns on capital. Conversely, it advises investors to avoid Lindsay (LNN) and First American Financial (FAF) due to concerns about stagnant sales, waning returns, and slow growth. The piece highlights EXL's positive financial performance and strategic advantages, while identifying red flags for LNN and FAF based on their recent performance and market challenges.

title: MTSI Q4 Deep Dive: Data Center, Defense, and Telecom Markets Fuel Growth and Guidance
summary: MACOM Technology Solutions (MTSI) reported strong Q4 CY2025 results, outperforming revenue and non-GAAP EPS expectations, driven by demand in data center, industrial and defense, and telecom markets. The company issued optimistic Q1 CY2026 guidance, anticipating continued growth in high-speed optical and analog products for hyperscale data center projects. Management emphasized increased demand for next-generation data center products, record industrial and defense performance, and opportunities in the telecom sector, alongside manufacturing efficiencies contributing to margin expansion.

title: 1 of Wall Street's Favorite Stock with Solid Fundamentals and 2 We Question
summary: This article analyzes three stocks, identifying one with solid fundamentals and two that are questionable despite Wall Street's bullish outlook. Universal Display (OLED) is highlighted as a stock to watch due to its strong revenue growth, high gross margin, and effective cost controls. Conversely, Best Buy (BBY) and Stratasys (SSYS) are identified as stocks to sell, citing concerns such as lagging sales, low margins, inefficient cost structures, and declining free cash flow.

title: Earnings call transcript: Alpha & Omega Semiconductor Q2 2026 misses earnings
summary: Alpha & Omega Semiconductor (AOSL) reported a significant earnings miss for Q2 FY2026, with an EPS of -$0.16 against a forecast of $0.04 and revenue of $162.3 million below the anticipated $177.67 million. Despite these financial setbacks, the stock price remained stable, reflecting investor confidence in the company's strategic focus on expanding AI opportunities and increasing R&D investments. The company aims for long-term growth and a $1 billion revenue target with a 30% gross margin, anticipating a rebound in the June quarter after a near-term low in March.

title: Tower Semiconductor (TSEM) Gets 6.4% Boost from Nvidia Deal
summary: Tower Semiconductor (TSEM) saw a 6.4% increase in its share price following news of a partnership with Nvidia Corp. for the development of AI infrastructure using 1.6T data center optical modules. These modules are specifically designed to support Nvidia’s networking protocols and the needs of artificial intelligence data centers, with Tower Semiconductor's CEO emphasizing their commitment to advanced, high-speed technologies. The company is also preparing to announce its Q4 2025 earnings on February 11th.

title: Hartline Investment Corp Has $131.17 Million Holdings in NVIDIA Corporation $NVDA
summary: Hartline Investment Corp has significantly invested in NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA), holding 703,009 shares valued at $131.17 million, making it their largest portfolio holding. This comes despite the firm trimming its stake by 8.0% in Q3. NVIDIA continues to show strong financial performance, beating quarterly estimates with $1.30 EPS and $57.01 billion in revenue, leading analysts to maintain a "Buy" consensus rating with an average target of $263.98.

title: MPWR Q4 Deep Dive: Data Center and Automotive Growth Drive Strong Outlook
summary: Monolithic Power Systems (MPWR) reported strong Q4 CY2025 results, exceeding revenue and profit estimates and providing optimistic guidance for Q1 CY2026. The company's performance was driven by robust demand in enterprise data, communications, and automotive end markets, particularly in AI-supporting data center power solutions. MPWR anticipates continued growth in these sectors, alongside product innovation and strategic supply chain expansion, despite upcoming changes in finance leadership.

title: Silicon Motion Technology Corporation (NASDAQ:SIMO) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Silicon Motion Technology Corporation reported strong Q4 2025 results, exceeding revenue guidance and anticipating a record-breaking 2026 driven by increasing demand across all markets and new product introductions. Despite challenges from NAND and DRAM supply tightness and rising prices, the company expects sequential growth throughout 2026, leveraging strong flash vendor partnerships and market share gains in eMMC, UFS, client SSDs, and new enterprise solutions. Investing heavily in next-generation products like MonTitan and enterprise boot drives, Silicon Motion aims for long-term growth and market diversification, including a significant ramp in its automotive business.

title: PayPal Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ:PYPL) Receives Average Rating of "Hold" from Brokerages
summary: PayPal Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ:PYPL) has received an average "Hold" rating from brokerages, with 30 out of 45 analysts recommending a hold. Contributing to this sentiment were disappointing Q4 results that missed expectations, lowered near-term profit guidance, and multiple analyst downgrades. The company also announced a new CEO, Enrique Lores, amidst securities fraud investigations and criticism from former executives, adding to investor uncertainty.

title: Advanced Micro Devices Stock To $132?
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) stock has experienced a significant 25.9% drop recently, leading analysts to suggest a potential further fall to $132 due to its "Very High valuation." While historic sharp dips (30% or more within 30 days) have shown median peak returns of 76% within a year, the article suggests caution before buying the dip given the current valuation and outlines financial quality checks passed by AMD.

title: Market Update: AlphaTON Capital’s Strategic Pivot to AI Infrastructure
summary: AlphaTON Capital Corp (NASDAQ: ATON) has strategically repositioned itself to become an AI infrastructure powerhouse, moving away from solely holding digital assets. The company is making significant investments in NVIDIA GPUs for its "Cocoon AI" network, forming a key partnership with Midnight Foundation for a zero-knowledge blockchain integration, and launching the AlphaTON Claude Connector to bridge Telegram users with Anthropic's Claude AI. This pivot emphasizes confidential AI compute and aims to leverage its ties to the Telegram and TON ecosystems for growth.

title: Bull of the Day: Photronics (PLAB)
summary: Photronics (PLAB) has been identified as a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy) due to its strong performance and critical role in the semiconductor and flat panel display industry, especially with the growth of AI. The company has seen significant share gains, record high-end revenue, and increased CapEx for expansion in the US and South Korea, positioning it for continued growth in the booming chip industry. Despite valuation multiples expanding, the stock still offers a discount compared to the S&P 500.

title: 3 Reasons to Avoid MEI and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: This article analyzes Methode Electronics (MEI), expressing caution despite its recent stock performance. The author highlights three concerns: stagnant long-term revenue growth, declining return on invested capital (ROIC), and high debt levels. Because of these factors, the article suggests avoiding MEI and instead recommends considering other "high-quality" stocks.

title: SPX Technologies (SPXC) Well-Positioned for Data Center Infrastructure Evolution
summary: SPX Technologies (SPXC) is identified as one of the top industrial machinery and supplies stocks, with analysts giving it a moderately bullish outlook and an almost 8% upside potential. Despite concerns about Nvidia's cooling technology shifts affecting data center infrastructure, SPX's products are deemed integral for heat rejection in liquid-cooled systems, positioning the company well within the evolving market. The article also touches upon broader AI investment opportunities, emphasizing the massive energy demands of AI and highlighting overlooked companies in critical infrastructure roles, but clarifies that it considers other AI stocks to hold more promise than SPXC for higher, quicker returns.

title: Monolithic Power (MPWR) Earnings Transcript
summary: Monolithic Power Systems (MPWR) reported record annual and quarterly revenue, driven by strong growth in non-enterprise data markets and a raised 2025 enterprise data growth guidance to 50%. The company is expanding manufacturing capacity, increasing its dividend by 28%, and emphasizing a strategic shift from silicon to integrated modules and systems to drive higher value and operating leverage. The CFO also announced his retirement, with a transition to an interim CFO from within the company.

title: Why Google’s Bad News Was Good News for Broadcom and Nvidia
summary: Broadcom's stock received a boost following Google-parent Alphabet's announcement of significant spending plans for artificial-intelligence infrastructure. This suggests that Google's investments in AI development are being viewed positively by the market for companies like Broadcom and Nvidia, which likely provide the underlying technology. The article indicates that what might seem like "bad news" for Google in terms of spending, translated into "good news" for its suppliers.

title: Stock Market Live February 5, 2026: S&P (SPY) Swimming in Red
summary: The stock market saw major indices, including the S&P 500, Dow, and Nasdaq, significantly down on February 5, 2026, primarily due to Alphabet's projected $185 billion AI capex plan raising free cash flow concerns. Bitcoin also plummeted below $67,200, with bearish forecasts suggesting further drops. Despite the market downturn, analysts reiterated buy ratings for Nvidia, Alphabet, and Broadcom, while oversold gambling stocks like DraftKings and Flutter Entertainment are highlighted as potential opportunities ahead of Super Bowl Sunday 2026, given the historical surge in betting volumes.

title: 3 Healthcare Stocks We Steer Clear Of
summary: This article identifies three healthcare stocks—UFP Technologies (UFPT), Chemed (CHE), and AdaptHealth (AHCO)—that investors should approach with caution. The author highlights concerns such as slower revenue growth, increasing expenses, and waning returns on capital for these companies, despite the broader healthcare sector's recent strong performance. The piece advises investors to look for higher-quality alternatives given the financial metrics and market valuations of these specific firms.

title: 3 Cash-Burning Stocks We Approach with Caution
summary: This article identifies three cash-burning companies — Lovesac (LOVE), JELD-WEN (JELD), and PacBio (PACB) — that the author advises caution against due to various financial weaknesses like low free cash flow margins, waning returns on capital, or poor liquidity and declining sales. It highlights that while some companies burn cash for expansion, these are struggling to turn spending into sustainable growth, suggesting better investment opportunities exist.

title: 3 Consumer Stocks We Find Risky
summary: This article identifies three consumer stocks — Genesco (GCO), Cushman & Wakefield (CWK), and RE/MAX (RMAX) — as risky investments due to various financial and operational weaknesses. These weaknesses include poor sales performance, shrinking returns on capital, high debt, slow growth, and eroding profitability. The piece advises caution when investing in consumer discretionary companies and suggests alternative "High Quality" stock picks.

title: Coherent stock price: COHR whipsaws after earnings; AI data-center optics in focus
summary: Coherent (COHR) shares experienced significant volatility after its earnings report, dipping 0.8% in after-hours trading following a 15% swing during the day. The photonics supplier projected Q1 2026 revenue between $1.70 billion and $1.84 billion, driven by strong demand in the datacenter and communications segment, particularly for AI infrastructure optics. Despite analysts raising price targets due to strong results and guidance, investors remain cautious about margins and future demand for high-speed optics, especially with a major co-packaged optics order expected later in 2026.

title: 2 High-Yielding Stocks That Retirees Will Love
summary: The article highlights Chevron (CVX) and Southern Company (SO) as ideal high-yielding stocks for retirees due to their strong fundamentals, consistent dividend growth, and low volatility. Chevron, an oil and gas giant, offers a 4.1% yield and has increased dividends for 39 consecutive years, while Southern Company, a utility, provides a 3.3% yield and has a 24-year dividend growth streak. Both companies are presented as safe, long-term investments for reliable income.

title: Taiwan’s ASE sees its advanced packaging business doubling to $3.2 billion in 2026
summary: ASE Technology Holding expects its advanced packaging business to double to $3.2 billion in 2026, driven by strong demand for AI chips. The company plans significant capital expenditure, including an additional $1.5 billion for machinery this year, to support this growth. ASE's subsidiary, Siliconware Precision Industries, is a key packaging supplier for Nvidia's AI chips.

title: Earnings call transcript: Power Integrations beats Q4 2025 EPS forecast, stock dips
summary: Power Integrations Inc. (POWI) reported strong Q4 2025 earnings, surpassing analyst EPS forecasts, but its stock dipped due to broader market concerns. The company saw full-year revenue growth driven by its GaN product line and is focusing on operational efficiency and expansion into automotive and data center markets. Despite some market headwinds, particularly in consumer appliances, Power Integrations aims for continued growth in industrial and high-power segments.

title: Digital Realty: A New Investment Choice for Cloud and AI
summary: Digital Realty (DLR) is presented as an attractive investment for cloud and AI, highlighting its projected FFO growth, increasing occupancy rates driven by AI demand, and a stable 2.9% dividend yield. Despite a recent downgrade by BofA due to slower-than-anticipated AI participation, analysts generally forecast a stock price rise, reflecting the company's strong leasing performance and optimistic revenue guidance for 2026. Digital Realty's role as the world's largest data center operator and its REIT structure further underscore its potential in the rapidly growing AI data center industry.

title: Connection (CNXN) Shares Skyrocket, What You Need To Know
summary: Shares of Connection (NASDAQ:CNXN), an IT solutions provider, rose over 10% after the company reported fourth-quarter results. While revenue of $702.9 million missed estimates, adjusted earnings of $0.91 per share surpassed Wall Street expectations by 5.8%. Investors focused on the better-than-expected profitability, indicating confidence despite the revenue shortfall.

title: Boyd Gaming’s (NYSE:BYD) Q4 CY2025 Sales Beat Estimates
summary: Boyd Gaming (NYSE:BYD) exceeded Q4 CY2025 revenue estimates with sales reaching $1.06 billion, a 2% increase year-on-year. The company's non-GAAP adjusted EPS of $2.21 also beat analyst consensus by 14.2%. Despite solid quarterly performance, the stock traded down 1% immediately after reporting, and analysts project revenue to remain flat over the next 12 months.

title: After NVIDIA, Is SMCI the Smartest AI Stock to Buy Right Now?
summary: This article examines whether Super Micro Computer, Inc. (SMCI) is a better AI investment than NVIDIA (NVDA) given its lower valuation and strong recent performance. While NVIDIA dominates the AI market, SMCI is presented as undervalued with significant revenue growth. However, concerns regarding SMCI's declining gross margins and high debt-to-equity ratio are also highlighted, leading to a cautious "Hold" rating from Zacks.

title: Fortinet Reports Strong Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2025 Financial Results
summary: Fortinet (Nasdaq: FTNT) announced strong financial results for the fourth quarter and full year 2025, with revenue growing 15% and 14% year over year respectively. The company exceeded the ‘Rule of 45’ for the sixth consecutive year and reported significant growth in Unified SASE billings. Fortinet also expanded its share repurchase authorization by $1.0 billion and provided positive financial guidance for Q1 and the full fiscal year 2026.

title: MACOM (MTSI) Stock Trades Up, Here Is Why
summary: Shares of MACOM Technology Solutions (MTSI) jumped 7.4% after the company reported strong fourth-quarter 2025 financial results that beat expectations and issued an optimistic outlook for the first quarter of 2026. The company posted revenue of $271.6 million and adjusted earnings of $1.02 per share, both exceeding analyst estimates. MACOM also provided an upbeat forecast for Q1 2026, signaling strong business momentum to investors.

title: Fund Manager Recommends Elon Musk Buyback Tesla Shares To Spark Stock Turnaround
summary: Future Fund Managing Partner Gary Black suggests Elon Musk should buy back Tesla shares, launch a brand awareness campaign for autonomous driving, and introduce a conventional pickup truck to boost the stock. Black argues that a CEO buying back shares demonstrates confidence and that these measures are crucial given Tesla's double-digit stock drop in 2026 compared to the Nasdaq-100's single-digit decline and increasing competition in the autonomous vehicle sector. He also controversially recommends removing safety monitors from robotaxis to prove FSD's safety to skeptics.

title: UPS vs. FedEx: Which Logistics Giant Looks Like the Better Long-Term Play?​
summary: This article analyzes UPS and FedEx as long-term investments, highlighting FedEx's superior performance in stock returns and revenue growth compared to UPS. While UPS focuses on cost-cutting and margin expansion through significant layoffs and reduced Amazon shipments, FedEx prioritizes growth and market share. The analysis suggests FedEx appears to be the stronger investment currently, offering both growth and margin expansion, whereas UPS's aggressive cost-cutting may hinder future growth opportunities.

title: Retirees: Can This Silver ETF Help Reduce Your Risk in the Markets This Year?
summary: This article examines whether the iShares Silver Trust (SLV) is a suitable investment for retirees looking to reduce market risk. It highlights the ETF's recent volatility, likening it to a "meme stock," and notes its significant decline from a 52-week high despite strong past performance. The author concludes that due to current market fluctuations, retirees might find more stability and predictability in dividend-paying or value stocks instead of silver.

title: A Fresh Look At A10 Networks (ATEN) Valuation Following Recent Share Price Performance
summary: A10 Networks (ATEN) stock closed at US$17.52, drawing attention due to its recent share price performance. While the 1-year return is down, longer-term performance shows significant gains, suggesting strong underlying momentum. Analysts currently peg A10 Networks as undervalued at $23, driven by anticipated AI-related security demand and margin potential, but this valuation hinges on AI demand translating into actual revenue despite competitive pressures.

title: Jacobs Solutions Q4 2025 Earnings Beat Estimates, Stock Rises 3.2%
summary: Shares of Jacobs Solutions (NYSE: J) rose 3.2% after its Q4 2025 financial report, with revenue growing 12.3% year-over-year to $3.29 billion and adjusted EPS reaching $1.53, both exceeding analyst estimates. The company's backlog increased by 20.6% to $26.31 billion, indicating strong future demand, and its free cash flow margin improved significantly to 11.1%. This positive market reaction follows a previous stock drop three months prior, which was influenced by broader macroeconomic concerns related to interest rates and a strong jobs report.

title: Tower Semiconductor stock jumps on Nvidia 1.6T optics collaboration as earnings loom
summary: Tower Semiconductor shares rose 6.6% after announcing a collaboration with Nvidia on 1.6-terabit-per-second data center optical modules, which are crucial for high-speed data transfer in AI data centers. This news comes as the company's Q4 and full-year 2025 earnings report and Q1 2026 guidance are set to be released on February 11, where investors will look for signs of silicon photonics demand impacting revenue.

title: HIVE Digital Technologies Achieves 290% Year-Over-Year Hashrate Growth, Strengthening Its Position as a Global Leader in Green-Powered Digital Infrastructure
summary: HIVE Digital Technologies announced exceptional Bitcoin production results for January 2026, showcasing a 290% year-over-year hashrate growth, reaching an average of 22.2 Exahash per Second (EH/s) and peaking at 23.7 EH/s. The company produced 297 BTC in January, a 191% increase from the previous year, despite a 30% rise in Bitcoin mining difficulty. HIVE continues to expand its green-powered infrastructure, with current operational capacity at 440 MW and an additional 100 MW scheduled for deployment in Q3 2026, which will also support AI and high-performance computing workloads.

title: Why ScanSource (SCSC) Shares Are Sliding Today
summary: ScanSource (NASDAQ:SCSC) shares dropped 16.8% pre-market after the company reported disappointing fourth-quarter results, missing both revenue and earnings expectations. The company also issued a weaker-than-anticipated full-year revenue guidance, leading to a negative reaction from investors. This significant drop is rare for the stock, indicating a substantial impact on market perception.

title: Here's What Investors Must Know Ahead of Chegg's Q4 Earnings Release
summary: Chegg (CHGG) is set to announce its fourth-quarter 2025 earnings on February 9th, with analysts predicting a significant decline in EPS and net revenues due to increased AI-driven alternatives and reduced subscriber engagement. The company's revenues from both Subscription Services and Skills and Other segments are expected to decrease, while margins are also projected to fall due to reduced top-line leverage and restructuring costs. Despite some efforts in AI incorporation and cost management, the Zacks Model does not conclusively predict an earnings beat for Chegg.

title: 3 Reasons to Hold Oracle Stock Despite 43% Decline in 6 Months
summary: Oracle's stock has declined significantly by 42.8% over the past six months, but several fundamental factors suggest investors should hold their positions. The company shows strong long-term revenue visibility with an unprecedented $523 billion backlog, strategic infrastructure expansion for AI workloads, and a differentiating multi-cloud strategy. However, Oracle's premium valuation and increased capital expenditures warrant caution for new investors.

title: Marvell Deepens AI Data Center Role With Celestial AI Optical Deal
summary: Marvell Technology has acquired Celestial AI, integrating its optical interconnect technology into Marvell's portfolio for AI infrastructure and data centers. This acquisition strengthens Marvell's position in high-speed connectivity for AI workloads, allowing it to offer optical solutions alongside custom AI processors and networking. While the deal deepens Marvell's role in AI infrastructure spending, investors should note that the financial impact is not expected until the second half of fiscal 2028.

title: Power Integrations earnings on deck: Can GaN rebound offset slump?
summary: Power Integrations Inc. is set to report fourth-quarter results, with analysts expecting $0.22 per share on $103.0 million revenue, reflecting a decline from the prior quarter due to weakness in consumer appliance markets. Investors are closely watching the company's datacenter opportunities, particularly its GaN technology and collaboration with NVIDIA, along with the timing of a cyclical recovery in core end markets and the impact of recent leadership changes on market diversification. Despite near-term headwinds, analysts maintain a "Strong Buy" rating with an average price target of $51.00.

title: Vishay Intertechnology Q4 2025 Results Beat Revenue Forecasts, Issues Strong 2026 Outlook
summary: Vishay Intertechnology (NYSE:VSH) announced strong fourth-quarter 2025 financial results, surpassing Wall Street's revenue expectations with $800.9 million, driven by increased demand in industrial and AI-related power applications. The company also provided an optimistic revenue guidance for the first quarter of 2026, exceeding analyst forecasts. Despite a modest five-year annualized revenue growth, Vishay demonstrated significant improvement in free cash flow and operating margin, indicating a positive financial turnaround driven by increased orders and a high book-to-bill ratio.

title: Celestica Projects Strong Growth as AI Demand Skyrockets
summary: Celestica Inc. is experiencing significant stock growth due to high demand for AI-related data center technology, leading to impressive Q4 2025 results and elevated forecasts for 2026. Analysts like BofA and Barclays have raised price targets, recognizing Celestica's strategic alignment with AI infrastructure investments and its strong financial performance. The company's focus on high-speed data center switches and accelerated servers positions it favorably to capitalize on the expanding AI market.
authors: Tim Bohen, Ben Sturgill, Ellis Hobbs

title: 2 Fidelity ETFs To Buy In February
summary: This article recommends two Fidelity ETFs, the Fidelity Blue Chip Growth ETF (FBCG) and the Fidelity Disruptive Technology ETF (FDTX), as strong buys for February. FBCG focuses on large-cap growth stocks, particularly in the tech sector, with strong returns over the past three years. FDTX invests in disruptive technology companies, showing significant growth since its 2020 launch and concentrating on the semiconductor and software industries.

title: Amdocs pivots to agentic AI OS, names new president and CEO
summary: Amdocs is undergoing a significant strategic pivot, launching an agentic AI operating system (aOS) designed to enhance existing telco OSS/BSS stacks, alongside a major leadership change with Shimie Hortig set to become the new President and CEO. This transformation aims to modernize its core telecom business and expand into enterprise technology platforms, with financial services as a key vertical. The company also extended its partnership with T-Mobile to include managed services, software development, AI innovation, and UScellular integration, signaling confidence in its new direction.

title: TSMC Founder Reappears As 2nm And Arizona Fabs Shape AI Outlook
summary: TSMC founder Morris Chang recently met with Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang, coinciding with TSMC's mass production of 2-nanometer chips and expansion into Arizona. These developments underscore TSMC's pivotal role in global AI and high-performance computing chip production, influencing the future of the semiconductor industry. Investors should monitor the progress of overseas fabs and acknowledge the company's valuation metrics, including its P/E ratio and flagged non-cash earnings risk.

title: 5 Insightful Analyst Questions From MarineMax's Q4 Earnings Call
summary: MarineMax's Q4 CY2025 results showed better-than-expected sales but missed adjusted EPS and EBITDA estimates, leading to a negative market reaction. Management cited elevated promotional activity and cautious retail behavior impacting margins despite premium product demand. Analysts raised questions regarding discounting assumptions, the disconnect between higher average selling prices and gross margins, demand trends across income groups, boat margin recovery, and factors contributing to margin decline.

title: Tower Semiconductor Shares Surge 17% on Nvidia Partnership for Optical Modules
summary: Tower Semiconductor's shares surged 17% following an announcement of a partnership with Nvidia to develop 1.6T data center optical modules. This collaboration is expected to significantly enhance data transmission capabilities and bolster Tower's competitive edge in silicon photonics technology, doubling data rates compared to previous solutions. Despite some bearish retail sentiment, investor optimism and high message volumes on Stocktwits reflect strong market interest in this development.

title: Astera Labs Broadens Scorpio X-Series Smart Fabric Switch Roadmap to Address Expanding Scale-Up Market Opportunities
summary: Astera Labs is expanding its Scorpio X-Series smart fabric switch roadmap to capitalize on the growing scale-up switching market, estimated to reach $20 billion by 2030. The updated roadmap includes new capabilities like increased radix, support for platform-specific protocols, in-network computing, Hypercast technology, and optical connectivity to meet the diverse and evolving demands of next-gen AI workloads in hyperscale environments. This strategic expansion is a result of close collaboration with hyperscale customers and aims to provide flexible, purpose-built connectivity solutions for large AI clusters.

title: Altrius Capital Management Inc Lowers Holdings in Caterpillar Inc. $CAT
summary: Altrius Capital Management Inc. reduced its stake in Caterpillar Inc. by 20% in the third quarter of 2025, selling 2,765 shares and retaining 11,045 shares valued at $5.27 million. Despite institutional ownership and strong fundamentals, recent insider selling totaling over 104,000 shares worth $67 million could create short-term selling pressure. Caterpillar reported strong Q4 results, beating EPS and revenue estimates, and has a significant backlog, positive guidance, and plans for increased capital expenditure.

title: Nvidia may not release new gaming chip this year due to memory shortage: report (NVDA:NASDAQ)
summary: Due to an ongoing memory supply crunch, Nvidia may not release a new gaming GPU in 2026. The company is reportedly prioritizing its existing memory supply instead of launching new products. This decision comes as the memory shortage affects the tech industry.

title: Sandisk Spin Off Puts AI Data Center NAND Strategy In Focus
summary: SanDisk has spun off from Western Digital, independently focusing on high-capacity SSDs and NAND for AI data centers. The company has extended its joint venture with Kioxia until 2034, securing long-term NAND supply crucial for scaling AI workloads. This strategic refocus and supply security are key for investors, linking Sandisk's future directly to the growing demand for AI infrastructure.

title: Flex Ltd. (NASDAQ:FLEX) Q3 2026 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Flex Ltd. (NASDAQ:FLEX) reported strong Q3 2026 earnings, with revenue up 8% year-over-year to $7.1 billion and adjusted EPS at a record $0.87, exceeding expectations despite missing on an earlier EPS estimate. The company highlighted significant growth in its data center business, driven by AI and integrated solutions, and strong performance in its Reliability segment, particularly in power and industrial. Flex also updated its full-year guidance, anticipating revenue between $27.2 billion and $27.5 billion, and maintained its commitment to disciplined execution and margin expansion.

title: TSMC Expands AI Chip Production to Japan
summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) is expanding its advanced AI chip production to Japan to mitigate geopolitical risks associated with its Taiwan-based manufacturing and meet the increasing demand for cutting-edge chips. This strategic move follows TSMC's strong Q4 2025 financial results, with significant revenue and net income growth driven by advanced technologies. The expansion in Japan offers supply chain proximity to key customers like NVIDIA and Apple and further diversifies TSMC's global manufacturing footprint, alongside its existing facilities in Arizona.

title: Tapestry (NYSE:TPR) Delivers Impressive Q4 CY2025
summary: Tapestry (NYSE:TPR) reported impressive Q4 CY2025 results, exceeding revenue and EPS expectations with sales up 14% year-on-year to $2.50 billion. The luxury fashion conglomerate also raised its full-year guidance for both revenue and EPS, indicating strong performance driven by increased efficiency and robust demand. The stock reacted positively, trading up 5% immediately following the announcement.

title: FLEX Q4 Deep Dive: Data Center and Industrial Growth Offset Consumer Weakness
summary: Flex (NASDAQ:FLEX) reported Q4 CY2025 revenue and adjusted EPS that exceeded Wall Street expectations, driven by strong demand in its data center and industrial segments, which counteracted weakness in consumer-facing businesses. The company's management highlighted a strategic shift towards higher-value offerings, including AI-driven infrastructure and medical devices, as key to margin improvement and future growth. Flex also raised its full-year Adjusted EPS guidance, signaling confidence despite ongoing consumer market challenges.

title: Citizens Maintains Outperform Rating On CRISPR Therapeutics (CRSP) Citing Undervalued Pipeline
summary: Citizens maintained an Outperform rating on CRISPR Therapeutics (CRSP) despite reducing its price target from $86 to $80, citing that much of the company's pipeline remains undervalued and anticipates late-stage development for up to seven opportunities in 2027. This follows a similar sentiment from Bank of America, which also reduced its price target but maintained a Buy rating, highlighting aligning factors for biotech growth. CRISPR Therapeutics is a gene editing company, though the article suggests that certain AI stocks may offer greater promise and lower risk for investors.

title: A Look At American Superconductor (AMSC) Valuation After Strong Third Quarter Earnings And Record Profitability
summary: American Superconductor (AMSC) reported strong third-quarter fiscal 2025 results with significant revenue and net income, yet its share price has recently declined. Despite this, the stock is considered 54.7% undervalued against a fair value estimate of $61, driven by anticipated tailwinds from increased government and utility spending on grid modernization. However, the current P/E ratio of 82.4x, almost double its peer average, suggests potential valuation risk if market sentiment shifts.

title: SiTime Corporation (NASDAQ:SITM) Receives Consensus Recommendation of "Moderate Buy" from Analysts
summary: SiTime Corporation (NASDAQ:SITM) has received a consensus "Moderate Buy" rating from nine analysts, with an average 12-month price target of $367.50. This optimism follows SiTime's strong Q4 results, which beat expectations, and its strategic acquisition of Renesas’ timing business, expected to accelerate revenue growth. However, concerns remain regarding a $42.9 million GAAP net loss in FY2025, elevated operating expenses, and potential financing and dilution issues related to the acquisition and recent insider sales.

title: PLUS Q4 Deep Dive: AI Tailwinds and Enterprise Projects Drive Growth Amid Service Delays
summary: ePlus (NASDAQ:PLUS) reported strong Q4 CY2025 results, surpassing revenue and profit expectations due to high demand for integrated AI, cloud, networking, and security solutions.
