Despite project delays in the retail sector and an industry-wide memory chip shortage, the company anticipates continued growth driven by AI adoption and plans to expand its services and market reach. Management increased guidance for full-year net sales, gross profit, and adjusted EBITDA, expressing confidence in managing potential roadblocks.

title: PTC Q4 Deep Dive: AI Integration and Deferred Revenue Shape Guidance
summary: PTC (NASDAQ:PTC) reported Q4 CY2025 results that exceeded revenue expectations, with sales up 21.4% year-on-year, and provided strong next-quarter revenue guidance. The company's performance was driven by robust customer demand for intelligent product lifecycle solutions, momentum in large deals, and strategic AI integration across its product portfolio. Future growth is expected to be fueled by deferred annual recurring revenue (ARR) from multi-year contracts and continued adoption of AI-enhanced product releases and SaaS offerings.

title: Teradyne, Inc. (NASDAQ:TER) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Teradyne (NASDAQ: TER) reported strong Q4 and full-year 2025 results, with significant revenue and earnings growth driven by AI demand, particularly in compute and memory. The company is strategically shifting its focus from mobile to AI-driven applications and expects this to continue to fuel growth into 2026, setting a new target earnings model based on an ATE TAM of $12 billion to $14 billion. Teradyne projects nearly double its 2025 revenue and 2.5 times its EPS in this midterm, anticipating continued share gains across its segments.

title: 3 Reasons ECPG is Risky and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: This article analyzes Encore Capital Group (ECPG), deeming it risky despite a recent 51.2% stock surge. The author advises against buying ECPG due to disappointing long-term revenue growth, declining earnings per share, and high debt levels with an inadequate net-debt-to-EBITDA ratio. Instead, it suggests looking for superior, quality stocks with stronger fundamentals.

title: Why Is Kulicke and Soffa (KLIC) Stock Soaring Today
summary: Shares of Kulicke & Soffa (KLIC) jumped following their strong fourth-quarter 2025 financial results, which surpassed both earnings and revenue expectations. The semiconductor production equipment company also provided an optimistic outlook for the first quarter of 2026. This positive performance and guidance, coupled with broader industry optimism driven by companies like Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co., fueled investor confidence, leading to a new 52-week high for the stock.

title: 1 Industrials Stock with Impressive Fundamentals and 2 We Find Risky
summary: This article analyzes three industrial stocks, recommending Armstrong World Industries (AWI) as a strong buy due to impressive revenue growth, strong operating margins, and share buybacks. Conversely, it advises selling BrightView (BV) and Luxfer (LXFR) due to declining sales, falling EPS, and underwhelming returns on capital, highlighting their struggles in the current market cycle.

title: Tower, NVIDIA silicon photonics offer up to 2x AI data speeds
summary: Tower Semiconductor announced a collaboration with NVIDIA on 1.6T data center optical modules, utilizing Tower's silicon photonics platform. This technology aims to achieve up to double the data-rate compared to previous silicon photonics solutions, boosting bandwidth and throughput for AI infrastructure. The partnership positions Tower as a key foundry for high-speed optical interconnects in AI, data center networking, and advanced telecom.

title: AXT, Inc. (AXTI): A Bull Case Theory
summary: This article summarizes a bullish thesis on AXT, Inc. (AXTI), highlighting its strong position in the optical communications sector due to the AI boom. AXTI is a leading manufacturer of Indium Phosphide (InP) substrate wafers, essential for high-performance lasers in data centers, and benefits from a unique pricing arbitrage for raw materials. Despite geopolitical risks associated with its China-based manufacturing, the company projects significant revenue and EBITDA growth.

title: After Earnings, Is Tesla Stock a Buy, a Sell, or Fairly Valued?
summary: Morningstar maintains a narrow economic moat rating and a "Very High" uncertainty rating for Tesla. Following its Q4 earnings, Morningstar raised its fair value estimate for Tesla to $400 per share from $300, driven by robotaxi valuation, autonomous driving software adoption, and the humanoid robot business. Despite this, Tesla shares are currently considered fairly valued, trading about 10% above the fair value estimate, placing them in 3-star territory due to expected volatility as new products progress.

title: Pinning Down Himax Technologies, Inc.'s (NASDAQ:HIMX) P/E Is Difficult Right Now
summary: Himax Technologies, Inc.'s P/E ratio of 21.2x is similar to the US market median, which is puzzling because its earnings have decreased by 21% in the last year and 82% over three years. Analysts forecast a modest 6.7% EPS growth for the coming year, significantly lower than the broader market's 16% expectation. This disparity suggests investors might be overlooking the company's inferior earnings outlook, potentially leaving them vulnerable to future disappointment if the P/E ratio adjusts to align with growth expectations.

title: 5 Insightful Analyst Questions From Allegro MicroSystems's Q4 Earnings Call
summary: Allegro MicroSystems reported strong Q4 results, exceeding revenue and EBITDA estimates due to robust demand in automotive and industrial sectors, particularly data centers. The article highlights key analyst questions from the earnings call, focusing on gross margin, growth outlook for different segments, data center product pipeline, and operating expenses. Management provided insights into these areas, forecasting continued growth and addressing inventory and operational efficiency.

title: Portside Wealth Group LLC Purchases New Position in Synopsys, Inc. $SNPS
summary: Portside Wealth Group LLC has established a new position in Synopsys, Inc. (SNPS), acquiring 4,692 shares valued at approximately $2.315 million during the third quarter. Institutional investors now collectively own about 85.47% of the semiconductor company. Synopsys recently surpassed Q3 earnings estimates, reporting $2.90 EPS against a $2.79 consensus, with revenues increasing 37.8% year-over-year to $2.25 billion, and has issued optimistic FY2026 guidance.

title: The Top 5 Analyst Questions From ResMed's Q4 Earnings Call
summary: ResMed's Q4 performance exceeded expectations due to strong demand for masks and devices, growth in digital health software, and operational efficiencies. CEO Michael Farrell highlighted double-digit growth in the U.S. mask segment and increased patient engagement, including those using GLP-1 medications. This article details the top five analyst questions from the earnings call, covering topics like the contribution of VirtuOx, the impact of GLP-1 drugs, SG&A expenses, patient funnel improvements, and competitive dynamics.

title: TENB Q4 Deep Dive: AI Security Demand, Platform Consolidation Drive Momentum
summary: Tenable (TENB) reported strong fourth-quarter 2025 results, outperforming revenue and non-GAAP profit expectations, driven by demand for AI exposure management and accelerated adoption of its Tenable One platform. Management is confident in continued platform expansion and investment in AI-driven innovation, which is expected to be central to future customer buying decisions. The company anticipates maintaining margin expansion while balancing growth, supported by increased professional services demand and its extensive exposure data.

title: Amdocs agentic aOS system boosts Gen AI support for telecom operators
summary: Amdocs has launched aOS, an agentic operating system designed for telecommunications to accelerate Generative AI strategies. This system aims to embed intelligence into telecom operations, improving customer and employee experiences and unlocking new growth opportunities and operational efficiencies for Communication Services Providers (CSPs). Amdocs highlights that aOS will help CSPs move from AI experimentation to real impact by creating a cognitive ecosystem for AI agents, built on modular architecture and strategic partnerships with tech leaders like Nvidia, Microsoft, Google, and AWS.

title: Navigating the Turnaround: A Deep-Dive into Mercury Systems (MRCY) in 2026
summary: Mercury Systems (MRCY) has completed a significant turnaround by 2026, transitioning from a component vendor to a systems-integrated powerhouse in the aerospace and defense sector. The company has seen its stock price surge over 135% in the last year, with a record backlog of $1.5 billion, driven by new leadership and a focus on operational excellence. While facing risks like short-term revenue dips and fixed-price contracts, Mercury Systems is well-positioned for future growth through international expansion, space electronics, and potential M&A, capitalizing on trends like "Software-Defined Defense" and the Replicator Initiative.

title: The Rack-Scale Revolution: A Deep Dive into Super Micro Computer (SMCI) in 2026
summary: This article analyzes Super Micro Computer (SMCI) in early 2026, highlighting its transformation into a key AI infrastructure provider despite facing internal governance issues and significant margin compression. The company's unique "Building Block" approach and dominance in Direct Liquid Cooling (DLC) technology have propelled its revenue growth, especially with the demand for NVIDIA Blackwell-based clusters. However, SMCI grapples with intense competition, ongoing regulatory probes, and reliance on NVIDIA, making its future both promising and volatile for investors.

title: KeyBanc Keeps Their Buy Rating on Advanced Micro Devices (AMD)
summary: KeyBanc analyst John Vinh has reiterated a Buy rating on Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) with a $300 price target, citing the company's strong financial performance. This positive outlook follows AMD's latest earnings report, which showed significant revenue and profit growth year-over-year. Despite a negative sentiment from corporate insider activity, with some insiders selling shares recently, Barclays also issued a Buy rating on AMD, though RBC Capital maintains a Hold rating.

title: Jefferies Remains a Hold on Novartis AG (NOVN)
summary: Jefferies analyst Benjamin Jackson CFA maintained a Hold rating on Novartis AG (NOVN) with a price target of CHF110.00. TipRanks reports Jackson CFA has a 3-star rating with a 7.7% average return and a 56.25% success rate, specializing in the Healthcare sector. Novartis AG's latest quarterly revenue was CHF14.36 billion, with a net profit of CHF3.93 billion.

title: Wall Street trading floors shocked at the magnitude of the momentum stock sell-off
summary: Wall Street is trying to understand if the recent momentum stock sell-off, marked by a significant drop in the iShares MSCI USA Momentum Factor ETF, indicates a simple sector rotation or a broader breakdown of the bull market. The decline was substantial, with Bank of America and JPMorgan noting it as one of the worst one-day moves in years, yet the broader S&P 500 saw only a modest dip. While Goldman Sachs suggests momentum dips can be buying opportunities, they advise short-term hedging due to the absence of clear capitulation signals and the strong run-up prior to the slide.

title: TSMC Needs to Make More Advanced Chips. Why It’s Turning to Japan.
summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (TSMC), the leading producer of high-end chips, is facing increasing demand for its advanced products. To address this, TSMC plans to expand its manufacturing capabilities by producing these high-end chips in Japan for the first time. This strategic move aims to boost its capacity for advanced chip production.

title: MZTI Q4 Deep Dive: Acquisition and Product Expansion Amid Volume Pressures
summary: The Marzetti Company (MZTI) reported mixed results for Q4 CY2025, meeting revenue expectations but slightly missing non-GAAP profit estimates, with sales up 1.7% and adjusted EPS at $2.20. Despite a challenging quarter due to retail volume softness and strong prior-year comparisons, the company is focusing on strategic growth through product innovation, supply chain simplification, and the recent acquisition of Bachan’s Japanese American barbecue sauce brand. Management expects this acquisition to be immediately accretive to gross margins and expand market reach, alongside continued growth in core brands and licensed products.

title: Tradr 1.5X Short NVDA Daily ETF (NASDAQ:NVDS) Shares Up 5.1% – Time to Buy?
summary: The Tradr 1.5X Short NVDA Daily ETF (NASDAQ:NVDS) saw a 5.1% increase in its share price on Wednesday, trading at $30.76 with a significant rise in volume. JPMorgan Chase & Co. recently acquired a new position in the ETF, purchasing 10,200 shares valued at approximately $147,000. NVDS is an exchange-traded fund launched on July 14, 2022, providing inverse (-1.25x) exposure to the daily price movements of Nvidia stock.

title: TSMC to Make More-Advanced Chips in Japan as Part of AI Push
summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) announced plans to begin making more advanced 3-nanometer chips in Japan, a significant development for the country's AI technology ambitions. This move, discussed by TSMC Chairman C.C. Wei and Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi, will see production at TSMC's Kumamoto site to support strategic sectors like data centers, AI, robotics, and autonomous driving. This marks TSMC's first 3-nanometer chip production in Japan, expanding beyond its initial focus on 6- to 12-nanometer logic chips for automotive and telecoms.

title: ADVANCED MICRO DEVICES INC SEC 10-K Report
summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. (AMD) has released its 2025 10-K report, showcasing significant financial growth with net revenue reaching $34.6 billion, a 34% increase from the previous year, driven by strong demand in Data Center, Client, and Gaming segments. The report also highlights strategic initiatives in AI and high-performance computing, including new product launches and the acquisition of ZT Systems. Challenges include industry cyclicality, intense competition, reliance on third-party manufacturers, and evolving regulatory risks, which AMD plans to mitigate through continued innovation, strategic partnerships, and robust financial management.

title: Should You Invest in the Pacer Data and Digital Revolution ETF (TRFK)?
summary: The Pacer Data and Digital Revolution ETF (TRFK) is a passively managed ETF focused on the Technology - Broad sector, launched in June 2022. It holds a "Buy" rank from Zacks, making it a strong option for investors seeking exposure to the technology sector. The fund has an expense ratio of 0.49% and has shown positive performance year-to-date and over the last 12 months.

title: Jefferies reiterates Buy rating on Broadcom stock amid AI growth
summary: Jefferies has reiterated its Buy rating and $500.00 price target for Broadcom (NASDAQ: AVGO), citing the company's strong position in the artificial intelligence and networking markets. The firm highlighted Broadcom's "well ahead" status in custom on-package (COT) business and expected growth in its networking segment, further supported by Google's increased AI spending guidance and positive InvestingPro data suggesting undervaluation. Other analysts from Wolfe Research and Wells Fargo have also recently upgraded Broadcom's stock, underscoring the semiconductor giant's strategic advancements and potential for future growth.

title: Carlisle Companies (CSL) Margin Compression Challenges Bullish Earnings Narratives
summary: Carlisle Companies (CSL) reported Q4 2025 revenue of US$1,127.7 million and basic EPS of US$3.21, with trailing net profit margins falling from 17.3% to 14.8%. While the company has a strong five-year EPS growth of 15.9%, recent results show slower growth forecasts (5.7% annual earnings growth, 3.1% revenue growth) compared to the broader US market. The article highlights mixed valuation signals, with the stock trading above its DCF fair value despite the margin compression and slower projected growth.

title: Why Photronics (PLAB) Is Down 5.6% After Raising 2026 Capex Guidance And Beating EPS Estimates
summary: Photronics (PLAB) shares dropped 5.6% despite beating EPS estimates and raising 2026 capital expenditure guidance to $330 million from $190 million. The company emphasizes its unique position as a U.S.-headquartered producer of trusted photomasks, critical for semiconductor supply chains. The increased capex indicates a focus on capacity expansion and deeper customer engagement, which investors are weighing against potential operational and capital allocation risks.

title: SoftBank slips 7% as Arm Holdings licensing revenues lag Wall Street expectations (SFTBY:OTCMKTS)
summary: SoftBank Group shares fell 7% after its majority-owned chip design unit, Arm Holdings, reported licensing revenues below Wall Street expectations. This occurred despite Arm's efforts to expand its licensing segment with new technology designs. The drop in SoftBank's stock price reflects investor concern over Arm's licensing performance.

title: TSMC to make advanced AI semiconductors in Japan in boost for its chipmaking ambitions
summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Corp. (TSMC) announced plans to manufacture advanced 3-nanometer semiconductors in Japan to meet the surging demand for AI-related products. This move, a significant win for Japan's chipmaking ambitions, was revealed during a meeting between TSMC's CEO C.C. Wei and Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi. The new factory in Kumamoto Prefecture will produce chips for AI, robotics, and autonomous driving, sectors deemed strategically important by Japan.

title: The Top 5 Analyst Questions From ResMed’s Q4 Earnings Call
summary: ResMed (RMD) reported a strong Q4 CY2025, outperforming analyst estimates in revenue, EPS, and EBITDA, driven by high demand for masks and devices and growth in digital health software. The company's CEO, Michael Farrell, attributed success to product launches, operational efficiencies, and increased patient engagement, including those using GLP-1 medications. Key analyst questions focused on the impact of VirtuOx, GLP-1 medications, SG&A expenses, patient funnel improvements, and the competitive landscape with a potential Philips reentry.

title: Taiwan's TSMC tells Japan PM of plan to produce advanced chips in Kumamoto
summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (TSMC) has informed Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi of its plan to mass-produce 3-nanometer semiconductors in Kumamoto Prefecture, Japan. This is an upgrade from their initial plan of 6-nanometer technology and marks Japan's first production of such advanced chips. The move is welcomed by the Japanese government, which views domestic chip output as crucial for economic security and has offered significant subsidies for the project.

title: MACOM Faces China AI Export Reviews As Valuation Looks Stretched
summary: MACOM Technology Solutions is facing significant uncertainty due to US government reviews of export licenses for high-end AI chip shipments to China, which are currently affecting Chinese customer orders. This situation introduces geopolitical risk and could impact MACOM's sales channels and customer planning cycles, especially given its stock currently trades above analyst targets and its estimated fair value. Investors are advised to monitor disclosures regarding China revenue exposure and management comments on export approvals.

title: Intel and Softbank aim ZAM at HBM
summary: Intel is collaborating with Softbank subsidiary SAIMEMORY to develop Z-Angle Memory (ZAM), a new memory technology based on stacked DRAM, similar to HBM. This initiative stems from Intel's Next Generation DRAM Bonding (NGDB) project, aiming for higher density, bandwidth, and lower power consumption compared to existing HBM. SAIMEMORY, backed by Softbank and Fujitsu, plans to commercialize ZAM for high-performance computing and AI by 2030, potentially allowing Japan to re-enter the semiconductor memory market.

title: Envirotech Vehicles, Inc. Advances Into Execution Phase Following On-Site Engineering Validation of Modular AI & Power Infrastructure Initiative with AZIO AI
summary: Envirotech Vehicles, Inc. (EVTV) has moved into the execution phase of its modular data and power infrastructure initiative with AZIO AI Corporation after completing an on-site engineering and technical validation review. The validation confirmed technical readiness through comprehensive assessments of fuel, power, and compute systems, leading to established deployment pathways. This advancement positions EVTV to leverage its expertise in modular manufacturing for emerging energy-and-compute use cases requiring rapid deployment of mobile AI units.

title: American Superconductor (NASDAQ:AMSC) Delivers Impressive Q4 CY2025, Stock Jumps 19.7%
summary: American Superconductor (NASDAQ:AMSC) reported strong Q4 CY2025 results, with revenue topping analyst estimates by 8% and non-GAAP EPS significantly exceeding expectations. Despite slightly lower-than-anticipated Q1 CY2026 guidance for both revenue and EPS, the company's stock jumped 19.7% immediately after the report. AMSC has shown impressive long-term revenue growth and improving operating margins, signaling an inflection point towards profitability.

title: Alibaba Group Holding Limited (BABA): A Bull Case Theory
summary: This article summarizes a bullish thesis on Alibaba Group Holding Limited (BABA), highlighting its stronger-than-expected Q2 earnings with revenue reaching 247.8 billion yuan and a 34% year-over-year growth in cloud revenue driven by AI-related investments. The reacceleration of its cloud division is seen as a key growth driver and a stabilizing force for the company amidst a challenging environment for Chinese tech. This performance reinforces the belief that Alibaba's cloud segment could lead to an investor re-rating.

title: Intel Corporation (INTC): A Bull Case Theory
summary: This article summarizes a bullish thesis on Intel Corporation (INTC) based on a large institutional options trade and the company's improving financial and operational stability. A significant put sale at a $20 strike price signals major institutional confidence in Intel's solvency and tangible book value, backed by recovering gross margins, cost reductions, and successful 18A process node development. This, combined with government support and "hard asset" base, presents an asymmetric risk/reward opportunity for investors.

title: TSEM Stock Soars After Tower Semiconductor Partners With Nvidia For Data Center Optical Modules
summary: Tower Semiconductor shares surged after the company announced a partnership with Nvidia for 1.6T data center optical modules. The company's silicon photonics (SiPho) technology is optimized for high-speed optical interconnects, enabling up to double the data rate compared to prior solutions and is available as an open platform for various applications including data centers, high-performance computing, telecommunications, and autonomous cars. TSEM stock is up 144% over the past 12 months.

title: News | Brandywine to kick off $300 million sales strategy alongside improving office market
summary: Brandywine Realty Trust plans to sell off up to $300 million of its portfolio this year, focusing on its best-performing properties as the office market improves. The Philadelphia-based REIT anticipates an occupancy boost due to increasing demand for top-tier office spaces and improving lease economics. CEO Jerry Sweeney noted increased tour levels and conversion rates in core markets, projecting positive net absorption for the first time in years.

title: Eagle Point sells acres commercial realty (ACR) stock worth $118,216
summary: Eagle Point Credit Management LLC, a significant owner in ACRES Commercial Realty Corp (NASDAQ:ACR), has sold preferred stock totaling $118,216 across different transactions between February 2nd and February 4th, 2026. The sales involved both Series D and Series C preferred stocks at varying prices. Despite these sales, Eagle Point still retains substantial holdings in both preferred and common stock of ACRES Commercial Realty Corp.

title: 3 Industrials Stocks Walking a Fine Line
summary: This article examines three industrial stocks—nLIGHT (LASR), Donaldson (DCI), and Worthington (WOR)—that the author advises against investing in. Despite the industrials sector's recent strong performance, these companies show concerning financial metrics such as slow revenue growth, increased cash burn, shrinking returns on capital, and declining earnings per share, suggesting they may struggle when market conditions shift. The article cautions investors to be discerning and offers an alternative list of "Top 5 Growth Stocks" to consider instead.

title: OPENLANE (OPLN): Buy, Sell, or Hold Post Q3 Earnings?
summary: This article analyzes OPENLANE (OPLN) post-Q3 earnings, concluding that despite recent stock gains, the company lacks long-term appeal due to revenue decline, ineffective growth initiatives, and high debt levels. The author suggests investors look for higher-quality stocks, citing concerns about OPLN's business quality and valuation.

title: Earnings call transcript: Alphabet Q4 2025 highlights strong earnings beat
summary: Alphabet Inc. (GOOG) delivered strong financial results for Q4 2025, beating analyst expectations with an EPS of $2.82 and revenue of $113.8 billion. The company saw an 18% increase in revenue year-over-year, surpassed $400 billion in annual revenue for the first time, and plans significant AI investments with anticipated 2026 CapEx between $175 billion-$185 billion. Key growth drivers included advancements in AI, increased demand for enterprise AI solutions, strong performance in Search, YouTube subscriptions, and Google Cloud, with the stock rising 0.97% in after-hours trading.

title: Palantir and Woodward Jumped on Earnings Beats—Here Are 3 More Setups to Watch
summary: Palantir Technologies (PLTR) and Woodward (WWD) recently saw significant stock rallies after beating earnings expectations and providing strong forward guidance, illustrating a market trend that rewards companies with raised outlooks. Investment expert Louis Navellier identified this pattern, emphasizing that guidance is a crucial catalyst. He highlights Vertiv (VRT), EMCOR Group (EME), and NVIDIA (NVDA) as three companies that exhibit similar strong setups going into their upcoming earnings reports, where positive guidance is expected to drive similar stock performance.

title: Allegion raises quarterly dividend by 8% to $0.55 per share
summary: Allegion plc announced an 8% increase in its quarterly dividend to $0.55 per ordinary share, marking its 12th consecutive annual dividend hike. The dividend is payable on March 31, 2026, to shareholders of record on March 13, 2026. This financial update follows an earlier dividend announcement of $0.51 for late 2025 and coincides with product line advancements, including enhancements to the LCN Senior Swing automatic door operator series with new AdaptivIQ technology.

title: Sam Altman Pushes Back On Report Claiming OpenAI Unhappy With Jensen Huang-Led Company's AI Chips Alternatives: 'Love' Working With Nvidia
summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman strongly denied reports suggesting the company was unhappy with Nvidia's AI chips and seeking alternatives, reaffirming their close partnership. Altman stated OpenAI "loves working with Nvidia" and considers them the "best AI chips in the world," expecting to remain a "gigantic customer." While acknowledging OpenAI's expanding partnerships with other chipmakers to meet growing compute needs, a senior OpenAI executive confirmed Nvidia remains their most important partner and the core of their compute infrastructure.

title: Why Super Micro (SMCI) Stock Is Trading Up Today
summary: Shares of Super Micro (SMCI) jumped 14.1% after the company reported strong fourth-quarter results and significantly raised its full-year revenue forecast, driven by booming demand for its artificial intelligence (AI) servers. The company's revenue surged 123% year-over-year to $12.68 billion, surpassing analyst estimates, and adjusted earnings per share also exceeded expectations. Super Micro boosted its full-year revenue guidance to a midpoint of $40 billion, reflecting an optimistic outlook on continued AI infrastructure spending.

title: Upwork and eBay Shares Are Falling, What You Need To Know
summary: Shares of Upwork and eBay fell by 6.9% and 6.5% respectively, after Anthropic unveiled significant upgrades to its enterprise AI tools, sparking concerns that AI could directly replace current software-driven work rather than just enhance productivity. This news led investors to fear that AI is becoming a direct substitute for parts of the software and services industry. Upwork's stock is down 14.1% since the beginning of the year, trading significantly below its 52-week high.

title: Don't Know Which AI Stock To Buy? Here's the Easiest Way To Play the Once-in-a-Generation Tech Boom.
summary: This article suggests that for investors looking to gain exposure to the AI boom without picking individual stocks, the VanEck Semiconductor ETF (SMH) is an excellent option. It highlights that semiconductors are critical for AI and will continue to see strong demand even beyond the current AI trend. The SMH ETF has historically outperformed the S&P 500 and includes major players like Nvidia, Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing, and Broadcom in its top holdings.

title: MACOM, Seagate, and Semtech Shares Plummet, What You Need To Know
summary: Shares of MACOM, Seagate, and Semtech fell in afternoon trading due to increased uncertainty over U.S. export license applications for high-end AI chips to China. The delay in approvals reportedly caused Chinese customers to postpone orders, impacting major exporters. Despite this, Semtech has shown significant volatility and is up 8.7% year-to-date, trading near its 52-week high, partly buoyed by positive industry news from Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.

title: Key facts: Intel Q4 2025 revenue falls 4%; launches GPU division; Trump stakes 9.9%
summary: Intel's Q4 2025 revenue dropped 4% year-over-year to $13.7 billion, though its EPS of $0.15 exceeded estimates. The company plans to launch its own GPU division, led by former Qualcomm executive Eric Demers, to compete with NVIDIA and AMD. Additionally, the Trump administration has acquired a 9.9% stake in Intel to support domestic advanced manufacturing and enhance supply chain security.

title: NVIDIA vs. Palantir: One AI Stock is a Clear Buy Right Now
summary: This article evaluates NVIDIA (NVDA) and Palantir (PLTR) as AI stock investments, noting Palantir's recent outperformance but ultimately favoring NVIDIA. While both companies are well-positioned for growth due to AI demand, NVIDIA is considered a better buy due to stronger pricing power, greater revenue generation opportunities, higher profitability metrics, and a more affordable valuation.

title: Jim Cramer on Marvell: “They’re an Excellent Company, But They’re a Derivative Company”
summary: Jim Cramer discussed Marvell Technology, Inc. (NASDAQ: MRVL), calling it an "excellent company" but also a "derivative company" that makes chips similar to NVIDIA and partners with them. While acknowledging MRVL's potential, the article suggests that other AI stocks might offer greater upside and less downside risk, especially considering Trump-era tariffs and the onshoring trend. It recommends a free report on an undervalued AI stock that could benefit from these factors.

title: What's in Store for These 3 Semiconductor Stocks This Earnings Season?
summary: Semiconductor companies like Microchip Technology (MCHP), Monolithic Power Systems (MPWR), and MACOM Technology Solutions (MTSI) are expected to report strong earnings this season, driven by solid demand, particularly from AI, cloud, and data center sectors. Each company's upcoming earnings report is analyzed, highlighting factors expected to impact their performance, such as inventory levels, demand trends across various markets, and rising operational expenses.

title: Is SLB Stock a Buy Now?
summary: SLB stock has surged over 25% since early 2026, partly due to hopes for increased oil production in Venezuela after the capture of Nicolas Maduro. While recent minor dips might allow for better entry points, SLB's long-term potential extends beyond Venezuela, incorporating digital footprints, AI tools for energy producers, and a partnership with Nvidia. The article suggests that while Venezuela provides a "bump," other catalysts make SLB a stock with strong adaptable potential.

title: Why Fortive (FTV) Stock Is Up Today
summary: Shares of industrial technology company Fortive (FTV) jumped 9.6% after reporting better-than-expected fourth-quarter earnings and revenue, and issuing an optimistic financial forecast for 2026. The company's adjusted earnings of $0.90 per share and sales of $1.12 billion surpassed analyst expectations. Fortive also projected full-year 2026 adjusted earnings of $2.90 to $3.00, exceeding the analyst consensus.

title: Qualcomm Expands APAC AI And Open RAN As Smartphone Reliance Eases
summary: Qualcomm has launched an AI program for innovators in the APAC region and announced a significant Open RAN collaboration with Rakuten Mobile and Fujitsu's 1Finity. These initiatives aim to diversify Qualcomm's business beyond smartphones into edge AI, automotive, and IoT markets. The company's expansion into these areas, despite potential challenges from weakening smartphone demand and increased competition, aligns with its strategy to leverage its core technologies in new growth sectors.

title: Gartner Forecasts Worldwide IT Spending to Grow 10.8% in 2026, Totaling $6.15T
summary: Gartner projects worldwide IT spending to reach $6.15 trillion in 2026, an increase of 10.8% from 2025, driven significantly by AI infrastructure. Server spending is expected to jump 36.9% year-over-year, and total data center spending will exceed $650 billion. While software spending growth sees a slight revision downwards, generative AI models continue to show robust growth, and device spending growth is anticipated to slow due to rising memory prices.

title: Can Starbucks Open Another 10,000 Stores in the U.S.?
summary: Starbucks, under CEO Brian Niccol, has made significant recovery progress and is taking a more deliberate approach to store expansion. The company believes it can open another 5,000 to 10,000 stores in the U.S. over the long term, in addition to its current 18,360 North American locations. Globally, Starbucks aims to double its international store count to approximately 40,000, including adding 15,000 to 20,000 in China, indicating a continued long growth runway despite its mature presence.

title: Buy This 1 Stock Hand Over Fist Before SpaceX Goes Public This Year
summary: SpaceX, which recently acquired xAI and posted an $8 billion profit on $15.5 billion revenue, is exploring a mid-2026 IPO. Investors looking to capitalize on this before direct public investment is possible can consider Destiny Tech100 (NYSE:DXYZ), a closed-end fund with 23-35% SpaceX exposure. However, the article cautions against holding DXYZ long-term as its purpose diminishes once SpaceX goes public and direct share purchases become available.

title: International Business Machines Corporation (IBM): A Bull Case Theory
summary: This article summarizes a bullish thesis on International Business Machines Corporation (IBM), highlighting its strong Q4 performance with a 12.2% year-over-year revenue increase, driven by software and infrastructure growth. Despite a forward P/E of 26x, the report suggests IBM is an attractive investment due to margin expansion, operating leverage, and integrated GenAI adoption, positioning it as a software-first platform company with potential for sustainable growth and positive market re-rating. The company's stock has appreciated by 28.51% since a previous bullish coverage in December 2024.

title: Broadcom, Nvidia shares rise on surging Google capital expenditures for AI
summary: Broadcom and Nvidia shares increased after Google announced a significant surge in capital expenditures for artificial intelligence, projecting to spend up to $185 billion this year. This substantial investment is nearly double last year's spending and is expected to benefit companies like Broadcom, which helps manufacture Google's custom tensor processing unit chips (TPUs), and Nvidia, as Google also utilizes their chips for AI development. Analysts believe this increased AI infrastructure spending will positively impact the "Google cohort" of technology companies.

title: Nvidia CEO: Software Selloff ‘Most Illogical Thing in the World’
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang stated that the recent sell-off in software company shares due to AI disruption concerns is "the most illogical thing in the world." He clarified that AI will use existing software tools rather than replacing or reinventing them. Huang made these comments during a Cisco Systems Inc. event.

title: Nebius Group Targets Early Nvidia Vera Rubin Deployment For AI Clients
summary: Nebius Group (NasdaqGS:NBIS) plans to be an early commercializer of Nvidia's Vera Rubin NVL72 AI infrastructure, integrating it into its cloud offerings for enterprise clients needing high-performance AI workloads. This strategic move aims to position Nebius more competitively against hyperscale cloud providers by offering advanced infrastructure for computationally intensive AI tasks. For investors, this development signals Nebius's commitment to scaling GPU supply and deepening its role in the AI ecosystem, though execution risks and competition from larger cloud platforms remain.

title: Freedom Holding plans to acquire another bank and marketplace in Kazakhstan
summary: Freedom Holding Corp. CEO Timur Turlov announced plans to acquire another bank and a local marketplace in Kazakhstan, as well as a second-tier bank in Turkey. The company is considering issuing up to $500 million in bonds to finance these acquisitions and also plans to expand its SuperApp into a digital ecosystem in the U.S. Additionally, Freedom Holding aims to raise an extra $200-300 million for technology investments, including a sovereign AI hub with Nvidia.

title: Micron stock sinks nearly 10% as AI-chip jitters flare — what to watch next
summary: Micron Technology shares dropped nearly 10% after hours on Wednesday, fueled by investor skepticism about the continued AI-driven rally and an insider filing to sell 25,000 shares. This dip is significant as Micron has been a key play in the AI buildout without being an AI chip designer, and its decline affected other semiconductor stocks. Despite the sell-off, memory fundamentals remain strong with TrendForce forecasting a significant jump in DRAM contract prices due to persistent AI and data center demands.

title: US Stock Market Outlook: Where We See Investing Opportunities in February
summary: The US equity market is currently trading at a 5% discount to Morningstar's fair value estimates, with growth stocks now discounted following significant fair value increases and small-cap stocks remaining particularly attractive. The greatest fair value increases were seen in commodity-oriented, late-cycle technology stocks. Investors are advised to market-weight equities and consider a barbell-shaped portfolio to navigate expected volatility in 2026, balancing technology and AI stocks with high-quality value stocks.

title: Anthropic Fallout Day 2: Infosys ADR falls 4%, Wipro down 1%
summary: New York-listed shares of Infosys and Wipro fell significantly after AI firm Anthropic launched its new automation product, Claude Cowork, sparking fears that AI tools could disrupt traditional IT and data services. Infosys ADRs were down over 4% and Wipro ADRs slipped more than 1%, adding to existing pressure on Indian IT stocks from weak guidance and a broader tech sector sell-off. The launch of Claude Cowork, which automates tasks across various functions, has led to investor concerns about reduced demand for traditional IT services.

title: Automatic Data Processing (ADP) Is Down 7.6% After Strong Earnings And New AI Agent Rollout – What's Changed
summary: Automatic Data Processing (ADP) recently reported strong quarterly earnings with higher revenue, net income, and EPS, while also launching ADP Assist AI agents to automate HR, payroll, and analytics. Despite these positive developments, the stock is down 7.6%, reflecting a mixed market reaction and concerns about client retention and AI-related competitive pressure. The article explores ADP's investment narrative, competitive landscape, and various fair value estimates from the Simply Wall St community.

title: Envirotech Vehicles’ Shares Skyrocket Following AI Advancements
summary: Envirotech Vehicles' stock surged by 9.96% after announcing an order for Nvidia GPUs expected to generate $107M in revenue and the acquisition of AZIO AI to bolster its AI infrastructure. Despite historical losses, the company's aggressive push into AI and strategic mergers are boosting investor confidence and positioning it for future growth in AI and mobility solutions. These strategic moves aim to enhance market standing and provide flexible capital opportunities.
authors: Tim Bohen, Ben Sturgill, Ellis Hobbs

title: A Look At Motorola Solutions (MSI) Valuation After Launching AI-Powered Assist Suites For Public Safety Agencies
summary: Motorola Solutions has launched AI-powered Assist Suites for public safety agencies, leading to a re-evaluation of its stock. While the company's long-term shareholder returns are positive, its current P/E ratio suggests potential valuation risk. The narrative fair value estimates the stock as undervalued at $409.47 against a fair value of $487.90, primarily due to its shift towards software and recurring services.

title: McKesson earnings on deck: Can specialty growth offset margin pressure?
summary: McKesson is set to report fiscal third-quarter earnings, with analysts focused on whether its strategic shift to high-margin specialty platforms can counteract margin pressure. While the company is expected to see mid-single-digit sales growth through 2029, driven by an aging population and specialty drugs, EPS estimates have remained flat. Investors will be looking for clarity on the performance of specialty businesses and margin trajectories, especially as the company divests European operations and plans an IPO for its Medical-Surgical Solutions business.

title: Galaxy Digital Q4 Loss Hits $482M on Falling Bitcoin Prices
summary: Galaxy Digital reported a net loss of $482 million in Q4 2025, primarily due to falling digital asset prices, contributing to a full-year loss of $241 million. Despite these losses, the company maintains strong liquidity with $2.6 billion in cash and stablecoins and saw $2 billion in net inflows into its asset management business. CEO Michael Novogratz noted the cyclical nature of crypto markets and emphasized the firm's strategic expansion into AI infrastructure to diversify revenue streams beyond token markets.

title: Taseko Mines (TGB) Soars 14.5% on Project Vault, Ahead of Earnings
summary: Taseko Mines (TGB) saw its share prices rise by 14.53% due to investor positioning in mining stocks following updates to the US government's Project Vault program and anticipation of strong Q4 and full-year 2025 earnings. The company expects increased copper production and improved molybdenum output, with existing offtake agreements for its copper concentrate. This rally aligns with broader interest in critical mineral resources identified by the US government.

title: Broadcom Inc. (AVGO): A Bull Case Theory
summary: This article summarizes a bullish thesis on Broadcom Inc. (AVGO), highlighting its strong position in semiconductors and enterprise software, particularly driven by AI-related demand. The company reported record revenue and significant growth in AI-specific products, maintaining strong operating income and free cash flow. Despite high valuation multiples, its cash generation, AI demand, and strategic hyperscale relationships justify its premium valuation.

title: Eaton Corporation plc (NYSE:ETN) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Eaton Corporation plc announced strong Q4 2025 results, with adjusted EPS up 18% and segment margins hitting a record 24.9%, driven by exceptional demand in Electrical Americas and Aerospace, particularly in the data center market. The company plans to spin off its Mobility business to sharpen focus on high-growth electrical and aerospace segments and is investing $1.5 billion to expand capacity to meet unprecedented demand, especially in data centers. Despite short-term ramp-up costs, Eaton remains confident in its 2026 guidance, projecting 7-9% total organic growth and continued margin expansion.

title: Vishay Intertechnology (NYSE:VSH) Posts Better-Than-Expected Sales In Q4
summary: Vishay Intertechnology (NYSE:VSH) reported better-than-expected Q4 CY2025 revenue of $800.9 million, a 12.1% year-on-year increase, signaling a potential upcycle with an optimistic Q1 CY2026 revenue guidance. While non-GAAP EPS was in line, the company's annual revenue growth over five years has been mediocre. The company's Inventory Days Outstanding are higher than its five-year average despite a recent decrease, suggesting inventory levels remain elevated.

title: Amdocs Limited (NASDAQ:DOX) Q1 2026 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Amdocs Limited reported a strong start to fiscal year 2026 with Q1 revenue of $1.16 billion, exceeding expectations, and non-GAAP diluted EPS of $1.81. The company announced a new multiyear agreement with T-Mobile, expanded its global footprint with deals like Vodafone Germany, and acquired Matrix Software for $197 million, strengthening its billing and monetization solutions. Amdocs also highlighted its advancements in generative AI with the introduction of AOS, an agentic operating system designed for telecommunications, positioned as a key long-term growth driver.

title: Do IDEX’s (IEX) Earnings and Dividend Streak Reveal a Deeper Capital-Return Strategy Shift?
summary: IDEX Corporation recently reported quarterly results, with analysts expecting modest revenue growth. The company's consistent dividend payments and raises, supported by strong profitability, are key to its investment appeal. While the stock has seen recent strength, its richer earnings multiple and varied fair value estimates suggest that investors need to consider if its quality and dividend track record are already fully priced in.

title: Inside the AI Nose winning $2.1M orders to teach machines to smell
summary: Ainos (NASDAQ:AIMD) has secured $2.1 million in multi-year semiconductor back-end orders for approximately 1,400 AI Nose units, expanding its SmellTech platform into industrial environments. The company's dual-engine architecture, combining physical sensing with intelligence-as-a-service through its subsidiary ScentAI, aims for recurring subscription revenues. Partnerships and robotics integration are set to accelerate continuous scent data generation and scale-up efforts in 2026.

title: ITW Q4 Deep Dive: CBI Drives Margins, Cautious Growth Outlook for 2026
summary: Illinois Tool Works (ITW) delivered better-than-expected revenue in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 4.1% year-on-year, driven by customer-backed innovation (CBI) and disciplined execution. The company is projecting moderate organic growth and continued margin expansion for 2026, while remaining cautious about potential inflationary pressures and a conservative demand outlook in Europe. Management emphasized the strengthening innovation pipeline and strong performance in automotive and test and measurement segments.

title: BR Q4 Deep Dive: Revenue Growth Led by Governance and Tokenization, Margins Face Headwinds
summary: Broadridge Financial Solutions (NYSE: BR) reported better-than-expected Q4 CY2025 revenue and adjusted EPS, driven by strong growth in Governance and Wealth segments, and early tokenization initiatives. Despite exceeding analyst estimates, the market reacted negatively due to concerns over declining operating margins, which management attributed to lower event-driven revenues and increased investment in technology and digital transformation. Broadridge reaffirmed full-year recurring revenue and margin guidance while raising its adjusted EPS target, underscoring confidence in pipeline growth and new client wins, particularly in digital and AI solutions.

title: Fortive earnings beat by $0.06, revenue topped estimates
summary: Fortive (NYSE: FTV) announced fourth-quarter EPS of $0.90, surpassing analyst estimates by $0.06, and revenue of $1.12 billion, which also topped the consensus estimate of $1.09 billion. The company provided FY 2026 EPS guidance of $2.90-$3.00, exceeding analyst expectations of $2.84. Fortive's stock has seen positive movement in the last three months but experienced a decline over the past year, with its financial health rated as "good performance" by InvestingPro.

title: HUBB Q4 Deep Dive: Data Center and Grid Investments Drive Growth, Cautious Outlook for 2026
summary: Hubbell (NYSE:HUBB) reported Q4 CY2025 results that met Wall Street's revenue and profit expectations, driven by strong growth in data center and grid infrastructure investments. The company's management highlighted operational improvements and strategic acquisitions contributing to margin expansion. While expressing optimism for 2026, Hubbell anticipates cautious growth in some nonresidential and heavy industrial sectors, alongside ongoing cost inflation that will be managed through pricing and productivity initiatives.

title: Why This Analyst Just Raised Their Price Target on Broadcom Stock
summary: Wolfe Research has upgraded Broadcom (AVGO) to "Outperform" with a $400 price target, citing increasing confidence in Google's TPU program and Broadcom's critical role as a supplier. This upgrade follows Broadcom's stellar Q4 2025 results, which saw record revenue and earnings driven by accelerated AI demand. Despite recent stock volatility, analysts maintain a "Strong Buy" consensus with a mean price target reflecting significant upside potential.

title: Intuit stock tumbles 11% then slips again premarket as AI jitters rattle software names
summary: Intuit (INTU) stock tumbled 10.9% on Tuesday and slipped further by 0.7% in premarket trading on Wednesday due to renewed concerns about AI-driven disruption in the software sector. The sell-off was exacerbated by Anthropic's introduction of AI plug-ins, causing investors to fear reduced pricing power for established software companies. All eyes are now on Intuit's upcoming fiscal second-quarter earnings call on February 26th for insights into TurboTax season performance and QuickBooks demand, which analysts view as a key catalyst.

title: Memory Costs Squeeze Tech, Apple Holds Firm
summary: Rising memory prices are impacting the tech industry, increasing build costs for smartphones and AI infrastructure, while demand remains soft. Apple, however, is better positioned due to its scale and negotiating power, reportedly seeking better pricing from suppliers. This helps Apple maintain margins as rivals struggle and as memory costs add billions to data center builds for companies like Microsoft and Meta Platforms.

title: Why Jacobs Solutions (J) Stock Is Trading Up Today
summary: Shares of Jacobs Solutions (J) rose by 4% after the company reported strong fourth-quarter 2025 results, exceeding Wall Street expectations for both revenue and profit. The global professional services company's revenue grew 12.3% year over year to $3.29 billion, and its adjusted earnings per share reached $1.53. A significant increase in its backlog to $26.31 billion and a robust free cash flow margin of 11.1% also contributed to the positive investor sentiment.

title: Johnson Controls Reports Strong Q1 Results and Raises FY26 Guidance
summary: Johnson Controls reported strong Q1 results, with sales up 7% to $5.8 billion and orders surging by 39% year-over-year, driven by investments in data center projects. The company achieved a GAAP EPS of $0.90 and an adjusted EPS of $0.89, marking a nearly 40% increase from the previous year, alongside robust operating cash flow of $611 million. Analysts maintain a positive outlook, with an average 1-year price target of $128.78, reflecting improved profitability and market position.

title: Morris Chang Reappears With Nvidia CEO As TSMC Valuation Debates Continue
summary: Morris Chang, founder of Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (TSMC), recently made a public appearance with Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang, easing concerns about his health after over a year out of the spotlight. This event assures investors about TSMC's stable leadership and strong relationships with key customers like Nvidia, especially given TSMC's central role in advanced semiconductor manufacturing for AI and computing. While the stock trades below analyst targets, Simply Wall St's valuation model suggests it's currently above its estimated fair value.

title: AMD stock sinks 12% after earnings. Here's why
summary: AMD's stock dropped 12% after its first-quarter revenue forecast, while topping analyst estimates for the previous quarter, fell short of some expectations for even stronger guidance amidst the AI boom. Analysts noted that despite the strong demand for AMD's data center chips and significant deals with companies like OpenAI and Oracle, the inclusion of unexpected Chinese revenue made the reported beat less substantial than anticipated. The company's stock had previously surged over 100% due to rising demand for its chips.

title: Astera Labs (ALAB) Valuation Check As AI Connectivity Roadmap Expands Across New Data Center Solutions
summary: Astera Labs (ALAB) is expanding its AI connectivity roadmap with enhanced solutions, attracting significant interest despite a mixed recent stock performance. While the company is considered undervalued at $199.15 compared to its current price of $158.52, driven by assumptions of aggressive AI connectivity buildout and strong hyperscaler engagement, its high P/E ratio of 134.6x suggests that much of its future success is already priced in. Investors are advised to consider the risks, such as product obsolescence and the need for sustained hyperscaler AI capital expenditure, when evaluating the premium for its growth potential.

title: Infosys stock sinks 7% as Anthropic AI tools spook India’s IT exporters — what investors watch next
summary: Infosys shares plummeted over 7% in response to Anthropic's new AI automation plug-ins, raising concerns that advanced AI tools could reduce the need for large delivery teams and impact billable hours for IT exporters. The broader Indian IT sector also suffered significantly, with the Nifty IT index experiencing its worst daily drop in nearly six years. Investors are now closely watching upcoming Infosys investor events for management comments and insights into demand, pricing, and delivery models in the evolving AI landscape.

title: IT Q4 Deep Dive: Strategic Shifts Amid Market Caution and Transformation
summary: Gartner (NYSE:IT) reported Q4 CY2025 results, meeting revenue expectations and beating non-GAAP profit estimates, yet experienced a negative market reaction due to a challenging selling environment. The company is undergoing internal transformations focusing on AI-driven content, improved client engagement, and streamlined operations, expecting contract value growth to accelerate in future quarters despite ongoing market caution. Gartner continues to invest in AI and process efficiency to drive relevance and timeliness of its insights while divesting non-core assets.

title: ADP’s Q4 Earnings Call: Our Top 5 Analyst Questions
summary: Automatic Data Processing (ADP) reported strong Q4 results with revenue beating estimates, driven by growth in both domestic and international businesses. Despite high client satisfaction, a slight dip in employer services retention was noted due to normalization in small business out-of-business rates. Analysts' questions focused on the international business's growth and profitability, PEO segment growth, impact of AI, and client satisfaction's relation to retention.

title: 5 Revealing Analyst Questions From Brinker International's Q4 Earnings Call
summary: Brinker International reported strong Q4 results, surpassing analyst estimates for revenue and adjusted EPS, driven by significant momentum at Chili's due to menu renovations and marketing efforts. Management increased full-year revenue and adjusted EPS guidance. The article highlights key analyst questions and management's responses regarding traffic drivers, pricing power, restaurant reimaging, marketing strategy for new product launches, and margin pressures.

title: AMD Earnings: Data Center Demand Still Looks Quite Strong to Us
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) reported strong fourth-quarter revenue, exceeding guidance, and provided an optimistic first-quarter forecast. While benefited by MI308 chip sales into China, core data center chip business showed sequential growth in AI accelerators and strong demand for server processors. Morningstar maintains its $270 fair value estimate for AMD, expecting continued data center revenue growth despite a recent stock selloff and investor concerns.

title: 5 Revealing Analyst Questions From General Dynamics's Q4 Earnings Call
summary: General Dynamics reported Q4 results that surpassed Wall Street estimates for sales and profit, driven by strong demand in Aerospace and Combat Systems. Despite this, the market reacted negatively due to concerns about margin pressures from tariffs, supply chain issues, and product mix. Analysts probed management on aerospace margin recovery, Navy production goals, free cash flow conversion, Gulfstream demand, and international backlog conversion, highlighting key challenges and future catalysts for the company.

title: Walmart Joins Nvidia in the $1 Trillion Club
summary: Walmart has joined the exclusive $1 trillion club, with a significant 13.2% gain to start the year pushing its market value past this milestone. This achievement, taking 64 years for the first trillion but only two for the second $500 billion, reflects Wall Street's re-evaluation of Walmart as a technology-driven enterprise rather than just a traditional retailer. The company's pivot to an AI-driven logistics giant, implementing machine learning for inventory, pricing, delivery, and customer service, is seen as a key factor in its parabolic growth and validates its strategic transformation.

title: Gaxos.ai (GXAI) slips in premarket after AWS-backed rally — what traders watch at the open
summary: Gaxos.ai (GXAI) saw a 7% drop in premarket trading after a 40% surge caused by an announcement that Amazon Web Services (AWS) would fund initial development of an AI sales coaching tool. Investors are closely monitoring the timing, commercialization plans, and potential for share dilution. The sell-off highlights the volatility in thinly traded AI stocks, where news of major cloud players can dramatically impact market perception.

title: Earnings call transcript: Silicom’s Q4 2025 sees revenue beat, stock surges
summary: Silicom (SILC) reported a strong Q4 2025 performance, exceeding revenue and EPS forecasts, which led to a significant pre-market stock surge and continued growth. The company reported $16.9 million in revenue, a 17% year-over-year increase, and a loss of $0.34 per share, outperforming expectations. Silicom is also focusing on new growth engines in AI inference networking, post-quantum cryptography, and white label switching, with expectations for double-digit revenue growth in 2026.

title: 1 Stock Under $50 with Exciting Potential and 2 We Find Risky
summary: This article identifies one stock under $50, LendingClub (LC), as having exciting potential due to impressive revenue growth and profitability. title: 3 Reasons to Sell SEM and 1 Stock to Buy Instead

The author suggests looking into "the Amazon and PayPal of Latin America" as better investment alternatives and mentions other high-quality growth stocks that have outperformed the market.

title: 5 Must-Read Analyst Questions From C.H. Robinson Worldwide's Q4 Earnings Call
summary: C.H. Robinson Worldwide's Q4 CY2025 results showed resilience despite weak global freight demand, with the company outperforming in key areas due to cost control and productivity. The article highlights five critical analyst questions from the earnings call, focusing on topics like Q1 net revenue growth, the balance between margin expansion and volume growth, competitive advantages of their AI, differing market cycles for brokers, and maintaining customer service amid automation. StockStory identifies key catalysts to monitor in upcoming quarters, including AI agent adoption, volume trends, and cost discipline.

title: 3 Reasons MSI Has Explosive Upside Potential
summary: Motorola Solutions' stock price has recently fallen by 7.9% over the past six months, despite strong underlying business fundamentals. The article highlights three key reasons for MSI's explosive upside potential: strong long-term revenue growth (8.5% CAGR over five years), excellent free cash flow margins (averaging 18.8% over five years), and stellar Return On Invested Capital (33% average over five years). These factors suggest that MSI is a high-quality business, and its recent price decline might present a buying opportunity.

title: Unveiling the Mystery Behind Elon Musk's Exploration of the Photovoltaic Industry Chain
summary: Elon Musk's teams (SpaceX and Tesla) have reportedly "surveyed" China's photovoltaic industry, showing particular interest in heterojunction and perovskite technologies for both terrestrial AI data centers and ambitious space solar power plans. This move has spurred significant market reaction in China's space photovoltaic sector, with companies like JinkoSolar confirming contact with Musk's inspection teams. The initiative highlights a potential new era for Chinese PV enterprises, moving towards higher technological thresholds required for space applications, and could revolutionize the global energy landscape by leveraging solar power in space.

title: NVDA: Cyngn Stock Pops on NVIDIA Partnerhip
summary: Cyngn Inc. (CYN) stock surged approximately 15% in premarket trading following an announcement of its advanced simulation collaboration with NVIDIA (NVDA). This partnership is expected to accelerate testing, expose edge cases, and shorten quality-assurance cycles for Cyngn's industrial-vehicle dynamics.

title: IBM's Q4 Earnings Call: Our Top 5 Analyst Questions
summary: IBM's Q4 performance exceeded Wall Street expectations, driven by strong growth in software and infrastructure, especially due to high demand for AI and automation solutions. Analysts focused on understanding the sustainability of software growth, free cash flow generation, Red Hat's contribution, memory cost impacts, and mainframe momentum.

title: 5 Revealing Analyst Questions From Lam Research's Q4 Earnings Call

Analysts are monitoring new product platform adoption, manufacturing scaling, and shifts in regional customer mix for future quarters.

title: WSBF's Q4 Earnings Jump 57% Y/Y on Margin Expansion, Credit Gains

title: Better AI Tech ETF: ProShares' QLD vs. Direxion's SOXL

Both ETFs are best suited for short-term investors due to their daily resetting leverage.

title: The Marzetti Company (NASDAQ:MZTI) Reports Q4 CY2025 In Line With Expectations

summary: Monolithic Power Systems (MPWR) is set to report its Q4 earnings on Thursday after market close. title: Cirrus Logic (CRUS) Valuation Check After Recent Pullback And Conflicting Fair Value Signals

title: Why Walmart, Verizon, Altria, and Other Safe Dividend Stocks Jumped Today
summary: On Tuesday, Walmart, Verizon, and Altria all saw their stock prices rise by roughly 3%, as investors rotated out of volatile tech stocks and into more stable, defensive dividend stocks. Walmart's market cap climbed above $1 trillion, Verizon is winning back subscribers, and Altria, despite challenges, continues to pay significant dividends, making these companies attractive during market uncertainty.

title: A Look At Signet Jewelers (SIG) Valuation As Free Cash Flow And Digital Channels Strengthen

title: Supermicro knocks it out of the park, as AI server sales drive 120% revenue increase

title: Could Applied Digital Stock Help You Become a Millionaire?
summary: Applied Digital (APLD) is building AI-specific data centers and has secured significant revenue agreements with CoreWeave and another major AI company. title: Why Kforce (KFRC) Shares Are Plunging Today
summary: Shares of professional staffing firm Kforce (KFRC) dropped significantly after the company reported fourth-quarter results.
