title: How Investors May Respond To TeraWulf (WULF) Pivoting From Bitcoin Mining To AI Infrastructure Partnerships
summary: TeraWulf (WULF) is transitioning from Bitcoin mining to AI infrastructure and high-performance computing, a move supported by analyst recommendations and partnerships with companies like Fluidstack and Google. While this shift aligns the company with growing AI demand, TeraWulf faces significant financial challenges, including a high valuation, substantial losses, and a short cash runway, raising concerns about its ability to fund expansion and execute its new strategy effectively. Investors are weighing the potential of AI infrastructure against these financial risks, leading to diverse fair value estimates for the stock.

title: 3 Value Stocks with Warning Signs
summary: This article identifies three value stocks—Quanex (NX), ICF International (ICFI), and Fastly (FSLY)—that exhibit warning signs despite their low valuation multiples. The author details specific concerns for each company, such as declining operating margins and earnings for Quanex, projected sales declines and lagging EPS for ICF International, and poor net revenue retention and high infrastructure costs for Fastly. The article concludes by suggesting readers look into StockStory's high-quality stock recommendations as alternatives.

title: 3 Reasons to Avoid GIC and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: This article advises investors to avoid Global Industrial Co (GIC) due to disappointing long-term revenue growth, stagnant EPS growth, and declining return on invested capital (ROIC). Despite a fair valuation, the authors suggest the upside isn't significant compared to potential downsides and recommend alternative "semiconductor picks and shovels" or other strong momentum stocks instead.

title: 3 Reasons ZBH is Risky and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: This article evaluates Zimmer Biomet Holdings (ZBH), cautioning investors due to disappointing long-term revenue growth, a dropping free cash flow margin, and unimpressive past growth initiatives. Despite a reasonable forward P/E, the analysis suggests superior investment opportunities exist. The authors recommend looking into high-quality industrial businesses or other high-growth stocks.

title: AI Infrastructure ETF Shows Balance Sheet Strength
summary: New research from Alger indicates that the significant investments in AI infrastructure today are backed by stronger corporate balance sheets and better interest coverage ratios compared to the dot-com bubble era. The Alger AI Enablers & Adopters ETF (ALAI) invests in companies funding expansion through free cash flow rather than debt, attracting substantial inflows and returning 40.3% in 2025. This suggests a more sustainable and financially sound buildout of AI infrastructure.

title: Arista Networks Links AI Data Center Growth With Debt Free Balance Sheet
summary: Arista Networks is gaining attention for its significant role in powering next-generation AI data centers. The company is highlighted for its strong financial position, including zero long-term debt and substantial liquidity, which provides flexibility for continued product development. This combination of AI exposure and balance sheet strength makes Arista Networks an attractive prospect for long-term investors in the evolving AI and cloud networking markets.

title: WeRide Inc. (WRD): A Bull Case Theory
summary: This article summarizes a bullish thesis on WeRide Inc. (WRD), highlighting its exceptional Q3 2025 results, including significant revenue growth in robotaxi and robobus deployments, improved unit economics, and a narrowed net loss. The company's extensive global footprint, strategic partnerships, and analyst forecasts predicting substantial revenue upside reinforce the positive outlook. This builds on a previous bullish thesis regarding its expanding Uber partnership and Nvidia's backing.

title: Super Micro crushes estimates for Q2, offers strong guidance
summary: Super Micro Computer significantly surpassed its Q2 financial estimates, reporting net sales of $12.7 billion and adjusted net income per share of $0.69, well above guidance. The AI server company also provided strong guidance for the current quarter, expecting net sales of at least $12.3 billion and adjusted net income per share of at least $0.60, leading to a 7% spike in after-hours trading. This performance indicates a more promising start to the year after previous concerns about strained profitability.

title: Teradyne, Inc. (TER): A Bull Case Theory
summary: This article summarizes a bullish thesis on Teradyne, Inc. (TER), emphasizing its strong position as a direct beneficiary of the accelerating AI hardware cycle. Despite a recent stock jump, the market is believed to underestimate the durability and magnitude of this shift in demand for semiconductor test equipment. The thesis projects a price target of $435 by mid-2027, citing compelling valuation relative to the company's long-term earnings trajectory.

title: Photronics, Inc. (PLAB): A Bull Case Theory
summary: This article summarizes a bullish thesis on Photronics, Inc. (PLAB) from Beeli Capital, highlighting the company's strong financial performance, increased capital expenditure guidance signalling growth, and its strategic position as a U.S. market leader in photomask products. Despite recent price appreciation, the secular demand and accelerating fundamentals suggest continued growth potential for PLAB. The company's stock has already appreciated significantly since previous coverage, validating earlier bullish indicators.

title: Analysts Continue to Raise SiTime Corporation's (SITM) Target Price
summary: Analysts have increased their price targets for SiTime Corporation (SITM), citing the company's strong exposure to AI and its improved prospects. UBS raised its target to $430, while Barclays upgraded the stock and set a $360 target, recognizing SiTime's portfolio transformation into an AI-focused business. The company, a developer of silicon timing systems, is seen as benefiting from growth in AI ventures, driving margin and revenue expansion.

title: Intel is moving into GPUs and has hired a chief architect, CEO Lip-Bu Tan says
summary: Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan announced the company has hired a chief architect to focus on building Graphics Processing Units (GPUs), which are crucial for AI infrastructure. This move follows increased investor optimism for Intel's foundry business, despite recent production snags and a lack of an anchor customer. The company has also received significant investments from the U.S. government, SoftBank, and Nvidia.

title: ARM to Post Q3 Earnings: Should the Stock Be in Your Portfolio Now?
summary: Arm Holdings plc (ARM) is set to report its third-quarter fiscal 2026 results, with analysts anticipating a 2.5% year-over-year increase in earnings and a 25.7% rise in revenues. Despite a strong history of exceeding earnings estimates, the Zacks model does not conclusively predict an earnings beat this quarter due to a 0.00% Earnings ESP and a Zacks Rank #3. The article advises potential investors to wait for a better price, despite ARM's strategic importance in AI computing, due to its high valuation multiple compared to the industry average.

title: In Days, Coca-Cola Announces Its Next Dividend Increase: What Can Investors Expect?
summary: Coca-Cola, a Dividend King with 63 consecutive years of dividend increases, is anticipated to announce its 64th hike soon. After a decade of modest dividend growth, new factors like soaring earnings, improved operating margins, and significant share buybacks suggest a potentially substantial, possibly double-digit, increase—the largest since 2007. The article compares recent dividend growth and inflation rates to historical trends, highlighting reasons for a potential resurgence in dividend momentum.

title: Worldwide IT spending to grow 10.8 percent to $6.15 trillion in 2026, says Gartner
summary: Gartner forecasts worldwide IT spending to reach $6.15 trillion in 2026, marking a 10.8 percent increase from 2025, driven significantly by accelerated server and data center spending, especially for AI infrastructure. While software spending growth is slightly revised downward to 14.7 percent, it will remain above $1.4 trillion, with generative AI models expected to see an 80.8 percent growth. Device spending will reach $836 billion but growth will slow to 6.1 percent due to rising memory prices and market-demand constraints.

title: Texas Instruments stock price holds near a 52-week high as chip shares wobble — what traders watch next
summary: Texas Instruments (TXN) shares rose by 0.6% to $226.33, near its 52-week high, despite a general downturn in the semiconductor sector. The company surpassed analyst expectations for its March-quarter revenue and profit per share, driven by strong demand for chips in AI data centers. Investors are now anticipating a February 24th webcast on capital management and demand indicators for the March quarter, which will be crucial for the stock's future trajectory.

title: Pegasystems, Cadence Design Systems, and Varonis Systems Shares Plummet, What You Need To Know
summary: Pegasystems, Cadence Design Systems, and Varonis Systems saw their shares fall as a broad sell-off swept through the software sector. This decline was driven by concerns about the impact of artificial intelligence, leading to institutional repositioning away from traditional SaaS providers. Pegasystems, for instance, fell 8.4% and is down 29% since the beginning of the year.

title: 5 Revealing Analyst Questions From Manhattan Associates's Q4 Earnings Call
summary: Manhattan Associates exceeded Q4 expectations due to strong cloud revenue growth and services segment resurgence, driven by increased adoption of cloud-based supply chain solutions and new AI features. Despite the strong performance, the adjusted EPS guidance for 2026 missed analyst estimates. This article highlights five key analyst questions from the earnings call, covering cloud migrations, RPO growth, renewal rates, AI monetization, and services growth.

title: Form 424B2 BARCLAYS BANK PLC
summary: Barclays Bank PLC has filed Form 424B2 for Callable Contingent Coupon Notes due March 1, 2029, linked to the S&P 500®, Russell 2000®, and Nasdaq-100® Indices. These notes have a minimum denomination of $1,000 and offer contingent coupon payments, but investors risk losing up to 100% of the principal amount if the least performing reference asset falls below its barrier value. The document details the terms, risks, tax considerations, and estimated value of these unsecured and unsubordinated debt obligations, which are also subject to potential U.K. Bail-in Power.

title: Boom continues as Fabrinet posts 36% surge in sales revenues
summary: Fabrinet, a Bangkok-based contract manufacturer, announced record-breaking sales of $1.13 billion for the final quarter of 2025, a 36% increase year-over-year, driven by strong demand for photonics components in AI data centers. The company is significantly expanding its manufacturing capacity in Thailand and is focused on emerging technologies like co-packaged optics (CPO) and optical circuit switches (OCS) to sustain growth. Despite a recent dip in stock price due to geopolitical concerns, Fabrinet remains confident in continued sales boom.

title: Dassault Systèmes and NVIDIA Partner to Build Industrial AI Platform Powering Virtual Twins
summary: Dassault Systèmes and NVIDIA have announced a long-term strategic partnership to create a shared industrial architecture for mission-critical AI, integrating Dassault Systèmes' Virtual Twin technologies with NVIDIA's AI infrastructure. This collaboration aims to establish science-validated Industry World Models and empower professionals with "virtual companions" on the 3DEXPERIENCE platform. The partnership will accelerate innovation across biology, materials science, engineering, and manufacturing, ensuring data privacy and intellectual property protection for customers.

title: AMD shares drop as forecast comes up short of some expectations
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) reported stronger-than-expected fourth-quarter earnings and provided a first-quarter revenue forecast of $9.8 billion, exceeding analyst expectations of $9.38 billion. Despite this, the stock fell as some analysts anticipated even stronger guidance given the ongoing AI spending boom and AMD's position as a competitor to Nvidia in graphics processors for AI. AMD's data center and client/gaming segments showed significant growth, with the company securing major customers like OpenAI and Oracle for its AI chips.

title: New Power Module Enhances AI Data Center Power Density and Efficiency
summary: Microchip Technology has launched the MCPF1525 Power Module, a highly integrated 16V Vin buck converter capable of delivering 25A per module, stackable up to 200A. This new module is designed to meet the increasing power demands of AI and high-performance computing workloads, offering enhanced efficiency, reliability, and scalability for advanced data centers. Its compact, vertical construction reduces board area by up to 40% and includes comprehensive diagnostic functions for increased reliability.

title: BTIG Flags Mortgage Policy Tailwind for Dynex Capital, Inc. (DX)
summary: BTIG has identified Dynex Capital, Inc. (NYSE: DX) as a top pick, citing a potential boost from President Trump's directive for government-sponsored enterprises to purchase up to $200 billion in mortgage-backed securities. This policy is expected to narrow agency MBS spreads, which BTIG projects could increase Dynex's mark-to-market net asset value by about 8%. The firm maintains a Buy rating on DX with a $16 price target, following Dynex's strong 2025 performance, including a 29.4% total shareholder return and a significant increase in book value per common share.

title: RBC Capital Says Agree Realty Corporation (ADC)’s Q4 Deal Activity Remains Within Guidance
summary: RBC Capital reaffirmed an Outperform rating on Agree Realty Corporation (ADC) while slightly trimming its price target to $79 from $80. The firm noted that Q4 acquisitions were slightly below expectations but still within management's guidance, and cap rates met their projections. Agree Realty has a strong dividend history, consistently increasing payouts annually since the 2008-09 financial crisis, and plans to invest up to $1.65 billion in real estate in 2025, supported by long-term tenant leases.

title: CoStar Group stock hits 52-week low at $57.00
summary: CoStar Group's stock (CSGP) has fallen to a new 52-week low of $57.00, marking a 26.13% decline over the past year. This comes amid scrutiny from activist investor Third Point LLC regarding CoStar's residential real estate investments, while the company has announced a $1.5 billion share repurchase program and its Homes.com platform shows significant subscriber growth. BTIG recently upgraded CoStar's stock to Buy with an $80 price target, citing a refocused salesforce.

title: Trupanion stock hits 52-week low at 30.85 USD
summary: Trupanion Inc. (TRUP) stock has fallen to a new 52-week low of $30.85, marking a 33.45% decrease over the past year due to market pressures and company-specific challenges. This decline occurred despite the company exceeding analyst expectations for its Q3 2025 earnings, with an EPS of $0.13 and revenue of $366.9 million. Stifel, however, adjusted its price target down to $42 from $45, noting that typical pet owner spending on insurance ($70/month) is below Trupanion's average revenue per user ($82).

title: Tutor Perini stock hits all-time high at 81.89 USD
summary: Tutor Perini (TPC) stock has reached an all-time high of $81.89, representing a 252.59% increase over the past year, driven by strong investor confidence. Despite currently being overvalued and not profitable in the last twelve months, analysts predict a return to profitability this year. Recent positive news includes strong Q3 2025 earnings, a quarterly dividend, a $200 million share repurchase program, and major contract wins in Israel and for military facilities.

title: Analysts’ Top Technology Picks: Viant Technology (DSP), Nvidia (NVDA)
summary: Three analysts recently issued bullish sentiments on technology stocks Viant Technology (DSP), Nvidia (NVDA), and Digital Turbine (APPS). Craig-Hallum reiterated a Buy rating for Viant Technology with an $18 price target, and Bank of America Securities maintained a Buy rating on Nvidia. Similarly, Craig-Hallum also maintained a Buy rating for Digital Turbine.

title: Cyngn Partners with Nvidia to Enhance Autonomous Vehicle Technology
summary: Cyngn Inc. (CYN) shares surged over 28% in premarket trading following its partnership with Nvidia (NVDA). This collaboration leverages Nvidia's Isaac Sim platform to create a high-fidelity digital warehouse for testing and refining Cyngn's autonomous vehicle software. This virtual environment allows Cyngn to efficiently simulate and evaluate real-world warehouse operations, enhancing testing accuracy and scalability.

title: Could This ETF Be the Best Way to Play Rising Interest Rates in 2026?
summary: The article discusses the Fidelity Dividend ETF For Rising Rates (NYSEMKT: FDRR) as a potential investment strategy for a rising interest rate environment. Despite its name, the ETF has performed well even when rates were not rising, partly due to its significant allocation to technology stocks. The fund's unique methodology focuses on dividend-paying companies with a positive correlation to increasing 10-year U.S. Treasury yields, making it a surprising but potentially effective option for dividend investors.

title: Illinois Tool Works’s (NYSE:ITW) Q4 CY2025 Sales Top Estimates
summary: Illinois Tool Works (NYSE: ITW) exceeded Wall Street's revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025 with sales up 4.1% year-on-year to $4.09 billion and GAAP EPS of $2.72 beat estimates by 1.2%. Despite strong Q4 performance, the company's EPS guidance for fiscal year 2026 slightly missed analyst estimates. Long-term revenue growth has been tepid, but the company has shown elite profitability with an average operating margin of 25.2% over the last five years.

title: Intel will start making GPUs, a market dominated by Nvidia
summary: Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan announced that the company will begin producing Graphics Processing Units (GPUs), entering a market currently dominated by rival Nvidia. This move marks a significant expansion for Intel beyond its traditional CPUs, particularly given the increasing demand for GPUs in gaming and AI model training. The initiative, still in its early stages, will be overseen by Kevork Kechichian and supported by new hires like Eric Demers, as Intel adapts its strategy to customer needs.

title: Is AXT’s New Independent Audit Chair a Turning Point for AXTI’s Governance and AI Ambitions?
summary: AXT, Inc. has appointed Leonard J. LeBlanc as the independent Chair of its Audit Committee, a move that could improve governance optics for the company. This comes as AXT's role as a key Indium Phosphide wafer supplier for AI-driven data centers attracts significant investor attention. While the governance change is positive, the article suggests it may not materially alter the company's core operational and valuation challenges, which include persistent losses and a stretched valuation.

title: CYN Stock Is Surging Pre-Market — What's The Nvidia Connection?
summary: Cyngn Inc. is partnering with Nvidia to develop a high-fidelity digital warehouse simulation environment using Nvidia’s Isaac Sim platform to test and refine its autonomous vehicle software. This collaboration allows Cyngn to simulate real-world operations at scale, validate new forklift use cases faster, and reduce development risks. The company's stock surged over 28% in premarket trading following the announcement.

title: Synopsys Stock: Investors Await Proof of Strategic Shift
summary: Investors are closely watching Synopsys (SNPS) as it navigates a significant strategic shift, marked by the acquisition of Ansys and the divestiture of its IP business. The market is eager to see how quickly synergies from the "Silicon-to-Systems" strategy will materialize, particularly with the upcoming Q1 FY2026 earnings report on February 25, 2026. Key areas of focus for analysts include integration metrics, AI-driven demand for EDA tools, and revised guidance post-divestiture, as the company transforms its business portfolio towards higher-margin core products.

title: Maplebear (CART) Faces Marketplace Competition but Expands AI-Powered Caper Cart Rollout
summary: Maplebear Inc. (NASDAQ: CART) is expanding its AI-powered Caper Carts rollout despite facing marketplace competition, which led Stifel to reduce its price target to $46. The company, operating as Instacart, is strengthening its partnership with Allegiance Retail Services to improve technological solutions for independent grocers. While acknowledging CART's growth potential, the article suggests other AI stocks may offer higher returns and lower risk, promoting a paid report on a more promising AI investment.

title: Pfizer Inc. (NYSE:PFE) Beats Q4 2025 Estimates but Muted Outlook Tempers Investor Reaction
summary: Pfizer Inc. exceeded Q4 2025 financial expectations, driven by strong performance in its non-COVID product portfolio. Despite beating estimates for both revenue and adjusted EPS, the company's reaffirmed modest 2026 outlook has led to a muted, slightly negative investor reaction. The company anticipates continued headwinds from declining COVID-19 product sales but highlights strong growth in other key products and significant strategic investments in its pipeline, particularly in obesity, for future growth.

title: BofA Securities upgrades Sigma Lithium stock rating to Neutral on resumed mining
summary: BofA Securities has upgraded Sigma Lithium Corp. (NASDAQ:SGML) from Underperform to Neutral, setting a price target of $14.00, following the resumption of mining activities. Despite the upgrade and operational improvements, the firm points to continued liquidity risk during the three-month ramp-up period to full production, alongside challenges with waste pile permits and the absence of a mining contractor. This upgrade reflects a more balanced valuation after a recent stock retracement, acknowledging both reduced project execution risk and ongoing operational hurdles.

title: Better Artificial Intelligence Stock: Applied Digital vs. CoreWeave
summary: The article compares Applied Digital (APLD) and CoreWeave (CRWV), two companies in the "neocloud" sector that provide data center infrastructure for AI. Both companies have taken on significant debt to fund their rapid expansion due to high demand for AI computing power. CoreWeave is presented as the better investment due to its higher sales, stronger gross profits, and backing from Nvidia, along with a more favorable forward price-to-sales ratio.

title: 3 Reasons AAON is Risky and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: This article analyzes why AAON is considered a risky investment, citing its shrinking operating margin, barely growing EPS, and dropping free cash flow margin. The author suggests AAON is overvalued at its current forward P/E and recommends looking into other growth stocks instead. The piece concludes by highlighting a curated list of "High Quality" stocks that have historically outperformed the market.

title: 1 Volatile Stock Worth Your Attention and 2 We Avoid
summary: This article analyzes three volatile stocks, recommending one as a buy and two as stocks to avoid, based on financial performance and market outlook. Himax (HIMX) and Viavi Solutions (VIAV) are flagged for underperformance due to declining sales, efficiency issues, and slow growth. Conversely, Ameriprise Financial (AMP) is highlighted for its strong share buybacks, balance sheet strength, and market-beating return on equity.

title: Natural Gas Player EQT (EQT) Projects Gaining $114M from Derivatives for Q4 2025
summary: EQT Corporation (NYSE: EQT) expects to gain $114 million from derivatives and receive $35 million in net cash settlements for Q4 2025. These gains include $44 million from NYMEX natural gas hedge positions, offset by $9 million in cash settlements paid on basis and liquids hedge positions. Analyst ratings for EQT included two Holds with price targets of $50 and $62, and one Buy with a $69 price target.

title: MTG Q4 Deep Dive: Flat Revenue and Margin Pressure Amid Stable Credit Performance
summary: MGIC Investment (MTG) missed Q4 CY2025 revenue expectations with flat year-on-year sales and experienced margin compression, despite its non-GAAP profit meeting analyst estimates. Management attributed the results to stagnant new insurance growth and high operating expenses, though credit performance in its insurance portfolio remained stable. The company plans to focus on portfolio diversification, reinsurance activity, and disciplined capital management in a challenging market expecting limited growth in 2026.

title: Y Intercept Hong Kong Ltd Invests $699,000 in MACOM Technology Solutions Holdings, Inc. $MTSI
summary: Y Intercept Hong Kong Ltd initiated a new position in MACOM Technology Solutions Holdings, Inc. (MTSI) during Q3, acquiring 5,616 shares valued at $699,000. This comes amidst significant insider selling of MACOM shares, totaling $104.36 million in the past three months, while institutional investors hold 76.14% of the stock. MACOM reported strong Q3 earnings, beating estimates, and analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating with a consensus target price of $196.82.

title: Earnings call transcript: Allegro MicroSystems Q3 2026 beats EPS forecast, stock rises
summary: Allegro MicroSystems reported Q3 2026 earnings, exceeding EPS and revenue forecasts with an EPS of $0.15 against an expected $0.14, and revenue of $229.2 million. The company's stock rose by 6.83% in pre-market trading following the announcement, driven by strong performance in e-mobility and data center markets. Allegro projects continued growth for Q4 FY2026, with sales between $230 million and $240 million and non-GAAP EPS between $0.14 and $0.18, emphasizing its focus on high-growth areas and technological innovation.

title: Western Digital Corp. stock outperforms competitors on strong trading day
summary: Western Digital Corp. (WDC) stock saw a gain of 2.10% to $64.86 on a strong trading day, outpacing the S&P 500's 1.15% rise. Despite this positive movement, the stock traded below its 52-week high, and its competitors also recorded gains.

title: Where is Alibaba Group Holding Limited (BABA) Headed According to the Street?
summary: Alibaba Group Holding Limited (NYSE: BABA) is considered a strong long-term, low-volatility investment, with China Merchants Securities reiterating a Buy rating and a HK$194.00 price target. The company's logistics arm, Cainiao, is reportedly set to acquire a stake in Chinese robovan developer Zelostech, a deal valued at around $2 billion, which involves Cainiao contributing its autonomous-driving business. While acknowledging BABA's potential, the article suggests that certain AI stocks might offer greater upside and less risk.

title: 2 Reasons to Like WRB and 1 to Stay Skeptical
summary: W.R. Berkley (WRB) stock has underperformed the S&P 500 over the past six months but presents some appealing internal metrics. The company boasts strong growth in net premiums earned and outstanding long-term EPS growth, indicating increasing profitability. However, cautious investors should note the projected slowdown in revenue growth, which analysts anticipate will be significantly lower than its historical rate.

title: Seagate's Q4 Earnings Call: Our Top 5 Analyst Questions
summary: Seagate's Q4 earnings exceeded analyst expectations, driven by strong demand from cloud data centers and a shift to high-capacity nearline drives, particularly HAMR shipments. The company saw significant revenue and adjusted EPS beats, alongside improved gross and operating margins. Analysts focused on pricing strategies, product mix contribution to margins, HAMR transition pace, long-term agreements, and future gross margin drivers, with management expressing confidence in continued growth.

title: 1 Safe-and-Steady Stock with Competitive Advantages and 2 Facing Challenges
summary: The article analyzes one low-volatility stock (Stryker) with competitive advantages and two (Taylor Morrison Home and Gilead Sciences) facing challenges. Taylor Morrison Home is highlighted for cratering demand and underperforming earnings, while Gilead Sciences is noted for slow revenue growth and declining operating margins. Stryker, conversely, is praised for healthy organic revenue growth, economies of scale, and increasing earnings per share.

title: Where is Cisco Systems (CSCO) Headed According to Analysts?
summary: Cisco Systems (CSCO) recently received an "Outperform" upgrade from Evercore ISI, with a price target increase to $100. The firm cited AI momentum, a campus refresh, EBIT margin expansion, and recovery in enterprise and telco markets as key tailwinds. Cisco also launched its 360 Partner Program to deliver outcomes focused on the AI era, aiming for predictable profitability for partners.

title: Williams-Sonoma stock hits 52-week high at 219.72 USD
summary: Williams-Sonoma Inc. (WSM) reached a 52-week high of $219.72, signaling strong market performance, despite its current price of $217.06 suggesting overvaluation. The company boasts a 1-year return of 6.29% and a year-to-date return of 20.22%, with 20 consecutive years of dividend increases, currently yielding 1.23%. While analysts have adjusted price targets due to tariff concerns, the company recently announced a cash dividend of $0.66 per share and reported significant Q3 sales growth, reflecting investor confidence.

title: This High-Flying Growth Stock Is Hiding in Plain Sight
summary: Rhythm Pharmaceuticals (RYTM) is a biotech growth stock that has significantly outperformed major tech companies over the last year, despite its smaller size and focus on rare genetic obesity disorders. The company's lead drug, Imcivree, is awaiting FDA approval for an expanded indication and has multiple new clinical trial results expected, positioning it for potential further growth. However, risks include potential FDA setbacks, clinical study failures, and the company's current unprofitability.

title: Calavo (CVGW): Buy, Sell, or Hold Post Q3 Earnings?
summary: StockStory analysts recommend avoiding Calavo (CVGW) due to a 4.2% loss over the past six months, underperforming the S&P 500. The company faces a downward revenue trend, limited distribution channels as a small consumer staples company, and poor structural profitability indicated by a low 10% gross margin. They suggest the stock's 16.4x forward P/E is overpriced given its fundamentals and recommend alternative high-quality stocks.

title: 5 Revealing Analyst Questions From General Motors's Q4 Earnings Call
summary: General Motors's Q4 2025 earnings showed strong performance despite a revenue miss, driven by disciplined inventory management and strategic shifts. Analyst questions during the call focused on the sustainability of pricing, inventory discipline, hybrid strategy, tariff mitigation, and achieving North America margin targets. The company addressed these concerns, highlighting efforts in EV profitability, cost controls, and Super Cruise expansion.

title: Bank of New York Mellon Corp Sells 56,244 Shares of Broadcom Inc. $AVGO
summary: Bank of New York Mellon Corp decreased its stake in Broadcom Inc. by 0.2% in Q3, selling 56,244 shares, though Broadcom remains its seventh-largest holding. Institutional investors collectively own 76.43% of the semiconductor manufacturer's stock. Despite recent insider selling, Broadcom shows strong fundamentals and analyst support due to its positioning in AI infrastructure, increased dividend, and revenue growth.

title: Adams Diversified Equity Fund Announces Results for Nine-Month Period
summary: Adams Diversified Equity Fund reported a strong performance for the first nine months of 2025, with a net asset value return of 16.0%, outperforming both the S&P 500 and its Morningstar category. The fund's net assets grew to $2.99 billion, with NVIDIA, Microsoft, and Apple as top holdings, and a significant weighting in Information Technology. Adams Funds also maintains a long-standing commitment to shareholders, having paid dividends for over 90 years and aiming for a minimum annual distribution rate of 8% of NAV.

title: AI Spending Doubles: Why This $500 Billion Boom Makes Equinix a Buy for 2026
summary: The AI market is experiencing a significant boom, with hyperscalers expected to spend over $500 billion on AI infrastructure this year, more than double 2024's figures. Equinix, a large data center REIT, is positioned as a safe and simple way to capitalize on this expansion due to its critical role in housing AI infrastructure. The company shows steady financial growth, a consistent dividend payout, and a reasonable valuation, making it an attractive investment despite not being a high-growth AI stock itself.

title: Navitas Semiconductor Refocuses On AI Data Centers And Electrification Margins
summary: Navitas Semiconductor (NasdaqGM:NVTS) is shifting its business strategy to prioritize higher-margin segments like AI data centers and industrial electrification, moving away from lower-margin mobile and consumer markets. The company is actively forming partnerships with AI leaders such as Nvidia and expanding its relationships with major electric vehicle and PC customers. This pivot aims to leverage the growth in AI computing and electrification trends, with investors watching how effectively these new ventures translate into sustainable revenue streams.

title: Investors Are Piling Into This Stock That's Up 28,000% Since Its IPO. Can It Soar in 2026?
summary: Starbucks (NASDAQ: SBUX) has shown strong growth in its fiscal 2026 first quarter, with revenue up 6% and comparable sales up 4%, despite a temporary squeeze on profitability due to investments in improvement strategies. The stock has seen a remarkable 28,000% gain since its IPO and offers a 2.6% dividend yield. However, its current high P/E ratio of 78 suggests it is expensive for a company still in recovery, leading to a recommendation to wait for a better entry point.

title: The Best Tech ETF to Invest $2,000 in Right Now
summary: The article recommends the Invesco Nasdaq 100 ETF (QQQM) as the best tech ETF for a $2,000 investment. QQQM tracks the Nasdaq-100, composed of 100 largest non-financial companies, with over 63% in tech stocks. It offers exposure to leading tech companies like Nvidia, Apple, and Microsoft, and has a lower expense ratio (0.15%) compared to its counterpart, Invesco QQQ Trust ETF (QQQ), allowing for significant savings over time.

title: SiTime nears $3 bln deal to buy Renesas timing unit, Bloomberg reports
summary: SiTime Corporation is reportedly close to acquiring Renesas Electronics Corp's timing unit for approximately $3 billion, according to Bloomberg News. This transaction would represent SiTime's largest acquisition to date. An agreement could be reached as early as Thursday, coinciding with Renesas's full-year earnings report, though negotiations are still ongoing.

title: Credo Technology’s AI Interconnect Push Meets Rich Valuation And Risk Flags
summary: Credo Technology Group Holding has introduced its Blue Heron 224G AI scale-up retimer and entered a patent licensing agreement with 3M, strengthening its position in high-speed AI interconnects. While these developments are positive for its role in AI infrastructure, Simply Wall St identifies a rich valuation with the stock trading 81.1% above estimated fair value, alongside risks like high non-cash earnings and recent insider selling. Investors are advised to watch revenue, margins, and the P/E ratio, and consider these risks against the growth story.

title: Synopsys, Inc. (SNPS): A Bull Case Theory
summary: This article summarizes a bullish thesis on Synopsys, Inc. (SNPS), highlighting its strong financial performance with 82% gross margins and 28% EBITDA margins, and significant recurring revenue growth. Despite near-term pressures from restructuring and the Ansys acquisition, the company's FY26 guidance projects robust revenue and EPS, supported by strategic partnerships with NVIDIA and a broadened long-term growth runway. The analysis suggests SNPS offers an attractive risk/reward opportunity due to operational leverage, AI-aligned innovation, and a de-risked outlook.

title: Qualcomm Stock Slumps On Downbeat Q2 Earnings Guidance Impacted By Memory Supply Shortage
summary: Qualcomm (QCOM) stock slumped after the company issued second-quarter earnings guidance lower than Wall Street expectations, citing memory supply constraints. Despite the downbeat Q2 outlook, Qualcomm's Q1 revenues and adjusted earnings per share surpassed analyst estimates, driven by record revenue growth in both its licensing and semiconductor businesses. CEO Cristiano Amon noted that while near-term handset outlook is affected by supply constraints, the company is encouraged by demand for premium smartphones and remains on track for its fiscal 2029 revenue goals.

title: Artemis Buys $104 Million of Commercial Metals Stock in Large New Stake
summary: Artemis Investment Management LLP has acquired a new stake of 1,501,906 shares in Commercial Metals Company (NYSE:CMC) for an estimated value of $103.96 million. This new holding represents 1.26% of Artemis's 13F reportable assets under management and suggests Artemis sees upside in CMC despite recent stock appreciation and increased EV/EBITDA. The investment may be influenced by CMC's recent acquisitions of concrete and pipe companies, aimed at growing its higher-margin Construction Solutions Group.

title: Fabrinet (FN) Is Up 5.4% After Strong Q2 Earnings And HPC Momentum - Has The Bull Case Changed?
summary: Fabrinet (FN) reported strong fiscal second-quarter 2026 results with increased sales and net income, driven by growth in Telecom, Data Center Interconnect, and High-Performance Computing. While the results support near-term catalysts, the company's rich valuation and insider selling remain key risks. The shift towards HPC and data center interconnect is reshaping Fabrinet's investment narrative beyond its traditional telecom focus.

title: Hercules Capital (HTGC) Stock Sinks As Market Gains: What You Should Know
summary: Hercules Capital (HTGC) stock saw a decline of 1.24% while the broader market gained, and its stock has dropped 1.75% over the past month. The company is set to release its earnings report on February 12, 2026, with analysts expecting a slight decline in EPS but an increase in revenue. Currently, HTGC holds a Zacks Rank of #3 (Hold) and trades at a premium compared to its industry's Forward P/E.

title: Texas Instruments (TXN) stock price jumps to a 52-week high — what traders watch next
summary: Texas Instruments (TXN) stock surged 4.4% to a new 52-week high of $225.01, driven by high trading volume and strong demand for analog chips. The company's first-quarter revenue and EPS projections exceeded estimates, and its CEO highlighted a significant increase in data-center revenue. Investors are now looking to the upcoming capital management webcast on February 24th and broader market trends.

title: TSMC’s US$165b US Chip Bet And The New Taiwan US Tariff Deal
summary: TSMC is investing US$165 billion in new semiconductor factories in the U.S., a move complemented by a new U.S.-Taiwan trade agreement that reduces tariffs on key tech products. This substantial investment is part of a larger US$250 billion push by Taiwanese corporations into American semiconductor and AI sectors, aiming to secure production closer to end markets and critical customers. For investors, this development raises considerations regarding capital intensity, policy risks, and the long-term balance between Taiwan-based and U.S.-based manufacturing capacity.

title: How Investors Are Reacting To Advanced Drainage Systems (WMS) Rising Earnings Optimism Despite Softer Revenue Expectations
summary: Advanced Drainage Systems (WMS) is seeing increased analyst optimism for its upcoming December 2025 earnings, with expectations for higher year-over-year earnings despite softer revenue. This positive sentiment, driven by a "Most Accurate Estimate" exceeding the "Consensus Estimate," highlights a focus on margins and capital discipline. However, investors are cautioned to consider the company's premium valuation and recent insider selling, suggesting the news might offer only a short-term confidence boost without changing the broader risk profile.

title: A Look At Honeywell (HON) Valuation After Q4 Earnings Beat And Record Backlog Update
summary: Honeywell International (HON) has garnered investor attention following a strong Q4 earnings beat, double-digit organic revenue growth, and a record backlog exceeding US$37 billion. While analysts generally consider the stock to be slightly undervalued with a consensus price target of $252.97, Simply Wall St's DCF model suggests it might be overvalued at its current price compared to its estimated future cash flow value. Investors are encouraged to review both valuation perspectives and consider key risks and assumptions.

title: Amazon stock (AMZN) climbs after-hours as earnings loom and fresh filing hits tape
summary: Amazon's stock (AMZN) rose 1.5% in after-hours trading as investors anticipate its upcoming quarterly earnings report, which will offer insights into cloud demand and AI costs. The company's results are a key indicator for corporate IT budgets and consumer spending. Investors are also monitoring Amazon's capital spending, recent job cuts, and an extension request for its satellite broadband project.

title: Applied Digital Corporation (APLD) stock ticks up in late trade as insider sale filings land
summary: Applied Digital (APLD) stock rose 2.7% in late trading following an insider's Form 4 filing revealing a stock sale and a Form 144 indicating a larger planned sale. Investors are keen on tenant signings and financing updates as the company accelerates its AI data-center expansion, including the construction of a 430-megawatt "AI Factory." The company's future growth hinges on execution and securing necessary capital, with its next earnings report expected around April 13.

title: Why a $17 Million ETF Exit Might Signal a Shift Toward Higher-Conviction Assets
summary: Strong Tower Advisory Services fully divested its $17.14 million stake in the F/m US Treasury 3 Month Bill ETF (TBIL) during the fourth quarter, signaling a potential shift towards higher-conviction assets. Ultra-short Treasury ETFs like TBIL are typically used for capital preservation and liquidity, but as opportunity costs rise, investors tend to reallocate these funds to more attractive, higher-growth investments. This move suggests Strong Tower is re-evaluating its portfolio for greater long-term returns.

title: Micron Technology, Inc – DRAM shortage fuels pricing upside
summary: Phillip Securities Research initiated coverage on Micron Technology (MU) with a "BUY" recommendation and a target price of US$500, driven by the strong demand for its high bandwidth memory (HBM) products and an industry-wide DRAM shortage. Micron's HBM3E chips are designed into Nvidia and AMD GPUs, and its upcoming HBM4 is expected to challenge SK Hynix's market share. The report highlights increasing DRAM prices, sold-out HBM products for 2026, and significant benefits Micron expects from US CHIPS Act grants.

title: Why AMD Is Set to Outperform NVIDIA - A Top Buy AI Stock
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) has significantly outpaced NVIDIA (NVDA) in stock performance over the past year, with a 107.1% surge compared to NVIDIA's 63.8%. Despite entering the AI market later, AMD is rapidly closing the gap by offering competitive products like the Instinct AI accelerators, increasingly adopted by major players such as OpenAI, IBM, and Oracle. With a more diversified business, strong financial outlook, and high analyst price targets, AMD is positioned as a compelling AI investment ready to outperform NVIDIA.

title: 5 Revealing Analyst Questions From Sanmina's Q4 Earnings Call
summary: Sanmina's Q4 earnings call highlighted strong revenue growth, especially in communications networks and cloud infrastructure, but was impacted by softer operating margins and the integration of ZT Systems. Analysts questioned the revenue split between legacy Sanmina and ZT, the transition from NVIDIA to AMD partnerships, and the sustainability of operating margins. The company addressed these concerns, emphasizing growth drivers from ZT Systems and expectations for recovery in industrial and medical segments later in the year.

title: Oracle stock in flux following $50 billion AI fundraising announcement
summary: Oracle plans to raise $45 billion to $50 billion this year to fund its expanding artificial intelligence infrastructure. This announcement caused significant fluctuations in the company's stock, which had previously dropped over 50% from its peak last year, though it saw a brief recovery before dipping again. The capital influx aims to meet demand from major clients like AMD, Meta, Nvidia, and OpenAI, and will be financed through a combination of debt and equity issuances.

title: SiTime Corporation (SITM): A Bull Case Theory
summary: This article summarizes a bullish thesis on SiTime Corporation (SITM), a fabless precision-timing semiconductor company. The thesis highlights SiTime's differentiated technology, strong financials, and growth potential driven by AI infrastructure demand and strategic expansion into new markets. While acknowledging some governance and valuation risks, the article suggests significant upside potential for SITM.

title: SMCI Stock Rises Ahead Of Q2 Earnings — What Does The Street Expect?
summary: Super Micro Computer (SMCI) stock saw a nearly 5% rise ahead of its Q2 2026 earnings report. Analysts expect an 82% revenue increase to $10.34 billion but an 18% decline in EPS to $0.49. Citi and Mizuho lowered price targets, while Goldman Sachs initiated a 'Sell' rating, yet retail sentiment on Stocktwits is largely bullish, with some users predicting significant revenue and stock price increases.

title: Amprius Technologies, Inc. (AMPX): A Bull Case Theory
summary: This article summarizes a bullish thesis on Amprius Technologies, Inc. (AMPX), highlighting its advanced silicon anode battery technology, which offers superior energy density and fast charging. The company is undergoing a strategic shift towards commercial scaling under new leadership and is targeting EBITDA breakeven by late 2026, reinforced by strong partnerships and financial growth. Despite its potential, it's noted that AMPX is not among the 30 most popular stocks among hedge funds.

title: Nvidia Q4 Preview: Margins, China, And Risks Of A Post-Earnings Bust (Downgrade) (NVDA)
summary: This article provides a Q4 preview for Nvidia, downgrading the stock primarily due to risks associated with margins and Q1 FY27 guidance, specifically concerning China GPU revenue. While the author maintains a long-term Buy rating on NVDA due to continued hyperscaler CapEx and future product upside, they highlight potential short-term headwinds. The key risk factors include the absorption of HBM cost hikes and US export fees, which could impact the company's gross margin targets.

title: 3 Reasons to Avoid USPH and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: This article recommends avoiding U.S. Physical Therapy (USPH) despite its recent stock performance. The author highlights three main reasons: limited distribution channels due to its small size in a regulated industry, a declining free cash flow margin, and a decrease in Return on Invested Capital (ROIC). Instead, the article suggests exploring "high-quality stocks for all market conditions," particularly those showing strong momentum in digital advertising.

title: Nvidia and Uber Just Announced a Major New Robotaxi Partnership. Does That Make UBER Stock a Buy Here?
summary: Uber (UBER) has partnered with Nvidia (NVDA) and Mercedes (MBGYY) to develop a robotaxi company, leveraging Uber's vast real-life data for AI models. Despite recent Q3 earnings showing strong growth, the stock reacted negatively due to management's announcement that autonomous vehicles will not be profitable for several years. Analysts maintain a "Strong Buy" rating for UBER, projecting significant upside, as future earnings growth and the company's valuable data are expected to drive its stock price higher.

title: Sandisk Stock Surges 23% After Q2 Earnings Soar
summary: Sandisk Corporation (NASDAQ: SNDK) saw its stock surge by 23% following a robust fiscal second-quarter earnings report that exceeded expectations and an optimistic outlook for the third quarter. The company's non-GAAP net income and revenue outperformed consensus figures, leading Citigroup to raise its price target to $490. This positive performance has generated significant excitement and confidence among investors.

title: The Silicon Ceiling: Ominous Technical Signals Flash Red for Micron as AI Supercycle Hits Resistance
summary: Micron Technology (NASDAQ: MU) is facing significant technical headwinds, including a 20% stock retreat from its January high, despite record Q1 2026 earnings. This downturn is attributed to NVIDIA's revised HBM4 specifications causing Micron to redesign its memory stacks and broader market concerns about AI capital expenditure ROI and increasing competition within the HBM space. The article suggests this marks a more volatile phase for the AI supercycle, requiring investors to be more selective.

title: 3 Reasons Investors Love Remitly (RELY)
summary: Remitly (RELY) has seen its shares drop by 17.3% over the last six months, despite the S&P 500 gaining 9.6%. This article highlights three key reasons for optimism about the company: significant growth in active customers, a positive shift in long-term EPS, and an increasing free cash flow margin, all contributing to its potential as a strong business. The article suggests that after the recent dip, the stock might be an opportune buy.

title: 5 Insightful Analyst Inquiries from Western Alliance Bancorporation’s Fourth Quarter Earnings Discussion
summary: Western Alliance Bancorporation reported strong fourth-quarter results, exceeding analyst expectations for revenue and adjusted EPS, driven by loan growth, stable deposits, and fee generation. The article details five key questions posed by analysts during the earnings call, covering topics like loan and deposit growth forecasts, fee income durability, deposit composition, net interest margin, and ECR deposits. These inquiries offer deeper insights into the company's financial strategies and future outlook.

title: This Stock Is Vital to the Tech Industry and Could Be a Huge Winner This Year
summary: The article highlights Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (TSM) as a crucial player in the global tech industry, controlling 72% of the pure foundry semiconductor market. TSM reported $122.4 billion in revenue for 2025, a 36% increase year-over-year, and maintains high profit margins despite being capital-intensive. The company is actively expanding its global footprint, including a significant investment in a Phoenix, Arizona factory, and is poised for continued growth due to its critical role and manufacturing capabilities.

title: Johnson Controls launches series of thermal management reference design guides for gigawatt-scale AI data centers
summary: Johnson Controls has launched a new series of thermal management reference design guides specifically for 1-Gigawatt AI data centers. These guides offer comprehensive cooling architectures, starting with water-cooled chiller plants, and aim to address the rapidly evolving thermal management needs of AI infrastructure. The designs prioritize energy and water efficiency, flexibility for diverse climates, and compatibility with future GPU architectures, including a focus on zero water consumption and alignment with the NVIDIA DSX reference architecture.

title: Retirees Should Know One Third of FlexShares Dividend Fund Is Actually Technology Stocks
summary: The FlexShares Quality Dividend Index Fund (QDF) is an ETF designed for income stability, not maximum yield, with a 1.6% dividend yield. Despite its focus on dividend sustainability, one-third of its assets are concentrated in technology stocks, including significant holdings in Apple, NVIDIA, and Microsoft. This concentration gives the fund a risk profile more akin to a large-cap growth fund, making it potentially less suitable for retirees seeking high current income and more for those in the accumulation phase prioritizing quality screening and downside protection.

title: Pacer’s Dividend Multiplier ETF Cleverly Magnifies Yield To Pay Monthly Income
summary: The Pacer Metaurus US Large Cap Dividend Multiplier 400 ETF (QDPL) uses an unconventional strategy, employing S&P 500 dividend futures to amplify income rather than relying solely on its underlying stock holdings' dividends. The fund recently shifted from quarterly to monthly distributions, totaling $2.36 annually, in response to investor demand for more consistent cash flow. While its largest holdings are growth stocks like NVIDIA, Apple, and Microsoft that pay minimal dividends, QDPL's futures-based approach aims to provide both price appreciation and a significant yield, though monthly payouts can vary with market conditions.

title: What Makes Micron Technology (MU) Ashva Capital Management’s Largest Holding?
summary: Ashva Capital Management has identified Micron Technology (MU) as its largest holding, emphasizing its position at the intersection of structural demand growth and improving industry discipline. The investment firm believes that memory is no longer a commodity business but a strategic input for AI and cloud infrastructure, with Micron positioned to generate significantly higher free cash flow. Despite Ashva Capital's 2.26% net return in 2025, lagging broad market indices, its conviction in Micron is strong due to the company's manufacturing scale, technology leadership, and exposure to AI-driven demand.

title: Oracle (ORCL) states alleged trouble with $100 billion NVIDIA (NVDA) & OpenAI deal won't affect it
summary: Oracle has assured investors that its financial relationship with OpenAI will not be impacted by the alleged troubles surrounding a potential $100 billion deal between NVIDIA and OpenAI. Oracle works with OpenAI as a business partner, utilizing GPT-5 in its Database and Cloud Applications Portfolio, but claims any issues with the NVIDIA deal will not affect its operations or OpenAI's ability to raise funds. This statement comes amidst speculation and NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang's past refutations of such a large investment.

title: AIG (AIG): Buy, Sell, or Hold Post Q3 Earnings?
summary: This article analyzes AIG's financial performance following its Q3 earnings, noting a 5.1% stock price drop over the past six months. Despite a seemingly cheaper entry point, the analysis recommends against buying AIG due to declining net premiums earned, weak EPS growth, and unimpressive BVPS trends over a five-year period. The author suggests investors consider other "high-quality" stock opportunities.

title: 1 Small-Cap Stock with Exciting Potential and 2 Facing Headwinds
summary: This article identifies one small-cap stock with exciting potential, iRhythm (IRTC), and two facing headwinds, Tandem Diabetes Care (TNDM) and AdaptHealth (AHCO). It details the reasons for its positive outlook on iRhythm, citing strong revenue growth and improving profits, while outlining concerns about Tandem Diabetes's weak pump shipments and AdaptHealth's low revenue growth and declining returns. The author emphasizes the importance of thorough analysis for small-cap investments.

title: Benchmark Electronics (BHE) Valuation Check As Earnings Approach After Prior Estimate Beating Quarter
summary: Benchmark Electronics (BHE) is preparing to report earnings after exceeding analyst expectations in its previous quarter. The stock's recent performance shows momentum, but its current price of US$52.14 is slightly above the fair value estimate of US$52, suggesting it may be 30% overvalued. The company's strategy of deepening vertical integration in the semi-cap sector is key to future growth and margin improvement, though risks related to market recoveries and medical demand exist.

title: Assessing Instacart (CART) Valuation After Recent Share Price Weakness
summary: Instacart (Maplebear - CART) is currently valued at $37.16, which Simply Wall St considers 26.2% undervalued compared to a narrative fair value of $50.37. Recent share price performance shows a decline, yet the company's deepening enterprise partnerships and growing suite of omnichannel integrations are diversifying revenues towards higher-margin, non-transaction-based services, suggesting potential for margin expansion and earnings resilience. Investors are encouraged to assess the risks, such as higher labor costs or competition, and consider building their own narrative based on their assumptions.

title: Should John Hancock Multifactor Large Cap ETF (JHML) Be on Your Investing Radar?
summary: The article evaluates the John Hancock Multifactor Large Cap ETF (JHML) for investors seeking broad exposure to the Large Cap Blend segment of the US equity market. It highlights JHML's passively managed nature, low expense ratio, key sector allocations (Information Technology, Financials, Industrials), and top holdings like Nvidia, Apple, and Microsoft. The ETF is recommended as a "Buy" by Zacks ETF Rank due to its performance, risk profile, and diversification.

title: Should Franklin U.S. Large Cap Multifactor Index ETF (FLQL) Be on Your Investing Radar?
summary: The Franklin U.S. Large Cap Multifactor Index ETF (FLQL), launched in 2017, provides broad exposure to the Large Cap Blend segment of the US equity market with over $1.78 billion in assets. It boasts a low expense ratio of 0.15% and has a Zacks ETF Rank of 2 (Buy). The ETF aims to match the LibertyQ US Large Cap Equity Index by selecting securities from the Russell 1000 with favorable exposure to quality, value, momentum, and low volatility factors, offering diversification with 218 holdings.

title: Yeehaw: Trump’s Truth Social Funds to Acquire God Bless America ETF (YALL)
summary: Trump Media’s Truth Social Funds, managed by Yorkville America Equities, plans to acquire the God Bless America ETF (YALL) from Curran Financial Partners, significantly expanding its assets and introducing its first actively managed fund. This acquisition, a rare move in the ETF industry, positions Truth.Fi to scale by integrating an existing fund that targets "God-fearing, flag-waving conservatives" and aligns with an "America First" investment philosophy. The deal highlights how politically aligned funds can attract interest and assets, despite some challenges in marketing morality in investing.

title: 3 Volatile Stocks Walking a Fine Line
summary: This article identifies three volatile stocks—AAON, KeyCorp, and Bank of America—that investors should be cautious about due to issues like declining operating margins, unexciting net interest income trends, and limited growth potential. It also suggests alternative, high-quality stocks that have historically outperformed the market.

title: 3 Reasons to Sell FULT and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: This article recommends selling Fulton Financial (FULT) despite its recent stock price increase, citing three main concerns: disappointing long-term revenue growth, an expected increase in its efficiency ratio, and slim projected tangible book value per share growth. The author suggests that while the stock's valuation is reasonable, its fundamental weaknesses present too much downside risk and advises investors to look for superior stock opportunities elsewhere.

title: The 5 Most Interesting Analyst Questions From NBT Bancorp's Q4 Earnings Call
summary: NBT Bancorp met Q4 revenue and non-GAAP profit expectations, driven by the Evans Bancorp merger, improved deposit mix, and strong noninterest income. The article details five key analyst questions from the earnings call, covering topics such as commercial real estate payoffs, net interest margin outlook, and competitive lending conditions. Upcoming catalysts for monitoring NBT Bancorp's performance include loan growth, deposit mix improvement, and noninterest income expansion.

title: Oracle rises after company announces $50 billion fundraising plans. Here's what's happening
summary: Oracle's stock rose 2% after the company announced plans to raise $45 billion to $50 billion in 2026 to expand its data center capacity for cloud customers, including major players like Nvidia and Meta. This move comes as hyperscalers pour funds into AI infrastructure, despite investor concerns over Oracle's aggressive buildout strategy and recent stock drops following disappointing financial results and debt raising. The company has already made significant bets on AI infrastructure, including an $18 billion bond sale and a $300 billion deal with OpenAI in September.

title: ASML stock slides before the U.S. open as risk-off trading spreads — here’s what to watch next
summary: ASML Holding N.V. shares slipped about 2.2% in premarket trading due to a broad "risk-off" market trend, impacting tech stocks amid volatility in metals and crypto. The company, a key player in advanced semiconductor manufacturing, will release its annual report on February 25, with an ex-dividend date on February 10, and quarterly earnings expected on April 15. Despite a strong close to 2025 and positive 2026 sales projections, concerns about tightening markets, potential AI chip investment slowdowns, and stricter export restrictions pose risks to ASML's stock performance.

title: 5 Revealing Analyst Questions From Sanmina’s Q4 Earnings Call
summary: Sanmina's Q4 CY2025 results showed strong revenue growth, especially in communications networks and cloud infrastructure, exceeding analyst estimates. However, the market reacted negatively due to a softer operating margin and challenges integrating ZT Systems. Analyst questions focused on revenue trends, the NVIDIA to AMD transition, sustainability of operating margins, new ZT Systems wins, and weakness in industrial and medical segments, providing insights into the company's future outlook and areas of concern.

title: Better AI Stock: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing or AMD
summary: This article compares Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (TSM) and AMD as AI stock investments. While AMD projects high growth for its data center division, TSMC is presented as a more reliable investment due to its foundational role in manufacturing chips for multiple AI leaders and its current excellent performance and lower valuation. The author concludes that TSMC is the better buy despite AMD's potential for higher returns if its ambitious projections materialize.

title: Oracle Plans To Lay Off 20,000 To 30,000 Employees: Report
summary: Oracle Corporation is reportedly considering laying off 20,000 to 30,000 employees, about 10% of its workforce, to fund its ambitious AI data center expansion projects. This move is expected to free up $8 billion to $10 billion to support a $300 billion partnership with OpenAI and other AI infrastructure. The company is also exploring selling some of its businesses, including the healthcare software unit Cerner, and plans to raise $45 billion to $50 billion in 2026 for additional cloud infrastructure capacity.

title: 1 Cash-Producing Stock on Our Watchlist and 2 We Ignore
summary: This article analyzes three cash-producing companies, recommending one to watch and two to ignore. Zoetis (ZTS) is highlighted as a strong cash-generating stock with effective management and high returns, while National Vision (EYE) and Mattel (MAT) are identified as companies that produce cash but face challenges such as falling sales, inefficient capital allocation, and shrinking returns on capital, suggesting they are less attractive investments.

title: Unity stock steadies premarket after Google’s Project Genie shock — what to watch next
summary: Unity Software Inc. shares rebounded modestly in premarket trading after a steep drop caused by Google's Project Genie announcement, which sparked fears that AI-generated interactive worlds could disrupt traditional game engine demand. While Unity's CEO and some analysts downplay the immediate threat, investors are closely watching the company's Q4 and full-year 2025 results on February 11th for clarity on management's AI strategy and growth prospects. The debate continues over how "world model" AI will impact the gaming industry and Unity's valuation.

title: Nvidia to expand Taiwan presence amid supply chain growth: CEO
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang announced plans to expand the company's presence in Taiwan due to significant supply chain growth and the availability of a skilled engineering workforce. Huang stated that Nvidia is hiring a lot of engineers and intends to open a new, larger site, with a design to be unveiled during his next visit for Computex Taipei in June. The expansion reflects Nvidia's evolving product range beyond GPUs to include CPUs, networking chips, and other complex products.

title: Where Will AbbVie Be in 5 Years?
summary: This article analyzes AbbVie's future performance over the next five years, focusing on its reliance on key drugs Skyrizi and Rinvoq, which are projected to generate over $32 billion by 2030. The author also anticipates new blockbuster drugs from AbbVie's pipeline, such as Elahere and Vyalev, and predicts the company could reach a market capitalization of $600 billion by 2031, solidifying its status as a Dividend King.

title: This Utility Stock Could Be the Next Big AI Winner
summary: NextEra Energy (NYSE: NEE) is presented as a strong investment opportunity in the AI boom due to its role as one of North America's largest utility companies. The company is actively signing deals with major tech firms like Alphabet and Meta Platforms to power data centers and support AI infrastructure development. NextEra's stock is considered appealingly priced, and it offers a growing dividend, making it attractive for long-term investors looking for indirect exposure to the AI sector.

title: Principal Financial Group Inc. Sells 17,621 Shares of Intel Corporation $INTC
summary: Principal Financial Group Inc. reduced its stake in Intel Corporation by 0.4% in the third quarter, selling 17,621 shares while still holding 4.7 million shares valued at $157.8 million. Despite beating EPS estimates, Intel's revenue declined, and the stock faces uncertainty due to mixed analyst ratings and concerns about Nvidia's potential use of Intel's foundry services. Institutional investors collectively own 64.53% of Intel's stock, and an Intel executive recently bought shares, indicating internal confidence despite market fluctuations.

title: SCHD ETF stock is beating the S&P 500 and Nasdaq 100 this year
summary: The Schwab US Dividend Equity ETF (SCHD) is outperforming the S&P 500 and Nasdaq 100 this year, driven by an 8.50% jump and reaching an all-time high. This strong performance is attributed to a rotation from technology stocks to value companies, especially within the energy sector, which comprises 20% of the fund. Upcoming catalysts for SCHD include key corporate earnings and US non-farm payroll data, with technical analysis suggesting continued upward momentum.

title: Nokia Corporation (NYSE:NOK) Increases Dividend to $0.04 Per Share
summary: Nokia Corporation announced a quarterly dividend increase to $0.0359 per share, up 3.1% from its previous $0.03. This dividend, annualized at $0.09, will be paid on February 18th to shareholders of record as of February 3rd, resulting in an approximate 2.2% yield. The dividend appears sustainable with a payout ratio of 22.5%, and analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating with an average price target of $6.77.

title: iShares U.S. Technology ETF
summary: The iShares U.S. Technology ETF (IYW) provides low-cost exposure to the U.S. tech sector, tracking the Dow Jones U.S. Technology Index. With over 150 securities, it's liquid and has significant assets under management, though it's heavily concentrated in major tech giants like NVIDIA, Apple, and Microsoft. While suitable for tactical investors or those looking to increase tech exposure, its sector-specific focus might be too granular for a long-term buy-and-hold portfolio.

title: 1 Prediction for NVTS in 2026
summary: Navitas Semiconductor Corporation (NVTS) is predicted to successfully navigate its strategic pivot into higher-margin data center infrastructure and industrial electrification markets during 2026, accelerating revenue growth and delivering strong returns for investors. The company's stock has seen significant growth in the past year, partly due to its collaboration with AI industry leaders like Nvidia and its growing customer base in electric vehicles and PCs. While its P/S ratio has increased, the author suggests this could be just the beginning for AI infrastructure optimists.

title: 3 Reasons to Buy Uber Stock Like There's No Tomorrow
summary: Uber Technologies, despite a recent stock price slide due to increased capital expenditures, presents a strong buying opportunity. The company's strategic investments in autonomous vehicles through partnerships and its expansion into AI Solutions demonstrate a forward-thinking approach beyond traditional ride-hailing. Coupled with outstanding financial performance, including significant revenue growth, rising EPS, and healthy free cash flow, Uber's current valuation makes its shares attractive to investors.

title: The Artificial Intelligence (AI) Winner Hiding in Plain Sight for 2026
summary: Marvell Technology (NASDAQ: MRVL) is presented as an overlooked AI infrastructure company poised for significant growth in 2026 and beyond. This is driven by its strong position in the custom AI processor market, particularly with hyperscalers like Amazon and Microsoft, and its attractive valuation compared to its high earnings growth potential. The article highlights Marvell's role in supplying application-specific integrated circuits (ASICs) for AI data centers, a market expected to grow substantially.

title: Element Solutions Is Quietly Eating Tech’s Lunch – Here’s Why Everyone’s Suddenly Watching E
summary: Element Solutions Inc (ESI) is a behind-the-scenes player in the tech industry, providing specialty chemicals and materials essential for electronics, 5G, EVs, and data centers. While not a flashy consumer brand, ESI is gaining attention in investor circles for its role as a "picks-and-shovels" play for the tech cycle, offering exposure to long-term tech trends with less volatility than high-profile tech stocks. The company is seen as a "slow-burn compounder" rather than a quick-flip stock, appealing to investors looking for steady growth tied to essential supply chains.

title: IBM Shares Pop on Strong AI Growth. Is It Too Late to Buy the Stock?
summary: IBM's shares have surged due to robust AI-driven revenue growth, exceeding fourth-quarter expectations and providing optimistic guidance. The company is actively acquiring new technologies to bolster its AI and hybrid cloud offerings while maintaining a reasonable valuation. Despite a 35% increase in stock value over the past year, its strong growth prospects and strategic moves suggest it remains a solid investment.

title: 3 Profitable Stocks We're Skeptical Of
summary: This article identifies three profitable companies—El Pollo Loco (LOCO), XPO (XPO), and Amentum (AMTM)—that StockStory believes carry significant risks due to outdated models, unsustainable advantages, or underperformance. It explains the specific reasons for skepticism regarding each company, such as lagging sales, competitive pressures, and low free cash flow, and suggests that investors consider alternative opportunities.

title: 1 Stock Under $10 to Target This Week and 2 Facing Headwinds
summary: This article analyzes three stocks trading under $10, identifying one potential target and two facing headwinds. Quest Resource (QRHC) and GoodRx (GDRX) are highlighted as stocks to avoid due to declining sales, weak returns on capital, and high debt for QRHC, and underwhelming customer growth and negative returns for GDRX. Conversely, Clover Health (CLOV) is presented as a stock to watch, citing strong customer growth, outperforming earnings growth, and improving cash burn tendencies.

title: 3 Reasons DRI is Risky and 1 Stock to Buy Instead

The article suggests investors should consider buying Newmont stock, aligning with UBS's positive outlook.

title: Can Keysight's Deal for High-Speed Testing Drive Its Future Growth?

This collaboration aims to ensure high performance and reliability for large-scale AI data centers, utilizing Keysight's advanced high-speed digital test solutions. The company also faces competition from other players like Viavi and Teradyne in the AI space but shows positive growth in earnings estimates and a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).

summary: Billionaire hedge fund managers Israel Englander and Ken Griffin have invested in the SPDR Gold Shares ETF (GLD), which has outperformed AI stocks like Nvidia and Palantir, and the S&P 500 year-to-date in 2026. It suggests that investors concerned about global anxiety may consider adding exposure to gold through ETFs.

title: HubSpot (HUBS) Derives Its Strength From Large Customers
summary: HubSpot (HUBS) is highlighted as a promising cloud stock, with several analysts maintaining Buy ratings and offering significant upside potential. However, the article also notes that while HUBS has potential, the authors believe certain AI stocks may offer even higher returns with limited downside risk.

title: A Look At Tower Semiconductor's (NasdaqGS:TSEM) Valuation After Record Q4 Guidance And US$650 Million Expansion Plan
summary: Tower Semiconductor is gaining attention after announcing record Q4 revenue guidance and a US$650 million expansion plan focusing on photonics and SiGe for AI, 5G, and data centers. summary: Fermi (NasdaqGS:FRMI) is gaining investor attention due to its participation in Project Matador, an ambitious AI data center and energy campus near Amarillo, Texas, which plans to integrate large-scale AI computing with diverse energy sources, including nuclear power. Investors will be closely watching how Fermi's role evolves within this significant project and its impact on the company's long-term standing in energy-linked AI developments.

summary: Ciena (NYSE: CIEN) is presented as a top AI stock for 2026, outperforming many prominent tech companies. Its optical networking components, routers, and switches are crucial for high-speed data transmission in AI data centers, leading to a supercharged demand for its products. With a strong order book, accelerating growth, and an undervalued stock price compared to the U.S. technology sector, Ciena is poised for significant upside.

title: Five Companies That Came To Win This Week
summary: This article highlights five companies that made significant strategic moves in the past week. Palo Alto Networks completed a major acquisition to boost its AI observability capabilities, while Cisco Systems officially launched its new 360 Partner Program and IBM updated its Partner Plus program with new incentives. Microsoft entered the AI processor market with its Maia 200 chip, and cloud security startup Upwind secured $250 million in funding, achieving a $1.5 billion valuation.

title: Does NANO Nuclear Energy (NNE) Hiring a Top Regulator Recast Its Advanced Nuclear Investment Story?
summary: NANO Nuclear Energy (NNE) has appointed Michael Montecalvo, a veteran nuclear regulator, as Licensing Director, which is seen as a strategic move to navigate the complex licensing process for its KRONOS microreactor. This development, coupled with fresh analyst coverage and U.S. President Trump's support for nuclear power, aims to bolster NNE's investment narrative despite its pre-revenue status and inherent execution risks. Investors are advised to consider the long-term licensing milestones rather than short-term earnings.

title: Here's Why This Cyclical Company's Stock Rocketed 26% Higher Today
summary: Robert Half International's stock surged 26% after its fourth-quarter earnings report indicated a potential turning point for the cyclical company. Despite year-over-year revenue and earnings declines, the company reported positive sequential growth in talent solutions and enterprise revenues for the first time in over three years, with positive momentum continuing into January. This suggests a possible prolonged recovery, making it a key stock to watch for signs of economic improvement.

title: One Stop Systems Slims Down, Sharpens Focus on Profitability
summary: One Stop Systems Inc. (OSS) sold its German reseller business, Bressner Technology GmbH, for approximately $22 million, aiming to focus on more profitable segments like deployable AI and rugged edge-computing systems. This strategic divestiture is expected to generate a pre-tax gain of $7.4 million and reduce the company's workforce from 110 to 60 employees. OSS plans to increase international sales, particularly in "Five Eyes" countries, and recently received a $1.2 million pre-production order for U.S. Army combat vehicles.

title: AlphaTON’s Claude Connector Accelerates User Shift Away From Big Tech AI Practices That Steal Ideas and Data

This initiative aims to provide a private and secure AI experience, allowing users to move away from centralized AI practices that may compromise data and ideas. The connector supports the growing trend of "Confidential Compute," where users utilize local AI servers, often Mac minis, to keep their data private and prevent Big Tech AI from accessing their information.

title: Is It Too Late To Reassess Microchip Technology (MCHP) After Its Strong Share Price Run
summary: Microchip Technology (MCHP) has seen significant share price appreciation, raising questions about its current valuation. The DCF model indicates MCHP could be 36.7% overvalued, while its P/S ratio of 10.18x is higher than the industry average and Simply Wall St's fair ratio of 9.08x.

RDWU expands the T-REX suite of leveraged and inverse single-stock ETFs, providing tools for precise, short-term trading.

title: Warren Buffett Broke One of His Most Important Investing Rules, and It's Cost Berkshire Hathaway $16 Billion (and Counting)
summary: Warren Buffett, before his retirement as CEO of Berkshire Hathaway, made a rare, short-term trade in Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (TSMC) that resulted in an estimated $16 billion opportunity cost. This quick exit from TSMC, attributed to concerns about its location and potential export restrictions, violated Buffett's long-standing principles of long-term investing and holding high-quality businesses. Had Berkshire Hathaway maintained its initial stake in TSMC, it would have significantly benefited from the company's growth in the AI sector, highlighting the costly impact of deviating from established investment rules.

title: AbCellera Advances ABCL635 Menopause Candidate As Shares Trade Below Targets
