The company's leadership highlighted increasing demand for AI-driven solutions and substantial investments in cloud and AI infrastructure, including new datacentres and silicon technology.

title: Itron to Showcase Advancements in Grid Edge Intelligence and Resiliency at DTECH 2026

These developments aim to improve power quality, reliability, and asset management for a more sustainable and resilient future.

title: Nvidia’s Campaign to Sell AI Chips to China Finally Pays Off
summary: Nvidia's CEO, Jensen Huang, is reportedly celebrating a major win as China has approved the sale of hundreds of thousands of Nvidia H200 AI chips to major Chinese tech companies like ByteDance, Alibaba, and Tencent. This decision marks a significant shift in US tech policy, moving from tight export controls under the Biden administration to a more conciliatory approach under the Trump administration, which argues that allowing regulated sales is preferable to an unregulated gray market and keeps China reliant on US technology. While this move benefits both Nvidia and provides Chinese companies with crucial AI hardware, some experts warn that the inconsistent US policy sends mixed signals and might inadvertently push China to further develop its indigenous chip industry.

title: Is BOND-003’s Phase 3 Progress Reshaping The Investment Case For CG Oncology (CGON)?

While the expected topline data for PIVOT-006 in H1 2026 adds a near-term catalyst, the company remains a single-asset, pre-commercial biotech with minimal revenue and ongoing losses, maintaining execution and funding risks. Despite a strong stock performance and some investors seeing large upside, its shares might still be trading above fair value, highlighting a need for investors to consider the binary outcomes of its clinical trials and cash needs.

title: Should Korn Ferry’s LA28 Talent Role Reshape How KFY Investors View Its Competitive Positioning?

Huang also expressed support for TSMC's global expansion while affirming Taiwan's continued importance as a manufacturing hub and reinforcing TSMC's irreplaceable partnership with Nvidia.

title: Microsoft leads software stocks lower; suffers 7th largest drop in company history (MSFT:NASDAQ)
summary: Microsoft experienced its seventh-largest single-day stock drop, plunging 12% due to investor concerns about AI capacity restraints, significant performance obligations to cash-burning OpenAI, and declining profit margins from heavy AI infrastructure investment. This sell-off occurred despite a strong earnings report and affected other enterprise software stocks. The substantial reliance on OpenAI, which accounts for 45% of Microsoft's commercial performance obligations, is increasing concentration risk for the company.

title: Portfolio Anchors: SCHB Offers Broader Growth Exposure While VTV Delivers Value and a Higher Yield

SCHB provides broad market exposure with a tech focus and higher growth potential, while VTV targets large-cap value stocks with a higher dividend yield and lower volatility. The company, which specializes in infection prevention solutions, boasts a "GREAT" financial health score from InvestingPro and an annual yield of 0.96%. title: NVIDIA Sets Conference Call for Fourth-Quarter Financial Results
summary: NVIDIA announced it will host a conference call on Wednesday, February 25, at 2 p.m. PT to discuss its financial results for the fourth quarter and fiscal year 2026, which ended January 25, 2026. Prior to the call, written commentary from CFO Colette Kress will be posted on investor.nvidia.com after the results are publicly announced. The webcast will be available for replay until the first quarter of fiscal year 2027 earnings call.

title: Why Is Avnet (AVT) Stock Soaring Today
summary: Shares of Avnet (AVT) jumped 11.6% after reporting strong fourth-quarter results for the quarter ended December 2025, beating analyst estimates for both revenue and profit. The company posted revenue of $6.32 billion and adjusted EPS of $1.05, significantly exceeding expectations. Additionally, Avnet issued optimistic revenue guidance for the next quarter, further boosting investor confidence.

title: IBM beats Q4 estimates as generative AI business tops $12.5B
summary: International Business Machines Corp (NYSE:IBM) surpassed Q4 revenue and profit expectations, driven by strong software sales and the growth of its generative AI business, which now exceeds $12.5 billion. The company reported $19.69 billion in revenue and an operating EPS of $4.52, both beating analyst forecasts. Following these positive results, IBM's shares rose 7.7% in aftermarket trading.

title: Lam Research and Generac have been highlighted as Zacks Bull and Bear of the Day
summary: Zacks Investment Research has designated Lam Research (LRCX) as its Bull of the Day due to its strong position in the semiconductor industry, driven by rising demand for AI and advanced computing chips, expanded capital expenditure plans from major manufacturers, and advancements in etch and deposition technology. Conversely, Generac Holdings (GNRC) is named the Bear of the Day, facing headwinds from inconsistent residential demand due to mild weather and increased competition in the commercial and industrial sector from companies like Bloom Energy, despite some growth in data center power solutions. The article also provides analysis on Micron Technology (MU), highlighting its strong gains from soaring High-Bandwidth Memory (HBM) demand and attractive valuation.

title: Microchip (MCHP) stock jumps after BofA upgrade as chip rally widens
summary: Microchip Technology (MCHP) shares rose approximately 8% following an upgrade from Bank of America to "buy" and an increased price target of $95. This boost reflects improving conditions in the analog market and wider enthusiasm for chip stocks driven by AI data-center demand. Investors are now awaiting Microchip's financial results on February 5th for further indications of an industrial recovery.

title: Gorilla Technology Group Says Backlog Tops $100M as AI Data Center Pipeline Nears $10B
summary: Gorilla Technology Group (NASDAQ: GRRR) announced its contracted backlog surpassed $100 million, with a qualified pipeline for AI infrastructure and data centers exceeding $10 billion. The company reiterated its 2026 revenue guidance of $137 million to $200 million and plans to deploy up to 100 MW of data center capacity this year, focusing on non-dilutive, project-level financing. They also increased their share repurchase authorization to $20 million, with approximately $9 million remaining.

title: A Meta deal just turned this 175-year-old company into a linchpin of the AI data center boom
summary: Corning, a 175-year-old company known for various glass innovations, has become a crucial supplier for AI data centers following a deal with Meta. Meta has committed up to $6 billion to Corning by 2030 for fiber-optic cable, prompting Corning to expand its manufacturing facility in North Carolina. This deal, which sent Corning's stock soaring 16%, highlights the company's re-invention as a key player in the AI boom by providing essential fiber-optic infrastructure for connecting powerful GPUs within data centers.

title: Jim Cramer Believes "Broadcom Represents One of the Cheaper Ways to Play Artificial Intelligence"
summary: Jim Cramer recommends buying Broadcom (NASDAQ: AVGO) stock, viewing it as an undervalued way to invest in artificial intelligence, despite recent market declines. He expresses strong confidence in CEO Hock Tan to continue delivering strong results, highlighting Broadcom's solid performance in both software and hardware. Cramer suggests that the recent dip in the stock presents a good buying opportunity.

title: AlphaTON stated that with the accelerated deployment of GPUs, Telegram’s Cocoon AI has now started generating revenue.
summary: AlphaTON Capital Corp. (NASDAQ: ATON) has commenced generating revenue through its GPU infrastructure deployed on the Cocoon network on Telegram, supporting AI inference workloads, following a $46 million computing resource deal. The company is expanding its GPU cluster with over 570 NVIDIA B300 GPUs expected in March, projecting significant financial returns and has secured $44 million in financing for this expansion. AlphaTON has also formed new partnerships, including a recurring revenue agreement with Midnight Foundation and the open-source Claude Connector, further integrating AI with TON.

title: Zscaler AI Security Push Highlights Enterprise Risks And Potential Valuation Upside
summary: Zscaler has launched an AI Security Suite and the ThreatLabz 2026 AI Threat Report, addressing significant vulnerabilities in enterprise AI adoption. The report indicates that most tested AI environments are easily compromised, underscoring gaps in current security practices. This strategic move positions Zscaler to capitalize on the growing corporate demand for AI risk management, with the company's valuation currently estimated to be undervalued by 24.5%.

title: QQQY Flips Nasdaq Volatility Into a 45% Yield, Paid Weekly! It’s Hard To Process
summary: The Defiance Nasdaq 100 Enhanced Options & 0DTE Income ETF (QQQY) utilizes a strategy of selling same-day expiring options to generate high income, boasting a 37% return through late January 2026, compared to QQQ's 22%. This approach prioritizes income over capital appreciation, with weekly distributions fluctuating based on Nasdaq 100 volatility. While offering an impressive yield, investors should be aware of the fund's concentrated tech exposure and the trade-off of capped upside participation during strong market rallies.

title: ServiceNow posts better-than-expected fourth-quarter results
summary: ServiceNow exceeded Wall Street's expectations for its fourth-quarter earnings and provided optimistic guidance. The company's recent strategic acquisitions, intended to bolster its AI and security capabilities, reinforce its commitment to accelerating organic growth rather than pivoting away from it. Despite a post-earnings dip in share price, the enterprise software firm demonstrated strong financial performance and a significant increase in subscription revenues.

title: Google stock price today: Alphabet Class C inches up as regulators circle and a $135 million Android settlement lands
summary: Alphabet Inc.'s Class C shares (GOOG) rose slightly as Google agreed to a $135 million settlement for an Android data use lawsuit, while facing new regulatory scrutiny in Europe and Britain regarding its Search and AI services. Investors are also anticipating Alphabet's earnings report on February 4th, amidst high expectations for Big Tech. The company's heavy investment in AI and potential regulatory changes pose both opportunities and risks for its stock performance.

title: AMD stock price rises as chip rally rolls on ahead of Fed decision and earnings
summary: Shares of Advanced Micro Devices (AMD.O) saw a 1.9% increase, reaching $256.72, and peaking at an intraday high of $258.65. This rise is attributed to a broader rally in chip shares, pushing the S&P 500 above 7,000, as investors await a Federal Reserve rate decision and upcoming Big Tech earnings. AMD is set to report its fiscal fourth-quarter and full-year 2025 results on February 3, with particular focus on data-center demand and its AI chip business.

title: Gold Fields Ltd ADR stock hits all-time high at 58.19 USD
summary: Gold Fields Ltd ADR stock has reached a new all-time high of $58.19, reflecting a 252.6% increase over the past year and a 131.24% surge in six months. The company boasts "GREAT" financial health, with strong gross profit margins and revenue growth, and it recently reported better-than-expected Q3 2025 earnings while strategically acquiring a stake in Founders Metals. Analysts have issued mixed revised price targets for Gold Fields, following its Capital Markets Day outlining growth strategies.

title: F5 Networks stock price target raised to $345 from $325 at RBC Capital
summary: RBC Capital has increased its price target for F5 Networks (NASDAQ:FFIV) to $345 from $325, maintaining an Outperform rating. This adjustment follows F5 Networks' strong Q1 fiscal 2026 performance and increased full fiscal 2026 guidance, driven by factors like hybrid multi-cloud adoption and enterprise AI adoption, with minimal impact from a prior security incident. Other analysts, including Piper Sandler, Evercore ISI, and Needham, have also reacted positively to F5's robust financial results.

title: Lam Research (LRCX) Has a Shortage That Can't Be Met, Says Jim Cramer
summary: Jim Cramer states that Lam Research (LRCX) is experiencing a shortage that cannot be met, highlighting the strong demand for its semiconductor capital equipment. Both Goldman Sachs and Mizuho have raised their price targets for LRCX, citing factors like increased demand for memory and AI chips. The company's shares have seen significant growth over the past year due to the booming semiconductor industry.

title: KLA Corp (KLAC) Has a Shortage That Can't Be Met, Says Jim Cramer
summary: Jim Cramer highlighted KLA Corporation (KLAC) as a company experiencing demand that cannot be met, classifying it as semiconductor capital equipment. Both Morgan Stanley and Bernstein have issued "Overweight" ratings and significant price targets for KLAC, citing double-digit revenue growth potential for the next few years. The stock has seen substantial gains, with a 119% increase over the past year and 21% year-to-date, indicating strong market confidence.

title: Beamr to Showcase Validation of Video Workflows Powered by NVIDIA
summary: Beamr Imaging Ltd. (NASDAQ: BMR) will showcase its validation framework for AI-enhanced and compressed video workflows at Mile High Video 2026. The framework addresses the critical challenge of verifying visual quality in Ultra HD and AI-enhanced video, utilizing NVIDIA RTX technology for real-time processing and perceptually driven compression. Beamr's solution aims to ensure reliable 4K delivery and quality enhancement, while also reducing infrastructure costs for streaming platforms and broadcasters.

title: Applied Digital (APLD) Jumps 14% on AI Optimism
summary: Applied Digital (APLD) saw a 14.29% increase in its share price due to growing optimism in the artificial intelligence industry. This surge was fueled by significant investments in AI companies, such as Nvidia's $2 billion investment in CoreWeave and Anthropic's $15 billion fundraising. The positive developments suggest increased demand for data center services, benefiting companies like Applied Digital, which is constructing a new 430-megawatt data center in Dallas.

title: Cipher Mining (CIFR) Jumps 13.7% as Tech Giants Pour More Funds Into AI
summary: Cipher Mining (CIFR) saw its share prices jump by 13.71 percent due to increased investor interest in high-performance computing operators, following Nvidia Corp.’s $2 billion investment in CoreWeave Inc. The investment firm Keefe, Bruyette and Woods also raised Cipher Mining's price target to $22, citing the company's strong execution of its AI colocation strategy. This positive sentiment highlights confidence in the AI sector despite some concerns about a potential AI bubble.

title: TeraWulf (WULF) Rebounds 11% on AI Bets
summary: TeraWulf (WULF) saw an 11% rebound on Tuesday, closing at $15.31 per share, following news of Nvidia's $2 billion investment in CoreWeave, a cloud computing services provider. This surge reflects growing confidence in the AI sector despite "AI bubble" concerns. TeraWulf itself has active partnerships with Fluidstack and Google to develop high-performance computing capacity for AI needs, including an $8.7 billion leasing agreement and plans for a 168-MW HPC facility.

title: T1 Energy (TE) Climbs 12% on Renewed AI Optimism
summary: T1 Energy (NYSE:TE) saw its stock climb 12.04% to a two-year high of $9.12, driven by renewed optimism in the AI sector due to Nvidia's $2 billion investment in CoreWeave Inc. This rise reflects investor expectations of increased power demand for AI and data centers, coupled with a positive outlook for solar and wind energy. T1 Energy is expanding its solar manufacturing capacity with a new $425 million facility in Texas, poised to benefit from the projected growth in the solar sector.

title: Assessing Alibaba Group Holding (NYSE:BABA) Valuation After Nvidia H200 Chip Approval
summary: Alibaba Group Holding received approval to order Nvidia’s H200 AI chips, alleviating supply concerns and boosting investor interest in its AI ambitions. Despite a recent share price decline over 90 days, Alibaba's one-year return is strong, and the company is seen as undervalued by analysts, with a fair value estimate of $254. However, potential risks include future regulatory pressure in China or tighter export controls on advanced chips.

title: 5 Insightful Analyst Questions From Banner Bank's Q4 Earnings Call
summary: Banner Bank's Q4 2025 results showed steady core deposit growth and strong expense management, meeting revenue expectations and beating non-GAAP EPS estimates. This article highlights five questions from analysts during the earnings call, focusing on net loan growth, competitive environment, expense normalization, share repurchases, M&A, and deposit growth drivers. Key catalysts for upcoming quarters include loan pipeline conversion, impact of Fed rate decisions, and continued core deposit growth.

title: MOEA approves Nvidia HQ investment on eve of Jensen Huang visit
summary: Taiwan's Ministry of Economic Affairs (MOEA) has approved Nvidia's application to invest NT$3.3 billion (US$105 million) in a new headquarters in Taipei. This approval comes just before Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang's scheduled visit to Taiwan to attend a year-end banquet and meet with Taiwanese tech leaders. The Taipei City Government has also taken steps to facilitate Nvidia's headquarters development by combining land lots and changing land use to provide a larger area.

title: Inside AlphaTON’s $46M push to power Telegram’s Cocoon AI for 1B users
summary: AlphaTON Capital announced it has raised $44 million and is generating revenue from AI inference, supporting Telegram's Cocoon AI network. The company plans a $46 million investment for 576 NVIDIA B300 chips, projecting a 27% IRR and 282% ROI. Additionally, AlphaTON has secured a 2.2 MW colocation deal in Sweden and established strategic partnerships to expand its AI infrastructure and revenue streams.

title: Intel jumps amid report it will play a role in manufacturing Nvidia GPUs in 2028, CFO purchases $250,000 in company stock
summary: Intel's stock increased following a report from DigiTimes suggesting the company will help manufacture Nvidia's Feynman generation GPUs in 2028, specifically for the I/O die and packaging. This potential partnership enhances a prior $5 billion investment from Nvidia in Intel. Adding to investor confidence, Intel's CFO, David Zinsner, bought $250,000 worth of company stock after a recent dip in share prices.

title: Why Is Stride (LRN) Stock Rocketing Higher Today
summary: Shares of Stride (LRN) jumped 20% after the company reported strong fourth-quarter 2025 results that exceeded Wall Street's expectations for both revenue and adjusted earnings per share. The online education provider also offered positive guidance for the upcoming quarter and demonstrated improved operating margins, signaling enhanced efficiency. Despite being up significantly year-to-date, the stock remains well below its 52-week high, indicating potential for further growth.

title: Alignment Healthcare (ALHC) Stock Trades Up, Here Is Why
summary: Shares of Alignment Healthcare (NASDAQ:ALHC) rose 4% after a Baird analyst reported a promising outlook for earnings growth, helping the stock rebound from a previous sharp decline. This recovery followed a significant drop due to a Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) preliminary payment proposal for Medicare Advantage that proposed a mere 0.09% increase, much lower than analyst expectations. Despite the bounce, the stock had previously fallen 13.9% on the news and is currently trading near its 52-week high, up 7.4% since the beginning of the year.

title: Why Monolithic Power Systems (MPWR) Stock Is Up Today
summary: Monolithic Power Systems (MPWR) stock jumped 5.7% after industry bellwether ASML reported strong earnings and a positive outlook for 2025 and 2026, signaling robust demand for advanced chips. The positive news from ASML and Monolithic Power's own forecast of 30-40% growth in enterprise data for 2026 created a tailwind for the stock, which has already set a new 52-week high. This follows a recent upgrade from Wells Fargo based on improving sentiment in the chip sector and potential for inventory replenishment.

title: Jim Cramer Says "Wish We Had Not Sold AMD for the Charitable Trust"
summary: Jim Cramer expressed regret over selling AMD shares from the Charitable Trust, citing AMD's strong rally due to its ability to factor in CPU shortages, unlike Intel. The article highlights AMD's significant presence in high-performance computing, AI, and data center markets, mentioning recent financial performance and strategic moves like a potential deal with Intel for foundry services.

title: 5 Must-Read Analyst Questions From Old National Bank's Q4 Earnings Call
summary: Old National Bank reported strong Q4 results, surpassing analyst estimates for revenue and adjusted EPS, driven by core deposit growth, expense control, and credit improvement. The earnings call highlighted key questions from analysts, focusing on net interest income, reserve coverage, capital targets, loan growth sources, and fee income sustainability. Management provided insights into these areas, expressing cautious optimism for future performance.

title: Attractive Valuations Drive Interest in QXO Inc (QXO)
summary: QXO Inc (NYSE: QXO) is gaining interest due to attractive valuations, with RBC Capital Markets and Citi reaffirming Outperform and Buy ratings despite lowering target prices slightly. The company is a tech-enabled distributor of building products aggressively expanding and is seen as a strong large-cap stock. The article also discusses broader AI investment opportunities, suggesting some AI stocks offer even greater promise for returns.

title: Wolverine Worldwide (WWW): Buy, Sell, or Hold Post Q3 Earnings?
summary: Wolverine Worldwide (WWW) has seen its stock price drop by 26.5% over the past six months. Despite the lower price, analysts are skeptical about its future performance due to flat long-term revenue growth, mediocre free cash flow margins, and declining return on invested capital. The article concludes that Wolverine Worldwide falls short of quality standards and suggests looking into other software businesses and high-quality momentum stocks instead.

title: SEALSQ shows post-quantum robotics concept at Davos
summary: SEALSQ demonstrated a secure robotics concept incorporating post-quantum cryptography, physical AI, and robotics during a high-level roundtable at the World Economic Forum in Davos. This live demonstration highlighted the transition of quantum-resistant technologies from theory to hardware and emphasized the need for chip-level trust in future AI and autonomous systems. Industry experts at the event underscored the urgency of post-quantum readiness, with IBM anticipating quantum computers as early as 2028.

title: AMD Lands OpenAI Chip Deal, Highlighting Growing AI Revenue Story
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) has secured a chip deal with OpenAI, leading to a 119% stock jump over the past year and signaling its growing presence in the AI chip market. This partnership challenges NVIDIA's dominance, with AMD reporting significant Q3 2025 revenue growth and improving gross margins. Analysts are bullish on AMD's prospects, especially with the demand for its MI300X chips as hyperscalers seek to diversify their AI infrastructure.

title: The Red Dragon’s Ascent: AMD’s High-Stakes Gambit for AI Supremacy
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) has transformed into a major player in high-performance computing and AI under CEO Dr. Lisa Su, challenging Nvidia's dominance. The company's strategic focus on its Data Center segment, propelled by the Instinct MI350 series and EPYC server processors, has driven significant revenue growth and stock performance. Despite facing competitive pressures from Intel and Nvidia, and risks related to execution and geopolitical factors, AMD's innovative product lineup, including its AI accelerators and ROCm software, positions it as a formidable contender in the rapidly evolving AI market.

title: Waabi launching robotaxi fleet with Uber after raising US$750-million
summary: Canadian autonomous vehicle startup Waabi Innovation Inc. has raised US$750-million, one of the largest venture capital financings in Canadian history, and plans to launch a robotaxi fleet with Uber Technologies Inc. The Toronto-based company will deploy at least 25,000 autonomous vehicles on Uber's ride-hailing service while continuing its expansion into autonomous long-haul trucking. Waabi's CEO, Raquel Urtasun, emphasizes the company's ability to quickly launch robotaxis due to its sophisticated AI technology, which is trained in virtual simulations.

title: The Silicon Fortress: An In-Depth Research Report on Apple Inc. (AAPL) in the Age of Generative Intelligence
summary: This research report offers an in-depth analysis of Apple Inc. (AAPL) as of January 28, 2026, highlighting its pivot to generative AI, upcoming fiscal first-quarter earnings, and anticipated leadership transition. The article discusses Apple's business model, stock performance, financial health, product innovations like the iPhone 17 series and Apple Intelligence 2.0 with Google's Gemini, competitive landscape, and regulatory challenges. It concludes that Apple remains a technology fortress but faces critical shifts in strategy, execution, and succession that will define its next 12 months.

title: If You Buy Upstart With $10,000 in 2026, Will You Become a Millionaire in 25 Years?
summary: This article examines the possibility of a $10,000 investment in Upstart (NASDAQ: UPST) growing to $1 million in 25 years. It calculates that this would require a compound annual growth rate of 20%, double the S&P 500's historical average. While Upstart shows promising recent growth and has a large addressable market, the article highlights long-term uncertainties such as its cyclical nature and competition from traditional banks, suggesting that achieving such returns is highly uncertain.

title: 3 Stocks Under $10 with Warning Signs
summary: This article identifies three stocks priced under $10 (Blink Charging, PacBio, and Western Union) that carry significant warning signs, advising investors to exercise caution. The analysis highlights issues such as declining sales, cash burn, unfavorable liquidity, and negative earnings profiles. StockStory suggests avoiding these companies and instead considering higher-quality assets for better long-term returns.

title: TSMC’s Global Fab Expansion Reframes Supply Risk And AI Growth Story
summary: TSMC is expanding its global manufacturing footprint with a "gigafab cluster" in Arizona and considering facilities in Japan and the UAE. This move, supported by a U.S. Taiwan trade agreement, aims to diversify the chip supply chain and position TSMC closer to key customers for AI and high-performance computing. While offering advantages like reduced geopolitical exposure and stronger customer relationships, the expansion also presents risks related to high capital expenditure and execution challenges in new regions.

title: Assessing Whether Nova (NVMI) Shares Look Overvalued After Recent Strong Price Momentum
summary: Nova (NVMI) shares have seen significant recent price momentum, with a 44.16% return in the last month and a substantial 5-year total shareholder return, pushing the stock price to $477.07. Despite this strong performance, Simply Wall St's analysis indicates that Nova is currently overvalued, trading above its narrative fair value estimate of $393.75. The demand for Nova's advanced metrology solutions is driven by the increasing complexity of semiconductor devices, which is expected to fuel long-term revenue growth, though risks include potential customer order delays or new tool adoption failures.

title: Bank of New York Mellon Corp Buys 609,023 Shares of Caterpillar Inc. $CAT
summary: Bank of New York Mellon Corp increased its stake in Caterpillar Inc. by 20.7% in the third quarter, acquiring an additional 609,023 shares to own a total of 3,553,930 shares valued at over $1.6 billion. Other hedge funds also adjusted their positions in Caterpillar, while insider activity showed both buying and selling of shares. Analysts have a "Moderate Buy" rating on Caterpillar with a consensus price target of $640.20, and the company recently announced a quarterly dividend.

title: Well Done! Invesco’s Semiconductor ETF Returned 46% Without Just Chasing NVDA | PSI
summary: The Invesco Semiconductors ETF (PSI) delivered a 46% return over the past year by using an equal-weighting strategy across 30 semiconductor companies, rather than concentrating on top performers like NVIDIA. This ETF provides diversified exposure to the semiconductor sector through a momentum-driven approach, balancing risk across the supply chain. While it offers strong returns and mitigates concentration risk, its equal-weight methodology means it holds only 3.86% in NVIDIA and excludes international giants like Taiwan Semiconductor and ASML.

title: Does Trinity Capital’s Venture Debt Focus Secure TRIN’s High Yield or Stretch Its Dividend Model?
summary: Trinity Capital (TRIN) is a venture debt provider with a high dividend yield, and its investment narrative centers on the resilience of its venture debt portfolio and dividend sustainability. While its shares have seen a rise, the potential for further valuation rerating seems limited, with credit performance, dividend coverage, and the effective use of a new KeyBank facility being key factors for investors. Various fair value estimates from the Simply Wall St Community highlight different expectations regarding its income story.

title: Astera Labs (ALAB) Valuation Check After Expanded AI Cluster Connectivity Roadmap
summary: Astera Labs (ALAB) is under valuation scrutiny after announcing an expanded AI cluster connectivity roadmap. While recent share performance has been mixed, longer-term returns are strong, backed by high growth expectations in AI infrastructure. The stock is considered 14.2% undervalued by some narratives, but its high P/E ratio suggests the market has already factored in significant future growth, leaving little room for error.

title: Eli Lilly (LLY) Drives Q4 Gains as Pharma Fundamentals Shine Amid Sector Rotation
summary: Polen Capital Management's Q4 2025 investor letter highlighted Eli Lilly and Company (LLY) as a top relative contributor to their Polen Focus Growth Strategy despite the overall fund underperforming due to market volatility. Eli Lilly's stock rallied over 40% in Q4 2025, driven by strong financial results, market leadership, and a new agreement with the White House regarding GLP-1 drug pricing, which is expected to expand its addressable market. The company remains a significant holding among hedge funds, although Polen Capital Management also noted a focus on AI stocks for potentially higher, shorter-term returns.

title: Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA) Stock Price Prediction for 2026: Where Will It Be in 1 Year (Jan 28)
summary: Nvidia (NVDA) faces headwinds from U.S.-China trade relations but maintains dominance as an AI chipmaker with strong profitability. Despite a recent stall in momentum and market volatility, its focus on U.S. AI infrastructure investments and robust data center demand position it for continued growth. Analysts have a consensus one-year price target of $253.19, while 24/7 Wall St. predicts a year-end 2026 price target of $300.14.

title: $100 Invested In GraniteShares 2x Long NVDA Daily ETF 5 Years Ago Would Be Worth This Much Today
summary: This article highlights the significant returns an investor would have seen by investing $100 in the GraniteShares 2x Long NVDA Daily ETF (NVDL) five years ago. The ETF has outperformed the market with an annualized return of 82.45%. A $100 investment made five years ago would now be worth $2,021.52, demonstrating the power of compounded returns.

title: APLD Stock Closes At All-Time High As Hyperscale Tenant CoreWeave Receives Another Nvidia Investment
summary: Shares of Applied Digital (APLD) reached an all-time high after its hyperscale tenant, CoreWeave, secured a $2 billion investment from Nvidia. This new investment from Nvidia is intended to fund the expansion of CoreWeave's AI factories. Applied Digital's partnership with CoreWeave includes two 15-year leases expected to generate substantial revenue for APLD.

title: AeroVironment, Inc. (AVAV) Gains Tailwinds as Geopolitical Tensions Drive Defense Investment
summary: AeroVironment, Inc. (AVAV) is benefiting from increased geopolitical spending, with analysts reiterating "Market Outperform" ratings due to its position in drone and cyber spaces and strong international presence. Despite a stop-work order on a key program, the company is seen as a defense technology leader. The article also includes promotional content for AI-related investment opportunities.

title: Chip stocks rally after bumper earnings and a report of a game-changing China approval for Nvidia
summary: Chip stocks surged on Wednesday following strong earnings reports from semiconductor giants ASML and SK Hynix. Further boosting the sector, Reuters reported that China has approved sales of Nvidia's H200 chips to major domestic tech companies, sending Nvidia's shares higher. The rally is attributed to memory chip shortages, high demand for AI-related chips, and the critical role of companies like ASML in manufacturing advanced semiconductors.

title: How BCE Preferreds Joining the S&P/TSX Index Will Impact BCE (TSX:BCE) Investors
summary: BCE Inc.'s preferred shares were added to the S&P/TSX Preferred Share Index on January 19, 2026, which is expected to influence institutional portfolios and preferred share liquidity and demand. While this inclusion is beneficial for demand in the preferred share segment, it does not fundamentally alter BCE's core investment issues, such as cash flow quality, debt metrics, and potential dividend policy shifts. The company is characterized by slow growth and income focus, with some concerns about earnings forecasts and payout risk, despite recent revenue figures.

title: Forget Tech Stocks: The Medical Device Maker That's Essential to AI Healthcare
summary: Intuitive Surgical (ISRG), the maker of the da Vinci surgical robot, is positioned to be essential to AI healthcare due to its vast database of surgical procedures. The company has already begun integrating AI into its technology, and its data could eventually enable AI to perform surgery autonomously. Although the stock is currently expensive, its potential in AI-driven healthcare makes it an attractive, high-growth opportunity for aggressive investors.

title: A New Era in Options Trading! Futu Partners with Nasdaq to Deliver Monday & Wednesday Expirations for Greater Flexibility and Opportunity
summary: Futu Holdings Limited announced that its Futubull and Moomoo platforms will support Nasdaq's new Monday and Wednesday options expirations, making it one of the first brokers to offer this. This innovation, following SEC approval for nine high-profile securities including the "Magnificent Seven," increases trading frequency to three times a week, enhancing flexibility for short-term options trading and risk management. Futu provides advanced tools and strategies to help investors leverage these extended options expiration dates in a volatile market.

title: Assessing VF Corp (VFC) Valuation As Earnings Approach After Mixed Results And Cautious Guidance
summary: VF Corp (VFC) is facing renewed scrutiny as its earnings report approaches, with the stock recently experiencing a 39.38% short-term rebound despite a 20% overvaluation according to one popular narrative. Analysts have a consensus price target of $15.19, with a wide range, while a Discounted Cash Flow model suggests the shares are undervalued by about 2%. Investors are encouraged to consider both earnings multiples and cash flow generation to assess the company's true value, especially given execution risks like revenue declines in Vans or elevated tariff costs.

title: Nio rolls out major update to NWM driver assist software in China, delivering more human-like driving experience
summary: Nio has released a significant update to its Nio World Model (NWM) driver assistance software in China, aiming for a more human-like driving experience. This update, available first to over 460,000 Banyan-system equipped vehicles, introduces pilot-assisted driving between urban battery swap stations, supporting over 2,000 locations. It also marks the first application of full closed-loop reinforcement learning in smart driving development in China, utilizing massive human driving data for model training to enhance reassurance and efficiency.

title: Applied Materials Growth Highlights AI Chip Investment And Trade Policy Risks
summary: Applied Materials (AMAT) has experienced six consecutive years of growth driven by rising demand for semiconductor equipment related to artificial intelligence, despite facing trade regulation headwinds, especially from China. The company's critical role in chip manufacturing and ongoing investments position it centrally in the AI-driven shift in the semiconductor sector. Investors are weighing AMAT's AI exposure against trade risks, with upcoming earnings expected to provide further insights into its growth trajectory.

title: Top 10 Insights to Accelerate Your AI Strategy in 2026
summary: This article provides 10 insights to accelerate AI strategy in 2026, based on client engagements in 2025. It highlights the challenges of "option paralysis" due to the rapid evolution of AI technology, continued investor bullishness despite high valuations, and the primary focus of AI use cases on reducing administrative burden. The author also discusses the shift towards "buy" strategies for AI solutions, strengthening partnership ecosystems, evolving risk tolerance, and the critical importance of data quality and accuracy even for advanced AI strategies.

title: 1 Profitable Stock with Impressive Fundamentals and 2 Facing Headwinds
summary: This article analyzes one profitable stock with strong fundamentals, Reddit (RDDT), and two stocks facing headwinds, Upstart (UPST) and Hub Group (HUBG). It details why Reddit shows promise with its growth in daily active visitors, earnings, and free cash flow margin, while highlighting concerns for Upstart due to long payback periods and negative free cash flow, and for Hub Group due to weak unit sales and diminishing returns on capital. The piece encourages investors to conduct further research into these companies.

title: China gives green light to importing first batch of Nvidia's H200 AI chips, sources say: Reuters
summary: China has reportedly approved the import of its first batch of Nvidia's H200 artificial intelligence chips, according to sources familiar with the matter. This approval, covering several hundred thousand chips, occurred during Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang's recent visit to China and indicates a strategic move by China to balance its AI development with domestic innovation. The initial allocation is primarily for three major Chinese internet companies, with others now awaiting subsequent approvals.

title: A Look At Great Lakes Dredge & Dock (GLDD) Valuation After The East Rockaway Inlet Dredging Contract
summary: Great Lakes Dredge & Dock (GLDD) recently secured a $14 million East Rockaway Inlet dredging contract, drawing attention to its project pipeline and revenue. The company is considered undervalued with a fair value of $17 per share against its current price of $15.20, supported by a strong $1 billion backlog and new modern vessels increasing operational capacity. However, risks include potential slowdowns in government or LNG-related awards and challenges in supporting high leverage if bidding conditions weaken.

title: 2 Reasons to Like PTC (and 1 Not So Much)
summary: PTC's stock has fallen by 19.4% in the last six months, prompting a review of its current standing. The company demonstrates strong points such as a rapid customer acquisition cost (CAC) payback period of 15.2 months and an elite average GAAP operating margin of 35.9%. However, a concerning factor is its underwhelming annual recurring revenue (ARR) growth, which averaged 10.1% over the last four quarters, suggesting potential challenges from increasing competition.

title: Trustmark (NASDAQ:TRMK) Posts Better-Than-Expected Sales In Q4 CY2025
summary: Trustmark (NASDAQ:TRMK) reported better-than-expected revenue in Q4 CY2025, with sales increasing 5.2% year-on-year to $207.1 million and non-GAAP profit exceeding analyst estimates. Despite this, the company's long-term revenue growth has been sluggish, and while tangible book value per share has grown impressively, its net interest income was only in line with expectations. The article provides a detailed financial overview and analysis of Trustmark's recent performance.

title: Why Did Intel Stock Jump Over 3% After-Hours?
summary: Intel stock rose over 3% after-hours on speculation that Nvidia might use Intel's manufacturing capabilities for its next-gen AI and GPU platform. This comes after a recent 20% decline following Intel's disappointing Q4 earnings report. Retail sentiment on Stocktwits remains "extremely bullish" despite the previous week's results.

title: Prediction: Super Micro Could Join the $1 Trillion Club by 2035
summary: This article suggests that despite current slowing growth, Super Micro Computer (NASDAQ: SMCI) has the potential to reach a $1 trillion valuation by 2035 due to its expanding role in AI infrastructure and edge computing, new partnerships, and favorable analyst targets. The Motley Fool's Stock Advisor team, however, did not include SMCI in their current top 10 stock recommendations.

title: Western Digital (WDC): New Buy Recommendation for This Technology Giant
summary: Mizuho Securities, through analyst Vijay Rakesh, has reiterated a Buy rating on Western Digital (WDC) with a price target of $265.00. This recommendation comes after the company reported strong quarterly revenues of $2.82 billion and a net profit of $1.18 billion. While corporate insider sentiment for the stock is currently negative due to recent share sales, another Buy rating was issued by Google's Google Computer Hardware, though UBS maintained a Hold rating.

title: Texas Instruments (NASDAQ:TXN) Releases Quarterly Earnings Results, Misses Estimates By $0.01 EPS
summary: Texas Instruments (NASDAQ:TXN) reported Q earnings of $1.27 EPS, falling short of analysts' consensus estimates of $1.28 by $0.01, with revenue of $4.42 billion against an expected $4.44 billion. Despite missing estimates, the company maintained strong profitability with a net margin of 29.21% and ROE of 30.41%. TXN declared a quarterly dividend of $1.42, resulting in a 2.9% yield, but its high payout ratio of 103.84% indicates payouts exceed current earnings.

title: Intuit (INTU) stock price slides late Tuesday as IRS tax season opens and director pay filing lands
summary: Intuit (INTU) stock price dropped by 2.9% on Tuesday, coinciding with the start of the U.S. tax season and a new filing revealing changes to non-employee director compensation. The market reaction is also set against the backdrop of the Federal Reserve's policy meeting and a mixed broader market. Despite product updates and integration deals for QuickBooks, investor focus remains on broader economic factors and the efficiency of the tax season for Intuit's consumer segment.

title: Does Franklin Electric’s (FELE) 34-Year Dividend Streak Reveal Its True Capital Allocation Priorities?
summary: Franklin Electric (FELE) recently increased its quarterly dividend by 5.7%, marking its 34th consecutive year of dividend increases. This strong track record of returning cash to shareholders highlights the company's commitment to its investors, despite uneven earnings and recent margin pressures. Investors should consider how this dividend policy balances with reinvestment needs and Franklin Electric's valuation, as some believe the stock may still be trading above its fair value.

title: Live Ventures’ Central Steel Fabricators Emerges as a Strategic Participant in the AI Data Center and Connectivity Infrastructure Cycle
summary: Live Ventures' portfolio company, Central Steel Fabricators, is positioned as a key infrastructure provider for the rapidly growing AI, automation, and data center ecosystems. The company produces precision-fabricated steel systems, including cable management and structural frames, and has increased production capacity through robotic welding. This strategic focus, coupled with automation, allows them to capitalize on long-term growth trends in AI-driven infrastructure development.

title: A Look At Arista Networks (ANET) Valuation After Earnings Beat And Fresh AI Infrastructure Endorsements
summary: Arista Networks (ANET) is gaining attention due to recent earnings outperformance and new endorsements as a key AI infrastructure provider. The company's stock, currently at US$143.72, shows positive momentum with strong returns over the past year and five years, indicating that long-term holders have been well-rewarded. While a fair value estimate suggests it is undervalued at $163.37, the high P/E ratio of 53.9x compared to industry averages indicates that the market might be factoring in significant future AI-driven growth.

title: Infleqtion Appoints CFO Eric Bjornholt To Board Ahead Of Public Listing
summary: Infleqtion has appointed J. Eric Bjornholt, CFO of Microchip Technology Inc., to its Board of Directors, a strategic move as the company prepares for a public listing in September 2025 following a business combination with Churchill Capital Corp X. Bjornholt, with over 30 years of financial experience, will also chair the Board's Audit Committee, bringing significant public-company finance and governance expertise to the quantum technology firm. Infleqtion's diverse product portfolio, including quantum computers and precision sensors, is already deployed with clients like the U.S. Department of War and NASA.

title: Arbe Robotics closes $18.5 million public offering of ordinary shares By Investing.com
summary: Arbe Robotics (NASDAQ:ARBE) recently completed a public offering, raising approximately $18.5 million in gross proceeds through the sale of 13,225,000 ordinary shares at $1.40 each. The funds will be used for working capital and general corporate purposes, with AWM Investment Company, Inc. participating as a significant institutional investor. This capital raise follows recent developments, including a previous public offering, the unveiling of a new radar platform with NVIDIA, and a successful private placement of convertible bonds, all aimed at advancing its radar technology for autonomous driving.

title: AMD (AMD) is Facing a Shortage That Can't Be Met, Says Jim Cramer
summary: Jim Cramer highlighted that Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) is experiencing an insatiable demand for its products, leading to a shortage. This comment comes as AMD's shares have shown significant growth over the past year, with various financial firms like Citi, RBC Capital, Jefferies, and Truist maintaining positive ratings and price targets due to its AI business and prospects. Despite acknowledging AMD's potential, the article suggests that other AI stocks might offer greater returns with less risk.

title: Texas Instruments Stock Rallying Into Earnings – What To Expect
summary: Texas Instruments (NASDAQ:TXN) is heading into its fiscal Q4 2025 earnings report with its stock up 12.28% at $197.26. Analysts expect EPS of $1.28 on $4.43B revenue, slightly above management's prior guidance, but concerns linger regarding demand visibility, tariff disruptions, and a shallow automotive recovery. The market will closely watch Q1 2026 revenue guidance, as a conservative outlook or specific cautions on China demand could temper the stock's recent rally, despite a history of beating EPS estimates.

title: Wall Street Analysts Think Advanced Micro (AMD) Is a Good Investment: Is It?
summary: This article examines the reliability of Wall Street analyst recommendations for Advanced Micro Devices (AMD), highlighting that while AMD currently has a strong "Buy" average brokerage recommendation, such ratings often carry a positive bias. It contrasts this with the Zacks Rank, a proprietary tool based on earnings estimate revisions, suggesting that combining the two approaches can lead to more profitable investment decisions. The piece concludes that AMD's recent positive earnings estimate revisions, leading to a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy), validate the favorable ABR for investors.

title: Did Rising Short Interest and Q4 Net Interest Income Just Shift Annaly Capital Management’s (NLY) Narrative?
summary: Annaly Capital Management (NLY) is facing a shifting investment narrative due to rising short interest and expectations for its Q4 2025 net interest income. While analysts anticipate strong revenue growth and flat adjusted earnings, the company's recent equity program and high dividend highlight a trade-off between income, dilution risk, and balance sheet flexibility. Investors are encouraged to consider multiple perspectives and the interaction of equity issuance and dividend coverage with Annaly's risk profile.

title: Does Azure AI Growth Make Microsoft Stock a Buy Ahead of Q2 Earnings?
summary: Microsoft's upcoming Q2 fiscal 2026 earnings are expected to highlight significant growth in its Intelligent Cloud segment, primarily driven by Azure and its AI initiatives. Key factors include a major partnership with OpenAI, expansion of its AI ecosystem through Azure Ignite innovations like Microsoft Foundry, and enhanced infrastructure, all contributing to increased Azure consumption and making Microsoft stock a potential buy. The company faces competition but solidifies its position through strategic investments and product development.

title: Worried About AI Stock Valuations? This REIT Trades at a Fraction of the Price.
summary: This article suggests that investors concerned about high valuations in AI stocks should consider Equinix (NASDAQ: EQIX), the largest data center REIT. Equinix provides the essential infrastructure for AI hardware to operate and is well-positioned to capitalize on the soaring demand for data centers driven by the AI boom. The stock is presented as a reasonably priced investment opportunity despite its significant potential.

title: A Look At Capricor Therapeutics (CAPR) Valuation As FDA Advances Review Of Deramiocel BLA
summary: Capricor Therapeutics (CAPR) shares are gaining attention as the FDA advances its review of Deramiocel for Duchenne muscular dystrophy, requesting the full Phase 3 HOPE-3 study report without requiring new trials. Despite significant recent share price appreciation, the stock is currently trading at US$23.62 against an analyst target of US$50.80, with a perceived intrinsic discount of about 91%. The article highlights a fair value narrative of $44.56, but cautions investors about potential regulatory setbacks or dilution risks.

title: Silicon Sovereignty: Alibaba and Baidu Fast-Track AI Chip IPOs to Challenge Global Dominance
summary: Alibaba and Baidu are accelerating plans to spin off their AI chip-making units, T-Head and Kunlunxin, into independent, publicly traded companies. This strategic move aims to challenge the dominance of global silicon giants like NVIDIA and AMD by commercializing their proprietary chips and addressing the growing demand for AI compute within China amid export restrictions. These IPOs signify a major step towards China's "Silicon Sovereignty" and could redefine the global semiconductor landscape by turning hyperscalers into influential hardware designers.

title: From pilots to production: Teradata's AgentStack for autonomous AI
summary: Teradata (NYSE: TDC) has launched Enterprise AgentStack, an integrated toolkit designed to help businesses build, deploy, and govern production-grade AI agents across hybrid environments. This platform aims to bridge the gap between experimental AI pilots and scaled deployments by providing essential tools for secure data discovery, agent creation, scalable hybrid deployment, and centralized monitoring. Cloud availability is expected in Q2 2026, with an on-premise version later in the year, and it integrates with various partners and AI frameworks.

title: The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. $GS Stock Holdings Lifted by Stonegate Investment Group LLC
summary: Stonegate Investment Group LLC significantly increased its stake in The Goldman Sachs Group by 207.6% in Q3, now owning 11,717 shares worth $9.33 million, contributing to institutional investors holding 71.21% of the company. Goldman Sachs reported strong Q4 earnings, surpassing analyst estimates for both EPS and revenue, and announced a quarterly dividend increase to $4.50. Despite some insider selling, analysts maintain an average "Hold" rating with an average price target of $898.00, reflecting positive sentiment around its financial performance and strategic moves.

title: Is iShares ESG Aware MSCI USA ETF (ESGU) a Strong ETF Right Now?
summary: The iShares ESG Aware MSCI USA ETF (ESGU) is a smart beta ETF launched in December 2016, offering broad exposure to All Cap Growth stocks with positive environmental, social, and governance characteristics. Sponsored by Blackrock, it has over $15.98 billion in assets and a low expense ratio of 0.15%. ESGU is heavily allocated to Information Technology, with top holdings including Nvidia, Apple, and Microsoft, and has shown a 13.98% return over the last 12 months.

title: Why Did Cyngn Stock Soar 27% Pre-Market Today?
summary: Cyngn's stock surged over 27% in pre-market trading after the company announced a near three-fold increase in orders for its autonomous DriveMod Tuggers for 2025 compared to 2024. This growth, driven by stronger customer engagement and operational activity, signals increasing commercial interest in self-driving material-handling equipment. The company plans multi-vehicle rollouts in early 2026, building on a previous capital raise and collaboration with Nvidia.

title: InnovizSMART LiDAR offers 450m range and fast deployment for smart infrastructure
summary: Innoviz Technologies announced the general availability of InnovizSMART, an off-the-shelf automotive-grade LiDAR solution for smart infrastructure applications. It offers a 450-meter detection range, blockage resilience, uniform resolution, and PoE-enabled connectivity for quick deployment. An upgraded model, InnovizSMARTer, is expected in Q2 2026.

title: Scalar Gauge Management LLC Invests $13.20 Million in Comfort Systems USA, Inc. $FIX
summary: Scalar Gauge Management LLC has invested $13.20 million in Comfort Systems USA, Inc. (NYSE:FIX), acquiring 16,000 shares which now comprise 6.7% of the firm's portfolio. Other institutional investors have also adjusted their stakes in the company. The article also details recent insider selling activity, stock performance metrics, and current Wall Street analyst ratings for Comfort Systems USA.

title: Silver is retail traders' new obsession as record numbers bet on rally — and on a crash
summary: Retail investors are actively trading silver, with record inflows into the iShares Silver Trust (SLV) ETF, indicating a strong belief in its rally. Simultaneously, a significant number of individual investors are making leveraged bets on silver crashing, leading to what an analyst describes as a "two-front war." This heightened interest has made silver the new epicenter of retail trading fervor, even surpassing the trading momentum of popular tech stocks like Nvidia.

title: Should TCW Transform 500 ETF (VOTE) Be on Your Investing Radar?
summary: The TCW Transform 500 ETF (VOTE), launched in 2021, offers broad exposure to the Large Cap Blend segment of the US equity market with low annual operating expenses of 0.05%. The ETF holds a Zacks ETF Rank of 2 (Buy) and has performed well, returning 1.47% year-to-date and 14.95% over the last year, making it an attractive option for investors. Its top holdings include Nvidia, Apple, and Microsoft, with a significant allocation to the Information Technology sector.

title: Aehr Test Systems to Participate in the 11th Annual Oppenheimer Emerging Growth Conference on February 3, 2026
summary: Aehr Test Systems (NASDAQ: AEHR) announced its participation in the Oppenheimer 11th Annual Emerging Growth Conference, taking place virtually on February 3-4, 2026. CEO Gayn Erickson and CFO Chris Siu will host virtual meetings with investors on February 3rd to discuss the company's expanding role in semiconductor device testing for AI, data center, automotive, and industrial applications. Aehr expects significant growth driven by the increasing adoption of wafer-level and packaged-part test and burn-in solutions across these markets.

title: Red Cedar Investment Management LLC Invests $2.09 Million in The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. $GS
summary: Red Cedar Investment Management LLC has invested $2.09 million in The Goldman Sachs Group by purchasing 2,622 shares during the third quarter. This comes amidst other institutional investors adjusting their stakes and a director selling 19,796 shares. The Goldman Sachs Group recently reported strong Q4 earnings, beating analyst estimates, and increased its quarterly dividend.

title: Popular (NASDAQ:BPOP) Posts Q4 CY2025 Sales In Line With Estimates
summary: Popular Inc. (NASDAQ: BPOP) reported its Q4 CY2025 results, with sales up 9% year-on-year to $823.8 million, aligning with Wall Street estimates. The company's GAAP EPS of $3.53 significantly beat analyst expectations by 16.2%. Net interest income also narrowly surpassed estimates, contributing to an encouraging quarter for the Puerto Rican financial institution.

title: The Trillion-Dollar Tightrope: Apple Faces 'Extreme Expectations' Ahead of Landmark 2026 Earnings
summary: Apple Inc. (AAPL) is gearing up to release its Q1 2026 fiscal results, with analysts projecting record-breaking revenue of $138.5 billion driven by the "iPhone 17 Supercycle" and Apple Intelligence. Despite high expectations and a rich 31x forward P/E multiple, concerns linger about whether the AI-driven narrative has peaked, especially as the company faces regulatory scrutiny and shifting supply chain dynamics. Investors will be keenly watching the growth of Apple's Services division and any insights into the "iPhone Air" inventory to gauge the company's ability to convert AI hype into tangible sales.

title: Why Agilysys (AGYS) Stock Is Falling Today
summary: Shares of hospitality software provider Agilysys (AGYS) fell 20.5% after the company reported fourth-quarter results that missed profit expectations, despite exceeding revenue forecasts. The adjusted earnings per share of $0.42 fell short of the $0.46 consensus estimate, overshadowing a slight raise in full-year revenue guidance. This earnings miss led to a significant drop in the stock price, which is down 21.9% since the start of the year.

title: SANM Q4 Deep Dive: AI and Cloud Demand Boost Revenue, Guidance Lags Street Expectations
summary: Sanmina (SANM) reported Q4 CY2025 results that exceeded revenue expectations, driven by strong demand in AI and cloud infrastructure, with sales up 59% year-on-year. Despite the positive revenue performance and strong adjusted EPS beat, the market reacted negatively due to a lower-than-expected next-quarter revenue guidance, softer operating margins, and challenges related to the ZT Systems acquisition integration. Management highlighted continued focus on higher-margin opportunities and investments in AI data center capabilities for future growth.

title: 3 Reasons PAG is Risky and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: Penske Automotive Group (PAG) experienced a 5.8% loss in shares over the past six months, underperforming the S&P 500. This analysis highlights three reasons for caution: same-store sales falling behind peers, low gross margins indicating weak structural profitability, and declining EPS. The article concludes that despite a reasonable valuation, PAG's shaky fundamentals present too much downside risk, recommending other high-quality stocks instead.

title: Aurora Mobile Limited (NASDAQ:JG) Shares Fly 27% But Investors Aren't Buying For Growth
summary: Aurora Mobile Limited (NASDAQ:JG) shares have risen 27% in the last month, but are still down 45% over the past year. Despite its price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of 0.9x making it appear undervalued compared to the broader Software industry, investors are not enthusiastic about its growth prospects. The company's recent revenue growth of 21% over the last year and 5.8% over three years is notably weaker than the industry's projected 33% growth, leading to the low P/S ratio.

title: Fastenal's Q4 Earnings Call: Our Top 5 Analyst Questions
summary: Fastenal's Q4 earnings met Wall Street expectations for revenue and EPS but missed on adjusted EBITDA, leading to a negative market reaction despite consistent double-digit sales growth driven by strategic customer focus and digital offerings. The article highlights key analyst questions from the earnings call, focusing on economic assumptions, incremental margins, pricing vs. volume, 2026 pricing sustainability, and e-business growth trends. Future catalysts include FMI device expansion, operating margin stability, and industrial end-market demand.

title: How Investors Are Reacting To Bilibili (BILI) Prioritizing Ads And Games Over Its Creator Community
summary: Bilibili has achieved profitability by shifting towards a commercial model focused on advertising and self-developed games, reducing creator subsidies. This pivot to short videos and heavier commercialization challenges the platform's community-driven culture, raising concerns about long-term user loyalty. Investors are reassessing whether this strategy is sustainable, with Bilibili's shares potentially undervalued despite recent rises.

title: Retail Resiliency: Walmart and Home Depot Anchor Dow Gains Amidst Market Turbulence
summary: The article highlights how Walmart and Home Depot are acting as stabilizing forces for the Dow Jones Industrial Average amidst market turbulence, echoing a trend from early 2025 where retail giants buoyed the market against downturns in technology stocks. It discusses how these "defensive powerhouses" leverage scale, strategic acquisitions, and integrated physical/digital storefronts to maintain profitability and growth, even as other sectors and smaller retailers struggle with volatility, trade tariffs, and interest rate fluctuations. The piece anticipates a potential repeat of this retail rally in February 2026, with upcoming earnings reports from both companies serving as key indicators for the market.

title: A Deep Dive into the iShares MSCI World ETF: A U.S.-Powered Global Vehicle
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH) offers diversified exposure to developed market equities but is heavily concentrated in U.S. technology stocks, which has driven recent performance but introduces significant risk. Its future hinges on the continued success of these major U.S. tech giants, the broader AI trend, and the global economic climate. Investors should consider its high U.S. weighting and tech focus when comparing it to other global equity ETFs.

title: NVIDIA Corporation $NVDA Stake Boosted by FengHe Fund Management Pte. Ltd.
summary: FengHe Fund Management Pte. Ltd. significantly increased its stake in NVIDIA Corporation by 43.1% in Q3 2025, bringing its total holdings to 222,500 shares valued at $41.5 million. This makes NVIDIA the fund's ninth-largest holding, despite recent insider selling and competitive pressures from Microsoft's new AI accelerator. Analysts widely maintain a "Buy" rating for NVIDIA, citing strong financial performance with Q3 revenue up 62.5% year-over-year and an EPS beat, although caution is noted due to insider transactions and broader market sentiment ahead of big-tech earnings.

title: Eli Lilly (LLY) Oncology Pipeline and $1B Nvidia (NVDA) AI Partnership Signal Strong 2026 Growth
summary: Eli Lilly (LLY) has received FDA Breakthrough Therapy designation for sofetabart mipitecan, accelerating its oncology pipeline development. The company has also partnered with Nvidia (NVDA) in a $1 billion joint venture to establish a new research laboratory, focusing on using AI to speed up drug discovery and development. These initiatives are expected to drive strong growth for Eli Lilly in 2026.

title: Fastenal’s Fourth Quarter Earnings Call: The Five Key Questions from Analysts
summary: Fastenal reported fourth-quarter results matching analyst forecasts but faced market negativity due to ongoing double-digit sales growth driven by major strategic clients and digital solutions, despite challenges from a sluggish industrial sector and margin pressures. Key analyst questions focused on sales growth targets, margin expectations, balancing pricing and volume, sustainability of pricing, and the impact of digital sales on margins. The company aims to expand its FMI device network and digital solutions, maintain stable operating margins, and track demand shifts in the industrial sector.

title: Avantax Planning Partners Inc. Sells 18,153 Shares of Dimensional World ex U.S. Core Equity 2 ETF $DFAX
summary: Avantax Planning Partners Inc. has reduced its stake in the Dimensional World ex U.S. Core Equity 2 ETF (DFAX) by 29.1%, selling 18,153 shares and holding 44,290 shares valued at $1.39 million. Several other institutional investors also adjusted their holdings in DFAX. The article also provides details on the ETF's price performance and company profile, noting its focus on small-cap non-U.S. stocks.

title: Stifel Sees Signs of a Demand Recovery for Texas Instruments (TXN)
summary: Stifel analyst Tore Svanberg raised Texas Instruments' price target to $200 from $170, maintaining a Hold rating, citing signs of demand recovery for analog chips and solid AI infrastructure spending. Texas Instruments, a global semiconductor company, produces chips for various markets including AI-focused data centers, aerospace, and industrial automation, leading to increased demand for its semiconductors as AI integration grows.

title: Meta inks deal to pay Corning up to $6 billion for fiber-optic cables in AI data centers
summary: Meta has committed to paying Corning up to $6 billion through 2030 for fiber-optic cable needed in its rapidly expanding AI data centers. This deal underscores the massive infrastructure build-out driven by AI, with Corning's stock surging over 75% in the past year due to high demand from tech giants like Meta, Nvidia, and Google. Corning has even developed a new, denser fiber-optic cable called Contour specifically for AI data centers to handle the increased connectivity requirements, anticipating that hyperscalers will soon be its biggest customers.

title: Wix.com’s (WIX) Downslide Makes It An Attractive Buy
summary: Wix.com (WIX) is considered an attractive buy despite a recent downslide, with analysts maintaining price targets that suggest significant upside potential. The company recently launched "Wix Harmony," a new AI website builder offering advanced visual editing capabilities and addressing security concerns, which has improved investor sentiment. Although there are investment risks, the article suggests Wix could be a promising AI stock, also featuring promotional material for other AI investment opportunities.

title: I Called Micron's Surge a Few Months Ago. Here's How High I See the AI Stock Going This Year.
summary: Micron (NASDAQ: MU) has experienced significant growth, becoming one of the biggest winners in the AI boom, with its stock up 239% last year and another 40% year-to-date in 2026. This surge is attributed to a memory-chip shortage driving up prices and the company's strong execution, including a major $100 billion manufacturing complex in New York. The author, who predicted Micron's rise, forecasts the stock could reach $600 by year-end, driven by continued demand, rising prices, and its "still-cheap" forward P/E of 12.

title: AEGON ASSET MANAGEMENT UK Plc Has $14.06 Million Stock Position in Veracyte, Inc. $VCYT
summary: AEGON ASSET MANAGEMENT UK Plc significantly increased its stake in Veracyte, Inc. (NASDAQ:VCYT) by 34.8% in the third quarter, now holding 409,601 shares valued at $14.06 million. The article notes mixed analyst ratings with a consensus "Hold" and a $46.14 price target, while insiders have been net sellers. Veracyte reported stronger-than-expected earnings and revenue for the last quarter.

title: Is Riot Platforms (RIOT) Quietly Redefining Its Identity From Bitcoin Miner To AI Infrastructure Builder?
summary: Riot Platforms is shifting its strategy from solely Bitcoin mining to becoming a broader AI and high-performance computing infrastructure provider, highlighted by a new lease agreement with AMD and Texas infrastructure initiatives. This repositioning aims to diversify its business model beyond the volatile crypto market. Investors should consider Riot's execution on AI, tenant demand, and capital allocation alongside its Bitcoin operations, especially given its current valuation and equity raises.

title: ASML's Key Role in AI Chip Supply Chain
summary: ASML plays a critical role in the AI chip supply chain due to its near-monopoly on extreme ultraviolet (EUV) technology, essential for producing advanced semiconductors. Major chipmakers like TSMC, Samsung, and SK Hynix are significantly increasing their investments in ASML's equipment, indicating strong demand. Despite some analysts forecasting a price drop, reflecting subjective views, the company's strong market position and technological advantage suggest continued performance in the advanced chip sector.

title: Lucid Group Fell 4% Last Week. Here’s Why the Stock Could Have 180% Upside
summary: Lucid Group (LCID) shares dropped 3.6% last week, closing at $11, despite the company emphasizing its technological leadership and AI-driven vehicle development. TIKR's Advanced Valuation Model suggests significant undervaluation, with a price target of $31, representing a potential upside of 179%. This valuation is based on an aggressive revenue CAGR and the company's ability to stabilize cash burn and execute on AI efficiencies.

title: Infleqtion and Churchill Capital Corp X S-4 Registration Statement Declared Effective by SEC in Connection with Proposed Business Combination
summary: Infleqtion, a leader in quantum sensing and computing, and Churchill Capital Corp X (CCCX) announced that their joint S-4 registration statement concerning their proposed business combination has been declared effective by the SEC. This significant step moves them closer to completing the merger, with Churchill X scheduling a shareholder meeting for February 12, 2026, to approve the combination. The transaction is expected to generate over $540 million in gross proceeds, accelerating Infleqtion's technology roadmap and product commercialization.

title: Form DEF 14A Keysight Technologies, For: Mar 19
summary: Keysight Technologies (KEYS) has filed its definitive proxy statement (Form DEF 14A) for its annual stockholder meeting scheduled for March 19, 2026. The meeting will be held virtually and will cover the election of three directors, ratification of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as the independent registered public accounting firm, an advisory vote on executive compensation, and a proposal to declassify the Board of Directors. The board also addresses a stockholder proposal for shareholders to call special meetings, recommending a vote against it due to potential inefficiencies and strong existing corporate governance practices.

title: Should Viatris’ (VTRS) First Inpefa UAE Launch Shape Investor Views on Its Innovation Strategy?
summary: Viatris recently launched Inpefa (sotagliflozin) in the UAE, marking its first international commercialization of this heart failure treatment outside the U.S. and Europe, stemming from a licensing deal with Lexicon Pharmaceuticals. This move highlights Viatris's strategy to expand its innovative, branded therapy portfolio and broadens patient access, although its immediate impact on the company's substantial revenue base is expected to be modest. Investors should consider this as one of several catalysts, alongside cost discipline and debt reduction, as Viatris continues its multi-year transformation while managing ongoing net losses and dividend coverage.

title: Jim Cramer Says Traders Don’t Understand International Business Machines’ Value
summary: Jim Cramer believes that traders do not fully appreciate the value of International Business Machines (NYSE: IBM), despite its strong performance and transformation into a tech juggernaut. He points to IBM's hybrid cloud, AI, and consulting businesses, along with its strong sales growth and sound leadership under CEO Arvind Krishna. Cramer suggests technical indicators like the bullish crossover and relative strength indicate potential for further rally, emphasizing that the stock is inexpensive relative to its growth rate.

title: NVIDIA invests $2 billion in CoreWeave (NASDAQ: CRWV) AI buildout
summary: NVIDIA has injected $2 billion into CoreWeave through a private placement, acquiring 22,935,780 shares of its Class A common stock at $87.20 per share. This investment strengthens CoreWeave's financial position and deepens a strategic collaboration to accelerate the buildout of over 5 gigawatts of AI factories by 2030, leveraging NVIDIA's computing platform technology. The deal, completed on January 23, 2026, also involves a broader collaboration framework to advance AI adoption globally.

title: 3 Low-Volatility Stocks with Questionable Fundamentals
summary: This article identifies three low-volatility stocks—fuboTV (FUBO), Cogent Communications (CCOI), and Goodyear (GT)—that, despite their apparent stability, possess questionable fundamentals. The author advises investors to avoid these stocks due to issues like weak demand, poor financial management, and declining sales, suggesting that better growth opportunities exist elsewhere. It also promotes StockStory's "Top 5 Growth Stocks" as an alternative for investors seeking higher-quality assets.

title: 3 Inflated Stocks We Think Twice About
summary: This article identifies three stocks—ON24 (ONTF), Dine Brands (DIN), and Kirby (KEX)—that are trading near their 52-week highs but are considered overhyped and potentially due for a correction. The author advises caution due to issues like declining billings, poor sales performance, increasing expenses, and high leverage, suggesting readers consider alternative high-quality growth stocks instead.

title: 2 Cash-Producing Stocks for Long-Term Investors and 1 That Underwhelm
summary: This article identifies two cash-producing stocks, Monolithic Power Systems (MPWR) and Wingstop (WING), as strong buys for long-term investors due to their growth, profitability, and market performance. title: 607,823 Shares in Hartford Total Return Bond ETF $HTRB Bought by Great Point Wealth Advisors LLC

title: Canaan Receives Nasdaq Deficiency Notice Over Minimum Bid Price

The company has a 180-day grace period, until July 13, 2026, to regain compliance, with delisting as a potential consequence if remediation efforts, such as a reverse stock split, are unsuccessful. Despite ongoing financial challenges and a "Hold" rating from analysts with a $1.75 price target, Canaan's shares continue to trade on the Nasdaq Global Market while it addresses the issue.

While other companies like Nvidia are growing rapidly, Amazon's combination of existing scale and AI-driven potential positions it to reach this milestone first.

The expansion is supported by Micron's strong financial health and aims to produce 40% of its DRAM memory in the United States, with recent analyst upgrades reflecting a positive outlook on the company's future.

President Trump has tasked the US Secretary of Commerce and Trade Representative to pursue further negotiations on chip imports.

Broadcom is benefiting from strong demand for its networking products and custom AI accelerators, leveraging strategic acquisitions to diversify and strengthen its market presence, despite integration risks and intense competition. summary: NVIDIA's shares dropped 1.4% after reports indicated that Chinese authorities are blocking imports of its H200 AI chips, raising concerns about its access to the crucial Chinese market. While NVIDIA developed the H200 to comply with U.S. rules, local Chinese enforcement may still limit shipments, posing a potential long-term headwind for the company's growth despite its strong performance over the past year.

title: JPM: NVIDIA and Eli Lilly announce co-innovation AI lab

This collaboration, announced during the JPM Healthcare Conference, will integrate Lilly's expertise in drug discovery with NVIDIA's AI and computing infrastructure. The lab will initially focus on creating a continuous learning system that connects wet and dry labs for 24/7 AI-enabled experimentation and aims to expand AI application across clinical development, commercial operations, and manufacturing.

title: Is Pony.ai’s Expanded BAIC BJEV Partnership Reframing Its Robotaxi Economics And Scale Ambitions (PONY)?
summary: Pony.ai and BAIC BJEV have expanded their partnership to accelerate the mass production, commercialization, and global deployment of Robotaxi solutions, focusing on purpose-built vehicles and operational efficiency. This collaboration aims to address cost and operational hurdles that have previously limited large-scale autonomous mobility services. While the partnership could improve Pony.ai's unit economics and ease cap-ex concerns, the company is still reporting significant losses, with profitability not expected within the next three years.

title: 3 Unpopular Stocks We Think Twice About

Himax faces declining sales and rising costs, Oxford Industries struggles with lagging sales and poor free cash flow, and Brighthouse Financial shows annual declines in net premiums and high debt. Instead, the article recommends exploring a curated list of high-quality alternative stocks.

title: 3 Reasons to Sell AMN and 1 Stock to Buy Instead

The funding will support expanding its workforce and securing compute resources, as Harmonic aims to differentiate itself from traditional large language models by providing verifiable solutions.

title: Tackling the Global "Compute Shortage": 3 E Network Technology Unveils a Next-Gen AI Data Center Solution
