The company is developing an integrated AI data center solution featuring modular design for rapid deployment, high-density computing (20kW+ rack power density), low-latency networking, and a flexible "Air-Liquid Hybrid" cooling system. This initiative aims to redefine computing infrastructure standards for AI workloads, promising improved efficiency, reduced PUE, and intelligent operations through AI-powered systems.

title: Torm PLC stock hits 52-week high at 23.68 USD
summary: Torm PLC Class A shares reached a new 52-week high, closing at $23.68, marking a 5.37% increase in value. title: Cadence & Microsoft Redefine Data Center Memory With Advanced Solutions

This innovation integrates Cadence’s LPDDR5X IP with Microsoft’s RAIDDR error correction code technology, providing high performance, energy efficiency, and enhanced reliability suitable for AI and HPC workloads. The solution addresses the trade-off faced by hyperscalers between power and reliability, enabling the deployment of LPDDR5X at scale with enterprise-class RAS capabilities.

Despite this leadership, ARM's stock has underperformed the industry over the past year, trading at a high forward price-to-sales ratio, and currently holds a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold).

summary: The article evaluates John Hancock Multifactor Large Cap ETF (JHML) for retirees, concluding that its high technology allocation, modest dividend yield, and recent underperformance compared to the S&P 500 make it unsuitable for income-focused retirement strategies. The article suggests alternatives like the WisdomTree U.S. Quality Dividend Growth Fund (DGRW) for those seeking both factor exposure and meaningful, growing income.

title: SEALSQ reports 66% revenue growth, reaffirms 2026 outlook
summary: SEALSQ Corp (NASDAQ:LAES) reported preliminary unaudited revenue of $18 million for fiscal year 2025, a 66% increase from the previous year, and reaffirmed its 2026 revenue growth guidance of 50% to 100%. This growth was driven by demand for existing products and the acquisition of IC ALPS. The company also announced a strong cash position exceeding $425 million and a business pipeline of over $200 million for 2026-2028, despite not being profitable in the last twelve months.

title: Lattice Semiconductor stock hits 52-week high at 86.79 USD
summary: Lattice Semiconductor (LSCC) stock has reached a new 52-week high of $86.79, marking a 149% increase from its 52-week low and a 53.75% appreciation over the past year. This surge is attributed to positive investor sentiment, strong financial results, and strategic initiatives, including a new sensAI solution stack and a $250 million share repurchase program. Analysts have reiterated Buy ratings and raised price targets for LSCC, reflecting confidence in its growth trajectory, although InvestingPro suggests the stock might be overvalued relative to its Fair Value.

title: Flex Stock Surges 55% in the Past Year: Will the Uptrend Continue?
summary: Flex Ltd. (FLEX) has seen its stock surge 54.7% over the past year, driven by strong performance in its cloud and power portfolios, growing data center exposure, and robust cash flow. The company is actively expanding its data center business through partnerships with LG Electronics and NVIDIA, and has revised its fiscal 2026 revenue and EPS guidance upwards. Despite a highly leveraged balance sheet, macroeconomic uncertainty, and competitive pressures, Flex's strategic moves and strong cash flow generation position it for continued growth, though new investors might consider a more attractive entry point.

title: Your car's GPS, minus cloud: local AI navigation from Visteon, TomTom
summary: Visteon and TomTom have partnered to launch the world's first in-car local AI conversational navigation system. This system integrates Visteon’s cognitoAI™ multimodal Vision Language Model with TomTom’s Automotive Navigation Application, offering privacy-first, low-latency, and offline-capable navigation. Key features include natural language understanding, real-time traffic adjustments, and EV charging optimization, all processed on vehicle hardware without reliance on cloud connectivity.

title: Arrive AI Celebrates 2025 Milestones - Delmarva Now | The Daily Times
summary: Arrive AI (NASDAQ:ARAI) released its 2025 Year in Review, highlighting significant achievements in public markets, product development, partnerships, and intellectual property. Key milestones included its Nasdaq direct listing, joining the Russell 2000 and 3000 Indexes, and expanding autonomous medical deliveries. The company also announced strategic partnerships, team expansion, accelerated development through the NVIDIA Connect program, and an expanded patent portfolio, setting the stage for further growth in 2026.

title: Envirotech Vehicles (EVTV) Stock Soars 442% After Nvidia GPU Contract News
summary: Envirotech Vehicles (EVTV) stock surged by 442% following news of its proposed merger with Azio AI and a significant $107 million binding contract for Nvidia B300 GPUs from a Southeast Asian government. This deal would transform Envirotech from an electric vehicle manufacturer into an AI infrastructure provider, with potential for an additional $200 million in contracts. Shareholders are scheduled to vote on the non-binding merger agreement on January 20th.

title: Winthrop Advisory Group LLC Has $4.24 Million Stock Position in Tesla, Inc. $TSLA
summary: Winthrop Advisory Group LLC increased its stake in Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) by 14.2% in the third quarter, bringing its total holding to 9,534 shares valued at $4.24 million. The article notes recent insider selling by Kimbal Musk and CFO Vaibhav Taneja, totaling over $53 million, although insiders still own about 19.9% of the company. Despite the positive news of beating revenue estimates, Tesla faces high valuation metrics, a "Hold" consensus rating, and a target price below its current share price.

title: Super Micro Computer (NASDAQ: SMCI) Stock Price Prediction and Forecast (Jan 2026)
summary: This article provides a stock price prediction and forecast for Super Micro Computer (NASDAQ: SMCI) through January 2026 and beyond. It highlights the company's strong performance, driven by explosive demand in the IT services industry and its focus on AI server solutions. The report forecasts significant revenue and net income growth, projecting the stock price to reach $127.44 by the end of 2030.

title: Should iShares Russell Top 200 Growth ETF (IWY) Be on Your Investing Radar?
summary: The iShares Russell Top 200 Growth ETF (IWY) is a passively managed ETF focusing on large-cap growth companies in the US equity market, with over $16.29 billion in assets. It has an expense ratio of 0.2% and is heavily allocated to the Information Technology sector, with top holdings including Nvidia, Apple, and Microsoft. The ETF holds a Zacks ETF Rank of 1 (Strong Buy) and has shown a 20.06% return over the last year, making it a strong option for investors seeking exposure to large-cap growth.

title: ATON Stock More Than Doubles Pre-Market After Company Adds 576 Nvidia B300 Chips To Its Arsenal: Retail Sentiment Soars
summary: AlphaTON Capital Corp. (ATON) shares surged over 122% pre-market after announcing the acquisition of 576 Nvidia B300 chips for $46 million. This investment is projected to yield a 27% internal rate of return and will fund AlphaTON's first large-scale confidential compute deployment to address AI workloads with privacy constraints. Retail sentiment on Stocktwits around ATON has become "extremely bullish" following the news.

title: Nordea Investment Management AB Purchases 313,180 Shares of PayPal Holdings, Inc. $PYPL
summary: Nordea Investment Management AB increased its stake in PayPal Holdings, Inc. by 7.9% in Q3, purchasing 313,180 additional shares to hold over 4.29 million shares valued at approximately $291.34 million. The article details PayPal's Q3 earnings beat, modest Q4 guidance, and a mix of positive and negative analyst sentiments, including recent insider selling. It also covers other institutional investor activities and recent news impacting the company.

title: Sound Group announces launch of SoundSphereAI platform
summary: Sound Group Inc. (NASDAQ:SOGP) has launched its new SoundSphereAI platform, integrating speech recognition, synthesis, and AI voice-changing modules, alongside a redesigned website. The company reported a 47% year-over-year revenue increase in the first half of 2025 and returned to profitability, with analysts forecasting 46% revenue growth for fiscal 2025. CEO Marco Lai recently purchased company shares, indicating confidence in Sound Group's strategic focus on becoming a leading AI-powered audio company.

title: KLA Corp. price target raised to $1,650 from $1,450 at BofA
summary: BofA has increased its price target for KLA Corp. (KLAC) to $1,650 from $1,450, maintaining a Buy rating on the company's shares. This adjustment reflects a stronger multi-year demand outlook in the semicap sector, improved visibility, greater customer diversification, and the potential for higher free cash flow generation during an upturn. The report follows similar target adjustments from other firms like Susquehanna and Cantor Fitzgerald.

title: Global Semiconductor Revenue Grew 21% in 2025, reports Gartner
summary: Worldwide semiconductor revenue reached $793 billion in 2025, marking a 21% year-over-year increase, according to Gartner. Strong demand for AI semiconductors, including processors and high-bandwidth memory (HBM), fueled this growth, with AI components accounting for almost one-third of total sales. NVIDIA significantly expanded its lead, becoming the first vendor to surpass $100 billion in semiconductor sales, while Intel continued to lose market share.

title: China approves tech companies buying Nvidia H200 GPUs in some cases: report (NVDA:NASDAQ)
summary: China has reportedly approved some local tech companies to purchase Nvidia's H200 AI accelerators, causing Nvidia's shares to rise by nearly 2% in midday trading. This approval allows for the acquisition of these advanced GPUs, despite previous restrictions. The decision was communicated by the Chinese government to specific domestic firms.

title: Bull of the Day: Sandisk (SNDK)
summary: Sandisk (SNDK) has emerged as a pure-play leader in NAND flash memory and SSD markets after its spin-off from Western Digital. The company's stock has seen significant growth due to the "AI Data Cycle" and strong performance across its Datacenter, Edge, and Consumer segments, leading to raised earnings estimates and a "Strong Buy" recommendation. Analysts predict continued demand for memory, especially with NVIDIA's new Vera Rubin platform, which will require substantial additional SSD NAND.

title: AlphaTON Capital (ATON) Stock Rallies 186% After-Hours on $46M Nvidia Chip Deal
summary: AlphaTON Capital (ATON) stock surged 186.8% after-hours following the announcement of a $46 million deal to acquire 576 NVIDIA B300 chips for AI infrastructure. The transaction, financed through cash, non-recourse debt, and equity installments, is expected to result in chip delivery by February 2026 and revenue generation starting in March 2026. This significant investment, dwarfing the company's current market capitalization, aims to deploy a privacy-preserving AI network at an AtNorth data center in Sweden.

title: Tema Etfs LLC Takes Position in Texas Instruments Incorporated $TXN
summary: Tema Etfs LLC has initiated a new position in Texas Instruments (NASDAQ:TXN) during the third quarter, acquiring 15,260 shares valued at approximately $2.80 million. Other institutional investors like Norges Bank and Vanguard Group Inc. also hold significant stakes, with institutional ownership of TXN standing at 84.99%. Texas Instruments recently reported Q3 EPS of $1.48, meeting analyst expectations, and revenue of $4.74 billion, with a consensus "Hold" rating and an average price target of $191.49.

title: 2 Things to Expect From Your First Bitcoin ETF Purchase in 2026
summary: This article discusses two key differences between purchasing Bitcoin directly versus through an ETF. It highlights that Bitcoin ETFs trade only during normal market hours, unlike spot Bitcoin which trades 24/7, and that ETFs come with an expense ratio, such as the iShares Bitcoin Trust's 0.25%, which can reduce returns over time. The piece advises potential investors to consider these factors, noting the iShares Bitcoin Trust (IBIT) as the largest and most liquid Bitcoin ETF.

title: New York State Teachers Retirement System Buys 5,262 Shares of Comfort Systems USA, Inc. $FIX
summary: The New York State Teachers Retirement System increased its stake in Comfort Systems USA, Inc. by 19.4%, acquiring an additional 5,262 shares to hold a total of 32,341 shares valued at approximately $26.69 million. Despite insider sales totaling over $25 million in the last three months, analyst sentiment remains largely positive, with a consensus "Moderate Buy" rating and an average price target of $1,011.75. Comfort Systems USA recently reported Q3 earnings of $0.90 EPS and revenue of $713.90 million, and also increased its quarterly dividend.

title: MKS Inc. Unveils Photonics Solutions to Advance AI, Quantum, and Biotech at Photonics West 2026
summary: MKS Inc. (NASDAQ: MKSI) will showcase its latest photonics solutions at Photonics West 2026, aimed at advancing technologies in AI, quantum, biophotonics, and security. The company will highlight offerings from its Newport, Ophir, and Spectra-Physics brands, demonstrating how its "Surround the Workpiece" strategy provides end-to-end solutions for various industries. MKS aims to empower customers with precision technologies that solve complex challenges and drive future breakthroughs.

title: GPIX: A Strong Covered Call ETF Option For 2026 (NASDAQ:GPIX)
summary: The Goldman Sachs S&P 500 Premium Income ETF (GPIX) offers investors high income and potential upside through a covered call strategy heavily focused on Magnificent 7 tech stocks. GPIX has shown strong performance since its inception, outperforming SPYI and providing an attractive 8% yield. While its concentration in the tech sector introduces risk, the ETF aims to balance income generation with NAV appreciation, serving as a middle ground for covered call investors.

title: NVIDIA Corporation $NVDA Shares Bought by Ninety One UK Ltd
summary: Ninety One UK Ltd increased its stake in NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA) by 6.0% in Q3, now holding over 11.69 million shares valued at approximately $2.18 billion, making it their second-largest position. NVIDIA reported strong Q3 earnings, beating analyst estimates with $1.30 EPS and $57.01 billion in revenue, driven by high margins and strategic AI initiatives like a planned co-innovation lab with Eli Lilly. Analysts maintain a "Buy" rating with an average target price of $262.84, despite some negative sentiment regarding paused China chip orders and recent insider selling.

title: JPM26: Takeda’s R&D head talks slow Monday, the biggest threat to US innovation and a phoenix rebirth
summary: Takeda's R&D head, Andy Plump, discussed the company's strategic shift to focus on more mature assets and its exit from cell therapy work. He highlighted Takeda's increasing integration of AI into its discovery process, citing a successful collaboration with Nabla Bio that resurrected a preclinical antibody. Plump also expressed concern about the high turnover at the FDA and disruptions at NIH and academic centers, viewing these as long-term threats to U.S. innovation.

title: GRIMES & Co WEALTH MANAGEMENT LLC Sells 10,290 Shares of Kimberly-Clark Corporation $KMB
summary: GRIMES & Co WEALTH MANAGEMENT LLC has reduced its stake in Kimberly-Clark Corporation (KMB) by selling 10,290 shares, decreasing its holdings by 6.9%. The firm now owns 138,116 shares valued at $17.17 million. Kimberly-Clark recently surpassed quarterly earnings expectations and announced a quarterly dividend of $1.26 per share.

title: The AI Memory Supercycle: A Deep Dive into Micron Technology (MU) in 2026
summary: Micron Technology has transformed into a high-margin technology leader due to its pivotal role in the AI memory supercycle, driven by high-bandwidth memory (HBM) demand. The company's strategic shifts, including significant capital expenditures and new fab constructions, position it for continued growth, although risks related to cyclicality and execution remain. Micron is a key beneficiary of the U.S. CHIPS Act, securing its long-term future despite geopolitical tensions.

title: AlphaTON Capital (ATON) stock rips after-hours on $46 million Nvidia B300 AI deal — what to watch next
summary: AlphaTON Capital (ATON) shares surged by 186.8% in after-hours trading following the announcement of a $46 million deal to acquire 576 Nvidia B300 chips for AI compute infrastructure. The company plans to deploy these at atNorth’s data center in Sweden for Telegram’s Cocoon AI network, expecting revenue to start in March 2026. Investors are now focused on execution, delivery schedules, and the company's ability to cover outstanding equity payments.

title: What's Driving The Surge In Nebius Stock?
summary: Nebius Group N.V. (NASDAQ: NBIS) shares are surging, driven by a favorable environment for tech stocks and a significant partnership with Nvidia. Nebius will be among the first Nvidia Cloud Partners to offer Nvidia's next-generation Rubin accelerated computing platform and Vera Rubin NVL72 system, enhancing its AI cloud and token factory capabilities. The stock displays strong momentum, trading above key moving averages, though mixed RSI and MACD signals suggest potential volatility amidst the bullish trend.

title: Envirotech Vehicles stock jumps 442% on AZIO AI $107 million order as traders eye Jan. 20 vote
summary: Envirotech Vehicles (EVTV) stock surged 442% after AZIO AI announced a $107 million binding order for Nvidia GPUs and plans for a potential additional $200 million in regional programs. This comes as investors anticipate a January 20th shareholder meeting regarding EVTV's acquisition of AZIO AI through a stock merger, valued at $480 million for AZIO AI. The deal is non-binding and contingent on various factors, leading to ongoing market speculation.

title: Thermo Fisher partners with NVIDIA on AI-driven lab automation
summary: Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. has announced a strategic partnership with NVIDIA to integrate AI-based solutions and enhance laboratory automation. This collaboration aims to leverage NVIDIA's AI platform, including DGX Spark, NeMo, and BioNeMo models, to connect laboratory instruments, data, and workflows. The goal is to reduce manual tasks, accelerate scientific advancement, and democratize scientific discovery through intuitive AI-powered user experiences.

title: Boothe Investment Group Inc. Sells 30,341 Shares of Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. $AMD
summary: Boothe Investment Group Inc. significantly reduced its stake in Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) by selling 30,341 shares, lowering its holdings by 37.7%. This comes even as AMD reported strong quarterly earnings, exceeding revenue and EPS estimates, and is poised for AI-driven growth with new products and positive analyst outlooks. However, company insiders, including CEO Lisa T. Su, have also recently sold shares totaling over $39 million.

title: Array Technologies and TAT Technologies have been highlighted as Zacks Bull and Bear of the Day
summary: Zacks Equity Research highlights Array Technologies (ARRY) as the Bull of the Day due to its strong market position in solar trackers, favorable clean energy policies, and promising financial outlook. Conversely, TAT Technologies (TATT) is named the Bear of the Day, with concerns about its high valuation and limited leverage in the aerospace and defense sector despite recent positive sentiment. The article also provides a comparative analysis of Micron Technology (MU) and NVIDIA (NVDA), both Zacks Rank #1 stocks, in the AI chip market, suggesting NVIDIA may have more stable growth potential in 2026.

title: Bosman Wealth Management LLC Acquires New Position in Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. $AMD
summary: Bosman Wealth Management LLC has acquired a new position in Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ:AMD), purchasing 5,559 shares valued at approximately $899,000 during the third quarter. This move is part of broader institutional investor activity, with hedge funds and other institutional investors now owning 71.34% of AMD's stock. The article also highlights AMD's recent earnings beat, where the company reported $1.20 EPS and $9.25 billion in revenue, exceeding analyst expectations.

title: Jim Cramer Calls Alphabet's Gemini 3 a "Home Run"
summary: Jim Cramer praised Alphabet's Gemini 3 AI platform, calling it a "home run" and noting its potential to compete with ChatGPT for mindshare. He reiterated his positive outlook on Alphabet, particularly its AI capabilities through Gemini, despite having previously sold it from his Charitable Trust. Cramer believes that Alphabet, along with NVIDIA, will be a significant outperformer in 2026 due to its strong AI platform, YouTube, Waymo, Google Cloud, and reasonable valuation considering its growth rate.

title: VNET Group (VNET) Jumps 10.4% on China Market Optimism
summary: VNET Group (NYSE:VNET) saw its stock jump over 10% following optimistic market reports from Goldman Sachs regarding the growth of Chinese stocks, especially those in the AI sector. The company, a leading data center provider in China, plans significant expansion in green computing capacity and unveiled a Hyperscale 2.0 initiative focused on AI data center innovation. This surge reflects broader confidence in China's AI growth, supported by policy measures and forecast gains in major Chinese stock indices.

title: Semiconductor sales jump 21% Y/Y backed by AI surge, Gartner says (SMH:NASDAQ)
summary: Worldwide semiconductor revenue increased by 21% year-over-year to $793 billion in 2025, according to preliminary results from Gartner. This significant growth was primarily propelled by the robust demand for artificial intelligence, with AI semiconductors contributing nearly one-third of total sales. The surge in AI-related components, including processors, high-bandwidth memory, and networking components, continues to fuel the market.

title: Should You Bet $1,000 on Nokia Before It's Too Late?
summary: Nokia's stock surged after announcing a partnership with Nvidia to develop AI mobile networks; Nvidia will also invest $1 billion in Nokia. This collaboration focuses on AI-RAN technology to improve wireless network performance, with commercial availability expected in late 2027. The article advises that investors bullish on this AI integration might consider investing now, while others might wait for more progress.

title: Energy Transfer LP price target lowered to $22 from $25 at Barclays
summary: Barclays analyst Theresa Chen has lowered the price target for Energy Transfer LP (ET) to $22 from $25, while maintaining an Overweight rating. This decision comes despite concerns about re-contracting events, as the firm notes Energy Transfer's continued commercial discipline and ingenuity, which support a positive future outlook. The news was first published on TheFly.

title: A Deep Dive into the iShares MSCI World ETF: Concentration and Performance
summary: This article provides a deep dive into the iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH), an ETF that has significantly benefited from the global equity rally since late 2025. It highlights the fund's heavy concentration in major U.S. technology stocks, outlining performance data, fund structure, portfolio composition, and market context. The analysis also compares URTH with competitors and discusses critical drivers for its performance in 2026, emphasizing the dual nature of its U.S. mega-cap concentration.

title: Cohu stock hits 52-week high at 27.17 USD
summary: Cohu Inc.'s stock reached a 52-week high of $27.17, reflecting a 14.43% increase over the past year and investor confidence. The company's recent Q3 2025 earnings exceeded expectations, and Needham upgraded its stock rating to Buy with a $30.00 price target due to growth potential in high-bandwidth memory (HBM) technology.

title: Assessing Arm Holdings (ARM) Valuation After Physical AI Reorganization Into Robotics And Automotive
summary: Arm Holdings (ARM) has reorganized its business, creating a new Physical AI unit that groups automotive and robotics, while separating cloud/AI and edge products. This comes as Arm's share price has seen a significant decline over the past one and three months. Despite most analysts seeing the stock as overvalued with a fair value around $70, the reorganization aims to re-focus growth in emerging high-demand sectors.

title: Evaluating Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (NYSE:TSM) After Strong Recent Momentum And Mixed Valuation Signals
summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (TSM) has shown strong recent momentum with significant share price returns over one, three, and twelve months. While current valuations present a mixed picture, with one narrative suggesting the stock is 7% overvalued based on a fair value of US$310, the market's P/E ratio for TSM is still below the industry average, implying a potential discount. The company is highlighted as a central pillar of the AI revolution, but risks like geopolitical tensions and cost pressures are noted.

title: Envirotech Vehicles stock surges 442% after partner flags $107 million Nvidia GPU order
summary: Envirotech Vehicles (EVTV) stock surged 442% after its merger partner, AZIO AI, announced a binding order for 256 Nvidia B300 GPUs, valued at approximately $107 million, linked to a Southeast Asian government initiative. This rally occurred despite the merger still being in the letter-of-intent phase, with investors reacting to the potential for AI infrastructure business. The company has rescheduled its shareholder meeting for January 20th to address the proposed acquisition and repositioning towards AI.

title: PepsiCo stock rises as AI “digital twin” warehouse push meets snack-volume questions ahead of earnings
summary: PepsiCo's stock rose 1% after hours, driven by investor interest in its AI-driven supply chain efforts, including "digital twin" technology. This comes ahead of its Q4 2025 earnings report on February 3rd, where attention will be on North American snack volumes and the effectiveness of cost-cutting measures. The company is also focusing on "permissible" snacks and its price-pack strategy to address fluctuating demand from price-conscious consumers.

title: Best Stock to Buy Right Now: Costco vs. Home Depot
summary: This article compares Costco and Home Depot as investment opportunities, highlighting Costco's consistent growth despite economic challenges due to its membership model and planned expansion, especially internationally. Home Depot, while dominating its industry, is more sensitive to macroeconomic factors but offers a lower valuation. The best choice depends on whether an investor prioritizes a lower starting valuation (Home Depot) or a consistently high-quality business (Costco).

title: Thermo Fisher Scientific Announces Strategic Collaboration With NVIDIA Leveraging AI to Advance Scientific Instrumentation and Accelerate Laboratory Performance
summary: Thermo Fisher Scientific is collaborating with NVIDIA to integrate AI into scientific instrumentation and laboratory automation. This partnership aims to enhance the speed, accuracy, and efficiency of laboratory processes by leveraging NVIDIA's AI platform and models like NeMo and BioNeMo, alongside Thermo Fisher's lab expertise. The goal is to reduce manual tasks, democratize scientific discovery, and accelerate breakthroughs in life sciences.

title: Digi Power X Secures $20 Million NVIDIA B300 GPU Purchase from Supermicro to Power NeoCloudz(TM) GPU-as-a-Service Platform
summary: Digi Power X Inc. has announced a definitive agreement to acquire approximately $20 million of next-generation NVIDIA B300 GPUs from Supermicro. These GPUs will power the company's NeoCloudz(TM) GPU-as-a-Service platform, targeting initial customer availability in March 2026. This move marks a strategic expansion for Digi Power X into recurring, high-margin AI infrastructure revenues, with an expected positive return on invested capital within 30 months.

title: 3 Value Stocks That Fall Short
summary: This article identifies three value stocks—Central Garden & Pet (CENT), Spectrum Brands (SPB), and Pfizer (PFE)—that it argues fall short as good investments despite appearing cheap. The author details specific reasons for avoiding each, such as flat sales estimates, underwhelming returns on capital, and organic revenue underperformance, suggesting they may be value traps rather than hidden gems. The article also recommends considering a curated list of "High-Quality stocks" from StockStory as alternatives.

title: Blink Charging (BLNK) Shares Skyrocket, What You Need To Know
summary: Shares of Blink Charging (BLNK) surged 22.2% following increased investor optimism about the EV charging infrastructure provider's expansion plans and favorable industry news. The company recently raised $20 million through a public offering to fund its fast-charging network expansion, coinciding with positive developments in the EV charging sector, including government efforts to reduce charging costs. Despite the significant jump, BLNK shares are still trading well below their 52-week high.

title: Behind the Scenes at CES 2026: Intelligent Product Lifecycle with PTC
summary: This article discusses how PTC, a software company specializing in product lifecycle management, is leveraging AI to transform product development and manufacturing. Steve Dertien of PTC highlights how AI can free engineers from time-consuming change management tasks to focus on innovation, optimize supply chains, and accelerate time to market. The piece emphasizes the importance of data quality, process reevaluation, and organizational change for companies adopting AI in their product development strategies.

title: Assessing Astera Labs (ALAB) Valuation After Analyst Optimism On Scorpio X And NVLink Fusion
summary: Astera Labs (ALAB) has seen a 7.9% share price gain since New Year's Eve, driven by analyst optimism regarding its Scorpio X revenue and upcoming products like larger switches and NVLink Fusion. While the company is considered undervalued at $162.61 against an analyst target of $197.26, its P/E ratio of 138.1x is significantly higher than peers, suggesting potential valuation risk if growth expectations aren't met. The article highlights the importance of UALink adoption for long-term growth but also cautions about risks from cooling hyperscaler AI capital expenditure or rival solutions.

title: Apple will use Google’s Gemini models to power new Siri release
summary: Apple Inc. has announced a multi-year partnership with Google LLC to integrate Google's Gemini series of large language models into its Siri voice assistant. The upgraded Siri, part of Apple's new AI suite called Apple Intelligence, is expected to provide more personalized responses and handle multi-step tasks across various apps, rolling out later this year. This collaboration has also reportedly pushed Alphabet Inc.'s market capitalization above $4 trillion, making it the fourth company to reach this milestone.

title: BlackBerry: Strong QNX Strategy Bolstered by Alloy Kore Announcement at CES
summary: BlackBerry's recent announcements at CES, including the launch of Alloy Kore in partnership with Vector, reinforce its strong QNX strategy for automotive software. Morningstar maintains its fair value estimate for BlackBerry, noting that the company's focus on expanding QNX into new use cases and increasing dollar content per vehicle aligns with their long-term growth outlook. The firm believes that QNX and Alloy Kore will help carmakers shorten time-to-market and achieve greater penetration in the evolving software-defined vehicle market.

title: Credo Technology (CRDO) stock climbs as AI-chip trade stays hot; Needham conference next
summary: Credo Technology Group Holding Ltd (CRDO) stock rose 3.1% to $155.10, fueled by enthusiasm for AI-driven semiconductors and its role in data center infrastructure. The company is set to present at Needham & Company’s Growth Conference, and investors are also looking ahead to Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co's (TSMC) earnings report for further insights into AI chip demand. While the stock's valuation reflects fast growth, risks such as a slowdown in AI spending or increased competition could impact its performance.

title: Caterpillar Launches AI Assistant for Equipment Management
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has introduced Cat AI Assistant at CES 2026, marking its entry into AI-powered fleet management for heavy equipment. This new conversational AI tool aims to streamline equipment operations by linking Caterpillar's digital applications into a single interface. The system will provide predictive maintenance, step-by-step repair guidance for technicians, and real-time in-cab coaching for operators, addressing skilled labor shortages in construction.

title: The Autonomous Trucking Stock Investors Overlook
summary: The article discusses Aurora Innovation (NASDAQ: AUR), an autonomous trucking company held in Cathie Wood's Ark Autonomous Technology & Robotics ETF. Aurora aims to address challenges in the freight industry like driver shortages and high costs by developing self-driving trucks, with operations already approved between Dallas and Houston. While the company is in an early stage with significant losses, it has $1.6 billion in cash to fund operations until mid-2027, making it a speculative but potentially high-growth investment in a rapidly expanding industry.

title: Nvidia partners with Lilly to launch $1B AI drug discovery lab
summary: Nvidia and Eli Lilly have partnered to invest $1 billion over five years to establish an AI co-innovation lab in the San Francisco Bay Area. This lab will integrate Lilly's scientific expertise with Nvidia's AI engineering to develop large datasets and powerful AI models, utilizing Nvidia's BioNeMo platform and their next-gen Vera Rubin AI chips. The initiative aims to significantly accelerate the drug research and development process, building on Lilly's previous plans to use Nvidia's Blackwell Ultra GPUs for a supercomputer dedicated to drug discovery.

title: NVIDIA Huge Head & Shoulders forming. $127 technical Target. for NASDAQ:NVDA by TradingShot
summary: NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA) appears to be forming a Head and Shoulders pattern, with the Right Shoulder currently developing since its October 29, 2025 high. A bearish divergence is indicated by the 1D RSI showing Lower Highs since July 17, 2025. This pattern suggests a potential break of support within a month, targeting $127.00 based on its technical extension to the 2.0 Fibonacci level.

title: Hesai Group (HSAI) Scales Up Lidar for NVIDIA DRIVE Hyperion 10 and Physical AI Ambitions
summary: Hesai Group has been selected as a lidar partner for NVIDIA’s DRIVE AGX Hyperion 10 and plans to more than double its annual lidar production capacity to over 4 million units by 2026. These developments underscore Hesai's strategy to expand manufacturing, strengthen ties in automotive and robotics, and integrate its lidar technology into autonomous driving platforms and emerging "physical AI" applications. The increased production capacity, while supporting existing and future NVIDIA demand, also carries the risk that capacity growth could outpace confirmed orders, especially given the company's high valuation multiples.

title: Apple calls on Google to help smarten up Siri and bring other AI features to the iPhone
summary: Apple is partnering with Google to integrate Google's Gemini AI technology into its "Apple Intelligence" suite for the iPhone and other products. This collaboration aims to enhance Siri and other AI features, addressing Apple's previous delays in the AI race. The deal is seen as a significant validation for Google, whose parent company, Alphabet, recently surpassed Apple in market value, driven by its AI advancements.

title: Sizing Up Whether The Global Select Equity ETF Is A Buy Right Now
summary: The JPMorgan Global Select Equity ETF (JGLO) launched in September 2023 with $7.1 billion in assets and a 0.47% expense ratio. The ETF, which has gained 15% over the past year, is heavily concentrated in six mega-cap tech stocks, holding over a quarter of its assets in NVIDIA, Microsoft, Apple, Amazon, Alphabet, and Meta. This concentration creates vulnerability if global equity returns broaden beyond U.S. mega-caps, exemplified by its underperformance against the iShares MSCI ACWI ETF in early 2026.

title: 3 Breakout Growth Stocks You Can Buy and Hold for the Next Decade
summary: This article highlights three growth stocks—Rubrik (cybersecurity), Comfort Systems USA (data centers), and Xometry (manufacturing)—that are recommended for long-term investment over the next decade. Each company is positioned to benefit from durable industry trends, exhibiting strong growth, solid financials, or innovative approaches within their respective sectors.

title: Nvidia and Eli Lilly launch Co-Innovation AI Lab to advance drug discovery
summary: Nvidia and Eli Lilly have partnered to create a new AI-focused co-innovation lab in the San Francisco Bay Area, aiming to accelerate drug discovery and development. The lab will combine Lilly's medical expertise with Nvidia's AI and computing capabilities, leveraging Nvidia's BioNeMo platform for developing AI models and pioneering robotics in pharmaceutical research. Both companies plan to invest up to $1 billion over five years to support this initiative, which is expected to transform drug discovery, enabling faster and more efficient medicine development.

title: Alphabet hits $4-trillion valuation as AI refocus lifts sentiment
summary: Alphabet briefly reached a $4 trillion market valuation, driven by its intensified focus on artificial intelligence. This surge, which saw its class-A shares hit a record high, reflects growing investor confidence and follows the company surpassing Apple in market capitalization for the first time since 2019. The company's AI efforts, including its Google Cloud unit and the Gemini models, have contributed significantly to its strong performance and market leadership.

title: Applied Materials stock rises on Susquehanna upgrade as chip gear spending call widens

The upgrade is based on anticipated increased spending in wafer fab equipment (WFE), with projections of $120 billion in current spending and potential for over $150 billion. Investors are now looking forward to upcoming CPI data and TSMC's earnings call for further market signals.

title: Accelsius Closes $65 Million Series B Funding Led by Johnson Controls; Legrand Joining Round to Scale Liquid Cooling for Gigawatt-Class AI Factories – Company Announcement - FT.com
summary: Accelsius, a leader in two-phase, direct-to-chip liquid cooling for AI and high-performance computing, has closed a $65 million Series B funding round. The round was led by Johnson Controls, with strategic investment from Legrand, to scale liquid cooling solutions for AI factories. This investment will accelerate Accelsius' expansion, global reach, and the deployment of its proprietary NeuCool® technology, crucial for managing the extreme thermal demands of next-generation AI and HPC chips.

This expansion aims to create a continuous learning cycle, turning experimental data into actionable AI intelligence and scaling scientific discovery.

title: AlphaTON Capital Closes $46M AI Infrastructure Expansion to
summary: AlphaTON Capital has announced a $46 million AI infrastructure expansion to address the demand for confidential compute, involving the deployment of 576 NVIDIA B300 chips. title: Micron Exclusive: Why Consumers Have Gotten the Memory Shortage Narrative All Wrong

Moore also welcomes competition from Chinese memory suppliers, viewing it as a driver for Micron's improvement.

title: ETFs That Can Beat the S&P 500 in 2026
summary: This article identifies three ETFs poised to outperform the S&P 500 in 2026, driven largely by their heavy exposure to the booming AI and technology sectors. The ETFs highlighted are the VanEck Semiconductor ETF (SMH), Vanguard Growth Index Fund ETF (VUG), and Invesco QQQ Trust (QQQ), each with a strong track record of outperformance. The article details their holdings, performance data, and reasons for continued growth potential.

title: A Look At Enova International (ENVA) Valuation As Lower Rates And Easier Lending Support Growth Prospects
summary: Lower interest rates and easier lending standards are bringing renewed investor focus to Enova International (ENVA), a fintech company with a data-driven lending model. Despite its stock already seeing significant returns, the article explores whether Enova is still undervalued, noting a popular narrative that suggests it is about 10% undervalued at $179.5 per share compared to its current price of $161.6. However, it also highlights that valuations depend on proper credit risk management and regulatory stability.

title: Genprex Regains Nasdaq Compliance but Faces Ongoing Monitoring
summary: Genprex announced on January 7, 2026, that it has regained compliance with Nasdaq's minimum stockholders' equity requirement of $2.5 million. The company will remain under mandatory panel monitoring through January 7, 2027, and any failure to meet the equity threshold during this period would lead to automatic delisting without a further cure period. This situation exposes shareholders to increased risk of the company's securities being removed from the Nasdaq exchange.

title: Riding the AI Wave: The iShares MSCI World ETF’s Strong Start to 2026
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH) is having a strong start to 2026, driven by a rebound in U.S. tech stocks and the ongoing artificial intelligence trend, with its benchmark MSCI World Index reaching 4,511 points. Despite its impressive performance and liquidity, the ETF carries elevated valuations for many of its top holdings, notably NVIDIA, Apple, and Microsoft, and is strongly influenced by U.S.-led AI dynamism and the U.S. dollar's strength. Investors should monitor valuation risks, the potential for a "Physical AI" rotation, and key technical levels and currency exposure in Q1 2026.

title: Nvidia resets the economics of AI factories, again
summary: Nvidia's recent announcements at CES 2026, particularly the new Vera Rubin platform, have significantly reset the economics of AI factories by introducing extreme co-design across its entire system architecture. The company is driving annual performance improvements of five times and throughput of ten times, shifting the focus from individual chip performance to system-level efficiency, specifically tokens per rack. This comprehensive redesign solidifies Nvidia's dominant position, widening the gap with competitors and forcing ecosystem players to align with this new paradigm where historical benchmarks like Moore's Law are accelerated tenfold.

title: Citizens Downgrades Life360 (LIF) to Market Perform Citing Skepticism Over 2026 Growth Catalysts
summary: Citizens downgraded Life360 (LIF) to Market Perform from Outperform due to skepticism over its 2026 growth catalysts, following a deceleration in its core expansion and difficult year-over-year comparisons. Despite the downgrade, Life360 recently completed its $120 million acquisition of Nativo and surpassed 50 million Monthly Active Users in the US. Earlier, DA Davidson initiated coverage with a Buy rating, anticipating international growth and higher-margin revenue streams from new features like pet GPS subscriptions.

title: Lam Research Stock Jumps Amid Analysts’ Enhancing Price Targets
summary: Lam Research Corporation's stock (LRCX) has surged by 8.88% due to optimistic market sentiment and technological advancements. Several analysts, including Cantor Fitzgerald, Mizuho, Goldman Sachs, and Aletheia, have raised their price targets for LRCX, citing robust growth in the wafer fabrication equipment demand and increased memory spending. The company demonstrates strong financial fundamentals, including high profitability margins and efficient capital management, despite a high PE ratio, indicating investor confidence in its future growth trajectory.

title: 2026’s Top Tech ETF Is Little Known, Cheap, Perfectly Positioned, and Ready To Rally
summary: The iShares Self-Driving EV and Tech ETF (IDRV) is highlighted as a top contender for 2026, offering diversified exposure to the autonomous vehicle ecosystem at a modest valuation. Despite its small asset base and exposure to China, IDRV has demonstrated strong performance, outpacing the S&P 500 and Nasdaq-100 over the past year. The article also compares IDRV to the Global X Autonomous & Electric Vehicles ETF (DRIV), noting IDRV's lower expense ratio but DRIV's larger assets and historical outperformance.

title: Aeva Technologies Stock Surges Amid Nvidia Partnership Announcement
summary: Aeva Technologies Inc. (AEVA) stock surged significantly by 17.94%, driven by its collaboration with NVIDIA to integrate its 4D LiDAR technology into the NVIDIA DRIVE Hyperion platform, expected to be in production vehicles by 2028. This partnership has solidified Aeva's role as a vital LiDAR provider, leading to substantial investor optimism and a 24% premarket increase. Despite some negative profit margins, the company demonstrates strong short-term solvency and is strategically positioned for future growth in the autonomous vehicle sector.
authors: Tim Bohen, Ben Sturgill, Ellis Hobbs

title: Jim Cramer on Microsoft: "Stock's Been Punished By the Fact That Management Wants to Spend a Fortune on AI"
summary: Jim Cramer discussed Microsoft's stock performance, noting its downward trend despite strong company performance. He attributed this to management's significant AI spending and concerns surrounding OpenAI's financial stability, in which Microsoft holds a substantial stake. Cramer remains optimistic about Microsoft, especially if OpenAI can secure funding at a high valuation and if Azure's growth exceeds recently lowered guidance.

title: Freedom Capital Downgrades Alibaba (BABA) Despite Raising Price Target to $180

Analysts suggest that Alibaba's future performance hinges on its ability to expand both retail and cloud operations without a significant increase in related costs.

summary: VCI Global Limited has announced the operational launch of its first Enterprise AI GPU Lounge in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, powered by NVIDIA Blackwell GPUs. This marks a new asset-light model for enterprise AI infrastructure, offering a subscription-based, usage-driven access model to high-performance computing without significant upfront capital investment. The facility also functions as an IDEX Hub and will support VCI Global's broader Physical AI strategy, including robotics and autonomous systems.

title: Freedom Capital Markets Lifts Baidu (BIDU) Price Target, Maintains Buy Rating
summary: Freedom Capital Markets analyst Roman Lukianchikov raised Baidu's price target to $160 from $120, while maintaining a "Buy" rating, citing positive signs from its transformation efforts. Despite near-term margin pressure due to increased capital expenditures and intensifying competition, analysts anticipate a recovery in profitability in the medium term as less profitable ventures scale. Baidu, a Chinese internet and AI pioneer, is noted for its AI investments, though the article suggests other AI stocks might offer greater return potential.

Analysts are debating whether current valuations accurately reflect future AI infrastructure demand, while the stock faces risks from potential order delays by hyperscalers or increased competition.

title: Red Hat pledges day-zero support for Nvidia’s newest GPUs
summary: Red Hat announced day-zero support for Nvidia's new Vera Rubin platform, signaling a tighter collaboration to keep pace with rapid hardware development in the AI sector. This initiative is driven by the surging demand for larger and more capable AI models, with Nvidia accelerating its hardware refresh cycles. The partnership ensures Red Hat's software stack, including RHEL and OpenShift, is ready for the Vera Rubin GPU to support advanced AI workloads and confidential computing.

title: 2026 US Stock Market Outlook: Where to Find Investing Opportunities
summary: The US equity market was trading at a 4% discount to fair value estimates as of December 31, 2025, driven by significant fair value increases in mega-cap stocks and despite an overall market rise. Investors can find attractive opportunities in small-cap, mid-cap, and certain large-cap growth and value stocks, with Real Estate, Technology, Energy, and Communications sectors showing significant undervaluation. The outlook for 2026 predicts continued volatility due to high AI valuations, a change in Fed leadership, trade negotiations, slowing economic growth, and midterm elections, suggesting a barbell-shaped portfolio strategy to balance upside potential with risk management.

title: Mizuho Picks Nvidia, Broadcom, Lumentum as Top AI Chip Stocks for 2026
summary: Mizuho Securities has identified Nvidia, Lumentum, and Broadcom as its top AI chip stock picks for 2026, driven by strong AI-related demand in accelerators, optical networking, and advanced chips. The firm also recommends watching Microchip Technology and Lam Research, and expects continued strength in wafer fab equipment and memory from companies like Micron and SanDisk due to growing AI data center needs. While cautious on autos, analog chips, PCs, and smartphones, Mizuho views semiconductor valuations as attractive, with AI-focused segments leading the market.

title: Intel stock jumps 10% after CEO meets with Trump
summary: Intel's stock jumped 10% after CEO Lip-Bu Tan met with President Donald Trump, who touted U.S. investment in the chipmaker and new microprocessors introduced by the company. Trump celebrated the federal government's nearly $9 billion investment and Intel's progress in bringing chip manufacturing back to America. Despite financial headwinds and job cuts, Intel's new 18A technology and potential deals with companies like Apple signal a significant effort in its comeback.

title: Caterpillar & NVIDIA: Expand Physical AI for Manufacturing
summary: Caterpillar and NVIDIA have expanded their collaboration, announced at CES 2026, to integrate physical AI into manufacturing processes. The partnership focuses on deploying edge AI, autonomy, and digital twins across construction, mining, and power equipment to enhance safety and productivity. Key initiatives include using NVIDIA Jetson Thor for real-time processing and autonomous operations, implementing generative AI with Cat AI Assistant for operator support, and leveraging NVIDIA AI Factory to create digital twins for optimizing factory and supply chain operations.

title: Can an Expanding Portfolio Help Skyworks' Shares Recover in 2026?
summary: Skyworks Solutions (SWKS) shares have underperformed due to macroeconomic challenges and inventory digestion, despite the company's expanding portfolio. New product introductions, such as highly integrated Wi-SUN/LoRaWAN RF front-end modules and automotive-grade solutions, aim to capitalize on robust demand in Mobile and Broad Markets, including AI-driven Android products, edge IoT, automotive, and infrastructure. While analysts project a decrease in net sales and earnings for fiscal 2026, Skyworks remains a crucial player in radio and analog solutions with a strong patent portfolio.

title: Why Is Lam Research (LRCX) Stock Soaring Today

While the NVIDIA collaboration and recent design wins strengthen Arbe's investment case, the company still faces challenges related to funding needs, execution risk, and achieving material revenue amidst ongoing losses and stock volatility.

Caterpillar also plans to invest $100 million over five years for workforce training in AI-enabled industrial systems.

title: NVIDIA Unveils Multi-Agent Intelligent Warehouse and Catalog Enrichment AI Blueprints to Power the Retail Pipeline
summary: NVIDIA has introduced new Multi-Agent Intelligent Warehouse (MAIW) and Retail Catalog Enrichment AI Blueprints, open-source developer references designed to optimize the retail value chain. These blueprints aim to solve issues like warehouse workflow inefficiencies, sparse product data, and inconsistent catalog information by leveraging generative AI and agentic systems. This initiative is part of NVIDIA's broader strategy to integrate AI infrastructure throughout the warehouse-to-consumer workflow, from supply chain management to customer shopping experiences.

(NASDAQ:AVGO), citing strong conviction in the company's continued dominance in the AI ASIC sector despite investor concerns about competition. Kohl's, on the other hand, is seen as a value trap with ongoing sales declines and frequent leadership changes that make a turnaround difficult.

title: Arm Pushes Beyond Smartphones With New 'Physical AI' Unit, Tying Robotics To The Next Wave Of AI Growth
summary: Arm Holdings is creating a new "Physical AI" division to expand its presence in the robotics and automotive sectors, reflecting a growing industry focus on AI that interacts with the physical world. This reorganization introduces a third core division alongside Cloud and AI, and Edge (mobile/PCs). The move capitalizes on the shared technical requirements between automotive and robotics, especially as humanoid robots gain prominence at events like CES 2026.

title: Can Retirees Count on QYLD’s Amazing 11% Dividend Any More?
summary: The Global X NASDAQ 100 Covered Call ETF (QYLD), known for its high yield, faces challenges in sustaining its dividend, with payouts declining 24% since 2021. QYLD has significantly underperformed the NASDAQ 100, returning 44% over five years compared to QQQ's 100%. For income investors, the JPMorgan Nasdaq Equity Premium Income ETF (JEPQ) offers a more flexible alternative with similar income and better total returns due to its active management strategy.

title: ALT5 Sigma Corp. Reports Company Record Annual Transaction Volume of $3.4 Billion in 2025
summary: ALT5 Sigma Corporation announced a record transaction volume of $3.4 billion in 2025, marking a 55% increase over the previous year and nearly $8 billion in cumulative volume since 2021. This growth highlights the company's strong position in digital payments and its scalable blockchain-powered infrastructure. ALT5 also emphasized its strategic $WLFI digital asset treasury, which currently holds 7.3 billion $WLFI tokens, further strengthening its financial position and future growth potential in the expanding USD1 ecosystem.
authors: ALT5 Sigma Corporation via Business Wire

title: Jim Cramer Says "Nokia Is Tough Because It's Up Against Apple"
summary: Jim Cramer commented on Nokia (NYSE: NOK), stating it faces tough competition, particularly from Apple. He also highlighted NVIDIA's significant stake in Nokia, leading to a substantial one-day gain for Nokia's stock, driven by their collaboration on AI native mobile networks. Despite this, Cramer's original advice suggests he believes other AI stocks might offer greater upside with less risk.

title: Where Is ServiceNow (NOW) Headed According to the Street?
summary: ServiceNow (NYSE: NOW) is considered a strong buy, with Canaccord Genuity reaffirming a Buy rating and a $224 price target. Recent acquisitions of Armis for cyber exposure management and Moveworks for AI-powered intuitiveness and workflow automation are expected to strengthen ServiceNow's security and AI offerings. While NOW shows growth potential, the article suggests other AI stocks might offer greater returns with limited downside risk.

title: RedCloud Delivers Record 2025, Executes $50m Turkiye License and Accelerates Toward $100m Revenue in 2026
summary: RedCloud Holdings plc announced exceeding management expectations in 2025, reaffirming revenue guidance of $51-53 million and signing a $50 million licensing agreement for the Turkish market. The company is targeting $100 million in revenue for 2026, supported by growth in existing markets and new joint venture agreements. RedCloud also joined NVIDIA Connect to accelerate the development of AI-native trading algorithms for the FMCG industry.

title: This Financial ETF Trounced the S&P 500 Last Year, and Arlington Capital Management Just Opened a 126,000-Share Position
summary: Arlington Capital Management, Inc. has acquired 125,717 shares of the iShares MSCI Europe Financials ETF (EUFN), valued at an estimated $4.66 million, making it a significant new position in their portfolio. The EUFN ETF offers exposure to developed European financial sector equities, outperforming the S&P 500 by a substantial margin last year with a 69% return and boasting a 3.5% dividend yield. This investment by Arlington Capital Management highlights a potential strategy for diversification away from the U.S. financial sector, given the ETF's strong performance and focus on established European financial institutions.

title: Jiayin Group Inc (JFIN): The Dirt-Cheap Fintech Stock Everyone’s Sleeping On
summary: Jiayin Group Inc (JFIN) is highlighted as a "dirt-cheap" Chinese fintech stock that is currently under the radar but could offer significant upside for risk-tolerant investors. The article details its business model of connecting borrowers with financial institutions, its low valuation based on traditional metrics like P/E, and the inherent risks associated with investing in a Chinese small-cap stock, including regulatory, country-specific, and market sentiment risks. It emphasizes that JFIN is suitable for experienced traders who can handle high volatility and are comfortable with speculative plays.

title: 3 Profitable Stocks with Questionable Fundamentals
summary: This article identifies three profitable companies—Novanta (NOVT), Belden (BDC), and Integra LifeSciences (IART)—that, despite their profitability, have questionable fundamental issues making them potentially poor investments. It highlights concerns such as slow revenue growth, stagnating earnings, increasing capital intensity, and high debt, suggesting that investors should look for better opportunities. The piece concludes by recommending StockStory's "Top 5 Strong Momentum Stocks" as an alternative for investors seeking companies with strong growth potential.

title: 2 Cash-Heavy Stocks Worth Investigating and 1 Facing Challenges
summary: This article analyzes three companies with significant cash positions, identifying one to sell and two to watch. Paylocity (PCTY) is flagged due to disappointing growth, slowing demand, and unchanged operating margins. Incyte (INCY) and Clover Health (CLOV) are highlighted as promising due to strong revenue growth, improved free cash flow margins, and customer acquisition success, respectively.

title: Who Are the Long-Term Winners of AI?
summary: This article discusses that the long-term winners of AI will not simply be the fastest adopters, but rather firms that can leverage strong productivity gains and capture unmet demand where lower prices lead to higher volumes. It highlights that while AI drives productivity, sustained profitability depends on market power and the ability to turn technological advantage into lasting market power. The authors suggest healthcare as a sector with significant unmet demand that could benefit from AI-driven cost reductions.

title: China’s Hesai Group partners with Nvidia in self-driving vehicle platform
summary: China's Hesai Group, a leading manufacturer of lidar sensors for vehicles, has announced a partnership with Nvidia to develop an autonomous driving platform. Hesai will supply its lidar sensors for Nvidia's Drive Hyperion platform, aiming for Level 4 self-driving standards. This collaboration supports Hesai's global expansion, including the opening of its first overseas factory in Bangkok by early 2027.

title: Micron Appears Unbeatable in Pricing as AI Demand Surpasses Available Supply
summary: Micron Technology (NASDAQ: MU) is experiencing a surge in memory demand driven by AI, with JP Morgan maintaining an "Overweight" rating and a $350 price target. The demand for DRAM and HBM is expected to outpace supply well beyond 2026, leading to elevated prices and strong revenue growth. Micron also anticipates significant opportunities for NAND in AI workloads, particularly in robotics, further boosting memory demand.

title: Ambarella stock dives as AMBA reverses after CES CV7 chip and DevZone launch
summary: Ambarella (AMBA) shares dropped sharply despite launching new products at CES, including a CV7 vision SoC and a new "DevZone." Investors are assessing near-term demand signals against upcoming earnings, as the stock saw a significant intraday reversal. The company aims to convert its edge AI vision technology into design wins and volume shipments, amidst a mixed performance in the broader semiconductor sector.

title: Aehr Announces Over $5.5 Million in Sonoma Ultra-High-Power System Orders to Test and Burn-in AI Processors; Introduces New Fully-Automated Sonoma for Next-Generation AI Applications
summary: Aehr Test Systems announced over $5.5 million in orders for its Sonoma ultra-high-power packaged-part burn-in systems from leading AI companies and a Bay Area lab. These systems are designed to test and burn-in next-generation CPUs, GPUs, and high-performance networking processors for AI and data center applications, with individual devices consuming up to 2000W. The company also introduced a new fully automated Sonoma platform, which provides seamless transition from engineering qualification to high-volume production, offering hands-free operation, continuous-flow burn-in, and the lowest total cost of ownership.

title: Is It Too Late To Consider Microchip Technology (MCHP) After Its Strong 1 Year Rally?
summary: Microchip Technology (MCHP) has seen a significant rally over the past year, prompting questions about its current valuation. A Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) analysis suggests the stock is approximately 29.2% overvalued at $73.94, while a Price-to-Sales (P/S) ratio of 9.49x also indicates it's trading above its estimated fair ratio of 8.81x. Both valuation approaches suggest MCHP may be expensive, encouraging investors to consider its intrinsic value and various risks.

title: Coreweave’s McBee Brannin sells $700k in class a common stock
summary: CoreWeave's Chief Development Officer, McBee Brannin, sold 8,335 shares of Class A Common Stock for approximately $700,454 through pre-arranged trading plans. This transaction occurred amidst CoreWeave's plans to integrate NVIDIA Rubin technology and amendments to its $2.6 billion loan agreement for liquidity relief. Analysts have issued mixed ratings, with Truist Securities initiating coverage with a Hold, while Compass Point and Cantor Fitzgerald reiterated Buy and Overweight ratings, respectively.

title: Analog Devices stock near $293 after chip rally pauses; insider sale and payrolls loom
summary: Analog Devices (ADI.O) shares ended near $293 after a volatile session, with investors weighing the company's "real economy" chip demand against broader market trends. A senior executive's sale of 10,000 shares and upcoming U.S. jobs report and ADI's earnings update are key factors traders are watching. The company previously set a constructive tone with strong Q4 results and Q1 guidance, projecting revenue of $3.1 billion and adjusted EPS of $2.29, despite "macro uncertainty."

title: Icahn Enterprises (IEP) Is Up 6.7% After Carl Icahn Deepens Control With Major Unit Purchase
summary: Carl Icahn recently acquired over 30 million additional units of Icahn Enterprises LP (IEP) in late December 2025, increasing his and affiliated holdings to approximately 549 million units. This significant insider purchase boosts Icahn's control to roughly 86% of the float, further concentrating ownership and intertwining the partnership's fortunes with his decisions. The investment narrative largely depends on the partnership's ability to achieve sustainable profitability while maintaining its high distribution, which is not currently covered by earnings or free cash flow.

title: Should You Buy the Invesco QQQ ETF With the Nasdaq at an All-Time High? Here's What History Says
summary: The Invesco QQQ ETF, which tracks the Nasdaq-100 index, is heavily weighted toward the technology sector and has seen significant gains. Despite the Nasdaq-100 being at an all-time high, historical data suggests that investing for the long term, even through market volatility, can lead to substantial returns. The article argues that the QQQ ETF remains a good buy for long-term investors aiming for compounding returns.
authors: Anthony Di Pizio for The Motley Fool

title: NVDW: Weekly Leverage, Path Dependency And The Cost Of Choppiness (BATS:NVDW)
summary: The Roundhill NVDA WeeklyPay ETF (NVDW) requires a strong, smooth Nvidia rally to outperform unleveraged Nvidia positions due to its weekly reset structure. This structure introduces path and volatility dependencies, which can lead to NAV erosion and volatility drag in choppy or sideways markets. While current high yields are funded by Nvidia's past rally, less bullish regimes risk NAV depletion. The author rates NVDW a Hold, suggesting unleveraged Nvidia offers better risk-reward unless a near-term, uninterrupted rally is highly probable.

title: Synopsys stock rises after CES automotive push as AI trade returns to tech
summary: Synopsys shares rose after hours, driven by renewed investor interest in AI-linked technology stocks and its automotive initiatives at CES 2026. The company showcased new automotive engineering tools and partnerships, including updates for sensor simulation and "Virtualizer" developer kits, which significantly reduce vehicle time-to-market. Investors are rotating back into AI trades, despite recent valuation concerns, with Synopsys expanding its system-level simulation capabilities through its acquisition of Ansys.

title: KLA stock slides after-hours as chip gear names cool off; India R&D expansion in focus
summary: KLA shares dropped about 2.5% in after-hours trading, mirroring a broader semiconductor pullback and driven by investors rotating into mega-cap AI names. The chip-equipment supplier recently announced a new R&D and innovation hub in Chennai, India, focusing on AI and software development. Traders are now keenly watching upcoming U.S. labor data and KLA's late-January earnings report, particularly for commentary on orders and China-related headwinds.

title: Seagate stock (STX) slides after CES-fueled rally cools; earnings date ahead
summary: Seagate Technology (STX) shares fell by 6.7% in after-hours trading, cooling a recent rally driven by optimism around AI hardware announcements at CES. The setback comes despite broader investor rotation into AI stocks, with Seagate's prospects tied to demand for its mass-capacity hard-disk drives used in AI models. Investors are now watching if STX can maintain the $300 level as the company approaches its anticipated next earnings release on January 20th.

title: AI gets physical: Nvidia’s self-driving platform captures consumer world’s attention at CES
summary: At CES, Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang showcased significant advancements in physical AI, particularly with the introduction of Alpamayo, an AI model for autonomous driving. The event highlighted AI's expansion into consumer products, from self-driving cars and humanoid robots to smart home appliances offering personalized assistance. Companies like Samsung and OpenAI demonstrated efforts to integrate AI as a "companion" into daily life, emphasizing its growing influence beyond traditional computing.

title: Why Alphabet Stock Topped the Market Today
summary: Alphabet's stock rose over 2% today after news that a U.S. House of Representatives subcommittee will discuss proposals to increase autonomous vehicle deployments. The company's Waymo subsidiary is a leader in self-driving technology, making it a direct beneficiary of any relaxed regulations. This move aims to boost the U.S.'s competitiveness in the next-generation auto industry.

title: 2 Consumer Stocks for Long-Term Investors and 1 We Brush Off
summary: This article analyzes three consumer staple stocks, recommending Monster Beverage (MNST) and Coca-Cola (KO) for long-term investors due to their strong market positions and efficient business models. Conversely, J&J Snack Foods (JJSF) is identified as a stock to avoid due to slower revenue growth, disadvantage against larger competitors, and projected demand slowdown. The article highlights key financial metrics and market positions for each company.

title: 3 Reasons UNM is Risky and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: This article identifies Unum Group (UNM) as a risky investment due to slow growth in net premiums earned and unimpressive EPS growth, despite some acceleration in BVPS. The authors suggest investors look for better opportunities, specifically recommending a digital advertising platform focused on the creator economy, and point to a curated list of market-beating stocks including Nvidia and Tecnoglass as alternatives.

title: Aeva Technologies Stock Pre-Market (+28%) : Selected for NVIDIA's DRIVE Platform
summary: Aeva Technologies (AEVA) saw a significant pre-market stock increase of 28% following its selection for NVIDIA's DRIVE platform. This partnership is expected to integrate Aeva's lidar technology into NVIDIA's autonomous vehicle solutions. The news suggests a strong market confidence in Aeva's future growth and its role in the advanced driver-assistance systems sector.

title: Does Dual AI-Focused Buy Initiations Transform the Bull Case For Digital Realty Trust (DLR)?
summary: Deutsche Bank and Goldman Sachs have initiated "Buy" ratings for Digital Realty Trust (DLR), citing strong AI-related demand, lease renewal opportunities, and a significant development pipeline. The article highlights DLR's role as a key infrastructure provider for AI and cloud computing and anticipates its Q4 2025 results on February 5, 2026, as a crucial update for investors to assess the company's alignment with the AI-driven narrative. Despite the bullish outlook, the article also notes the importance of converting the lease backlog and managing interest rate risks.

title: New Strong Sell Stocks for January 7th
summary: This article identifies three stocks — Aviva plc (AVVIY), CAE Inc. (CAE), and Chemung Financial Corporation (CHMG) — that have been added to the Zacks Rank #5 (Strong Sell) list as of January 7th. The downgrade for each company is attributed to downward revisions in their current year earnings estimates by 4.7%, 6.5%, and 3.9% respectively over the past 60 days. The article also briefly promotes a "semiconductor stock to buy (not NVDA)" for investors seeking growth opportunities.

title: Is Astera Labs (ALAB) Insider Selling Reframing Its AI Data Center Connectivity Narrative?
summary: Astera Labs (ALAB) is navigating renewed AI infrastructure optimism and a significant insider selling plan. The company's role in providing connectivity solutions for AI data centers makes it sensitive to sector sentiment, with upcoming February earnings and guidance on AI infrastructure spending being a critical near-term catalyst. Despite strong AI enthusiasm, investor focus remains on growth durability and valuation, particularly given the concentration of hyperscaler demand.

title: CGDV ETF at $44.17 Targets $52 as Dividend Value and AI Leaders Drive 2026 Upside
summary: The Capital Group Dividend Value ETF (CGDV), currently trading at $44.17, delivered an 86% price return over three years and expects to reach $52 by 2026, driven by its exposure to AI leaders and growth-oriented sectors like technology and industrials. Despite its "dividend value" label, CGDV acts more like a growth-tilted core equity fund with moderate yield, focusing on companies with accelerating future earnings growth rather than deep value or high current yield. The ETF's strong performance, fueled by top holdings like Eli Lilly, NVIDIA, and Microsoft, makes it a "Buy" for 2026, though its higher valuation presents a risk during market corrections.

title: 1 Reason I Am Never Selling This International ETF
summary: The article highlights the Schwab International Equity ETF (SCHF) as a crucial component for a diversified investment portfolio, especially to gain exposure to developed international markets. SCHF invests in approximately 1,500 mid- and large-cap stocks from stable economies globally, acting as a hedge against potential underperformance of the U.S. economy. The ETF boasts a low expense ratio (0.03%) and a strong dividend yield (3.5%), which are key attractions for long-term investors.

title: Key facts: AMD Stock Drops 20% Amid AI Market Competition; TSMC Key Supplier
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) has seen a 20% decline in its stock price, dropping to $215, forming an "island reversal" pattern. This decrease occurs amidst growing competition in the AI chip market, where AMD remains a key player, leveraging TSMC as its primary supplier alongside competitors like Nvidia and Broadcom.

title: Caterpillar Debuts AI-Powered Equipment and Virtual Assistant at CES 2026
summary: Caterpillar unveiled new AI-powered construction equipment and a virtual assistant at CES 2026. The new line includes five autonomous machines, such as an improved Cat 306 CR Mini Excavator, and the Cat AI Assistant for real-time insights, predictive maintenance, and in-cab coaching. These advancements were made possible through collaboration with NVIDIA, integrating advanced AI capabilities into their machinery and manufacturing processes.

title: Alphabet Trades Near Highs as Earnings Power and AI Spend Justify a Premium
summary: Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOGL) is trading near its 52-week highs, driven by strong earnings growth and significant strategic investments in AI infrastructure, including custom Tensor Processing Units (TPUs) and large-scale energy acquisition for data centers. The company's core advertising business remains robust, complemented by rapid expansion in Google Cloud and other segments, justifying its premium valuation despite market concerns about AI competition and regulatory pressures. The article argues that Alphabet's comprehensive AI strategy, from chip design to power generation, positions it as a foundational layer for future AI and cloud growth, making it a compelling "Buy" despite current high multiples.

title: Intel Launches AI Chip Platform; Stock Surge Expected
summary: Intel's stock has risen by 7.67% following the introduction of its new AI-centric Core Ultra Series 3 processors at CES 2026, which are manufactured in the U.S. Analysts have upgraded Intel to a "Buy" rating, anticipating further stock increases due to potential partnerships with Nvidia and Apple. The company's strategic focus on AI and prudent financial management are positioning it for significant growth and a return to technological leadership.
authors: Tim Bohen, Ben Sturgill, Ellis Hobbs

title: Riot Platforms offloads $161M in Bitcoin in December amid strategy shift
summary: Riot Platforms sold 1,818 Bitcoin for $161.6 million in December as part of a strategic shift away from solely Bitcoin mining. The company aims to monetize its power and data center infrastructure by supporting artificial intelligence workloads, and will transition to quarterly disclosures. This move reflects a broader trend among Bitcoin miners to seek additional revenue streams beyond BTC production, especially after the 2024 halving.

title: Caterpillar Unveils AI-Powered Future and Invests in the Workforce Building It
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has unveiled AI-powered and autonomous innovations at CES 2026, marking a significant advancement for heavy industry by transforming machines into intelligent, connected systems. The company introduced Cat AI Assistant for data-driven decision-making and expanded its collaboration with NVIDIA to accelerate an AI-enabled future. Furthermore, Caterpillar pledged $25 million over five years to support workforce education, ensuring employees and customers are equipped with the skills needed for an increasingly digital and autonomous environment.

title: Lam Research stock slips after two-day rally as traders weigh fresh Buy call and CES headlines
summary: Lam Research (LRCX) shares fell 2.5% Wednesday, paring gains from a two-day rally, despite Aletheia Capital initiating coverage with a Buy rating and a $260 price target. The stock's performance reflects investor focus on chipmaking spend indicators and the broader semiconductor equipment sector's reaction to CES headlines and analyst attention ahead of earnings season. Other chip-related stocks like Applied Materials and KLA also saw declines, while Nvidia rose following its CEO's CES keynote.

title: Global Mofy AI Takes 51% Stake in New U.S. Subsidiary Eaglepoint AI to Build Global Data and Training Hub
summary: Global Mofy AI has acquired a 51% controlling stake in Eaglepoint AI Inc. for $100,000, establishing a new U.S. subsidiary aimed at building a global data and training hub. Eaglepoint AI will focus on data labeling, governance, and AI model training using its proprietary workflow tool, Aquila. This strategic move intends to create a scalable, cost-effective data supply chain and strengthen Global Mofy AI's position in enterprise AI services by leveraging African tech talent.

title: AMD stock slips in regular trade as CES buzz fades and Feb. 3 earnings loom
summary: AMD shares fell about 2% in morning trade, lagging some chip peers, as the buzz from CES fades and investors look ahead to quarterly results on Feb. 3. Despite AMD showcasing new AI hardware at CES, an analyst noted the event didn't alter the debate around the stock, keeping focus on future MI455 ramp and OpenAI as an anchor customer. Macroeconomic data, including softer labor demand, also impacted rate-sensitive tech stocks.

title: SMH vs SOXX: What's the Better Semiconductor ETF Buy?
summary: This article compares two prominent semiconductor ETFs, VanEck Semiconductor ETF (SMH) and iShares Semiconductor ETF (SOXX), to determine which is a better investment. It highlights that the main distinction lies in their concentration, with SMH offering heavier exposure to large-cap companies like Nvidia and Taiwan Semiconductor, while SOXX employs caps on individual holdings for broader diversification. The author concludes that SMH is currently the better choice for investors who prefer significant exposure to the largest companies in the semiconductor sector.

title: Analysts Offer Insights on Technology Companies: comScore (SCOR) and Nvidia (NVDA)
summary: Analysts have provided insights on comScore (SCOR) and Nvidia (NVDA). Jason Kreyer from Craig-Hallum assigned a Hold rating to comScore, while Oppenheimer analyst Rick Schafer reiterated a Buy rating on Nvidia with a $265.00 price target. Melius Research also maintained a Buy rating on Nvidia with a $350.00 price target.

title: AMD's "AI Everywhere, for Everyone" Push: Is the Stock Ready to Rally?
