summary: AMD outlined its "AI Everywhere, for Everyone" strategy at CES 2026, introducing its Helios rack-scale platform and new Instinct MI400 and Ryzen AI 400 series processors to expand its footprint in AI data centers, HPC, and AI PCs. While AMD's shares have significantly outperformed the sector and competitors like Broadcom and NVIDIA over the past year, its valuation is currently stretched, and it faces stiff competition from NVIDIA and Intel in the AI market. Despite strong forecasted revenue growth driven by its data center prospects, AMD holds a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) due to its high valuation and competitive landscape.

title: New Buy Rating for KLA (KLAC), the Technology Giant
summary: KLA Corporation (KLAC) has received a new "Buy" rating and a $1,500.00 price target from KeyBanc analyst Steve Barger. The company recently reported strong financial results with quarterly revenue of $3.21 billion and a net profit of $1.12 billion. This rating contributes to a "Moderate Buy" consensus among analysts, with an average price target of $1,379.42 for KLA.

title: Why is Intel’s stock surging? Here’s what Wall Street has to say.
summary: Intel's stock (INTC) surged 6.5% on Wednesday, making it the top S&P 500 gainer. This suggests a broadening of the AI trade beyond its usual players, potentially positioning Intel as a new focus for investors in artificial intelligence.

title: Apollo Backs $5.4 Billion Valor and xAI Data Center Compute Infrastructure Transaction with $3.5 Billion Capital Solution
summary: Apollo-managed funds have led a $3.5 billion capital solution for Valor Compute Infrastructure (VCI) to support its $5.4 billion acquisition and lease of data center compute infrastructure, including NVIDIA GB200 GPUs, to xAI Corp. This financing is structured as a triple net lease and will power one of the world’s most powerful compute clusters for xAI's Grok model training and development. The deal highlights Apollo's role in funding critical AI infrastructure alongside partners like Valor and NVIDIA.

title: WisdomTree’s ho-hum ETF Has Been A Huge Winner For Retirees
summary: The WisdomTree U.S. LargeCap Fund (EPS) has been a significant outperformer for retirees, beating the S&P 500 by 32 percentage points over the last decade due to its earnings-weighted indexing strategy. This ETF, with a low 0.08% expense ratio and 16% annual turnover, prioritizes companies with strong earnings, providing steady growth and defensive balance through its sector allocations. While it offers capital appreciation and a 1.3% dividend, retirees seeking higher immediate income or lower volatility might consider alternatives like dividend funds or bond exposure.

title: TSM Hits 52-Week High: Should You Hold the Stock or Book Profits?
summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (TSM) recently hit a new 52-week high, driven by its pivotal role in the AI chip market, manufacturing for major clients like NVIDIA, Broadcom, and Marvell Technology. Despite strong growth and financial performance, the article suggests a cautious "Hold" position due to near-term risks such as softness in PC/smartphone markets, high global expansion costs, geopolitical tensions, and a premium valuation compared to the sector average.

title: Intel Stock Jumps as Management Teases New Gaming Chips
summary: Intel (INTC) shares rose about 7% after an executive announced that the company is developing a new processor and platform specifically for gaming, combining hardware and software. This move signifies Intel's renewed focus on the gaming chip market, aiming to compete more strongly with AMD and Nvidia. Investors responded positively to the news, hoping it will drive growth in the high-demand gaming hardware sector.

title: The AI Storage Supercycle: A Deep Dive into Western Digital (WDC)
summary: Western Digital (WDC) has transformed into a focused powerhouse in 2026, pivoting to high-capacity storage drives after spinning off its flash memory business. This strategic shift positions WDC as a primary beneficiary of the "AI Data Cycle," providing essential infrastructure for massive AI data storage. The company has seen significant stock performance, margin expansion, and analyst upgrades due to its leadership in specialized HDD technologies for data centers.

title: FICO Xpress 9.8 speeds up optimization problems by 50x with NVIDIA AI
summary: FICO announced that its FICO Xpress Optimization suite now integrates NVIDIA CUDA-X libraries, leading to a significant acceleration in solving large computational problems. The new version features a GPU-accelerated hybrid gradient algorithm that can process optimization problems up to 50 times faster. This enhancement, along with other performance improvements to its mixed-integer programming engine and global solver, positions FICO to offer more efficient solutions for complex business analytics.

title: CDNS Boosts Physical AI With Spec-to-Packaged Chiplet Ecosystem
summary: Cadence Design Systems (CDNS) has launched its Chiplet Spec-to-Packaged Parts ecosystem to mainstream chiplet-based architectures, addressing complexity and integration risks. This initiative, backed by IP partners and Samsung Foundry, aims to leverage Arm IP for edge AI and support next-generation interfaces for data center, cloud, and HPC workloads. Cadence seeks to capitalize on increasing R&D spending in AI-driven automation, despite intense competition and market volatility.

title: Seagate (STX) stock slides as AI storage rally cools after record run
summary: Seagate Technology Holdings plc (STX) shares fell about 7% after a record-setting surge, driven by analyst optimism regarding increased demand for AI storage following Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang's remarks at CES. The pullback occurred as the broader AI storage rally cooled, and investors now focus on Seagate's upcoming fiscal second-quarter report for insights into demand, pricing, and margins. This movement reflects the volatile nature of the storage market, which has a history of boom-and-bust pricing.

title: Rambus (RMBS) Valuation Check As Semiconductor Rally And Data Center Expectations Lift Investor Interest
summary: Rambus (RMBS) stock surged 8.0% on January 3, 2026, driven by a broader semiconductor rally and investor anticipation of strong data center demand and upcoming quarterly results. While the stock has seen a mixed short-term performance, its impressive 72.47% one-year return highlights strong momentum. Currently trading at US$97.50 against an average analyst target of US$120, Simply Wall St assesses RMBS as potentially undervalued by 18.8% based on future fundamentals, despite its current P/E of 45.9x being higher than peers.

title: Oracle stock slips as Jefferies sticks with $400 target; jobs report and dividend date loom
summary: Oracle (ORCL) shares slipped on Wednesday despite Jefferies reiterating a Buy rating and a $400 price target, as investors weigh the company's AI-driven cloud growth prospects and upcoming economic data. The stock's performance is tied to its ability to convert signed cloud contracts into revenue and the broader macroeconomic environment, particularly ahead of Friday's U.S. payrolls report and Oracle's dividend record date. Jefferies highlights Oracle as a top large-cap pick, expecting meaningful AI revenue by fiscal 2027, despite concerns about investment costs and project delays.

title: Alibaba Stock Price Forecast - BABA Stock at $154: AI Cloud Surges 34% While Instant Commerce Explodes
summary: Alibaba (NYSE:BABA) is investing heavily in AI and cloud infrastructure, committing RMB 380 billion, leading to a 34% surge in Cloud Intelligence Group revenue and triple-digit AI-related cloud growth. Despite a reported 5% revenue increase, underlying growth is closer to 15% when accounting for divestitures, with all major operating blocks showing double-digit growth. The company is actively sacrificing short-term EBITA margins to secure market dominance in fast-growing instant commerce and expand its AI ecosystem.

title: Radware Sets February 11 Release Date for Q4 and Full-Year 2025 Results
summary: Radware (RDWR) announced that it will release its fourth-quarter and full-year 2025 financial results on February 11, 2026. The company's management will host a conference call on the same day to discuss the results and provide an outlook for Q1 2026. An analyst rated the stock as "Hold" with a $25.00 price target, while TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, assessed RDWR as "Neutral," citing strong financials and growth in cloud security against bearish technical indicators and high valuation.

title: Can Retirees Count on JEPQs 10.4% Dividend and Monthly Payments?
summary: The article examines whether retirees can rely on the JPMorgan Nasdaq Equity Premium Income ETF (JEPQ) for its high yield and monthly payouts. JEPQ utilizes a covered call strategy on Nasdaq-100 stocks, leading to fluctuating monthly distributions and potentially capping upside potential in strong bull markets. It also discusses an alternative, the Schwab U.S. Dividend Equity ETF (SCHD), which offers lower but more predictable dividend growth, suggesting a blended strategy could balance income and growth for retirees.

title: Why Crocs (CROX) Shares Are Sliding Today
summary: Crocs (CROX) stock fell 4.8% after Baird downgraded it from 'Outperform' to 'Neutral' due to valuation concerns, despite keeping a $100 price target. The downgrade follows a 20% gain since November lows and a previous revenue decline for the company. Analysts predict slowed growth for Crocs, contributing to its year-to-date decline and recent stock volatility.

title: 3 Great ETFs for 2026 and Beyond
summary: This article identifies three highly recommended ETFs for long-term investors looking to diversify their portfolios beyond 2026. The selected ETFs are the Vanguard Total World Stock ETF (VT), State Street SPDR Portfolio S&P 500 ETF (SPYM), and Dimensional Core Fixed Income ETF (DFCF), all praised for their low fees, broad diversification, and strong investment strategies. The author emphasizes the importance of diversification across various asset classes and geographies to mitigate risk and achieve long-term financial success.

title: 3 Reasons to Avoid MTH and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: This article advises investors to avoid Meritage Homes (MTH) due to declining backlog, a drop in EPS over the last two years, and a decrease in Return on Invested Capital (ROIC). Instead, the author suggests investing in a more stable, "all-weather company" and points to a curated list of high-quality stocks like Nvidia and Comfort Systems.

title: Seagate stock (STX) slips in premarket after 14% jump as Nvidia CES storage push reshapes AI trade
summary: Seagate Technology Holdings plc (STX) shares slipped 1.3% in premarket trading after a 14% jump on Tuesday, following Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang's announcement of new storage technology at CES. This news caused a significant rally in storage and memory stocks, including SanDisk, Western Digital, and Micron Technology, with all hitting record highs. The article also notes that Seagate's stock had a 219% run in 2025 and that strong earnings from Big Tech could further drive capital spending in the sector.

title: Western Digital stock dips in premarket after 17% jump as CES “AI storage” trade cools
summary: Western Digital (WDC) shares dipped 1.2% in premarket trading after a significant 16.8% jump the previous day, spurred by the "AI storage" trade following comments from Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang at CES 2026. The surge, also seen in SanDisk and Seagate Technology, was fueled by reports of rising server DRAM prices and increased demand from cloud operators for AI workloads. Investors are now looking for proof of firming prices and customer commitment to sustain the rally, as analysts warn about the vulnerability of high-flying storage names to cooling AI growth or weaker earnings.

title: Marriott Vacations Worldwide (VAC) Valuation Check After Recent Share Price Gains
summary: Marriott Vacations Worldwide (VAC) has seen recent share price gains, with a 5.0% increase over the past week and 13.5% over the past month, despite a 23.57% decline over the last year. The stock is trading near its analyst target of $64.00, suggesting a potential mispricing given an intrinsic discount of 55%. The company's valuation narrative points to it being undervalued at a fair value of $64, driven by modernization initiatives, expected EBITDA benefits, and robust leisure travel demand.

title: Bitcoin miner Riot Platforms (RIOT) raised $200 million via BTC sales
summary: Bitcoin mining company Riot Platforms (RIOT) sold $200 million worth of Bitcoin in November and December 2025 to fund the first phase of its Corsicana AI data center build. VanEck’s head of digital assets, Matthew Sigel, noted that these sales represent a growing trend of miners funding AI infrastructure by selling BTC, particularly when credit conditions are tight. These sales may also have contributed to Bitcoin's price decline in 2025.

title: PENG Q1 Deep Dive: Enterprise AI Uptake and Memory Growth Offset LED Weakness
summary: Penguin Solutions (NASDAQ: PENG) reported Q4 CY2025 results that surpassed revenue expectations, with flat year-on-year sales but an adjusted EPS beat. The company saw strong enterprise AI adoption and memory growth, which helped offset ongoing weaknesses in its LED segment. Management highlighted a shift from hyperscale to broader enterprise AI deployments and anticipates continued growth in these areas, along with increased memory demand, in the coming quarters.

title: NBIS - Nebius Group Latest Stock News & Market Updates
summary: This page provides the latest news and market updates for Nebius Group (NBIS), focusing on its advancements in AI infrastructure solutions. Key announcements include offering NVIDIA Vera Rubin NVL72, new versions of Nebius AI Cloud with Blackwell Ultra compute, the Robotics & Physical AI Awards, Q3 2025 financial results with a Meta agreement, and the launch of Nebius Token Factory for AI inference. The company is actively expanding its AI infrastructure through technology partnerships and product developments.

title: Microsoft Corporation $MSFT is Brian Low Financial Group LLC's 2nd Largest Position
summary: Brian Low Financial Group LLC significantly increased its stake in Microsoft (MSFT) by 16.3% in Q3, making it their second-largest holding. Microsoft also exceeded quarterly earnings estimates, reporting impressive EPS and revenue figures, alongside announcing a quarterly dividend of $0.91 per share. The company continues to show strong financial performance, high profitability, and strategic advancements in AI and cloud infrastructure.

title: Silicon Sovereignty: Texas Instruments’ SM1 Fab Marks a New Era for American Chipmaking
summary: Texas Instruments has officially begun high-volume production at its $30 billion SM1 fabrication plant in Sherman, Texas, marking a significant milestone for domestic semiconductor manufacturing under the CHIPS and Science Act. This facility focuses on foundational analog and embedded chips critical for various industries, aiming to secure the U.S. supply chain from geopolitical disruptions. The SM1 fab is the first of four planned facilities, highlighting a broader national strategy for "Silicon Resurgence" in America.

title: Should You Invest in the iShares Expanded Tech Sector ETF (IGM)?
summary: The iShares Expanded Tech Sector ETF (IGM) is a passively managed ETF designed to track the performance of the S&P North American Technology Sector Index, offering broad exposure to the Technology - Broad segment of the equity market. With over $8.89 billion in assets and a low expense ratio of 0.39%, it's considered a medium-risk investment with a Zacks ETF Rank of 1 (Strong Buy). Key holdings include Apple, Broadcom, and Nvidia, providing diversified exposure within the technology sector.

title: Nvidia CEO Says Chinese Demand for Its AI Chips Is ‘Quite High’ - WSJ
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang stated that Chinese demand for the company's H200 advanced AI processors is "quite high." This comes a month after the Trump administration approved the sale of these chips in China. Huang noted that the supply chain is active and the company is finalizing licensing details with the U.S. government.

title: AMD aprofunda o impulso em IA corporativa com novos chips de data center
summary: AMD lançou o novo chip MI440X direcionado a data centers corporativos menores, visando a IA local e reduzindo a dependência de grandes provedores de nuvem. A empresa também revelou o acelerador MI455X para cargas de trabalho de IA exigentes e anunciou planos para a série MI500 em 2027, prometendo ganhos de desempenho significativos. Este movimento visa diminuir a lacuna com a Nvidia no mercado de chips de IA, com a CEO Lisa Su enfatizando a contínua e forte demanda por poder de computação de IA.

title: Ações da AMD caem após destaque para chips de IA na CES reacender foco em acordo com a OpenAI
summary: As ações da AMD caíram cerca de 1,3% após a CES, apesar de a empresa ter apresentado novos processadores de IA para data centers e clientes corporativos, incluindo uma plataforma em colaboração com a OpenAI. Os investidores buscam provas concretas de crescimento de vendas, enquanto a Nvidia também revelou sua plataforma de próxima geração. A AMD busca se posicionar como uma alternativa à Nvidia, focando em soluções de IA para dados regulados e inferência sensível à latência, mas enfrenta o desafio da consolidação do software da Nvidia e possíveis restrições na cadeia de suprimentos.

title: |8 Lessons for Investors From Market Turbulence in 2025
summary: |The article outlines eight key lessons for investors derived from the market turbulence of 2025, offering insights on forecasting difficulties, equity valuations, inflation, the US dollar, international diversification, gold, cryptocurrency, and private credit strategies. It emphasizes the importance of patience, diversification, and maintaining a long-term perspective in the face of market uncertainties. The author suggests specific strategies, such as including inflation hedges and non-dollar assets, to build portfolio resilience for the future.

title: Hesai Group (NasdaqGS:HSAI) Valuation Check As Lidar Capacity Expansion And NVIDIA Partnership Take Shape
summary: Hesai Group is gaining attention due to its plans to double annual lidar production capacity to over 4 million units by 2026 and a new partnership with NVIDIA's DRIVE AGX Hyperion 10 platform. Despite a 33.33% 1-month share price return, the company is trading at a roughly 12% discount to its average analyst target and DCF estimate, suggesting potential undervaluation. However, its high P/E ratio of 68x earnings, significantly above the industry average, raises questions about whether its growth can sustain such a premium.

title: 3 Top Quantum Computing Stocks to Buy in 2026
summary: This article identifies three leading technology companies - Nvidia, IBM, and Microsoft - as top quantum computing stocks to consider in 2026. While pure-play quantum companies can be risky, these established giants offer exposure to the emerging field without all-or-nothing gambles. Each company is actively involved in quantum computing research and development, leveraging their strong existing businesses and strategic investments to position themselves for future growth in this potentially vast market.

title: Lattice Semiconductor (LSCC) Stock Trades Up, Here Is Why
summary: Lattice Semiconductor (LSCC) stock rose by 6.3% following a broad market rally driven by optimism in AI and big tech stocks. The positive momentum was partly attributed to the annual CES trade show and hopes for easier monetary policy from the Federal Reserve. The semiconductor industry as a whole is projected for significant growth in 2026, contributing to LSCC's 8.8% year-to-date increase and new 52-week high.

title: The iShares MSCI World ETF: A Concentrated Bet on U.S. Technology
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH) is increasingly concentrated in U.S. technology stocks, with the U.S. constituting about 70% of its holdings, making its performance closely tied to a few American tech giants. Recent MSCI methodology decisions have temporarily stabilized the fund by postponing the removal of Digital Asset Treasury firms, avoiding significant outflows. However, investors face potential reweighting risks, valuation concerns in the tech sector, and the influence of systematic fund flows.

title: KLA Corporation stock hits a fresh 52-week high after Cantor upgrade — what’s next for KLAC
summary: KLA Corporation's stock reached a new 52-week high of $1,395 after Cantor Fitzgerald upgraded the chip-equipment maker to Overweight with a price target of $1,500. The upgrade reflects an AI-driven semiconductor upcycle constrained by capacity rather than demand, positioning KLA to benefit from increased investments in advanced manufacturing. Investors are now looking to upcoming U.S. jobs and services data for further market direction.

title: Robots, drones and hospitals: inside Arrive AI's year in autonomous delivery
summary: Arrive AI (NASDAQ: ARAI) released its 2025 Year in Review, reflecting on public-market achievements, significant healthcare deployments, strategic partnerships, and intellectual property growth. The company achieved a Nasdaq direct listing, joined Russell indexes, and expanded its patent portfolio. Looking forward, Arrive AI plans to scale deployments, broaden enterprise and healthcare applications, and enhance product development through its NVIDIA Connect partnership in 2026.

title: Supermicro Brings Enterprise-Class AI Performance to the Client, Edge, and Consumer Markets
summary: Supermicro is expanding its portfolio with new AI-powered systems for client, edge, and consumer markets, featuring technologies from NVIDIA, Intel, and AMD. The company announced its Super AI Station for high-performance AI development, along with new workstations, AI PCs, and compact edge AI systems. These innovations aim to deliver enterprise-class AI capabilities to a broader range of users, including creators, developers, startups, and higher education.

title: Johnson Controls (JCI) stock slides 6% after Nvidia’s “no water chillers” line jolts data-center cooling trade
summary: Johnson Controls (JCI) shares dropped over 6% after Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang stated that next-generation chips would significantly reduce data center cooling needs, specifically eliminating the necessity for water chillers. This announcement impacted JCI and other HVAC suppliers like Trane and Carrier, as investors had viewed them as beneficiaries of AI-driven data center expansion, where cooling is a significant cost. Barclays analysts noted that data centers constitute a low-double-digit percentage of JCI's total sales, making Huang's comments a notable concern for the sector.

title: Applied Materials stock jumps to a fresh 52-week high as CES AI talk lifts chip-equipment shares
summary: Applied Materials stock reached a new 52-week high, rising 4.1% following renewed AI optimism at CES, which also boosted other semiconductor equipment manufacturers. Nvidia's announcement of its "Vera Rubin" chips in full production and new "context memory storage" features fueled investor interest in the AI build-out and associated capital spending. Despite the rally, uncertainties remain regarding potential curb on chipmaking equipment spending in China due to U.S. export controls and upcoming earnings season expectations.

title: Seagate stock jumps 14% as Nvidia CES “context memory storage” lifts STX and peers
summary: Seagate Technology Holdings plc (STX.O) shares surged nearly 14% following Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang's announcement of "context memory storage" at CES, indicating widening investor interest in AI-related hardware. This boost also lifted other memory-linked stocks like SanDisk, Western Digital, and Micron, as supply tightens and AI-driven demand increases. Seagate anticipates strong Q2 revenue and profit, driven by new AI applications, with Q4 earnings season approaching.

title: Assessing Beam Therapeutics (BEAM) Valuation After ARK Invest Expands Its Position
summary: ARK Invest has increased its stake in Beam Therapeutics (BEAM), signaling confidence in its genetic medicine and base-editing approaches. While Beam is considered undervalued by a narrative model, analysts note its high price-to-sales ratio, suggesting the market is anticipating significant future growth, which comes with inherent risks regarding clinical outcomes and regulatory approvals. The company recently achieved a milestone with BEAM-302, demonstrating first-ever in vivo base editing in humans for AATD.

title: 3 Unpopular Stocks We Find Risky
summary: This article identifies three stocks—Thermon (THR), Proto Labs (PRLB), and AGNC Investment (AGNC)—that StockStory considers risky due to factors like sluggish revenue growth, underperforming earnings, and negative returns on capital. Despite some Wall Street skepticism, the analysis suggests these companies face fundamental challenges that make them less attractive investments. It also recommends exploring StockStory's list of "Market-Beating Stocks" for better investment opportunities.

title: 2 Cash-Producing Stocks with Impressive Fundamentals and 1 We Brush Off
summary: This article identifies two cash-producing stocks, TransDigm (TDG) and Axon (AXON), with impressive fundamentals and growth prospects, recommending them as buys. Conversely, it advises investors to sell Sensata Technologies (ST) due to challenges in its end markets, slow projected growth, and low gross margin. The analysis emphasizes that while strong cash flow is important, its effective deployment is crucial for shareholder value.

title: Nio flags potential cost pressures from memory chips
summary: Nio's CEO, William Li, has warned of "significant" cost pressures in 2026 due to surging memory chip prices, which are impacting the entire automotive sector. These chips are crucial for Nio's own Shenji chips, as well as Nvidia and cockpit chips used in its vehicles, with demand from AI players and computing centers driving up costs. Despite the rising expenses, Nio currently has no plans to pass these costs on to vehicle prices, affirming its ability to manage the situation through its gross margin.

title: Marvell buys network switching specialist XConn for $540M to boost its AI story
summary: Marvell Technology Inc. is acquiring network interconnect startup XConn Technologies Holdings Inc. for $540 million in a stock-and-cash deal. This acquisition aims to strengthen Marvell's AI infrastructure offerings, particularly its switching portfolio, to better compete with rivals like Broadcom and solidify its position in connecting large AI chip clusters. The purchase is expected to contribute $100 million in revenue by fiscal 2028 and follows Marvell's recent acquisition of Celestial AI Inc. to enhance its AI infrastructure story.

title: Denny's (DENN): Buy, Sell, or Hold Post Q3 Earnings?
summary: Denny's stock has seen a significant 41% jump in the past six months, reaching $6.22 per share. However, the article advises caution due to flat same-store sales indicating weak demand, limited distribution channels for the small restaurant chain, and high debt levels which increase risk for investors. The analysis concludes that while the current valuation is fair, the company lacks the confidence needed for a strong buy recommendation, suggesting better investment opportunities exist elsewhere.

title: 3 Big Reasons to Love Euronet Worldwide (EEFT)
summary: Despite a recent pullback in its stock price, Euronet Worldwide (EEFT) presents a compelling investment case. The company demonstrates strong long-term revenue growth (11.1% CAGR over five years) and exceptional EPS growth (23% CAGR), indicating increasing profitability. Furthermore, its stellar 19.5% average return on equity over the last five years showcases a strong competitive moat and effective capital utilization.

title: 3 Reasons to Avoid FBNC and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: This article articulates three reasons to avoid investing in First Bancorp (FBNC), citing disappointing long-term revenue growth and barely growing EPS. It suggests that the company's business quality falls short of standards and that the stock's upside is limited compared to its potential downside. Instead, the article recommends exploring other growth stocks from its curated list.

title: Coastal Financial (CCB): 3 Reasons We Love This Stock
summary: Coastal Financial (CCB) has demonstrated strong financial performance, with its stock gaining 15.4% over the last six months, outperforming the S&P 500. The company excels in net interest income growth, boasts an elite net interest margin, and shows outstanding long-term EPS growth. These factors highlight Coastal Financial as a high-quality business with significant growth opportunities.

title: Western Digital (WDC) stock jumps 17% after Nvidia CES storage talk sparks AI-driven rally
summary: Western Digital (WDC) shares surged 17%, trading above $219 after Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang's CES remarks about "context memory storage" sparked an AI-driven rally among storage and memory companies. This jump reflects investor optimism about demand for data storage tied to AI data centers, with other companies like SanDisk, Seagate Technology, and Micron also experiencing significant gains. However, analysts caution that current high prices might not be sustainable long-term, and upcoming U.S. labor data could influence market expectations and tech trades.

title: PepsiCo Partners With Siemens, Nvidia To Advance Existing Plant, Warehousing Facilities
summary: PepsiCo has partnered with Siemens and Nvidia to implement digital twin technology and AI in its plant and supply chain operations. This initiative aims to replace traditional, slow, and costly expansion methods by simulating and optimizing facility layouts before any physical construction. The company expects initial trials in the U.S. to lead to global scaling, allowing them to identify up to 90% of potential issues pre-emptively.

title: Lenovo Teams with NVIDIA on Gigawatt AI Factories Program to Accelerate Enterprise AI
summary: Lenovo and NVIDIA have partnered to launch the Lenovo AI Cloud Gigafactory program, designed to accelerate enterprise AI adoption and deployment for AI cloud providers. This initiative focuses on high-velocity solutions to achieve faster "time-to-first token," combining liquid-cooling technology, global manufacturing, and full-lifecycle services to deliver AI at a giga-scale. The program leverages advanced NVIDIA accelerated computing infrastructure, including the upcoming NVIDIA Blackwell Ultra and Vera Rubin NVL72 systems, to support complex AI workloads and enable rapid monetization of customized AI solutions.

title: How Schwab’s Softer December STAX Reading at Charles Schwab (SCHW) Has Changed Its Investment Story
summary: In December 2025, Charles Schwab's Schwab Trading Activity Index (STAX) eased to 48.48, indicating clients were net sellers across sectors due to year-end portfolio repositioning. This softer reading is viewed as seasonal and does not materially alter Charles Schwab's investment narrative, which continues to focus on attracting retail investors, managing interest rate risks, and ongoing share repurchase programs. The article suggests this data point provides insight into client behavior and supports the firm's strategic positioning amidst competitive and interest rate pressures.

title: WeRide's Robotaxi GXR becomes world's first Robotaxi to adopt NVIDIA DRIVE Thor X chip
summary: WeRide's Robotaxi GXR has become the world's first Robotaxi to use NVIDIA's DRIVE Thor X chip, entering fully driverless commercial operations in China and the UAE. The vehicle utilizes the HPC 3.0 platform, co-developed with Lenovo Vehicle Computing, boasting 2,000 TOPS of AI computing power and significant cost reductions. WeRide plans to expand its global Robotaxi fleet to hundreds of thousands by 2030, enhancing its partnership with NVIDIA for mass commercialization.

title: Why Lam Research (LRCX) Stock Is Trading Up Today
summary: Lam Research (LRCX) stock rose 6.2% after Aletheia Capital initiated coverage with a 'Buy' rating and a $260 price target, citing its strong market position and growth in AI and high-performance computing. This positive sentiment, along with a previous recommendation from Citi and an increased price target from TD Cowen, pushed the stock to a new all-time high amidst broader optimism for semiconductor stocks driven by AI trends. The company has seen an 11.8% gain year-to-date, with strong returns for long-term investors.

title: Lidar Stock Soars After Nvidia Taps Supplier
summary: Aeva Technologies' stock surged after the company announced it was selected as a lidar supplier for Nvidia's autonomous-vehicle platform. This partnership highlights the growing importance of lidar technology in the automotive industry. The news significantly boosted investor confidence in Aeva.

title: Will Microchip Tech (MCHP) Beat Estimates Again in Its Next Earnings Report?
summary: Microchip Technology (MCHP) is positioned for another potential earnings beat, evidenced by its strong history of surpassing estimates and a positive Zacks Earnings ESP. The company has an average surprise of 9.28% over the last two quarters and a current Earnings ESP of +4.99%, combined with a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold). This combination suggests a high probability of exceeding consensus expectations in its upcoming quarterly report.

title: Is AI-Focused Networking Momentum And CEO Stock Sales Altering The Investment Case For Arista Networks (ANET)?
summary: Arista Networks is experiencing a surge in demand for its AI-focused networking gear, bolstering its investment narrative through new hyperscale design wins and positive analyst views. CEO Jayshree Ullal has sold significant stock, but this doesn't fundamentally change the core investment thesis driven by AI data center buildouts. The company's future growth relies on maintaining its role in high-speed Ethernet for AI and cloud data centers, despite risks like customer concentration within hyperscale clients.

title: Modine (MOD) stock falls as Nvidia Rubin cooling remarks rattle data-center suppliers
summary: Modine (MOD) shares fell after Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang stated that the new Rubin platform does not require water chillers, impacting data-center cooling suppliers. The selloff also affected other HVAC and data-center cooling companies. Despite this, experts believe the comments may not automatically translate to lower cooling spend, as high rack densities could still favor liquid cooling solutions.

title: Aeva’s Partnership with NVIDIA: Impact on Stock
summary: Aeva Technologies Inc. (NASDAQ: AEVA) saw its stock price surge by 35.91%, driven by a significant partnership with NVIDIA involving its 4D LiDAR technology for autonomous vehicles. The company is actively showcasing its innovations at CES 2026 and participating in investor conferences to expand its market reach. Despite challenges like negative profitability ratios, Aeva maintains a strong cash position and aims to solidify its position in the autonomous vehicle market.
authors: Tim Bohen, Ben Sturgill, Ellis Hobbs

title: Did Modine’s (MOD) Expanded Credit Lines and Nvidia’s Cooling Shift Just Recast Its Data Center Narrative?
summary: Modine Manufacturing recently expanded its credit lines to US$550.0 million, increasing financial flexibility. This comes as Nvidia's comments on future data center cooling, favoring liquid cooling, raise questions about the long-term demand for Modine's traditional cooling solutions and could impact its growth narrative, especially concerning data center cooling orders. Investors are now reassessing Modine's position given its aggressive data center expansion capital allocation and inventory build-up.

title: Camtek stock jumps to a new high after Needham lifts target — what traders watch next
summary: Camtek Ltd. shares surged 7.5% to a new high of $133.18 after Needham raised its price target to $135, citing strong demand linked to high-bandwidth memory (HBM) used in AI accelerators. The rally occurred as chip-related stocks broadly climbed, with investors now watching for U.S. jobs data and Camtek’s upcoming earnings report. Needham analyst Charles Shi suggested that back-end tools for chip packaging and testing could outperform front-end wafer-fab gear in 2026.

title: Tesla: Shares Fall on Market Concerns About Autonomous Driving Competition from Nvidia
summary: Tesla's shares fell by 5% following Nvidia's announcement at CES 2026 to develop and sell an autonomous driving system for personal vehicles and robotaxis. This new competition is seen as a threat to Tesla's growth in the autonomous driving software market, potentially impacting its future robotaxi service and overall market share. Morningstar maintains its $300 fair value estimate for Tesla, considering the stock overvalued at current prices.

title: Did Colgate-Palmolive’s (CL) Dividend King Status and Q4 Preview Just Redefine Its Defensive Edge?
summary: Colgate-Palmolive is gaining attention as a Dividend King, with analysts highlighting its innovation, cost initiatives, and focus on high-growth oral and home care categories ahead of its Q4 earnings. This reinforces its image as a defensive consumer staples leader. The company's investment narrative centers on its ability to convert a science-led franchise into steady earnings and dividend power, with upcoming Q4 earnings providing a key catalyst.

title: ARM Stock Down 20% in a Year vs Industry Gains: Buy Signal or Caution?
summary: ARM Holdings' stock has underperformed its industry, falling 20% over the past year despite being central to energy-efficient AI computing. While its robust ecosystem and strong future earnings and revenue growth outlook present a high-quality business case, its current valuation is considered stretched. Investors are advised to hold existing positions but wait for a better entry point due to the high valuation, which leaves little room for error.

title: Caterpillar introduces ‘Cat AI Assistant’
summary: Caterpillar has launched its new "Cat AI Assistant," an AI-based solution designed to enhance how customers interact with their equipment and digital applications. This assistant integrates Caterpillar's digital applications into a conversational experience, providing personalized data and insights to improve productivity, efficiency, and safety for business owners, technicians, and machine operators. Caterpillar plans to roll out the off-board Cat AI Assistant in the first quarter of this year and will showcase its capabilities at CES 2026.

title: ServiceNow Drops 30% in a Year: Buy, Sell or Hold the NOW Stock?
summary: ServiceNow's shares have dropped nearly 30% in the past year, underperforming the sector due to macroeconomic challenges and slowing subscription revenue growth. Despite being currently overvalued with a bearish technical trend, the company's AI-powered workflows, expanding partner base, and recent acquisitions are expected to improve its top-line growth in 2026. Given the mixed outlook, Zacks Investment Research suggests a "Hold" rating for NOW stock.

title: Caterpillar stock rises on Cat AI Assistant launch as CES-Nvidia tie-up nears
summary: Caterpillar shares rose 1.2% to $623.73 after unveiling its "Cat AI Assistant" at CES 2026, which aims to integrate digital applications and equipment data into a chat-style interface for fleet owners, technicians, and machine operators. The in-cab version runs on Nvidia’s Jetson Thor platform, highlighting Caterpillar's push into AI and software-linked demand. CEO Joe Creed will deliver a CES keynote on January 7th to detail an expanded collaboration with Nvidia, as investors look to see if digital tools can smooth cyclical business and boost service revenue.

title: Western Digital stock jumps nearly 14% as CES chip talk lifts storage and memory shares
summary: Western Digital shares soared by nearly 14% after Nvidia's CEO announced a new storage technology at CES, fueling a rally in storage and memory stocks. This surge, also seen in SanDisk, Seagate, and Micron, is attributed to increasing demand for AI infrastructure and improved memory market conditions. Investors are reacting positively to signs of tight memory supply and the critical role storage plays in AI buildouts.

title: Is This Under-the-Radar Infrastructure Stock the Best Way to Play AI Without Buying Chips?
summary: As artificial intelligence (AI) continues to develop at a rapid pace, the infrastructure supporting it requires a reliable and clean power source. Brookfield Renewable, a leader in clean energy with a global presence, is poised to capitalize on this demand by supplying power to AI infrastructure build-outs for companies like Microsoft and Google. For investors looking for a less direct play on AI, Brookfield Renewable offers an attractive opportunity with its stable distribution yield and potential for consistent dividend growth.

title: AMD stock tumbles sharply: why chip giant is facing profit-taking after 2025 rally
summary: AMD stock experienced a sharp decline on Tuesday due to profit-taking following an exceptional 97% surge in 2025. The selloff was exacerbated by technical resistance, competitive pressure from Intel's new chips unveiled at CES, and mixed analyst sentiment regarding AMD's growth targets and market positioning against Nvidia.

title: Nvidia’s Cooling Claim Sent HVAC Stocks Sliding
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang's statement at CES that next-generation AI chips could drastically reduce data center cooling needs, possibly eliminating water chillers, caused a dip in HVAC stocks like Johnson Controls, Trane, and Carrier. This highlights the sensitivity of the "picks and shovels" trade to architectural shifts in AI infrastructure, favoring companies like Vertiv and nVent with more exposure to precision or liquid cooling. The market reaction indicates a new focus on efficiency in AI infrastructure, moving from rapid capacity buildout to more compute per watt and advanced cooling solutions.

title: Lam Research stock jumps 6% after Aletheia starts coverage with $260 target
summary: Lam Research Corp (LRCX.O) shares rose 6.2% in after-hours trading after Aletheia Capital initiated coverage with a buy rating and a $260 price target, citing expected sustained strong growth due to demand for AI and high-performance computing tools. This bullish initiation comes amid renewed AI optimism in the chip sector, though the stock remains sensitive to potential customer spending shifts or new export rules. Investors are awaiting Lam's earnings report on January 28th for insights into bookings, gross margin, and the 2026 outlook.

title: Nvidia Says Its Revenue Forecast Has Only Grown More Bullish
summary: Nvidia's CFO stated that the company's revenue forecast has become even more bullish since October, driven by strong demand for its AI products. The company cited large customer deals and increased adoption of new AI models at the CES show in Las Vegas. Nvidia had previously projected half a trillion dollars in revenue from data center chips by the end of 2026.

title: Siemens and NVIDIA Expand Partnership to Build the Industrial AI Operating System
summary: Siemens and NVIDIA are expanding their partnership to create an "Industrial AI operating system," aiming to revolutionize the entire industrial value chain from design to manufacturing and supply chains. This collaboration will focus on AI-native electronic design, simulation, and adaptive manufacturing, with the goal of developing next-generation AI factories and optimizing operations through shared innovation. The initiative will involve NVIDIA providing AI infrastructure and Siemens contributing industrial AI experts and hardware/software, starting with an AI-driven manufacturing site in Erlangen, Germany, by 2026.

title: PepsiCo Announces Industry-First AI and Digital Twin Collaboration with Siemens and NVIDIA
summary: PepsiCo has announced a multi-year, industry-first collaboration with Siemens and NVIDIA to transform its plant and supply chain operations using advanced digital twin technology and AI. This initiative, marked by early pilots in the U.S., aims to reshape how facilities are digitally simulated and tested to meet rising production demands more efficiently. By leveraging Siemens Digital Twin Composer, built on NVIDIA Omniverse libraries, PepsiCo has already achieved significant improvements, including a 20% increase in throughput and 10-15% reductions in capital expenditure in initial deployments.

title: Nvidia chooses China’s Hesai for lidar in Hyperion autonomous driving platform
summary: Hesai Group, the world's largest vehicle lidar sensor maker, has partnered with Nvidia to supply lidar sensors for Nvidia's Drive Hyperion platform, aiming for L4 self-driving standards. This partnership signifies Hesai's global expansion, with a new plant in Bangkok set to open in 2027, and is expected to boost its sales significantly. The move highlights accelerated autonomous driving development in China and other markets.

title: New phase ahead for office space market: JLL Taiwan
summary: Taiwan's commercial property market is entering a transitional and more competitive phase this year, driven by increased office availability, regulatory changes, and demand from AI and semiconductor industries. JLL Taiwan predicts a shift from a landlord-driven market to one favoring tenants, giving them greater choice and bargaining power. Despite this, demand for high-quality, newly completed office buildings, especially from tech-related sectors, remains strong.

title: Agencia de Comunicacão - A Supermicro anuncia suporte às futuras plataformas NVIDIA Vera Rubin NVL72 e HGX Rubin NVL8, além de expandir sua capacidade de fabricação em escala de rack para soluções de IA com resfriamento a líquido.
summary: Supermicro announced expanded manufacturing capacity and liquid cooling capabilities to support NVIDIA's upcoming Vera Rubin NVL72 and HGX Rubin NVL8 platforms. The company's Data Center Building Block Solutions (DCBBS) are designed for rapid deployment of next-generation AI infrastructure, offering advanced liquid cooling and optimized performance for AI and HPC workloads. This collaboration aims to provide hyperscalers and enterprises with scalable, efficient, and reliable AI infrastructure solutions.

title: Supermicro Announces Support for Upcoming NVIDIA Vera Rubin NVL72, HGX Rubin NVL8 and Expanded Rack-Scale Manufacturing Capacity for Liquid-Cooled AI Solutions
summary: Supermicro is expanding its manufacturing capacity and liquid-cooling capabilities in collaboration with NVIDIA to deliver data center-scale solutions optimized for NVIDIA's forthcoming Vera Rubin and Rubin platforms. This initiative will enable the rapid deployment of flagship NVIDIA Vera Rubin NVL72 and NVIDIA HGX Rubin NVL8 systems, leveraging Supermicro's Data Center Building Block Solutions approach. The company aims to provide hyperscalers and enterprises with advanced AI infrastructure featuring industry-leading liquid-cooling technology for enhanced speed, efficiency, and reliability.

title: A Supermicro leva desempenho de IA em nível empresarial para os mercados corporativo, de edge e consumidor
summary: Supermicro is expanding its portfolio of edge solutions with advanced platforms based on NVIDIA, Intel, and AMD, bringing enterprise-level AI performance to corporate, edge, and consumer markets. The company is unveiling its new Super AI Station and other systems at CES, designed for AI developers, startups, and educational institutions, offering unprecedented performance and energy efficiency. These solutions aim to address the growing demand for AI applications by providing powerful, localized computing capabilities that overcome the limitations of traditional server infrastructures and cloud-based AI services.

title: Wall Street Lunch: D-Wave Quantum Shows Industry First On-Chip Cryogenic Control of Qubits
summary: D-Wave Quantum (QBTS) has achieved an industry-first with scalable, on-chip cryogenic control of qubits, a breakthrough essential for developing larger, commercial-grade gate-model quantum systems by drastically reducing wiring requirements. This milestone, along with AI advancements showcased at CES Vegas by companies like Nvidia and Caterpillar, indicates significant technological progress. Meanwhile, Nio (NIO) targets substantial annual sales growth and infrastructure expansion, and Morgan Stanley forecasts a robust S&P 500 by 2026 driven by synergistic market forces.

title: How Bank of America’s AI Data‑Center Call On Credo Technology Group (CRDO) Has Changed Its Investment Story
summary: Bank of America has identified Credo Technology Group as a key beneficiary of AI infrastructure growth, linking its role to long-term data center plans. While BofA's confidence supports Credo's near-term capital expenditure story, investors will closely watch the company's execution against aggressive revenue targets, especially given strong recent financial results. The article also touches on varying fair value estimates and potential risks related to hyperscaler AI spending normalization.

title: If The US Beats China in EVs This ETF Is Going To Soar | DRIV
summary: The Global X Autonomous & Electric Vehicles ETF (DRIV) is positioned to benefit if the US maintains its lead in EV technology, especially in semiconductors and software, over Chinese manufacturers. The ETF's performance is heavily influenced by trade policy, such as tariffs and federal tax credits, and has a significant allocation to information technology rather than solely automakers. Investors should monitor trade policy announcements and DRIV's sector allocation for future performance indicators.

title: SoftBank seeks US$5 bil margin loan backed by Arm stock — Bloomberg
summary: SoftBank Group Corp is reportedly in talks to secure a US$5 billion margin loan using its Arm Holdings plc shares as collateral to fund further AI investments, particularly in OpenAI. This move is part of Masayoshi Son's strategy to intensify SoftBank's bets on artificial intelligence, following significant investments in the sector. The latest borrowing would increase SoftBank's total margin loans backed by Arm shares to US$18.5 billion, reflecting the company's aggressive expansion in AI despite concerns about the growing debt in the AI market.

title: Micron Up 239% in 2025: Is the Memory Chip Stock Still a Buy in 2026?
summary: Micron Technology, Inc. (MU) saw its stock soar 239.1% in 2025, driven by strong demand for memory chips fueled by the AI boom. The company is well-positioned for continued growth in 2026 due to its involvement in AI, high-performance data centers, and HBM products, strong financial performance evidenced by its Q1 fiscal 2026 results, and a relatively low valuation compared to its peers. Analysts forecast significant revenue and EPS growth for fiscal 2026, making MU a "Strong Buy" according to Zacks Rank.

title: Seagate Technology (STX) Shares Skyrocket, What You Need To Know
summary: Shares of data storage manufacturer Seagate (NASDAQ:STX) jumped 13.9% after analysts raised their price targets, reflecting strong investor confidence in the data storage sector. Morgan Stanley notably increased its price target to $337 from $270 and reaffirmed an Overweight rating. This positive outlook is driven by high demand for hard disk drives (HDD) due to AI sector growth and improved supply-and-demand balance.

title: AMD stock slips after CES AI chip push puts OpenAI deal back in focus
summary: AMD shares fell despite the company showcasing new AI processors at CES, including the MI455 designed for data centers and the MI440X for on-premises use. The mixed market reaction suggests investors are looking for concrete sales growth from AMD's product roadmap, especially with upcoming U.S. labor reports that could influence interest rates and tech valuations. AMD is positioning itself as an alternative to Nvidia, particularly for enterprise buyers prioritizing on-premises AI deployment, though it faces challenges in gaining market share against Nvidia's established ecosystem.

title: Marvell to buy networking equipment firm XConn in $540 million deal amid AI infrastructure push
summary: Marvell Technology announced its acquisition of XConn Technologies for approximately $540 million, aiming to strengthen its data center hardware offerings amidst the growing demand for AI infrastructure. This move is expected to expand Marvell's networking portfolio, essential for connecting hardware in AI data centers and enhancing data processing speeds. The transaction, comprising 60% cash and 40% stock, is anticipated to close in early 2026 and contribute to Marvell's sales and profit from the second half of fiscal year 2027.

title: Tesla Stock Falls on Rising Competition in Robo-Taxi Market
summary: Tesla shares fell after Nvidia's CEO presented new self-driving technology at CES, raising concerns about increased competition in the robo-taxi market. Nvidia's Alpamayo system, which offers deep reasoning for autonomous vehicles, will be integrated into Mercedes' CLA models this year. Analysts still see significant long-term growth potential for Tesla's robo-taxi unit despite the rising competition.

title: Amkor Technology stock hits 52-week high at $47.28
summary: Amkor Technology (AMKR) stock reached a new 52-week high of $47.28, reflecting a significant milestone for the semiconductor company. The stock has seen a 64.08% increase over the past year and a 94.14% surge in six months, largely due to strong financial results and increased AI demand. Analysts have raised price targets, indicating continued optimism for its future growth.

title: Stryker (SYK) Stock Trades Up, Here Is Why
summary: Shares of medical technology company Stryker (NYSE: SYK) jumped 4.1% following an upgrade from Raymond James to "Outperform" with a $418 price target. The analyst noted Stryker's strong performance as a "highest quality compounder" in medical technology and argued that its current valuation offers an attractive entry point. The stock is up 4.7% year-to-date, though it remains below its 52-week high.

title: Stock Market Live January 6: Nvidia Revs Up, S&P 500 (VOO) Slips
summary: Nvidia announced plans to produce AI chips and software for robotaxis by 2027, with Mercedes-Benz already planning to use Nvidia's tech. This news has led Wedbush analyst Daniel Ives to call Nvidia, Microsoft, and Oracle "table-pounder opportunities" for investors, highlighting underestimation of demand for Nvidia. Meanwhile, Ford reported a 6% sales growth in 2025, but faced headwinds in Q4 from supply chain issues and decreased EV sales due to expiring tax credits, leading to a mixed market performance where the S&P 500 (VOO) slightly declined despite Nvidia's gains.

title: New car ‘brain’ lets automakers add AI features without redesigning vehicles
summary: Visteon (NASDAQ: VC) has launched a new AI-ADAS Compute Module, powered by NVIDIA DRIVE AGX Orin, designed to allow automakers to integrate AI-powered cockpit features or Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) without overhauling vehicle electrical architectures. This plug-and-play solution offers dual-role configuration, a hybrid cloud-to-edge pipeline, and multimodal AI capabilities through Visteon's cognitoAI™, aiming to reduce integration risk and accelerate time-to-market. The module addresses the challenge of adding AI capabilities to vehicles cost-effectively and flexibly, supporting the transition to software-defined vehicles.

title: Innoviz stock jumps premarket as LiDAR maker adds camera to InnovizThree, touts Nvidia edge tie-up
summary: Innoviz (INVZ) shares rose 7.3% in premarket trading after the company announced new developments ahead of CES 2026. Innoviz unveiled a new InnovizThree LiDAR sensor integrated with an RGB camera, and also revealed an integration of its InnovizSMARTer sensor with Nvidia’s Jetson Orin Nano for real-time 3D perception. These advancements aim to simplify multi-sensor perception for OEMs and enable more scalable LiDAR technology.

title: KLA Corporation Shares Hit All-Time High of US$1,310.0
summary: KLA Corporation's shares reached a new all-time high of US$1,310.0 before rising further to US$1,337.0, marking a 95.64% increase over the past 12 months. This significant performance is backed by a perfect Piotroski Score of 9 and strong analyst upgrades, indicating exceptional financial strength and investor confidence despite potential overvaluation. The company also announced a quarterly dividend of US$1.90 per share, reflecting its commitment to shareholder returns.
source: Investing.com Brasil - Finanças, Câmbio e Investimentos

title: Why We Highly Rate JPMorgan Large Cap Growth
summary: JPMorgan Large Cap Growth R6 (JLGMX) receives a Gold Morningstar Medalist Rating due to its highly experienced lead manager, Giri Devulapally, and a solid team of sector analysts. The fund's strategy combines robust fundamental research with a momentum component, enabling early identification and long-term holding of market-winning companies like NVIDIA and Tesla. Devulapally's tenure has resulted in impressive performance, consistently outperforming peers and the Russell 1000 Growth Index while effectively managing market volatility.

title: Nvidia Corp. (NVDA) Raymond James Stays Bullish with a “Strong Buy” Rating
summary: Raymond James has reiterated its "Strong Buy" rating for Nvidia (NVDA) with a 12-month target of $272.00 per share, following CEO Jensen Huang's CES keynote which reinforced confidence in the company’s market leadership in AI. Analysts noted strong demand, robust December sales, and solid long-term supply chain planning, with Nvidia confirming production of its next-generation Vera Rubin platform. Both technical and fundamental indicators support a highly constructive outlook, with a consensus "Strong Buy" rating and an implied 35% upside reflecting confidence in Nvidia's growth potential.

title: Arbe Robotics stock jumps premarket on Nvidia link as CES 2026 opens
summary: Arbe Robotics Ltd (ARBE) stock soared about 24% premarket after announcing a collaboration with Nvidia to combine its automotive-grade radar with Nvidia's accelerated computing for a new driving platform. This development coincides with the opening of CES 2026, where Arbe will demonstrate its AI-based perception technology. The stock boost follows an 8.3% climb on Monday, with traders closely watching for new customer acquisitions or accelerated timelines from the CES showcase.

title: Silicon Sovereignty: Texas Instruments’ SM1 Fab Leads the Charge in America’s Semiconductor Renaissance
summary: Texas Instruments' SM1 fab in Sherman, Texas, has begun high-volume production of analog and embedded processing chips, marking a significant milestone for American technology under the CHIPS and Science Act. This facility aims to reduce fabrication costs, increase efficiency, and provide stable domestic hardware for the AI revolution and autonomous vehicles. The SM1 fab is a key part of the U.S. strategy to secure its technological lead and de-risk the hardware supply chain against geopolitical instability.

title: NVIDIA Reveals Why the Company Is “Immune” to Memory Shortages — and How The Firm Prepaid Inventory to Keep the AI Boom Running
summary: NVIDIA claims to be "immune" to the current memory shortages affecting the industry, attributing this to early and massive investments in partners, including prepayments, to expand capacity. The company's direct purchasing of DRAM at a global scale and its ability to transform it into CoWoS supercomputers provide a significant advantage in managing its supply chain. While NVIDIA's AI division benefits from these strategies, its consumer gaming business, however, is feeling the pinch, experiencing product launch delays and necessitating the reintroduction of older GPU models.

title: Caterpillar launches AI assistant for equipment management
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has introduced Cat AI Assistant, an AI solution designed to enhance how customers interact with its equipment and digital applications. This assistant integrates Caterpillar's digital portfolio and data into a conversational interface, providing insights and assistance for equipment buying, maintenance, management, and operation. The system leverages the NVIDIA Jetson Thor platform and is set to be demonstrated at CES 2026, with the off-board version launching in Q1 2026.

title: AI 'coach in the cab' is changing how people run heavy machines
summary: Caterpillar (NYSE: CAT) has launched Cat AI Assistant, an AI client that unifies Caterpillar's digital applications and data into a conversational assistant. This assistant leverages the company's Helios data platform and NVIDIA Jetson Thor for advanced AI models, aiming to help customers buy, maintain, manage, and operate equipment more efficiently and safely. The off-board rollout is planned for Q1 2026, with in-cab applications undergoing final validation and capabilities to be demonstrated at CES 2026.

title: Arista Networks (ANET): New Buy Recommendation for This Technology Giant
summary: Melius Research analyst Ben Reitzes has maintained a Buy rating on Arista Networks (ANET) with a price target of $200.00. Arista Networks reported strong financials for the quarter ending September 30, with revenues of $2.31 billion and net profits of $853 million, showcasing significant growth compared to the previous year. The overall analyst consensus for Arista Networks is a Strong Buy, with an average price target of $171.42.

title: Is Costco Stock Set to Rebound Higher in 2026?
summary: Costco Wholesale (NASDAQ: COST) stock faced a "rare weak stretch" in 2025 despite strong business growth, including an 8.2% rise in total sales and 14% growth in membership fee income in fiscal Q1 2026. The article questions whether Costco's stock, currently trading at a high valuation of 47 times earnings, is overvalued, fairly valued, or undervalued, suggesting that the lofty price leaves little room for error and could lead to underperformance. Despite the company's solid fundamentals, the author indicates a preference to stay on the sidelines due to valuation concerns.

title: Introducing InnovizSMARTer: Combining Scalable, Cost-Effective LiDAR with Edge Compute Platform for Smart Infrastructure Powered by NVIDIA Jetson Orin Nano
summary: Innoviz Technologies has announced the integration of its InnovizSMARTer LiDAR with NVIDIA Jetson Orin Nano, creating a complete far-edge solution for real-time 3D perception. This solution enables wireless deployment of LiDAR sensors in bandwidth-constrained environments, significantly reducing centralized processing costs and data transmission requirements. The collaboration aims to make advanced LiDAR technology accessible and scalable for various applications like smart cities, mobility, and perimeter security.

title: A Look At FTI Consulting (FCN) Valuation After Mixed Short And Long Term Share Returns
summary: FTI Consulting (FCN) has experienced mixed share performance, with a recent 5.2% gain over the past week contrasting with a 7.5% decline over the past year. The current share price of $179.06 suggests the stock is approximately 7.9% overvalued based on a fair value of $166, according to one narrative. However, its P/E ratio of 20.4x is below the industry average, potentially indicating room for multiple expansion if sentiment improves.

title: Bull of the Day: Western Digital (WDC)
summary: Western Digital (WDC) is highlighted as a "Bull of the Day" due to its strong performance driven by artificial intelligence and increasing demand for storage solutions, particularly in enterprise hard disk drives. The company has consistently exceeded EPS estimates and its stock has surged, outperforming both the market and its peers. With robust fundamentals and a solid technical trend, Western Digital is expected to continue its outperformance.

title: NVIDIA releases new physical AI models, plus autonomous vehicle tools
summary: NVIDIA has introduced new open models, frameworks, simulation tools, datasets, and AI infrastructure designed for robotics and self-driving vehicle developers. These advancements aim to enable "physical AI" — models that can understand, reason, and plan actions in dynamic real-world environments. The company emphasizes the shift towards "generalist-specialist" robots and unveiled the Jetson T4000 module and Alpamayo models to power next-generation autonomous machines and vehicles.

title: Magna to Offer Drive Hyperion-Compatible ECUs and Tier-1 Integration Services for NVIDIA Drive AV
summary: Magna has expanded its collaboration with NVIDIA to offer Drive Hyperion-compatible ECUs and comprehensive system integration services for NVIDIA DRIVE AV stack. This partnership aims to accelerate the deployment of software-defined vehicles for OEMs by providing expertise across L2++, L3, and L4 autonomy levels, including hardware-software coordination, thorough testing, and global rollout support. The initiative reinforces Magna's role as a leader in automotive system integration and NVIDIA's advanced AI compute capabilities.

title: Cybersecurity firm Fortinet schedules Feb. 5 call on 2025 results
summary: Fortinet (NASDAQ: FTNT) announced it will hold a conference call on Thursday, February 5, 2026, at 1:30 p.m. PT / 4:30 p.m. ET to discuss its fourth quarter and full-year 2025 financial results. The live broadcast will be accessible on the company's investor relations website. The announcement comes after Q3 2025 revenue of $1,724.9M and operating income of $547.3M, with recent company history highlighting AI-focused partnerships and strong product momentum.

title: Fermi Inc (FRMI) stock jumps nearly 10% as class-action filing adds pressure
summary: Fermi Inc (FRMI) shares rose nearly 10% in midday trading following the filing of a securities-fraud class action lawsuit. The lawsuit alleges Fermi overstated tenant demand for its "Project Matador" campus and downplayed risks associated with a single tenant's $150 million funding commitment, which was later terminated. Investors are keenly awaiting a January 8-9 conference appearance for updates on tenants and financing for the company's 11-gigawatt power-and-data campus in Texas.

title: Aeva Introduces Omni, the First Compact Wide-View Short-Range 4D LiDAR Sensor for Physical AI Applications
summary: Aeva (Nasdaq: AEVA) announced Aeva Omni, the industry’s first wide-view short-range 4D LiDAR sensor for physical AI applications, developed in partnership with LG Innotek. Omni features a panoramic 360-degree horizontal and 90-degree vertical field of view, detecting velocity and position simultaneously with immunity to interference. Designed for harsh environments, Omni extends Aeva's LiDAR-on-Chip technology to provide robust short-range perception for autonomous vehicles, robotics, drones, and smart infrastructure.

title: Prediction: Synopsys Stock Will Soar Over the Next Decade. Here's 1 Nvidia-Related Reason Why.
summary: Synopsys (NASDAQ: SNPS) is poised for significant growth over the next decade, largely due to its acquisition of Ansys, which expands its market reach and customer base. The partnership with Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA), involving a $2 billion investment, will further enhance Synopsys's "silicon-to-systems" offering by integrating Nvidia's powerful computing capabilities. This strategic move is expected to drive substantial growth for Synopsys in the rapidly expanding electronic design automation market.

title: Amkor Technology (AMKR) Hits 25-Year High on Rosy Prospects
summary: Amkor Technology Inc. (AMKR) saw its stock reach a 25-year high after Needham & Company upgraded its price target by 35% to $50, citing Amkor's potential to become a leader in Chip on Wafer on Substrate (CoWoS) technology. This surge is driven by increasing demand for AI chips and an anticipated transition to Chip on Polymer on Substrate (CoPoS), which could lead Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co Ltd. to outsource CoWoS demand to Amkor.

title: Lockheed Martin Stock Hits November 2024 Highs On Production Agreement With Department Of War
summary: Lockheed Martin (LMT) stock reached November 2024 highs after signing a major long-term agreement with the U.S. Department of War. This deal aims to increase the annual production of PAC-3 Missile Segment Enhancement interceptors from 600 to 2,000 units, tripling output under a new seven-year framework. The agreement, part of the Department of War’s Acquisition Transformation Strategy, is expected to create thousands of new U.S. jobs and enhance the defense industrial base.

title: Are Quantum Computing ETFs the Safest Bet for 10-Year Growth?
summary: Quantum computing exchange-traded funds (ETFs) offer a way to invest in the emerging, high-risk field of quantum computing without the idiosyncratic risks of individual stocks. The article highlights two specific ETFs: Defiance Quantum ETF (QTUM) and WisdomTree Quantum Computing ETF (WQTM), comparing their holdings, expense ratios, and performance histories. It emphasizes that quantum computing is a long-term investment, still in the developmental stage, and should not be expected to yield immediate returns.

title: Riot Platforms (RIOT) Valuation Check As Leadership Changes Refocus Growth On Data Centers
summary: Riot Platforms (RIOT) is repositioning its strategy towards data centers, reflected in new leadership appointments and incentivized growth beyond Bitcoin mining. Despite a recent stock rally, its valuation suggests undervaluation compared to analyst targets, hinting at significant upside potential if the data center pivot proves successful. However, the company faces substantial capital requirements for this transition and remains exposed to Bitcoin price volatility.

title: Intel Launches Next-Gen ‘Panther Lake’ Chips At CES
summary: Intel launched its Panther Lake architecture-based chips, Intel Core Ultra Series 3, at CES in Las Vegas, marking the first time the company has used its new 18A manufacturing platform. These next-generation chips promise a 60 percent performance improvement over the previous Lunar Lake Series 2 and will power over 200 PC designs with enhanced compute, graphics, and battery life. Intel aims to regain market share against competitors like AMD and ARM-based chip makers by focusing on power efficiency, CPU and GPU performance, AI compute, and x86 app compatibility.

title: CoreCap Advisors LLC Has $41.43 Million Stake in Goldman Sachs MarketBeta U.S. Equity ETF $GSUS
summary: CoreCap Advisors LLC significantly increased its stake in the Goldman Sachs MarketBeta U.S. Equity ETF (GSUS) by 3.3% during the third quarter, bringing its total holdings to 448,326 shares valued at $41.43 million. This investment now represents 1.5% of CoreCap's portfolio and is its 9th largest position. Other institutional investors like CWM LLC, Qube Research & Technologies Ltd, and Private Trust Co. NA also adjusted their holdings in GSUS.

title: WeRide's Robotaxi GXR Becomes World's 1st Equipped with NVIDIA DRIVE Thor X Chip
summary: WeRide, a global L4 Robotaxi partner of NVIDIA, announced that its Robotaxi GXR is the world's first to be equipped with the NVIDIA DRIVE Thor X chip. This advancement allows the Robotaxi GXR to achieve fully unmanned commercial operations in China and the UAE.

title: Nvidia: Full Steam Ahead With an Impressive Array of Announcements at CES 2026
summary: Nvidia showcased its latest product innovations at CES 2026, including the Vera Rubin products set for release in the second half of 2026 which are expected to deliver five times the performance of current Blackwell products for certain AI inference tasks. The company also announced a full-stack autonomous driving solution to be integrated into the Mercedes-Benz CLA in Q1 2026, further solidifying its position in the physical AI market. Morningstar maintains its $240 fair value estimate for Nvidia, believing the stock to be undervalued despite recent AI bubble concerns.

title: Aeva’s LiDAR Innovations At CES 2026 Have Retail Investors Buzzing – Traders Eye Big Gains
summary: Aeva Technologies made significant announcements at CES 2026, introducing its new Omni 4D LiDAR sensor for physical AI applications and confirming its FMCW 4D LiDAR technology's selection for Nvidia's DRIVE Hyperion platform. These innovations led to a surge in AEVA shares and generated highly bullish sentiment among retail investors. The company's stock has recovered significantly over the past year despite a slight year-to-date dip.

title: Adobe Underperforms Broader Tech Gains: What the "Software Slog" Means for AI Monetization
summary: Adobe Inc. (ADBE) underperformed broader tech gains on January 6, 2026, creating investor skepticism around the immediate monetization of its AI strategies despite strong Q4 2025 revenues. A "Hold" downgrade by Jefferies Financial Group Inc. (JEF) and concerns over decelerating growth and competition from AI-native startups highlight a broader shift from "AI Euphoria" to "Fundamental Scrutiny" in the software sector. The article suggests Adobe's success will depend on its ability to effectively monetize its AI offerings, particularly in the video AI space, to move past the current valuation gap.

title: Super Micro Computer expands liquid-cooled AI infrastructure support for Nvidia’s Vera Rubin (SMCI:NASDAQ)
summary: Super Micro Computer (SMCI) is expanding its manufacturing capacity and liquid-cooling capabilities with Nvidia (NVDA) to accelerate the delivery of data-center solutions. These solutions are optimized for Nvidia’s Vera Rubin and Rubin platforms. This collaboration aims to enhance support for Nvidia's advanced AI infrastructure.

title: Brokers Suggest Investing in JD.com (JD): Read This Before Placing a Bet
summary: This article examines brokerage recommendations for JD.com (JD), noting an average recommendation of 1.57 (approaching Strong Buy) from 21 firms. However, it cautions against solely relying on these recommendations due to a potential positive bias from brokerage firms' vested interests. Instead, it suggests validating such information with the Zacks Rank, which currently rates JD.com as a "Strong Sell" (#5) due to declining earnings estimates.

title: The Best Dividend ETF to Invest $1,000 in Right Now
summary: The Schwab U.S. Dividend Equity ETF (SCHD) is presented as a strong investment option for dividend investors despite recent underperformance compared to the S&P 500. The ETF follows a specific index that screens for financially strong companies with consistent dividend growth, high yields, and fast-growing dividends. Its lower exposure to technology stocks positions it well for a potential market rotation away from concentrated tech leadership.

title: A Deep Dive into the iShares MSCI World ETF’s Standout Year
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH) had a strong year in 2025, returning over 22% and growing its assets to more than $6.8 billion, primarily driven by U.S. technology stocks. The ETF provides diversified access to large and mid-cap companies across 23 developed nations, with a significant allocation to U.S. mega-cap firms, particularly in technology. Despite its concentration in U.S. tech, the fund holds 1,320 individual securities and maintains a 5-star Morningstar rating, making it suitable for investors seeking developed market exposure while avoiding emerging economies.

title: Visteon Launches Flexible Compute Solution with NVIDIA AI to Accelerate Smart Cockpit and ADAS Development
summary: Visteon has launched its next-generation AI-ADAS Compute Module, powered by NVIDIA, designed to help automakers integrate AI-powered features and advanced driver assistance systems (ADAS) using a single, scalable platform. This plug-and-play solution addresses cost and complexity challenges, offering flexibility for intelligent cockpit experiences or ADAS safety functions. The module leverages NVIDIA DRIVE AGX Orin and AI Enterprise software, enabling multimodal intelligence and supporting accelerated development for automotive applications.

title: Hesai Selected by NVIDIA as Lidar Partner for NVIDIA DRIVE Hyperion 10 to Enable Level 4 Fleet Deployment
summary: Hesai Technology has been chosen by NVIDIA as the lidar partner for NVIDIA DRIVE AGX Hyperion 10, a reference architecture designed to make vehicles Level 4-ready for autonomous fleets. This collaboration highlights Hesai's ETX, an automotive-grade ultra-long-range lidar for L3 and L4 autonomous driving, reinforcing their long-standing partnership with NVIDIA to bring advanced autonomous driving technologies to market. The DRIVE Hyperion platform integrates compute, sensors, and safety to accelerate the deployment of full autonomy.

title: Why SoFi Stock Dropped13% in December
summary: SoFi Technologies (NASDAQ: SOFI) stock dropped 12% in December, despite the company's continued record-breaking customer growth and expansion into new financial products, including a stablecoin. The decline is attributed to its premium valuation and potentially falling cryptocurrency prices impacting adjacent stocks. While SoFi is performing well and is sustainably profitable, its high valuation (53 times trailing 12-month earnings) and exposure to the crypto market may have contributed to the recent stock movement.

title: Davis Select International ETF (BATS:DINT) Stock Price Up 39.1% – Still a Buy?
summary: The Davis Select International ETF (BATS:DINT) saw its share price increase by 39.1% in mid-day trading Monday, closing at $29.6390 with a market capitalization of $285.42 million. Despite a 56% decline in trading volume, several institutional investors, including Integrity Wealth Advisors Inc. and Geneos Wealth Management Inc., have recently adjusted their stakes in DINT. The ETF, launched in 2018, actively manages a portfolio of international companies outside the US for long-term capital growth.

title: 1 AI & 1 Quantum Stock Beat NVIDIA in 2025, Promise More Gains Ahead
summary: Two companies, D-Wave Quantum Inc. (QBTS) and Palantir Technologies Inc. (PLTR), significantly outperformed NVIDIA (NVDA) in 2025 and are expected to continue their strong growth into 2026. D-Wave's success is fueled by its Advantage2 platform and expanding customer base, leading to robust revenue and earnings growth predictions. Palantir's strong performance is attributed to increasing demand for its Artificial Intelligence Platform (AIP) across commercial and government sectors, with analysts expecting substantial earnings growth and continued upside.

title: How Ciena’s AI Webscale Surge And S&P 500 Prospects At Ciena (CIEN) Has Changed Its Investment Story
summary: Ciena has recently reported strong fiscal fourth-quarter results, driven by a significant increase in AI-focused webscale customers, which now constitute 42% of its sales. The company is also seen as a strong candidate for S&P 500 index inclusion in early 2026, potentially impacting its investor base and liquidity. This article examines how Ciena's evolving role in AI infrastructure is reshaping its investment narrative and long-term business outlook, projecting $6.5 billion in revenue and $590.5 million in earnings by 2028.
