title: Should iShares S&P 100 ETF (OEF) Be on Your Investing Radar?
summary: The iShares S&P 100 ETF (OEF) is highlighted as a large-cap blend ETF focusing on major US companies, offering stability and diversification. The article details its expense ratio, sector exposure with top holdings in Information Technology, and its performance and risk profile. It suggests OEF as a strong option for investors in this segment, while also mentioning alternative ETFs like IVV and VOO.

title: BNP Paribas Exane Starts Waste Connections Inc. (WCN) at Outperform
summary: BNP Paribas Exane analyst Seth Weber has initiated coverage on Waste Connections Inc. (WCN) with an Outperform rating. This article, published on StreetInsider.com, provides premium stock market news. To access the full details, readers need to sign in or upgrade to StreetInsider.com Premium.

title: Figure Technology (FIGR) Soars to All-Time High — here’s why
summary: Figure Technology Solutions, Inc. (NASDAQ:FIGR) reached an all-time high amidst investor expectations of further rate cuts by the Federal Reserve. The stock rallied significantly, driven by the prospect that lower borrowing rates could boost demand for mortgages and other loans, benefiting lending companies like FIGR. While acknowledging FIGR's potential, the article also promotes other AI stocks with supposedly higher upside potential.

title: Ryanair Reports 7% December Traffic Growth and 206.5 Million Rolling Annual Passengers
summary: Ryanair announced a 7% year-on-year increase in December 2025 traffic, reaching 14.5 million passengers, while maintaining a 92% load factor. The airline's rolling 12-month passenger count grew by 5% to 206.5 million, with a steady 94% load factor, reinforcing its strong market position. An analyst has a Buy rating on RYAAY stock with a $74.00 price target, and TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, also rates it "Outperform" due to its strong financial performance and strategic initiatives.

title: 【即時新聞】YieldMax CVNA Option Income Strategy ETF 宣布每週股息，股東注意
summary: The YieldMax CVNA Option Income Strategy ETF (CVNY) has declared a weekly dividend of $0.3112 per share, payable on January 9th. Shareholders must hold the ETF by January 8th to be eligible for this dividend. This ETF focuses on option strategies to provide stable income, making it attractive to investors seeking regular payouts.

title: Gene Munster Flags Positive Signal For Nvidia And Apple As Foxconn Smashes Q4 Revenue Estimates
summary: Foxconn Technology Group reported record-breaking Q4 revenue of NTD 2.6 trillion ($82.7 billion), largely driven by surging demand for AI servers and networking products. This strong performance, exceeding Wall Street expectations, reinforced optimism for both Nvidia, a key partner in AI server manufacturing, and Apple, despite a slight decline in Foxconn's iPhone assembly segment. Gene Munster viewed these results as a positive indicator for Apple's December quarter iPhone demand.

title: Assessing Quantum Computing (QUBT) Valuation As CES 2026 Demos And Luminar Deal Draw New Interest
summary: Quantum Computing (QUBT) is gaining attention due to upcoming CES 2026 demonstrations and a proposed US$110 million acquisition of Luminar Semiconductor, despite a recent share price decline. The article assesses QUBT's valuation, noting its 3.1x price-to-book ratio is higher than the US tech industry average but lower than its closest peers, giving a mixed signal. Investors are advised to consider the company's significant net loss and limited revenue, as well as execution risks if the Luminar deal goes through.

title: AMD Crashes CES 2026 With All-Out Offensive Against Nvidia, Touts ‘World’s Best AI Rack’ — And Retail Is Delighted
summary: At CES 2026, AMD launched new chips including the MI440X and previewed the MI500 Series, intensifying its competition with Nvidia in the AI data center market. CEO Lisa Su unveiled Helios, an AI rack system she claimed was the "world's best," while also introducing new AI-powered PC chips and gaming processors. Retail investor sentiment on Stocktwits shifted to "extremely bullish" following the announcements, highlighting AMD's strong performance and future pipeline.

title: A Look At Semtech (SMTC) Valuation After Recent Share Price Weakness And Long Term Returns
summary: Semtech (SMTC) has experienced recent share price weakness, with a 30-day decline of 6.62% and a year-to-date decline of 1.22%, despite stronger long-term returns. The company is considered 9.3% undervalued based on a narrative fair value of US$82, driven by demand from hyperscale data centers and AI infrastructure, potentially leading to significant revenue and margin expansion. However, Simply Wall St's DCF model suggests the stock is overvalued at US$46.41, raising questions about whether growth expectations are outpacing fundamentals.

title: Intel launches first chips built on its most advanced 18A manufacturing process
summary: Intel has unveiled its new Intel Core Ultra X9 and X7 processors, which are the first chips to be built on its advanced 18A manufacturing process. Announced at CES 2026, these chips will be part of the new 18A Panther Lake Core Ultra Series 3 lineup and are intended for top personal computer manufacturers. The company claims these are its most advanced processors produced in the U.S., marking a significant step to regain its standing against rivals.

title: Why KLA stock jumped 6% and what CES headlines mean for KLAC next
summary: KLA Corp (KLAC) shares rose 6.3% on Monday, outperforming chip-equipment peers, driven by CES headlines including Nvidia's new AI chip announcements. The rally extends a strong start to 2026 for semiconductor equipment makers, with investors now watching if this momentum translates into future orders. However, the stock's recent jump also exposes it to risks from any potential slowdown in AI-led spending or increased U.S.-China trade tensions.

title: Uber stock slides as CES robotaxi debut collides with fresh Wall Street downgrade
summary: Uber's stock slid 2.56% to $80.74 following the unveiling of a "production-intent" robotaxi at CES and a downgrade to Sell from Melius Research. The decline reflects investor concerns over intensifying driverless-car competition and Uber's long-term economics as a "demand aggregator" in the robotaxi space. The company faces scrutiny over how much of each fare it can retain when autonomous technology owners gain leverage.

title: Applied Materials stock jumps about 6% as CES buzz lifts chip-equipment names
summary: Applied Materials (AMAT.O) stock rose about 6% as the Consumer Electronics Show (CES) created buzz around chip-equipment names like AMD and Nvidia, leading to anticipation for increased capital spending in the semiconductor industry. Investors are watching for any insights into AI-driven demand and data-center investments from CES keynotes, though concerns remain about U.S. export controls impacting China-related demand and potential revenue losses for Applied Materials. The company's next earnings report on February 12th will provide crucial guidance on wafer-fab tool demand and margins.

title: NVIDIA Rubin Platform, Open Models, Autonomous Driving: NVIDIA Presents Blueprint for the Future at CES
summary: At CES 2026, NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang unveiled the Rubin platform, an extreme-codesigned AI platform in full production, and introduced Alpamayo, an open reasoning model family for autonomous vehicle development. He emphasized NVIDIA's commitment to open models for various domains, trained on NVIDIA supercomputers, and showcased AI integration into personal devices and physical AI through robotics and autonomous driving. Huang highlighted NVIDIA's full-stack approach to drive AI innovation, from data centers to physical AI applications.

title: 3 Stocks Under $50 We Think Twice About
summary: This article advises caution on three stocks under $50: Jamf (JAMF), Smith & Wesson (SWBI), and Vishay Precision (VPG), citing concerns like underwhelming growth, suboptimal cost structures, and declining revenues. It suggests investors consider alternative, higher-quality stocks instead, highlighting past successes from StockStory's recommendations.

title: As AMD chases Nvidia, here’s how it’s positioning itself for the future of AI
summary: AMD CEO Lisa Su highlighted the company's AI strategy at CES, introducing the MI455 chip with significantly more transistors and HBM4 memory. Su emphasized AMD's role in addressing the ongoing demand for computing power and positioning itself as a strong competitor in the AI hardware market. The company aims to provide cost benefits and enhanced performance with its next-generation products.

title: NVIDIA Kicks Off the Next Generation of AI With Rubin — Six New Chips, One Incredible AI Supercomputer
summary: NVIDIA has launched the Rubin platform, a new generation of AI supercomputers featuring six advanced chips designed to accelerate AI development. The Rubin platform promises significantly reduced training times and inference token costs, aiming for up to a 10x reduction in inference token cost and requiring 4x fewer GPUs for MoE models compared to the Blackwell platform. Major industry players like Microsoft, OpenAI, and Meta are already on board to adopt this new technology, which introduces innovations like NVIDIA Vera CPU, Rubin GPU, and NVLink 6 Switch.

title: Credo Technology Group Holding Ltd (CRDO): New Buy Recommendation for This Technology Giant
summary: Mizuho Securities reiterated a Buy rating on Credo Technology Group Holding Ltd (CRDO) with a price target of $225.00. This recommendation comes despite negative corporate insider sentiment, with several insiders selling shares recently. The company significantly grew its quarterly revenue to $268.03 million and achieved a net profit of $82.64 million, a substantial improvement from a net loss in the previous year.

title: Lucid, Nuro, and Uber Unveil Global Robotaxi at CES, Announce Autonomous On-Road Testing
summary: At CES 2026, Lucid Group, Nuro, and Uber Technologies unveiled their production-intent robotaxi, designed for a global service set to launch in the San Francisco Bay Area later in 2026. The robotaxi, based on the Lucid Gravity, features advanced sensor technology, an intuitive in-cabin rider experience, and is powered by NVIDIA DRIVE AGX Thor. Autonomous on-road testing, led by Nuro, has already begun, marking a key step towards validation and market deployment.

title: Aeva and NVIDIA to Integrate 4D LiDAR as Reference Sensor within the NVIDIA DRIVE Hyperion Platform Ecosystem
summary: Aeva announced its 4D LiDAR technology will be integrated as the reference sensor within the NVIDIA DRIVE Hyperion autonomous vehicle platform. This collaboration expands Aeva's role as a core LiDAR sensor supplier for global automotive OEMs, targeting production vehicles by 2028. The integration aims to enhance Level 3 and Level 4 automated driving by providing superior detection, tracking, and long-range performance through Aeva's unique per-point instant velocity measurement.

title: Nvidia Details New A.I. Chips and Autonomous Car Project With Mercedes
summary: Nvidia introduced its new Vera Rubin A.I. chip at CES, promising increased computing power with less energy consumption. This chip, shipping later in the year, is designed to enhance A.I. training efficiency and reduce operational costs for companies like Microsoft and Amazon. Additionally, Nvidia announced a partnership with Mercedes-Benz to integrate its self-driving technology into cars this year, rivaling Tesla's Autopilot.

title: Mercury General (MCY): Buy, Sell, or Hold Post Q3 Earnings?
summary: Mercury General (MCY) has seen significant stock appreciation, beating the S&P 500 by 27% in six months, now trading at $90.58. Despite its recent performance, analysts are not recommending it as a buy due to slim projected revenue growth, an uninspiring return on equity, and a valuation of 2.1x forward P/B, suggesting limited upside compared to potential downside risks.

title: 3 Reasons LOPE is Risky and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: This article identifies Grand Canyon Education (LOPE) as a risky investment due to weak student growth, barely growing EPS, and only slight improvements in projected free cash flow. The author suggests caution, despite a reasonable valuation, and recommends seeking other investment opportunities. The article concludes by promoting a curated list of "High Quality" alternative stock selections.

title: Visa (NYSE: V) Stock Price Prediction and Forecast 2026-2030 (Jan 2026)
summary: This article provides a stock price prediction and forecast for Visa (NYSE: V) from 2026 to 2030. Despite potential regulatory scrutiny, 24/7 Wall St. anticipates significant gains for Visa stock by the end of the decade, driven by its dominance in the global payments processing industry, advancements in digital payments, and strong financial performance. The forecast outlines projected revenue, EPS, and price targets for each year, with an estimated share price of $522.60 by 2030.

title: Could This AI ETF Surge 300% and Become the Next Nvidia?
summary: The article discusses the Invesco AI and Next Gen Software ETF (IGPT), highlighting its potential for significant long-term growth, possibly triple-digit gains, despite not being expected to replicate Nvidia's monumental returns. The ETF, which holds Nvidia as its second-largest component, has evolved from a software fund to an AI-centric one, boasting $652 million in assets and significant exposure to semiconductor and AI software companies like Adobe and Snowflake. It offers diversification while capitalizing on the substantial growth tailwinds in the AI software market, which Goldman Sachs projects to expand significantly by 2030.

title: Why a $7 Million Bond ETF Buy Signals a Defensive Move Inside a $560 Million Portfolio
summary: LaSalle St. Investment Advisors bought 135,360 shares of the iShares 0-5 Year Investment Grade Corporate Bond ETF (SLQD), valued at $6.88 million, indicating a defensive strategy for capital preservation and steady income. This allocation, while a new position, is for diversification rather than chasing high returns, given the ETF's focus on short-duration, high-quality corporate bonds. It suggests an emphasis on risk management within its $560 million portfolio.

title: NVIDIA BlueField-4 Powers New Class of AI-Native Storage Infrastructure for the Next Frontier of AI
summary: NVIDIA announced its BlueField-4 data processor powers the new Inference Context Memory Storage Platform, an AI-native storage infrastructure designed for gigascale inference and agentic AI. This platform extends AI agents' long-term memory, enables high-bandwidth context sharing across AI systems, and boosts tokens per second and power efficiency by up to 5x. It addresses the growing need for scalable storage infrastructure for vast context data generated by increasingly complex AI models.

title: NVIDIA Announces Alpamayo Family of Open-Source AI Models and Tools to Accelerate Safe, Reasoning-Based Autonomous Vehicle Development
summary: NVIDIA has unveiled the Alpamayo family of open AI models, simulation tools, and datasets aimed at accelerating the development of safe, reasoning-based autonomous vehicles. This initiative introduces chain-of-thought, reasoning-based vision language action (VLA) models that enable AVs to think through novel scenarios and explain their decisions, improving trust and safety. Mobility leaders like JLR, Lucid, and Uber, as well as the AV research community, are showing interest in adopting Alpamayo to advance level 4 autonomy.

title: Watch the NVIDIA CES 2026 keynote with CEO Jensen Huang live here: AI, robotics updates and more
summary: NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang's CES 2026 keynote focused heavily on AI, robotics, and autonomous vehicles, showcasing advancements like the new Alpamayo AI for self-driving cars. The event also featured live demonstrations of robots and discussed NVIDIA's strategy for generating data to train AI using its Cosmos platform. NVIDIA remains a key player in AI infrastructure, with its announcements closely watched by both tech enthusiasts and Wall Street investors.

title: CES 2026: Intel Core Ultra Series 3 Debuts as First Built on Intel 18A
summary: Intel unveiled its Core Ultra Series 3 processors at CES 2026, marking the first AI PC platform built on Intel 18A process technology, designed and manufactured in the United States. These processors offer exceptional performance, graphics, and battery life, powering over 200 PC designs and are also certified for embedded and industrial use cases like robotics and smart cities. The new series includes Core Ultra X9 and X7 processors with integrated Intel Arc graphics, boasting significant improvements in multithread performance, gaming, and battery life.

title: Micron stock whipsaws as “unprecedented” AI memory shortage tightens supply
summary: Micron Technology Inc. (MU) experienced a volatile trading session, closing down about 1.2% despite early gains, as a Reuters report highlighted an "unprecedented" AI-driven memory shortage and rising prices for high-bandwidth memory (HBM). The article discusses the impact of AI demand on memory supply, with manufacturers diverting capacity to HBM, and anticipates upcoming U.S. jobs and inflation data as key catalysts for stock movement. Investors are closely watching for signals on memory contract pricing and HBM availability amidst debates about a potential "supercycle" in the memory market.

title: KLA Corporation stock jumps 6% as chip-equipment rally builds ahead of Nvidia CES keynote
summary: KLA Corporation (KLAC.O) shares rose about 6.4% to $1,356, reaching an intraday high ahead of Nvidia's CEO Jensen Huang's keynote at CES, signaling investor optimism for semiconductor factory spending and AI hardware demand. Other chip-equipment makers like Applied Materials, Lam Research, and ASML also saw significant gains, fueled by positive supply-chain reports and brokerage upgrades. Investors are now looking to KLA's upcoming earnings report for guidance, especially regarding the impact of U.S. Commerce Department export rules given China accounted for 39.5% of its Q3 revenue.

title: A Deep Dive into the iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH): Performance and Positioning
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH) saw strong performance in 2025, driven by AI investments and U.S. tech, but faces increased volatility in 2026 due to high concentration and valuation. Its portfolio is heavily weighted towards U.S. large-cap tech companies, with NVIDIA now its largest holding. Investors should watch upcoming MSCI index reviews, tech earnings, and the "soft landing" economic scenario for its Q1 2026 trajectory.

title: Enterprise AI flywheel effect drives scalable use cases
summary: The "flywheel effect" is powerfully influencing enterprise AI, fostering collaborations that build scalable and resilient solutions. This concept, emphasizing consistent, small efforts leading to sustained growth, is evident in partnerships between companies like Hewlett Packard Enterprise Co., SHI International Corp., and their partners, driving significant advancements in AI deployment. Use cases spanning medical data management and smart city solutions demonstrate the tangible ROI and long-term benefits emerging from these AI initiatives.

title: Marvell stock (MRVL) rises after Melius upgrade sets $135 target ahead of CES CEO chat
summary: Marvell Technology Inc. (MRVL) shares rose after Melius Research upgraded the chipmaker to "buy" with a $135 price target, highlighting its role in AI-driven data centers. The stock's performance is tied to custom silicon demand and investor anticipation for CEO Matt Murphy’s upcoming CES fireside chat and the U.S. jobs report. Marvell's acquisition of Celestial AI and demonstrations at CES further underscore its commitment to next-generation AI infrastructure.

title: A Note On Open Text Corporation's (NASDAQ:OTEX) ROE and Debt To Equity
summary: This article analyzes Open Text Corporation's (NASDAQ:OTEX) Return On Equity (ROE) and Debt To Equity ratio. Open Text has an ROE of 13%, similar to the software industry average, but its high debt-to-equity ratio of 1.61 raises concerns about the quality of these returns. The analysis suggests caution, as significant debt can amplify risk, even if it boosts ROE.

title: Nvidia, Broadcom, AMD among BofA's top chip stocks to 'ride the wave' (NVDA:NASDAQ)
summary: Bank of America has identified Nvidia (NVDA), Broadcom (AVGO), and AMD (AMD) as its top picks among semiconductor stocks, urging investors to leverage the ongoing artificial intelligence spending boom. The firm maintains a positive outlook on AI-related semiconductor, memory, and semiconductor capital equipment stocks. This recommendation highlights the continued growth potential within the AI sector for these key chip manufacturers.

title: Form FWP GOLDMAN SACHS GROUP INC Filed by: GOLDMAN SACHS GROUP INC
summary: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. has filed Form FWP for Market Linked Securities linked to NVIDIA, AMD, and Tesla common stocks, due January 12, 2029. The filing includes a summary of terms, hypothetical payout profiles, and detailed risk factors associated with this complex investment.

title: Sandisk stock hits fresh 52-week high after CES “Optimus” rebrand as memory-supply story drives swings
summary: Sandisk shares reached a new 52-week high on Monday before closing slightly lower, driven by a broader interest in memory-related stocks and the company's "Optimus" rebrand at CES 2026 for its consumer NVMe SSDs. The stock's performance reflects the volatile NAND flash market, where supply changes heavily influence pricing, especially with increasing demand from AI infrastructure buildouts. Investors are now looking to Sandisk's upcoming Q2 earnings call on January 29th for further insights into demand and pricing.

title: Magna to Offer DRIVE Hyperion-Compatible ECUs and Tier-1 Integration Services for NVIDIA DRIVE AV
summary: Magna announced an expanded collaboration with NVIDIA to offer OEMs comprehensive system integration, validation, and vehicle launch services for the NVIDIA DRIVE Hyperion platform. This initiative will support the deployment of NVIDIA DRIVE AV stack running on DRIVE AGX Thor, covering L2++, L3, and L4 autonomy systems. The collaboration aims to accelerate the deployment of software-defined vehicles by combining NVIDIA's AI compute capabilities with Magna's expertise in system engineering and integration.

title: NaaS Technology Sets January 23, 2026 Extraordinary General Meeting for Key Shareholder Votes
summary: NaaS Technology Inc. announced an Extraordinary General Meeting (EGM) for January 23, 2026, in Langfang, Hebei Province, to vote on proposed resolutions. Shareholders as of January 2, 2026, are eligible to participate, with the board strongly endorsing a "yes" vote for these strategically important decisions. Despite the board's optimism, NaaS (NAAS) currently holds a Neutral rating from analysts, with a $3.50 price target, primarily due to financial performance concerns.

title: Assessing Arm Holdings (ARM) Valuation After Meta AI Partnership And DreamBig Semiconductor Acquisition Plan
summary: Arm Holdings (ARM) is gaining attention due to a new AI partnership with Meta and plans to acquire DreamBig Semiconductor, intended to enhance its AI efficiency and networking capabilities. Despite recent short-term gains, the stock has experienced significant longer-term declines. Simply Wall St's analysis suggests ARM is overvalued, with a fair value estimate of $70 per share against a market price of $114.73, although this valuation could shift based on the success of new initiatives.

title: Arbe Robotics Partners with Nvidiaon AI Driven Autonomous Driving Platform
summary: Arbe Robotics and Nvidia are collaborating to develop an AI-powered perception platform for autonomous vehicles. This partnership combines Arbe's high-resolution radar technology with Nvidia's computational prowess to enhance safety and reliability. The system will be demonstrated at CES 2026 and integrates directly with Nvidia's DRIVE AGX Orin platform.

title: Assessing Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (NYSE:TSM) Valuation After Recent Share Price Momentum and AI Demand Expectations
summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (NYSE:TSM) has gained significant investor attention due to a 46.8% one-year return and strong revenue and net income growth. The differing valuations highlight the complexity of assessing TSM, especially with the reliance on sustained AI demand and geopolitical factors.

title: Stock Market Live January 5, 2026: S&P 500 (SPY) at Higher Highs
summary: The stock market saw the S&P 500 (SPY) reaching higher highs on January 5, 2026, driven by speculation around Venezuela’s oil infrastructure rebuilding benefiting energy stocks, particularly Chevron (CVX). Nvidia (NVDA) also received a reiterated buy rating from UBS ahead of a keynote where new AI factory visions are expected to be outlined.

title: D-Wave Quantum Skyrocketed Today -- Is the Stock a Buy for 2026?
summary: D-Wave Quantum stock saw significant gains today, rising 8.9% amidst a bullish tech market, particularly in quantum computing and AI. The company's quantum-annealing approach and strong balance sheet with $836 million in cash make it a notable player in the nascent quantum computing space. However, due to high volatility and early-stage technology, the stock is best suited for investors with a high risk tolerance.

title: How new car radar sees 300m ahead for eyes-off highway driving
summary: Arbe Robotics announced at CES 2026 its collaboration with NVIDIA to create an advanced AI-based perception platform for hands-off and eyes-off driving. The system features ultra-HD radar capable of 300+ meter long-range detections at highway speeds (up to 130 km/h) and delivers consistent performance in adverse weather. This integration aims to democratize autonomous technology, making it more accessible, reliable, and cost-effective.

title: Nvidia Just Made a $5B Bet on Intel. Here’s Why It Matters
summary: Nvidia has completed a $5 billion investment in Intel, purchasing over 214.7 million shares and gaining roughly a 4% ownership stake. This move provides Intel with a significant cash injection to support its manufacturing operations and its 18A process, and it gives Nvidia a strategic option for chip manufacturing amidst growing demand for AI hardware.

title: Broadcom (AVGO) stock slides while chip peers rally — what’s weighing on shares now
summary: Broadcom (AVGO) shares slid about 2% despite a broader rally in semiconductor stocks, as investors focused on the increasing costs associated with AI infrastructure buildout and its impact on chipmaker margins. This underperformance puts Broadcom, a key supplier of networking silicon for AI data centers, at the center of concerns regarding AI growth sustainability and profitability. Upcoming economic data like ISM services and U.S. CPI, along with Broadcom's next earnings report in early March, will be closely watched for further indications of inflation and its effect on technology valuations.

title: Why American Outdoor Brands (AOUT) Stock Is Trading Up Today
summary: Shares of American Outdoor Brands (AOUT) jumped 5.5% due to significant insider buying activity, signaling strong internal confidence in the company. Although the shares cooled down slightly, this insider purchasing encouraged broader investor interest. This surge follows a period of volatility and a significant drop four months prior due to disappointing financial results.

title: Why Bruker (BRKR) Stock Is Up Today
summary: Bruker (BRKR) stock rose 5.5% after Guggenheim increased its price target to $53.00 from $45.00, maintaining a "Buy" rating and signaling a more bullish outlook. This follows a previous increase due to an order for €35 million received by its majority-owned subsidiary, RI Research Instruments. Despite the recent gains, Bruker's stock is still trading below its 52-week high.

title: Why Are Vicor (VICR) Shares Soaring Today
summary: Vicor Corporation's shares jumped 15.1% after Roth Capital initiated coverage with a "Buy" rating and a $115 price target, citing Vicor's leadership in power architecture crucial for AI platforms. This new analyst coverage and an ambitious price target, contrasting with a prior average of $93.75, have reignited investor interest and optimism. The company has also shown strong financial performance, including a 18.5% year-on-year revenue growth in Q3 and a solid balance sheet.

title: Uber stock slips on Melius “Sell” call as robotaxi competition looms in 2026
summary: Uber shares experienced a 1.9% decline after Melius Research downgraded the stock to "Sell" with a $73 price target, citing increasing autonomous vehicle (AV) competition expected in 2026 and beyond. Melius warned that intensified AV competition could negatively impact Uber's returns and pricing power, even with the company's strategic partnerships. Investors are now awaiting Uber's February 4th earnings report for updates on its margins and autonomy strategy amid these competitive concerns.

title: Allegro MicroSystems Simplifies SiC Power Design for AI
summary: Allegro MicroSystems has expanded its Power-Thru™ isolated gate driver portfolio with the new AHV85003/AHV85043 chipset, complementing the existing AHV85311 integrated solution. This expansion aims to simplify high-voltage silicon carbide (SiC) designs for AI data centers and EVs by eliminating the need for external isolated bias supplies and significantly reducing noise and EMI. The portfolio offers both integrated and chipset options, providing design flexibility and supply chain resilience for customers.

title: Arbe Robotics shares surge after introducing NVIDIA-backed radar platform
summary: Arbe Robotics shares surged after the company introduced a new radar platform supported by NVIDIA's AI processing. This collaboration integrates Arbe's imaging radar technology with NVIDIA's DRIVE platform to enhance perception capabilities for autonomous vehicles. The platform aims to provide superior object detection and 4D imaging, improving automotive safety and autonomy.

title: Is MRVL Stock a Buy, Sell or Hold at a P/S Multiple of 7.67X?
summary: Marvell Technology (MRVL) is currently trading at a premium valuation with a forward 12-month price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of 7.67X, higher than its sector average. Despite this, the company is experiencing significant growth fueled by the AI wave, strong demand for custom silicon and interconnect semiconductor products, and strategic acquisitions and partnerships. Analysts suggest MRVL is a "Buy" due to its strong long-term fundamentals and leadership in the data center and high-speed networking space.

title: Does Amkor Technology’s (AMKR) Flip Chip Momentum Reveal a Deeper Packaging Edge in Semis?
summary: Amkor Technology (AMKR) saw a recent stock upswing driven by optimism for advanced semiconductor packaging, particularly flip chip technology. While this aligns with the company's focus on outsourced packaging, investors should consider that the core business remains low-margin and that current share prices are already above consensus targets. The company's future success depends on executing its Arizona campus plans, converting earnings growth into higher returns on equity, and managing its balance sheet effectively amidst tight industry pricing.

title: Charles Schwab stock hits all-time high at 102.34 USD
summary: Charles Schwab (SCHW) stock has reached an all-time high of $102.34, now trading at $103.46, marking a 38.88% increase over the past year. The company's strong performance is supported by a market capitalization of $183.65 billion, 21.67% revenue growth, and 37 years of consistent dividend payments. Upcoming earnings on January 21st are expected to provide further insights into its financial strategies.

title: Powering the AI Revolution: Advanced Energy Industries Hits Record Highs as Data Center Demand Surges
summary: Advanced Energy Industries (NASDAQ: AEIS) has reached record highs, trading in the $222–$230 range, driven by the surging demand for power delivery systems in the "agentic AI" era. The company's data center computing revenue increased by 113% year-over-year in Q3 2025, and its high-efficiency power conversion technology is crucial for next-generation AI data centers. This strategic shift and operational execution position AEIS as a key enabler for the AI supercycle, offering a more stable investment compared to volatile semiconductor manufacturers.

title: Should Diodes’ (DIOD) Soft Quarter in a Cooling Chip Cycle Change Its Long-Term Risk Profile?
summary: Diodes Inc. recently reported earnings below expectations due to a cooling semiconductor market, impacting revenue. Despite this, the company's profitability and cash generation in power management and analog chips suggest it is resilient. The earnings miss highlights cyclicality rather than a fundamental shift in its long-term investment narrative, which hinges on an eventual demand recovery and growth in higher-value automotive and power management products.

title: Millions more lidar 'eyes' are coming to cars and robots in 2026
summary: Hesai Technology (NASDAQ: HSAI) announced a plan to double its annual lidar production capacity to over 4 million units by 2026, driven by surging demand from the ADAS and robotics sectors. The expansion is bolstered by their proprietary ASICs, fully automated production lines, and a new factory in Bangkok, Thailand, set to open in early 2027. This move follows Hesai surpassing 2 million cumulative deliveries in 2025 and securing over 4 million units in ATX lidar orders, with mass production beginning April 2026.

title: A Look At Fortune Brands Innovations (FBIN) Valuation As Shares Trade Near Recent Levels
summary: Fortune Brands Innovations (FBIN) shares are currently trading around US$50.94, presenting a potential undervaluation according to Simply Wall St's analysis. The company's strategic investments in tech-enabled home and security products are expected to drive improved margins and earnings growth, leading to a fair value estimate of $62.56. However, risks such as weak housing demand or rising input costs could impact this narrative.

title: Bulldozers get brainy: how Caterpillar is bringing AI to worksites
summary: Caterpillar (NYSE: CAT) will showcase its advancements in Industrial AI and autonomy at CES 2026, including a keynote address by CEO Joe Creed alongside NVIDIA VP Deepu Talla. The company will unveil an expanded collaboration with NVIDIA and feature an exhibit highlighting the Cat AI Nexus on a mini excavator, an AI Insights Lab, and various autonomy demonstrations. These initiatives underscore Caterpillar's commitment to transforming worksites with advanced technology, built upon its 30-year legacy in autonomy.

title: Caterpillar to Showcase Next Era in Industrial AI and Autonomy at CES 2026
summary: Caterpillar Inc. (NYSE: CAT) will be a keynote speaker and exhibitor at CES 2026 to highlight how Industrial AI and autonomy are driving innovation and transforming worksites globally. CEO Joe Creed will deliver a keynote address, joined by NVIDIA's VP of Robotics and Edge AI, Deepu Talla, to announce an expanded collaboration. The exhibit will feature live demonstrations of AI-integrated equipment, an AI Insights Lab, and a vision for the future of autonomous job sites.

title: AMD Challenges NVIDIA’s Crown with MI450 and “Helios” Rack: A 2.9 ExaFLOPS Leap into the HBM4 Era
summary: AMD has unveiled its Instinct MI450 accelerator and Helios server rack platform, aiming to disrupt NVIDIA's dominance in the high-end generative AI market. The MI450 boasts 432GB of HBM4 memory and the Helios platform achieves 2.9 ExaFLOPS of FP4 performance, positioning AMD as a significant contender. authors: Bethany McLean, Andrew Ford, Laura Wadsten

title: Fortinet brings FortiGate-VM security to Nvidia BlueField-3 for AI factories
summary: Fortinet Inc. has integrated its FortiGate-VM virtual cloud firewall to run directly on the Nvidia BlueField-3 DPU, an offering designed for AI factories. This integration embeds networking and isolated infrastructure acceleration, allowing core security functions like firewalling and zero-trust controls to operate on the DPU instead of the host CPU. The solution aims to secure high-performance AI environments without impacting workload speed, improving isolation, reducing latency, and simplifying policy enforcement.

title: Fortinet (NASDAQ: FTNT) offloads firewalling to NVIDIA BlueField-3 DPUs for AI
summary: Fortinet and NVIDIA have partnered to integrate Fortinet's FortiGate VM directly onto NVIDIA BlueField-3 data processing units, aiming to enhance security for AI and private-cloud workloads. This solution offloads firewalling and zero-trust controls from host CPUs, reducing latency and improving isolation. The integration, supported by FortiOS 7.6.3, targets cloud service providers, telco edges, and enterprise private clouds by embedding security directly into the data center fabric.

By embracing open innovation and transparency, Nvidia aims to provide developers with the resources needed to build scalable AI agents, especially important given the rising popularity of open models from Chinese firms.

These models feature a breakthrough hybrid latent mixture-of-experts (MoE) architecture to overcome challenges in multi-agent AI systems, offering high accuracy and efficiency. Early adopters across various industries are already integrating Nemotron 3 models, and NVIDIA has also released new open tools and data to facilitate AI agent customization and development.

title: TSMC (NYSE:TSM) Valuation Check After Strong Year-to-Date Share Price Run
summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (TSM) has experienced a strong year-to-date performance, with shares up over 50%. While a narrative valuation suggests the stock is fairly priced at $310, a discounted cash flow (DCF) model indicates it might be trading rich at $225, raising questions about the extent of AI optimism already factored into its price. Investors face a dilemma regarding whether TSM is undervalued or already reflecting future growth.

title: Ollie's (OLLI) Stock Is Up, What You Need To Know
summary: Shares of Ollie's Bargain Outlet (NASDAQ:OLLI) jumped 4% after the company reported third-quarter results that surpassed profit expectations and raised its full-year guidance. While BofA Securities raised its price target to $150, UBS Group reduced its objective to $130, indicating a mixed analyst reaction. The stock closed up 3.3% at $116.12, reflecting investor focus on the positive earnings and improved outlook despite a slight revenue miss.

title: KULR Technology Group Joins Open Compute Project as a Platinum Member, Advancing AI Data Center Energy Solutions
summary: KULR Technology Group has become a Platinum Member of the Open Compute Project (OCP), marking its entry into the AI data center market with rack-level Battery Backup Units (BBUs). This strategic move expands KULR's focus from battery safety to mission-critical energy infrastructure, aligning with NVIDIA's architectures and the OCP's ORV3 specifications for integrated energy systems. KULR's CEO, Michael Mo, highlighted that their ONE® MAX BBU platform meets these new standards, leveraging their aerospace-derived thermal management and safety expertise to help define future data center power and thermal standards.

title: Advanced Micro Devices Rises as Nvidia Wins China Chip Approval Under New U.S. Rule
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) stock rose after Nvidia received U.S. approval to sell its H200 AI chips to China under a new revenue-sharing model. This development has investors anticipating that a similar approval could extend to AMD's MI300 line, which has previously been restricted from the Chinese market. Such an authorization would significantly boost AMD's data center forecast and competitive position in a major AI chip market.

title: Why Amkor Technology (AMKR) Is Up 6.6% After Intel EMIB Win And Insider Share Transfer
summary: Amkor Technology (AMKR) shares rose 6.6% after the company secured an advanced packaging contract with Intel for EMIB technology and reported strong Q3 results. An insider share transfer also occurred, highlighting evolving ownership stakes. These developments underscore Amkor's growing importance in advanced packaging, although investor expectations are already high due to recent price increases and premium valuations.

title: KULR Technology Group Joins Open Compute Project as Platinum Member
summary: KULR Technology Group announced its Platinum Membership in the Open Compute Project on December 11, 2025, signaling its entry into the AI data center market. The company will focus on rack-level Battery Backup Units (BBUs) aligned with NVIDIA and ORV3 standards, leveraging its KULR ONE® platform to meet new AI infrastructure demands. This collaboration aims to enhance KULR's energy product development within the AI sector.

title: KULR Technology (NYSE American: KULR) becomes OCP Platinum member for AI rack-level BBUs
summary: KULR Technology Group announced it has joined the Open Compute Project (OCP) as a Platinum Member, entering the AI data center market with rack-level Battery Backup Units (BBUs). The company's KULR ONE® MAX BBU aligns with OCP ORV3 standards, leveraging space-grade battery safety and carbon-fiber thermal management. This membership is expected to provide benefits such as early standards contribution, integration opportunities with hyperscalers, and faster product development cycles, strengthening KULR's position in AI-driven energy infrastructure.

title: Qualcomm (QCOM): Navigating the AI Era with Strategic Diversification
summary: Qualcomm (QCOM) is undergoing a significant strategic transformation, diversifying beyond mobile handsets into high-growth areas like automotive, IoT, and AI-enabled computing. This pivot is aimed at achieving a 50/50 revenue split between mobile and non-mobile segments by 2029, driven by substantial investments in on-device AI, the Snapdragon Digital Chassis for automotive, and the Snapdragon X Series for AI PCs. While facing intense competition and potential shifts in its mobile modem business due to Apple's in-house chip development, Qualcomm's robust financial performance and aggressive pursuit of new markets position it for long-term growth in the evolving tech and AI landscape.

title: STMicroelectronics (STM): Navigating the Semiconductor Giga-Cycle with Strategic Precision
summary: STMicroelectronics (STM) is navigating a transformative "giga-cycle" driven by AI, connectivity, and electrification, positioning itself as a European semiconductor powerhouse. Despite facing a challenging financial landscape in 2024 and 2025 with revenue declines, STM anticipates a recovery in the second half of 2025 and into 2026, driven by strategic investments in high-growth sectors like automotive and industrial, and continuous innovation in areas like silicon carbide and microcontrollers. The company is poised for long-term growth through its IDM model, strong financial health, and significant EU-backed financing for R&D and manufacturing expansion.

title: Coherent (COHR) Is Up 15.5% After 300mm Silicon Carbide Breakthrough For AI Datacenter Efficiency – Has The Bull Case Changed?
summary: Coherent (COHR) has seen its stock rise by 15.5% following a breakthrough in 300mm silicon carbide technology, which aims to enhance energy efficiency and thermal performance in AI datacenters. This development reinforces the company's position as a key enabler in AI infrastructure and electrification, potentially boosting its profit growth despite existing risks related to manufacturing investment and market cyclicality. The new technology, combining with past collaborations like that with NVIDIA, strengthens Coherent's AI-focused narrative.

title: Ciena Corp earnings beat by $0.14, revenue topped estimates
summary: Ciena Corp (NYSE: CIEN) reported fourth-quarter EPS of $0.91, beating analyst estimates by $0.14, with revenue also topping expectations at $1.35 billion. The company provided strong guidance for Q1 2026 and FY 2026 revenue, indicating continued growth. Ciena's stock has seen significant gains over the last 3 and 12 months, and its financial health is rated as "good performance."

title: Paycom, ADP top compensation rankings as Salesforce, Workday drop off
summary: Paycom and ADP have emerged as leaders in Comparably's 2025 Best Companies for Compensation awards, with employees highly satisfied with their pay and benefits. Notably, enterprise software giants Salesforce and Workday, which previously ranked in the top 10, were absent from this year's list. The rankings are based on anonymous employee feedback across 70,000 U.S. companies regarding total compensation packages.

title: Why Alta (ALTG) Stock Is Trading Up Today
summary: Shares of Alta Equipment Group (NYSE:ALTG) surged after a director, Zachary E. Savas, disclosed a significant purchase of 40,000 shares, signaling strong insider confidence. This transaction suggests that insiders believe the stock is undervalued or poised for growth. The shares are highly volatile, and while the market views this news as meaningful, it doesn't fundamentally alter its perception of the business.

title: Applied Optoelectronics (AAOI) Soars 15% on Hyperscaler Huge Volume Order
summary: Applied Optoelectronics, Inc. (NASDAQ:AAOI) saw its stock jump 15.14% after securing its first volume order for 800G data center transceivers from a major hyperscale customer. This order positions the company to meet its year-end 800G shipment expectations, contributing $4 million to $8 million in Q4 revenues. Additionally, the company is ramping up 400G transceiver shipments, with $22 million in orders year-to-date and $13 million delivered in Q4 from the same customer.

title: Laureate Education (LAUR): Assessing Valuation After a 70% Year‑to‑Date Share Price Surge
summary: Laureate Education (LAUR) has seen a significant share price increase of over 70% year-to-date, driven by steady revenue and earnings growth. Despite this surge, analysts suggest the stock is still undervalued by 12.6%, with a fair value target of $36 against its current price of $31.47, implying a potential entry point for investors. However, risks such as downturns in key markets or weaker returns from new campuses could impact these optimistic forecasts.

title: Samsung and KT Corp ‘validate AI-RAN’ on live network
summary: Samsung and KT Corp have successfully validated AI-based radio access network (AI-RAN) optimization technology on KT's commercial network, following simulation tests conducted in June. This technology automatically applies optimal configurations for individual users based on real-time wireless conditions, leveraging AI to predict and prevent connectivity issues. The collaboration aims to advance network automation and develop core 6G capabilities.

title: 5 Revealing Analyst Questions From Hewlett Packard Enterprise's Q3 Earnings Call
summary: Hewlett Packard Enterprise's Q3 revenue missed expectations despite strong growth, attributed to delayed AI server shipments and reduced federal spending. Analysts focused on GreenLake ARR growth, the impact of the Juniper acquisition, memory cost inflation, server price increases, and AI server shipment timing. The article highlights key financial results and identifies catalysts for upcoming quarters.

title: JEPQ’s 10% Dividend Is Legendary, But At What Cost?
summary: The article analyzes the JPMorgan Nasdaq Equity Premium Income ETF (JEPQ), which offers an 11.52% dividend yield by selling covered calls on Nasdaq-100 stocks. While providing high monthly income, JEPQ significantly caps upside capital appreciation compared to growth-focused ETFs like QQQ, essentially trading 10-12 percentage points of annual total return for its yield. The fund's distributions also fluctuate greatly, making it less predictable for budgeting, and its high tech concentration and portfolio turnover present specific risks.

title: Amtech Systems stock rating reiterated at Hold by Benchmark
summary: Benchmark has reiterated its Hold rating on Amtech Systems Inc. (NASDAQ:ASYS) following strong Q4 2025 earnings driven by AI-related reflow equipment demand, although front-end semiconductor business remains soft. The company exceeded expectations with an EPS of $0.10 and revenue of $19.8 million. Despite positive performance and a 125% price return, the stock is considered overvalued by InvestingPro Fair Value metrics.

title: KULR Deepens Commitment to AI Data Center Energy Storage
summary: KULR Technology Group, Inc. has joined the Open Compute Project (OCP) as a Platinum Member, focusing on AI data center energy storage. This move positions KULR to integrate its battery safety and thermal management expertise into mission-critical AI energy infrastructure, aligning with NVIDIA's architectures. The company will contribute to open standards for AI power, energy storage, and resilient data center infrastructure through this membership.

title: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) Is Up 11.3% After Raising 2026 Guidance And Doubling Down On AI
summary: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) saw an 11.3% increase in its stock after reporting Q4 2025 sales of US$9,679 million and full-year sales of US$34,296 million, despite lower profitability. The company raised its fiscal 2026 earnings guidance and increased its dividend, while also expanding its GreenLake cloud portfolio and AI collaborations with NVIDIA and AMD. HPE's strategy focuses on hybrid cloud and AI-centric solutions to offset pressure on traditional hardware and aims for $44.4 billion revenue and $2.7 billion earnings by 2028.

title: Ilya Rachman, Immix Biopharma CEO, buys $4975 in shares
summary: Ilya Rachman, CEO and Chairman of Immix Biopharma, Inc. (NASDAQ:IMMX), recently purchased 746 shares totaling $4,975. This insider buying occurred as IMMX trades near its 52-week high, following a public offering of $93.7 million and promising Phase 2 trial results for its CAR-T therapy, NXC-201. H.C. Wainwright subsequently raised its price target for Immix Biopharma to $12.

title: 5 Revealing Analyst Questions From Hewlett Packard Enterprise’s Q3 Earnings Call
summary: Hewlett Packard Enterprise faced a negative market reaction to its Q3 earnings, with revenue missing expectations despite strong year-over-year growth. The company attributed this to delayed AI server shipments and reduced US federal spending, while highlighting strong order momentum in networking and storage. Analyst questions focused on profit guidance, order surges, GreenLake ARR growth, server price increases, and revenue seasonality, revealing key insights into HPE's operational strategies and future outlook.

title: The Bull Case For New Oriental Education & Technology Group (EDU) Could Change Following Its Removal From A Key Hong Kong Index - Learn Why
summary: New Oriental Education & Technology Group (EDU) has been removed from the Hang Seng China Enterprises Index, which could impact institutional investment flows and sentiment. While this doesn't change the fundamental growth drivers in non-academic tutoring and AI-powered learning or the risks of competition, the company's $300 million buyback authorization and dividends may offer some stability. Investors should still consider policy, demographic shifts, and increased competition within varied education segments.

title: The Bull Case For First Solar (FSLR) Could Change Following New Lockhart III–IV Module Deal - Learn Why
summary: First Solar (FSLR) recently secured a deal to supply solar modules for the Lockhart III and IV projects in California, reinforcing its U.S. utility-scale footprint and revenue visibility. This new contract, combined with strong Q3 performance and an aggressive U.S. capacity ramp, strengthens the company's investment narrative, particularly its reliance on domestic manufacturing and policy support. Investors should consider how these incentives and the expanding U.S. project pipeline might shape First Solar's future performance.

title: OceanFirst Financial stock hits 52-week high at 20.25 USD
summary: OceanFirst Financial Corp (OCFC) stock reached a 52-week high of $20.25 USD, driven by a 14.5% gain over six months and a 13.3% year-to-date increase. The company's consistent profitability and 4.09% dividend yield are factors influencing investor confidence. Despite Q3 2025 EPS missing estimates, revenue exceeded expectations, and the company announced a $185 million public offering of subordinated notes while reiterating deposit growth targets.

title: Morgan Stanley Raises CSX Price Target Amid Positive Freight Outlook
summary: Morgan Stanley increased its price target for CSX Corporation (NASDAQ:CSX) to $30 from $27, maintaining an Equal Weight rating, due to a positive outlook for the freight transportation industry in 2026. The firm upgraded its industry view to "Attractive" and highlighted CSX's improved operational metrics despite mixed third-quarter earnings, noting increased volumes and faster train velocity. CSX, a leading transportation company, is positioned for growth with completed infrastructure projects enhancing capacity.

title: Microchip Technology (MCHP) Is Up 6.7% After Raising Q3 FY26 Outlook And Launching New AI‑Focused Chips
summary: Microchip Technology (MCHP) has seen a 6.7% stock increase after raising its third-quarter fiscal 2026 guidance, now expecting sequential net sales growth and positive GAAP EPS. This positive outlook is further bolstered by the launch of new ultra-low-power digital power monitors, the PAC1711 and PAC1811, targeting the growing AI infrastructure and e-mobility markets. While the improved guidance and new products address some concerns, the company's high leverage and competitive landscape remain key risks to monitor.

title: Check out CDW Corp's stock price (1CDW-IT) in real time
summary: This article provides real-time stock information for CDW Corp (1CDW-IT) on the Milan Stock Exchange, including its current price, 52-week range, and key financial statistics like dividend yield. It also lists recent news and analyst calls related to CDW, offering a comprehensive overview of the company's market position and profile.

title: 5 Insightful Analyst Questions From SAIC’s Q3 Earnings Call
summary: Science Applications International Corporation (SAIC) reported a positive Q3 CY2025 with strong adjusted EPS and EBITDA beats, driven by operational efficiency and the successful integration of SilverEdge. Despite a revenue decline, the company raised its full-year guidance. Analysts' questions focused on government procurement pace, SilverEdge integration, DoD procurement reforms, savings reinvestment, and federal civilian budget pressures, providing deeper insights into SAIC's strategic direction.

title: Shares of Oracle slide 10% on revenue miss and rising capital expenditures
summary: Oracle's shares dropped over 10% in extended trading after the company missed revenue expectations despite a strong performance in earnings per share. While cloud revenue performed well and remaining performance obligations soared, investors are concerned about rising capital expenditures for AI infrastructure and its impact on profitability. New co-CEOs highlighted customer wins to address market nervousness about over-reliance on AI plays.

title: Pioneer Power Unveils Mobile Energy Solutions for AI Hubs
summary: Pioneer Power Solutions, Inc. has introduced PRYMUS, a mobile power delivery platform designed to meet the surging electricity demands of artificial intelligence and hyperscale data centers. This scalable edge energy solution offers pre-engineered power blocks from 1 MW to 10 MW, deployable within approximately six months, significantly faster than traditional utility scheduling. PRYMUS aims to provide critical energy resiliency and rapid deployment for AI, technology, and industrial sectors struggling with grid upgrades.

title: 3 Reasons We Love Moody's (MCO)
summary: Moody's (MCO) presents an interesting investment opportunity despite recent underperformance against the S&P 500. The company shows encouraging short-term revenue growth, with annualized revenue growth of 14.5% over the last two years, and spectacular EPS growth of 22.3% over the same period. Additionally, Moody's boasts a stellar average return on equity (ROE) of 63.8% over the last five years, far exceeding the sector average, indicating a strong competitive moat.

title: CSX (CSX): Buy, Sell, or Hold Post Q3 Earnings?
summary: This article from StockStory advises against investing in CSX following its Q3 earnings, citing weak sales volumes indicating waning demand, barely growing EPS, and a dropping free cash flow margin. The company's valuation is considered fair, but with limited upside compared to potential downside risks. Instead, the authors recommend exploring other high-quality growth stocks.

title: Amkor Technology (AMKR) Hits 52-Week High | Q3 2025 Earnings & Buy Rating - News and Statistics
summary: Amkor Technology (AMKR) stock reached a new 52-week high after exceeding Q3 2025 earnings expectations with strong revenues and EPS, and increasing its quarterly dividend. The semiconductor packaging company also received a "Buy" rating and a $62.00 price target from Aletheia Capital. This positive news follows a previous significant stock increase stemming from Intel outsourcing its high-end chip packaging production to Amkor.

title: T-Mobile US CEO stakes carrier’s 6G leadership goal
summary: T-Mobile US CEO Srini Gopalan has declared the company's ambition to lead the industry in 6G development, building on its 5G successes. He emphasized the critical role of AI in 6G, particularly for operational efficiencies and enabling new applications like advanced automation and robotics that require low-latency "physical AI" capabilities. Gopalan also highlighted anticipated improvements in spectrum efficiency and cybersecurity through 6G, acknowledging the early stages of global standardization efforts.

title: Microsoft Stock Slips After Hours as AI Scrutiny Rises: What MSFT Investors Should Know Before the December 11 Open
summary: Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ: MSFT) experienced a slight dip on December 10, 2025, closing down 2.7% and trading marginally lower after hours, primarily due to increased regulatory scrutiny on AI and concerns over monetizing its substantial AI investments. This comes as state attorneys general warned tech companies about "delusional outputs" from AI chatbots and Microsoft announced $23 billion in new AI data center investments. Despite these near-term pressures, Wall Street analysts maintain a broadly bullish outlook on Microsoft's long-term prospects, with price targets suggesting significant upside, though some quantitative models show mixed signals and long-term caution on valuation.

title: Secure AI integration: Can tech achieve true resilience
summary: The article discusses the challenges and solutions for secure AI integration, emphasizing the need for resilience, trust, and compliance as AI adoption grows. It highlights how companies like HPE and SHI, along with partners, are developing programs and platforms, such as HPE's Unleash AI and an automated Section 508 compliance solution, to help organizations securely deploy AI and address new attack surfaces. The evolving role of CISOs from policy enforcers to AI governance designers is also noted.

title: Is Chipotle Attractively Priced After a 48% Slide and Modest Valuation Discount?
summary: Chipotle Mexican Grill (CMG) has experienced a volatile period, including a 48% slide over the past year, sparking debate among investors about its current valuation. While a Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) analysis suggests it's fairly valued with a slight 4.9% discount, its Price-to-Earnings (PE) ratio indicates it might be slightly overvalued compared to its fair ratio. The article introduces "Narratives" as a way for investors to develop their own valuation based on personalized assumptions regarding Chipotle's future growth and financials.

title: HIVE Digital Technologies Enters Colombia’s Deep Andean Capital Markets With Colombia Listing, Advancing Its Role as Latin America’s Emerging Leader in Green AI and Bitcoin Infrastructure
summary: HIVE Digital Technologies has expanded its Latin American capital-markets presence by listing on the Colombian Stock Exchange, becoming the first Bitcoin and AI infrastructure company to do so. This move reinforces HIVE's position as a major renewable-powered data center operator and is part of its strategy to transition from Tier I Bitcoin mining to Tier III AI and HPC cloud infrastructure. The company aims to deploy over 36,000 GPUs for AI and HPC services, leveraging its expertise in using renewable energy for large-scale compute clusters.

title: OGE Energy (OGE) Announces Dividend of $0.425 per Share
summary: OGE Energy Corp. (NYSE: OGE) announced a dividend of $0.425 per share, payable on January 30, 2026, to shareholders of record as of January 5, 2026. The company has a 19-year history of growing payouts and offers an annual dividend yield of 3.96%. OGE is also investing in expansion, including a $345 million public stock offering to fund capital expenditures and debt repayment, and recently received a "Buy" rating and $51 price target from Barclays.

title: Is Himax (HIMX) Quietly Reframing Its AI Narrative Through Healthcare-Focused Sensing Interfaces?
summary: Himax Technologies is expanding its AI applications beyond traditional display drivers into healthcare, as showcased by its collaboration with Liqxtal Technology on the Pro-Eye vision-care monitor. This monitor utilizes Himax's WiseEye AI for facial recognition and eye-tracking, hinting at a new investment narrative centered on health and security-oriented interfaces. While the Pro-Eye demonstrates WiseEye's potential, Himax's near-term growth still heavily relies on broader AI and AR design wins due to ongoing softness in traditional display sectors.

title: Is Navitas Semiconductor Stock Going to $0?
summary: Navitas Semiconductor is developing advanced semiconductors using gallium nitride and silicon carbide, aiming for greater efficiency. Despite a recent decline in revenue due to a strategic shift away from low-margin opportunities and a transitional period, the company has a stable financial foundation with low debt and sufficient cash reserves. Partnering with Nvidia for AI factory computing suggests a promising future for Navitas, as the demand for advanced, energy-efficient semiconductors grows.

title: Why Redwire (RDW) Stock Is Trading Lower Today
summary: Shares of aerospace and defense company Redwire (RDW) fell 1.3% after Cantor Fitzgerald significantly lowered its price target by 55% to $9.00, while maintaining an "Overweight" rating. This substantial cut reflects a more cautious stance on Redwire's future, concerning investors. The stock's volatility is noted, with its current trading price significantly below its 52-week high, and investors who bought at IPO in 2021 are now seeing a loss.

title: Why Alibaba Stock Inched Higher Today
summary: Alibaba Group's stock closed higher after a report indicated its AI model, Qwen, is being used to train a proprietary, for-pay AI model ("Avocado") by a major U.S. tech company, Meta Platforms. This collaboration, while not significantly impactful for immediate revenue, enhances Alibaba's reputation as a key player in the AI revolution. Investors responded positively, pushing shares almost 2% skyward.

title: A Supermicro expande o portfólio NVIDIA Blackwell com novas soluções NVIDIA HGX B300 de 4U e 2U (OCP) com resfriamento a líquido, prontas para envio em grande volume.
summary: A Supermicro expandiu seu portfólio de arquitetura NVIDIA Blackwell com o lançamento de novos sistemas NVIDIA HGX B300 de 4U e 2U (OCP) com resfriamento a líquido. Essas soluções de alta densidade e eficiência energética são projetadas para data centers de hiperescala e fábricas de IA, oferecendo até 144 GPUs em um único rack. Com tecnologias avançadas de resfriamento e conectividade de rede, os novos sistemas prometem ganhos significativos de desempenho e economia de custos operacionais.

title: Will Strong Data Center Growth Push Up AMD's Stock Higher in 2026?
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) has seen its shares jump significantly due to strong demand for its EPYC processors and Instinct MI350/MI300 series GPUs, particularly within the data center segment. Despite projecting double-digit revenue growth for its data center business, the article raises concerns about AMD's stiff competition from NVIDIA, Broadcom, and Intel, along with its current "overvalued" stock valuation. Consequently, AMD currently holds a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) rating, suggesting investors might await a more favorable entry point.

title: Micron Technology (MU) Stock Today: AI Memory Supercycle, Crucial Exit and New $330–$338 Price Targets – What Investors Need to Know on December 10, 2025
summary: Micron Technology (MU) is experiencing an AI-driven memory boom in 2025, with its stock trading around $253 and new price targets reaching $330-338 from HSBC and Morgan Stanley. The company is strategically exiting its Crucial consumer memory brand to focus on high-margin AI memory products and investing heavily in new fabs in Japan and the U.S. While bullish sentiment prevails due to projected multi-year memory shortages and improved profitability, some skeptics warn about the inherent cyclicality of the memory business and potential "peak sentiment."

title: Nvidia refutes report that China's DeepSeek is using its banned Blackwell AI chips
summary: Nvidia has refuted a report claiming that Chinese AI startup DeepSeek is using smuggled Blackwell chips for its upcoming model development. The U.S. has banned the export of Nvidia's advanced Blackwell chips to China. Nvidia stated it has seen no substantiation for the claims despite the alleged "farfetched" smuggling scenario.

title: ‘Greetings, earthlings’: Nvidia-backed Starcloud trains first AI model in space as orbital data center race heats up
summary: Nvidia-backed Starcloud has become the first to train an AI model from space, utilizing an Nvidia H100 GPU on its Starcloud-1 satellite to run Google's Gemma LLM. This achievement signals a significant step towards orbital data centers, offering a solution to the terrestrial data centers' energy demands and environmental impact. Starcloud plans to build a 5-gigawatt orbital data center powered by solar energy, with future launches incorporating Nvidia's Blackwell platform for enhanced AI performance.

title: Immutep Limited (IMMP): Firm Reports Positive Data from Trials
summary: Immutep Limited (NASDAQ:IMMP) recently announced positive data from two clinical trials for its drug candidate, eftilagimod alpha. A Phase 2 study showed significant efficacy in treating soft tissue sarcoma, while a Phase 1 study achieved an 81% overall survival rate for metastatic non-small cell lung cancer. The company has also reached a key enrollment milestone for a Phase III trial, moving closer to potentially changing the non-small cell lung cancer treatment landscape.

title: WINTON GROUP Ltd Takes Position in Modine Manufacturing Company $MOD
summary: WINTON GROUP Ltd has acquired a new position in Modine Manufacturing (NYSE:MOD), purchasing 15,625 shares valued at approximately $1.539 million. This comes as CEO Neil David Brinker recently sold 31,871 shares, reducing his stake by 11.8%. Modine Manufacturing, an auto parts company, reported an EPS beat and 12.3% revenue growth last quarter, with a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating from analysts and an average target price of $182.

title: AMD Stock on December 10, 2025: AI Supercycle, China Risks, and What Wall Street Expects Next
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ: AMD) is experiencing a significant rerating due to its AI ambitions and hyperscale partnerships, with shares trading around $221.62. The company's Q3 2025 results show strong growth, and it has an aggressive multi-year AI roadmap targeting a substantial share of the data-center market. While analyst sentiment is broadly positive, risks include rich valuation, intense competition, supply-chain constraints, and geopolitical uncertainties, particularly regarding China export policies.

title: Assessing Credo Technology Group (CRDO) After Blowout AI-Driven Quarter and Strong Revenue Guidance
summary: Credo Technology Group (CRDO) reported a strong quarter driven by AI demand and provided optimistic revenue guidance. Despite powerful year-to-date share price returns, Simply Wall St assesses the company as 4.5% overvalued, with its current price potentially having factored in future growth already. The analysis highlights that aggressive growth, margins, and future earnings multiples are necessary to justify the current valuation, while industry adoption delays or increased competition pose risks.

title: 3 Volatile Stocks with Open Questions
summary: This article identifies three volatile stocks—Park-Ohio (PKOH), Sunrun (RUN), and Xerox (XRX)—that investors should avoid due to various financial fragilities such as declining sales, high production costs, and cash burn. It recommends that readers explore StockStory's suggestions for high-quality stocks that have outperformed the market, offering them as better investment opportunities.

title: 1 Tech ETF to Buy Hand Over Fist and 1 to Avoid in 2026
summary: This article identifies one tech ETF to buy and one to avoid in 2026, targeting growth opportunities for investors. The recommended ETF is the Invesco Nasdaq 100 ETF (QQQM) due to its lower expense ratio and diversification across top tech and other sectors. Conversely, the Vanguard Information Technology ETF (VGT) is advised against because of its high concentration in just three stocks and its exclusion of major tech companies categorized in other sectors.

title: 3 Contrarian Investment Ideas for 2026
summary: This article presents three contrarian investment ideas for 2026, stemming from Morningstar's Global Investment Outlook. The suggestions include balancing AI-heavy equity exposure by diversifying into value stocks, small caps, and dividend payers; expanding internationally, particularly into emerging markets and overlooked developed markets; and carefully pursuing fixed income, with a focus on intermediate-term bonds and local-currency emerging-market debt, while avoiding yield chasing. The author emphasizes preparation over prediction, advocating for diversification to navigate a range of market outcomes.

title: Nasdaq Market Activity December 9: Volume Leaders and Price Moves - News and Statistics
summary: On December 9, Nasdaq trading saw high volume led by Netcapital Inc. (over 130 million shares, up $0.9411 to $1.60) and Paranovus Entertainment Technology Ltd. (over 126 million shares, down $0.0038 to $0.0451).
