The partnership involves NVIDIA’s newly announced AI Factory Research Center at Digital Realty’s Manassas facility and focuses on AI-optimized data center infrastructure, including advanced cooling and power management. This expansion positions Digital Realty as a key provider for the growing demand in AI computing resources.

title: Microsoft signs $9.7-billion cloud contract with IREN for Nvidia chips
summary: Microsoft has secured a US$9.7-billion deal with data-centre operator IREN for access to Nvidia's advanced chips, aiming to address the computing shortages hindering its AI growth. The five-year agreement allows Microsoft to expand its computing capacity without constructing new data centers and involves IREN using Microsoft's prepayment to finance a US$5.8-billion deal with Dell for Nvidia's GB300 chips. This partnership comes as Microsoft forecasts its AI capacity crunch to extend into at least mid-2026.

title: Microsoft to ship 60,000 Nvidia AI chips to UAE after U.S. approves deal

This is part of Microsoft's $15.2 billion technology investment in the UAE, despite former President Trump's earlier remarks about restricting advanced chip exports. The UAE's access is tied to a $1.4 trillion pledge to U.S. energy and AI projects.

title: AMD earnings: Here’s what’s needed to keep the stock rally going

Analysts suggest that near-term upside in AMD's graphics processing unit segment, critical for AI, may be limited.

The initiative aims to address the unique infrastructure requirements for large-scale AI workload deployment, including supporting the NVIDIA Omniverse DSX blueprint.

Initial customers include RIMAC Group, Siemens, and WPP, leveraging Omniverse Cloud for diverse applications ranging from automotive design and marketing to industrial automation and robotics.

title: SEMIL-2200GC Series | 2U IP69K rack-mount GPU computer with NVIDIA® L4 - Unmanned Systems Technology

The series boasts a stainless-steel and aluminum chassis for protection and meets MIL-STD-810H, MIL-STD-461G, and MIL-STD-1275D standards for resilience in extreme conditions.

This move by Ant Group, alongside Alibaba's open-sourcing of other AI tools, aims to promote transparency, customization, and cost reduction in the rapidly growing LLM field.

title: SuperX Launches Rack-Scale AI Platform Powered by NVIDIA GB300 Chips, Redefining Data Center Infrastructure

The platform achieves up to 1.8 exaFLOPS of FP4 AI compute per rack, positioning SuperX as a key provider of infrastructure for hyperscale AI, exascale scientific computing, and industrial digital twins.

Huang argues that the economic advantage of NVIDIA's superior efficiency outweighs any pricing discounts from rivals, making their performance-per-watt advantage a formidable moat in the AI chip market.

title: Taiwan Semiconductor (TSM) Stock: Why the World’s Top Chipmaker Just Got More Bullish
summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) has raised its 2025 revenue growth forecast and reported better-than-expected Q3 earnings, driven by strong AI demand. The company plans to increase capital spending to at least $40 billion for capacity expansion, anticipating that AI-related chip revenue will double in 2025 and grow at a mid-40% annual rate for the next five years, offsetting challenges like US sanctions on China. This optimistic outlook and strong financial performance have led to a significant increase in its stock value and investor confidence.

title: SuperX Launches Rack-Scale AI Platform Powered by NVIDIA GB300 Chips, Redefining Data Center Infrastructure - Macau Business
summary: SuperX AI Technology Limited announced the launch of its GB300 NVL72 System, a rack-scale AI supercomputing platform powered by NVIDIA GB300 Grace Blackwell Ultra Superchips. This liquid-cooled system offers up to 1.8 exaFLOPS of AI performance per rack, addressing the physical and computational challenges of next-generation AI models. The platform necessitates advanced power solutions like 800 Voltage Direct Current (800VDC) and is integral to SuperX's modular AI factory solution, targeting hyperscale AI, scientific computing, and industrial digital twins.

title: Should Cybersecurity Stock Investors Buy Palo Alto Networks Stock? - The Globe and Mail
summary: This article discusses the investment potential of Palo Alto Networks (NASDAQ: PANW) in the growing cybersecurity industry. It highlights the long-term growth forecast for cybersecurity and mentions Stock Advisor's past successful stock recommendations, including Netflix and Nvidia, suggesting PANW as a potentially strong buy.

title: Nvidia (NVDA) Stock: CEO Huang Sells $41 Million While Cutting Leadership Team
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang has reduced his direct reports from 55 to 36 executives as part of a leadership restructuring within the rapidly growing company. Concurrently, Huang sold $41.3 million worth of Nvidia stock between October 13-15 through a pre-arranged trading plan, while still directly owning over 70 million shares. Wall Street analysts maintain a bullish outlook on Nvidia (NVDA), with 36 out of 38 recommending a "Buy" rating.

title: SuperX launches rack-scale AI platform powered by Nvidia GB300 chips, redefining data center infrastructure - MarketScreener
summary: SuperX has launched a new rack-scale AI platform utilizing Nvidia GB300 chips, aiming to redefine data center infrastructure. title: Bull of the Day: Micron Technology (MU) - sharewise.com

title: Oracle CTO Larry Ellison on AI use cases for healthcare, agriculture, climate change - Constellation Research
summary: Oracle CTO Larry Ellison discussed various AI use cases at Oracle's AI World conference, focusing on healthcare, agriculture, and climate change. He highlighted Oracle's plans for a massive AI Brain data center and AI Data Platform, emphasizing AI's role in solving humanity's most difficult problems through reasoning and perception. Ellison detailed how AI can revolutionize precision surgery, healthcare workflows, sustainable farming, crop engineering, and drone applications for fire detection and medical transport.

title: Gene Munster Calls $40 Billion Texas Data Center Involving Nvidia, xAI, Microsoft And BlackRock Proof That 'We're Still Early In AI' - Benzinga
summary: Gene Munster of Deepwater Asset Management highlighted a $40 billion Texas data center project involving Nvidia, xAI, Microsoft, and BlackRock as evidence of the early stages and immense potential of AI. This acquisition of Aligned Data Centers by an investor consortium underscores the conviction leading companies have in AI's long-term future. Despite this optimism, economists have raised concerns about a growing economic divide, with AI capital spending masking slower growth in non-AI sectors.

title: AMD Stock Soars after Top HSBC Analyst Lifts Price Target to Street-High $310 - TipRanks

This bullish outlook, driven by potentially high revenue from new MI450 AI chips and underestimation of AMD's potential by investors, led to a significant surge in AMD's stock. The analyst community largely echoes this positive sentiment, indicating a strong buy consensus for AMD.

title: AI Infrastructure Wave Reaches Australia: NVIDIA Partners with Firmus to Build Data Center Worth USD 2.9 Billion - 富途牛牛
summary: NVIDIA is partnering with Australian startup Firmus Technologies to build a large-scale AI data center cluster in Australia, named "Project Southgate," with an initial investment of USD 2.9 billion. The project will utilize NVIDIA GB300 chips and aims for significant expansion by 2028, potentially reaching 1.6 gigawatts of electricity consumption and AUD 73.3 billion in investment, driving substantial renewable energy development. This initiative marks a major step in extending global AI infrastructure to the Southern Hemisphere and highlights AI's growing impact on energy systems.

title: Want to Invest in Quantum Computing? 5 Stocks That Are Great Buys Right Now - The Globe and Mail
summary: This article identifies five stocks for investors looking to gain exposure to quantum computing, acknowledging the inherent risks but suggesting a basket approach. Additionally, it features legacy tech giants Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL) and Nvidia (NVDA), which are investing heavily in quantum computing through internal development or by evolving their existing platforms to support hybrid quantum systems.

summary: This article analyzes whether BigBear.ai (NYSE: BBAI) has the potential to make investors millionaires. The author concludes that there are better AI investment opportunities available.

title: SuperX Launches Rack-Scale AI Platform Powered by NVIDIA GB300 Chips, Redefining Data Center Infrastructure - PR Newswire
summary: SuperX AI Technology Limited has launched the SuperX GB300 NVL72 System, a rack-scale AI supercomputing platform powered by NVIDIA GB300 Grace Blackwell Ultra Superchips. This liquid-cooled system delivers up to 1.8 exaFLOPS of AI performance in a single rack, addressing the demands of training next-generation trillion-parameter models. The launch emphasizes the need for advanced power solutions like 800VDC and liquid cooling to support this high-density compute infrastructure, positioning SuperX's solution as a foundational element for hyperscale AI, exascale scientific computing, and industrial digital twins.

title: 1.8 ExaFLOPS: SuperX GB300 NVL72 rack AI system — 72 GPUs, liquid-cooled, 800VDC-ready - Stock Titan
summary: SuperX AI Technology Limited (NASDAQ: SUPX) launched its SuperX GB300 NVL72 System, a liquid-cooled, rack-scale AI platform built around the NVIDIA GB300 Grace Blackwell Ultra Superchip. The system integrates 72 Blackwell Ultra GPUs and 36 Grace CPUs, delivering approximately 1.8 exaFLOPS FP4 AI compute per rack. This platform aims to redefine data center infrastructure with high performance density and energy efficiency, requiring 800VDC power and liquid cooling to support its advanced AI workloads.

title: Chip giant TSMC posts record profit as AI demand continues to surge - This is Money
summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) announced a record net profit of $14.7 billion for the third quarter, a 39.1% increase year-over-year, driven by robust demand for AI and iPhone microchips. The company is strategically building fabrication plants in the US and Japan to mitigate geopolitical risks and capitalize on the surging AI investment, which is projected to reach $1.5 trillion by 2025. Despite warnings of an AI "bubble" and trade tensions, TSMC's CEO expects dramatic and positive AI growth to continue.

summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (TSMC) reported a rise in Q3 earnings and revenue, leading to an optimistic Q4 sales outlook and a pre-bell increase in its shares. title: Is BigBear.ai Your Ticket to Becoming a Millionaire?

title: Micron may follow Nvidia and AMD with this move that could send its stock higher, Citi says

Micron is one of three major DRAM producers, and Citi sees its importance and undersupply in the AI "food chain" leading to such contracts.

title: Hon Hai, Nvidia partner on AI factory infra development - Communications Today

This architecture is designed for high-density AI workloads, reducing losses and improving energy efficiency, and will support next-generation Nvidia GPUs. title: MediaTek helps NVIDIA to design its GB10 Grace Blackwell Superchip in NVIDIA DGX Spark - varindia.com

This superchip integrates MediaTek's expertise in power-efficient CPU design with NVIDIA's Blackwell GPU to deliver up to 1 PFLOP of AI performance for prototyping and fine-tuning large AI models. The DGX Spark, available from October 15, aims to make advanced AI development more accessible and solve performance and power consumption challenges.

This agreement includes the provision of approximately 200,000 Nvidia GB300 GPUs, marking one of the largest AI infrastructure deals to date. Nscale plans an IPO, potentially in the second half of 2026, leveraging this collaboration to position itself as a key provider of GPU capacity.

The DGX Spark, priced at $3,999, provides a petaflop of AI computing power in a compact form and is aimed at accelerating advanced AI and agentic development, having also been distributed to tech giants like Microsoft, Google, and Meta for testing.

title: Microsoft vs. Apple: What's the Better Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stock to Buy Today? - AOL.com

title: Nvidia Expands AI Empire Down Under — Chipmaker Plugs Into Australia With 54,000 GPUs To Power Massive Data Center
summary: Nvidia Corp. is significantly expanding its AI footprint in Australia through a partnership with Firmus Technologies and CDC Data Centers for Project Southgate. This initiative involves deploying 54,000 Nvidia GB300 AI chips and establishing a DGX Cloud region, with an initial investment of A$4.5 billion, scaling up to A$73.3 billion by 2028. The project aims to deliver sovereign, world-class AI capability powered by renewable energy, emphasizing Nvidia's push for global AI dominance despite recent concerns about retail sentiment and potential "related-party transactions" in the AI funding landscape.

title: Nasdaq-100 Firms Lead AI Revolution, Hold $206B Patents - 조선일보

title: TSMC expects AI megatrend to strengthen, as profit blows past forecasts - ET Telecom

title: BlackRock, MGX Make $40 Billion Bet on AI Boom With Aligned Data Centers Deal - Energy Connects
summary: BlackRock Inc.'s Global Infrastructure Partners, alongside MGX and other investors, have agreed to acquire Aligned Data Centers for $40 billion, marking one of BlackRock's largest infrastructure investments and a significant bet on the AI boom. This deal highlights the intense competition among financial firms to capitalize on the increasing demand for data center infrastructure driven by artificial intelligence. The acquisition positions Aligned, a hyperscale data center provider in the Americas, to benefit from substantial AI spending and expanding processing capacity needs.
authors: Bloomberg, Ryan Gould, Michelle F. Davis, Matthew Monks, Manuel Baigorri

title: Nvidia (NVDA) Reshapes Leadership Team as AI Expansion Speeds Up - TipRanks
summary: Nvidia's CEO Jensen Huang has reorganized the leadership team, reducing direct reports from 55 to 36, aiming for a flatter management structure as the company rapidly expands in AI. Key figures like Ian Buck, Michael Kagan, Bill Dally, Colette Kress, Debora Shoquist, and Chris Malachowsky remain in senior roles. This strategic reshuffle is intended to maintain efficiency and quick decision-making amidst Nvidia's significant growth and increasing market value, with analysts remaining bullish on NVDA stock.

title: Nvidia Partners in $2.9 Billion Australia Data Center Drive - Energy Connects
summary: Nvidia Corp. is partnering with Australian startup Firmus Technologies Ltd. on Project Southgate, a A$4.5 billion ($2.9 billion) initiative to build renewable energy-powered AI data centers across Australia. The project, which includes two data centers already under construction in Melbourne and Tasmania, plans to utilize 150 megawatts of power and Nvidia’s GB300 chips. There are plans to potentially expand the project to 1.6 gigawatts of power at a total investment of A$73.3 billion by 2028, which would necessitate 5.1 gigawatts of new wind, solar, and hydropower capacity.

title: Taiwans leading computer chip maker, TSMC, has reported its net profit surged nearly 40% in the last quarter, boosted by the surge in use of artificial intelligence

The article reiterates Huang's long-standing belief in human-AI collaboration, with AI agents assisting in various tasks and improving overall output.

authors: Jay Liu, Taipei; Sherri Wang, DIGITIMES Asia

summary: Dutch tech giant ASML reported stable net profits in Q3 2025 but issued a warning about a significant decline in its China sales for 2026 compared to 2024 and 2025. Despite geopolitical tensions and previous uncertainties, the company expects overall net sales in 2026 not to fall below 2025 levels, driven by strong quarterly performance and the expanding AI market. The article also highlights the broader geopolitical context of semiconductor technology, particularly between China and Western nations.

title: ASML Logs Strong Orders Amid AI Spending Frenzy - MarketScreener
summary: ASML Holding reported stronger-than-expected orders for its chip-making equipment in the third quarter, driven by robust demand for sophisticated semiconductors used in artificial intelligence. The Dutch company's orders reached 5.40 billion euros, surpassing analyst forecasts, with a significant portion attributed to its extreme ultraviolet lithography machines. ASML also anticipates that sales in the upcoming year will not fall below its 2025 figures.

title: ASML orders beat expectations as AI arms race boosts demand - The Edge Malaysia
summary: ASML Holding NV reported third-quarter orders of €5.4 billion, surpassing analyst expectations, driven by significant investments in artificial intelligence infrastructure. The Dutch semiconductor equipment maker, a sole producer of extreme ultraviolet lithography machines, is benefiting from strong AI chip demand and aims for annual revenue of €60 billion by 2030, despite geopolitical challenges and trade restrictions with China.

title: ASML sees significant China demand drop, Q3 bookings above estimates - MarketScreener
summary: ASML, a major supplier of chip-making equipment, projects a significant decline in demand from China for 2026, despite its third-quarter 2025 bookings surpassing market estimates. The company reported net bookings of 5.40 billion euros, exceeding analyst forecasts of 5.36 billion euros. ASML's CEO, Christophe Fouquet, stated that while total net sales in 2026 are not expected to fall below 2025 levels, demand from China will decrease substantially.

title: WaterBridge prices upsized IPO at $20 per share, to begin trading Wednesday
summary: WaterBridge Infrastructure LLC has priced its upsized initial public offering of 31.7 million Class A shares at $20.00 per share, aiming to raise approximately $588 million in net proceeds. The shares will begin trading Wednesday on the NYSE and NYSE Texas under the ticker "WBI," with the company operating the largest produced water infrastructure network in the United States. Despite robust operational efficiency and revenue, financial metrics suggest the company is not yet profitable, as highlighted by InvestingPro.

title: What’s Driving Baidu to New Heights?
summary: Baidu Inc.'s stock surged by 7.9% due to promising AI advancements, including the use of self-developed AI chips and the introduction of their ERNIE X1.1 reasoning model, which boasts improvements over rivals. Despite a neutral outlook from Susquehanna due to mixed Q2 results, Baidu is strategically restructuring its finances with a $617.6M senior notes offering and focusing on robust AI cloud growth. The company's strong financial metrics, including $18.96B revenue and a P/E ratio of 12.4, along with high ROA and ROE, position it well for future growth in the dynamic tech market.
authors: Tim Bohen, Ben Sturgill, Ellis Hobbs

title: SuperX forms joint venture with Zhonhen Electric
summary: SuperX AI Technology Limited has formed a joint venture with Zhonhen Electric, a Singapore subsidiary of Hangzhou Zhonhen Electric Co., Ltd., to establish SuperX Digital Power Pte. Ltd. This partnership aims to deliver advanced High Voltage Direct Current (HVDC) solutions globally, integrating SuperX's AI compute infrastructure with Zhonhen Electric's HVDC technology. The collaboration addresses the growing energy consumption in AI data centers by providing a more energy-efficient, high-density, and reliable "Compute + Power" integrated solution, significantly reducing total cost of ownership.

title: QQQ ETF: Hơn cả một chiếc rổ cổ phiếu công nghệ
summary: QQQ ETF (Invesco QQQ ETF) mô phỏng hiệu suất của chỉ số NASDAQ-100, bao gồm 100 công ty phi tài chính lớn nhất trên Nasdaq, chủ yếu là các công ty công nghệ hàng đầu như Apple, Microsoft, Amazon và Nvidia. Quỹ này thu hút nhà đầu tư toàn cầu nhờ khả năng tiếp cận nhanh chóng với các cổ phiếu tăng trưởng mạnh trong ngành công nghệ, phù hợp với những nhà đầu tư có khẩu vị rủi ro trung bình đến cao và tầm nhìn dài hạn, mặc dù đi kèm với rủi ro tập trung cao và biến động mạnh. Bài viết cũng so sánh QQQ với các biến thể QQQM và QQQJ, cung cấp cái nhìn chi tiết về cấu trúc danh mục, hiệu suất, chi phí và rủi ro liên quan, giúp nhà đầu tư đưa ra quyết định phù hợp với mục tiêu tài chính cá nhân.

title: NVIDIA and United Kingdom Build Nation’s AI Infrastructure and Ecosystem to Fuel Innovation, Economic Growth and Jobs
summary: NVIDIA is collaborating with the United Kingdom to build the nation's AI infrastructure, involving partners like Nscale, CoreWeave, and Microsoft, and an investment of up to £11 billion. This initiative includes deploying hundreds of thousands of NVIDIA Grace Blackwell GPUs, establishing AI factories, and boosting quantum computing and AI/robotics ecosystems. The goal is to accelerate the AI industrial revolution in the UK, fostering innovation, economic growth, and job creation.

title: Jacobs CEO Bob Pragada Talks Data Centers and Growth on CNBC’s Mad Money
summary: Jacobs CEO Bob Pragada appeared on CNBC’s Mad Money to discuss the company's growth strategy, particularly focusing on its expanding work in next-generation data centers to meet the demand for digital infrastructure. He highlighted Jacobs' comprehensive capabilities in infrastructure, energy, and water to address complex power and cooling needs, as well as collaborations with technology leaders like NVIDIA and the use of digital twins for optimization. Pragada underscored Jacobs' commitment to delivering innovative and sustainable solutions for evolving infrastructure and technology challenges.

title: Eaton (ETN) Set to Ride AI Data Center Boom, Analysts Reiterate Outperform
summary: Eaton (ETN) is anticipated to benefit significantly from the AI data center boom, with analysts reiterating an Outperform rating. BNP Paribas Exane analyst Andrew Buscaglia highlighted Oracle's strong backlog as an indicator of future demand for Eaton's power management equipment in AI data centers. Though ETN has underperformed year-to-date, analysts expect its valuation to re-rate higher as AI-related orders accelerate.

title: IWY ETF Price at $270.12: Outperformance Driven by Mega-Cap Tech
summary: The iShares Russell Top 200 Growth ETF (IWY) has climbed to $270.12, showcasing significant outperformance with a 25.34% yearly gain driven by its concentrated holdings in mega-cap tech giants like NVIDIA and Microsoft. The ETF is positioned to benefit from the AI capital expenditure supercycle and is projected to reach the $300-$310 range within the next year, despite its premium valuation. Its strategic weighting methodology balances concentration risk while leveraging strong growth prospects from its top holdings.

title: This Artificial Intelligence (AI) ETF Has Outperformed the Market By 2.4X Since Inception and Only Holds Profitable Companies
summary: The Roundhill Magnificent Seven ETF (MAGS) focuses on leading and profitable AI-involved companies, holding the "Magnificent Seven" stocks. Since its inception in April 2023, the ETF has returned 160%, significantly outperforming the S&P 500's 65.9% return. Its strategy is to provide equal-weight exposure to these megacap companies, which are deeply involved in artificial intelligence.

title: Direxion's QQQU/QQQD ETFs Facilitate Speculation For Magnificent Seven Stocks
summary: Direxion offers two ETFs, QQQU and QQQD, for speculating on the "Magnificent Seven" stocks. The QQQU ETF is a leveraged bull fund tracking 200% of the Indxx Magnificent 7 Index, while the QQQD ETF provides 100% inverse performance for bearish investors. These ETFs allow traders to gain exposure to the Mag 7's performance without the complexities of options, though they carry unique risks such as higher volatility and suitability for short-term holding due to daily compounding effects.

title: Micron Technology and Wendy's have been highlighted as Zacks Bull and Bear of the Day
summary: Zacks Equity Research has named Micron Technology (MU) as the Bull of the Day due to its critical role and strong growth prospects in the AI data center buildout, with a "Strong Buy" rating and robust earnings acceleration predicted. Conversely, Wendy’s (WEN) has been designated as the Bear of the Day, facing stagnant sales, a plummeting stock price, and downward earnings revisions, leading to a "Strong Sell" rating. The article also touches upon the rebounding U.S. IPO market in 2025, highlighting ETFs like Renaissance IPO ETF (IPO) and First Trust US Equity Opportunities ETF (FPX) as potential beneficiaries.

title: Elon Musk buys millions of Tesla shares and the Austin company’s stock jumps
summary: Elon Musk purchased approximately $1 billion worth of Tesla shares, totaling over 2.5 million shares, in response to a proposed trillion-dollar pay package and to signal confidence in the company's future. This acquisition caused Tesla's stock price to jump, helping it recover to a 1.5% year-to-date gain after an earlier 45% decline. The stock purchase also moves Musk closer to the ambitious benchmarks set by the Tesla board for his pay package, which could eventually require the company's market value to reach $8.5 trillion.

title: What Is Going On With Texas Instruments And Analog Devices Stocks On Monday?
summary: Texas Instruments and Analog Devices stocks dropped on Monday as China escalated its regulatory pressure on the U.S. semiconductor sector, launching new anti-dumping probes. This action, alongside an antitrust ruling against Nvidia, coincides with high-stakes U.S.-China trade talks in Madrid, intensifying geopolitical tensions affecting American chipmakers.

title: The Zacks Analyst Blog Highlights NVIDIA, Meta Platforms, Alibaba Group and Medalist Diversified REIT
summary: This Zacks Analyst Blog highlights recent research reports on NVIDIA, Meta Platforms, Alibaba Group, and Medalist Diversified REIT. It details each company's recent performance, key financial figures, growth drivers, and challenges, based on analysis from Zacks Equity Research. The article emphasizes the importance of these reports for investors seeking to understand market actions.

title: Lincoln Educational (LINC): Buy, Sell, or Hold Post Q2 Earnings?
summary: Despite Lincoln Educational (LINC) outperforming the S&P 500 significantly over the past five years, the article suggests caution due to weak growth in enrolled students, negative free cash flow margins, and declining return on invested capital. The authors believe that while its valuation is reasonable, the company's shaky fundamentals present too much downside risk. They recommend exploring other investment opportunities.

title: Jim Cramer Believes Oracle Corporation (ORCL)’s Conference Call Was Just “Masterful”
summary: Jim Cramer praised Oracle Corporation's recent conference call as "masterful" after its shares jumped 36% following a strong earnings report. Cramer highlighted CEO Safra Catz's projections for Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) growth, with revenue expected to reach $144 billion over four years. While acknowledging Oracle's investment potential, the article suggests that some AI stocks offer even greater promise with limited downside risk.

title: Alphabet enters $3 trillion market cap club as Big Tech's AI momentum builds
summary: Google parent Alphabet achieved a $3 trillion market capitalization for the first time, driven by renewed optimism in artificial intelligence and a favorable antitrust ruling. Its shares have rallied over 32% this year, making it the best performer among the "Magnificent 7" stocks. This milestone positions Alphabet alongside Apple and Microsoft in the $3 trillion club, with a recent court ruling allowing it to retain control of its Chrome browser and Android operating system.
authors: Johann M Cherian and Shashwat Chauhan

title: Hudson Global Announces New Share Repurchase Program
summary: Hudson Global, operating as Star Equity Holdings, announced modifications to its 2025 CEO/CAO Incentive Compensation Plan, reducing annual officer compensation by approximately $700,000. The company also completed a $5 million share repurchase program and authorized a new $3 million initiative, signaling confidence in its future. TipRanks' AI Analyst assigned a "Neutral" rating to the stock, citing strong earnings calls and corporate events balanced by ongoing profitability challenges.

title: Deeter Byron B, director at Servicetitan, reports stock sales
summary: Byron B. Deeter, a director and ten percent owner of ServiceTitan, Inc. (NASDAQ:TTAN), reported the sale of Class A Common Stock on September 10 and 11, 2025. This news follows ServiceTitan's impressive Q2 results, with 25% revenue growth, leading several analysts to raise price targets for the company.

title: Newegg Stock Soars: Buy Now?

(NASDAQ: NEGG) stock has soared by 18.53% due to positive investor response to strategic gains in the first half of 2025, including a narrower net loss and increased sales. The company introduced a "Gamer Zone" and saw significant growth in GMV and net sales, along with insider buying, indicating strong confidence in its future performance and a promising recovery path.
authors: Tim Bohen, Ben Sturgill, Ellis Hobbs

title: Occidental Petroleum Stock: Recovery Potential or Value Trap?
summary: Occidental Petroleum's stock has underperformed the S&P 500 significantly this year due to lower oil prices and high debt, despite strong operations. The company shows financial flexibility with high-margin Permian Basin production and debt reduction efforts, but faces risks from volatile oil prices and environmental liabilities. Investors are left to weigh its historical resilience against ongoing market volatility and debt levels.

title: BioSig Technologies Rebrands to Streamex Corp.

This change follows a merger with Streamex Exchange Corporation and aims to expand the company's business model by integrating tokenization technology, particularly in the commodities market. Despite this strategic move, an AI analyst from TipRanks classifies the stock as Underperform due to significant financial difficulties.

title: Super Micro’s stock is getting an Nvidia bump. Here’s the latest update.
summary: Super Micro Computer Inc.'s stock is experiencing a rally following the company's announcement that it has started shipping Nvidia Corp.’s Blackwell Ultra systems in volume. The stock has gained 10% over the past three sessions and rose an additional 4% in extended trading. Super Micro emphasizes its advantage in fast deployments of new Nvidia technologies.

title: Vanguard's VUG ETF: The Ultimate Growth ETF for Your Portfolio
summary: The Vanguard Growth ETF (VUG) is highlighted as a premier investment for growth-oriented portfolios, driven by its focus on large-cap companies at the forefront of innovation, particularly in AI and technology. The article details its top holdings like NVIDIA, Microsoft, and Apple, its consistent outperformance against benchmarks such as the S&P 500, and its exceptionally low expense ratio. VUG is presented as a stable, diversified, and cost-effective vehicle for long-term wealth building, offering broad exposure to dynamic companies shaping the global economy.

title: Cloudastructure, Inc. Approves 2024 Equity Incentive Plan
summary: Cloudastructure, Inc. (CSAI) has approved an amended 2024 Equity Incentive Plan, increasing shares available for issuance by 2,000,000, and stockholders elected Ruba Qashu to the board. Despite strong revenue growth, TipRanks' AI Analyst "Spark" rates CSAI as "Underperform" due to financial instability, negative equity, ongoing losses, and high volatility, making it a risky investment. The stock has a current "Buy" analyst rating with a $6.00 price target.

title: Synopsys Stock Surge: A Deep Dive
summary: Synopsys Inc. (NASDAQ: SNPS) shares surged 11.8% due to investor optimism fueled by new strategic partnerships, robust earnings growth forecasts, and the crucial acquisition of Ansys. The company's strategic foresight is also evident in its collaborative educational efforts and embrace of AI, reinforcing its market position despite a recent earnings miss. Analysts maintain an optimistic long-term outlook, highlighting strong profitability and liquidity.
authors: Tim Bohen, Ben Sturgill, Ellis Hobbs

title: Next Technology Rocketed 38% Today – Here’s What Retail Investors Feel About The Stock
summary: Next Technology (NXTT) stock surged over 38% and saw a 1,719% increase in user message count on Stocktwits, reflecting extremely bullish retail sentiment. The company, which combines AI with digital assets, significantly increased its Bitcoin holdings, from 833 Bitcoin in late 2024 to 5,833 Bitcoin by mid-2025. Despite recent losses in its stock value this year, investors are optimistic, especially given the rise in Bitcoin's price.

title: SK hynix shares hit 52-week high after Oracle rally
summary: SK hynix Inc. shares reached a 52-week high, trading at 313,500 won, boosted by an overnight rally in Oracle Corp. following its strong earnings outlook and significant jump in remaining performance obligations. This surge also positively impacted other Korean chipmakers like Samsung Electro-Mechanics Co., which also hit a record high after brokerages raised their target prices. The broader tech market saw gains with Nvidia and Broadcom also rising due to renewed optimism for AI infrastructure.

title: Super Micro Computer, Inc. - Supermicro Begins Volume Shipments of NVIDIA Blackwell Ultra Systems and Rack Plug-and-Play Data Center-Scale Solutions
summary: Supermicro announced the broad availability and volume shipments of its NVIDIA Blackwell Ultra solutions, including Plug-and-Play-ready NVIDIA HGX B300 systems and GB300 NVL72 racks. These pre-validated solutions are designed for rapid deployment of high-performance AI infrastructure for various AI applications, optimized for efficiency and performance at scale. Supermicro's Data Center Building Block Solutions (DCBBS) offer turn-key delivery and services to accelerate AI factory deployment, showcasing the company's commitment to cutting-edge AI technology.

title: What Video Gaming and eSports Reveals About Thematic ETFs
summary: This article examines the evolution and performance of VanEck's Video Gaming and eSports UCITS ETF (ESPO) since its launch in 2019, highlighting its strong returns and the growth of the gaming industry. It discusses how thematic ETFs adapt to market changes, exemplified by shifts in ESPO's holdings, and emphasizes the importance of investment patience. The piece also delves into trends like mobile gaming, in-app monetization, and AI's impact on game development, while noting the slower-than-anticipated revenue growth in eSports.

title: Lunate Capital lines up quantum computing ETF
summary: Lunate Capital is launching the Boreas Solactive Quantum Computing UCITS ETF (QUANTM) to expand its Irish-domiciled ETF offerings. This new ETF, listing on the Abu Dhabi Securities Exchange on September 22nd with a 0.49% TER, will track 25 companies in quantum computing hardware, software, algorithms, and communication. The firm sometimes opts for UCITS ETFs over Sharia-compliant ones to avoid filtering out major, marketable companies.

title: Oracle salta 36%, “ganha” US$ 244 bi e tem melhor sessão de 1992 com ânimo sobre IA
summary: Oracle's shares soared 36%, adding US$244 billion to its market value and marking its best session since 1992, driven by an aggressive outlook for its cloud business and strong demand for AI infrastructure. The company is emerging as a key provider of computational capacity for AI, signing massive contracts including a commitment with OpenAI for 4.5 gigawatts of data center capacity. Oracle's CEO, Safra Catz, projects significant growth in its cloud infrastructure unit, despite high investment costs in data centers.

title: B2Gold Corp stock hits 52-week high at 4.34 USD
summary: B2Gold Corp's stock has reached a 52-week high of $4.34, reflecting a 58% increase over the past year and a 64% gain in the last six months. The company, with a market cap of $5.72 billion, appears undervalued according to InvestingPro analysis, which also indicates expected revenue growth of 66% this year and includes 12 additional investment insights. This milestone highlights strong investor confidence and favorable market conditions.

title: Erayak Power Solution Faces Nasdaq Delisting Notice
summary: Erayak Power Solution Group Inc. (RAYA) has received a delisting notice from Nasdaq due to non-compliance with the Low Priced Stocks Rule, as its securities traded below $0.10 for ten consecutive days. The company plans to appeal the delisting decision by September 10, 2025, and is considering a reverse stock split to regain compliance. Erayak specializes in power supply products like inverters and generators for various applications.

title: ProShares Expands Lineup with ETFs Targeting 2x Daily Returns of Coinbase, Nvidia, Palantir, and Tesla
summary: ProShares has expanded its product lineup with new single stock ETFs designed to target 2x daily returns of Coinbase (COIA), NVIDIA (NVDB), Palantir (PLTA), and Tesla (TSLI). These new funds allow investors to magnify the daily returns of these transformative companies. ProShares, as the world's largest provider of geared ETFs, aims to provide strategic and tactical opportunities for investors.

title: Dropbox Secures $700M Loan, Announces Share Buyback
summary: Dropbox (DBX) has announced an amendment to its Credit and Guaranty Agreement, securing an additional $700 million in delayed draw term loans to address convertible senior notes due in 2026. Concurrently, the company authorized a new $1.5 billion share repurchase program for its Class A common stock. TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates DBX as Neutral, noting strong technical momentum and strategic moves but tempered by financial instability and declining revenue growth.

title: Asset Entities Approves Merger with Strive Enterprises
summary: Asset Entities Inc. (ASST) stockholders have approved a merger with Strive Enterprises, Inc., creating a new entity named Strive, Inc. set to trade under the ticker ASST on Nasdaq. This strategic move aims to establish a leading public Bitcoin Treasury Company, maximize Bitcoin per share for investors, and is expected to close around September 12, 2025, pending a private placement financing exceeding $750 million. Asset Entities is a technology company specializing in social media marketing and content delivery.

title: Ault Alliance rebrands as Hyperscale Data, eyes data center growth
summary: Ault Alliance, Inc. has rebranded as Hyperscale Data, Inc. (NYSE American: GPUS) to reflect its strategic focus on data center operations, particularly expanding its Michigan AI data center capacity from 30 to 300 megawatts. This move aligns with growing demand for AI infrastructure, despite the company facing significant debt and cash burn challenges highlighted by InvestingPro. Stockholders do not need to take action regarding the rebranding.

title: Applied Materials at Goldman Sachs Conference: Strategic Growth in AI and Packaging
summary: Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) presented at the Goldman Sachs Communicopia + Technology Conference 2025, with CEO Gary Dickerson outlining strategic growth opportunities driven by AI demand and advanced packaging. The company anticipates its sixth consecutive year of revenue growth and plans to double its advanced packaging business to $3 billion, despite a near-term slowdown in the iCAPS market. Dickerson expressed confidence in long-term growth fueled by innovation, co-innovation with customers, and investments in U.S. facilities.

title: Nvidia Unveils New Chip System for AI Video, Software Creation
summary: Nvidia, a key player in AI computing, announced a new product called Rubin CPX, designed for advanced tasks like video generation and software creation. This new chip system, set to debut in late 2026, will be available as cards for existing servers or as discrete computers for data centers. The announcement highlights Nvidia's continued innovation in powering the artificial intelligence boom.

title: Industry First: Eaton's Edge Solution Tackles Massive AI Power Spikes Threatening Data Centers and Grid Stability
summary: Eaton has launched an industry-first edge-based solution designed to detect AI power bursts, which are large fluctuations in energy demanded by AI computing infrastructure. This innovation, available via a firmware update for its Eaton Power Xpert quality (PXQ) event analysis system, helps data center operators mitigate the impact of these power spikes on critical infrastructure and the grid. The solution addresses the challenge of subsynchronous oscillations (SSO) caused by AI workloads, which can lead to costly outages and equipment damage.

title: 2 Artificial Intelligence (AI) ETFs to Confidently Buy Heading Into 2026
summary: This article recommends two Artificial Intelligence (AI) ETFs, the Roundhill Generative AI and Technology ETF (CHAT) and the Vanguard Mega Cap Growth ETF (MGK), for investors looking to capitalize on the AI boom heading into 2026. Both ETFs offer exposure to leading technology companies heavily involved in AI development and infrastructure. The article highlights the key holdings and performance of each ETF, suggesting them as simple ways for investors to participate in the growing AI market.
authors: Anthony Di Pizio, The Motley Fool

title: Oracle shocks investors with massive future revenue AI deals
summary: Oracle's shares skyrocketed by 42% despite missing Wall Street revenue expectations, driven by the announcement of several multi-billion-dollar AI-related cloud deals. The company reported $14.93 billion in revenue and touted significant contracts with major AI players like OpenAI, xAI, and Meta, with future revenue obligations soaring to $455 billion. Founder Larry Ellison's net worth increased by $100 billion, briefly making him the world's richest person.

title: 5 Stocks to Buy Before the Fed Cuts Interest Rates
summary: Morningstar strategists discuss the economic outlook, including tariffs, inflation, jobs, and the Federal Reserve's potential interest rate cuts. They review recent company earnings for Nvidia, Marvell Technology, and Alphabet, and analyze stock picks like Bath & Body Works, Constellation Brands, and Kraft Heinz. The article concludes with five stock recommendations across real estate, homebuilding, building products, financials, and energy sectors that are positioned to benefit from falling interest rates.
authors: David Sekera, CFA and Susan Dziubinski

title: NVIDIA Unveils Rubin CPX: A New Class of GPU Designed for Massive-Context Inference
summary: NVIDIA announced the Rubin CPX, a new class of GPU designed for massive-context inference, enabling AI systems to handle tasks like million-token coding and generative video. This GPU, part of the NVIDIA Vera Rubin NVL144 CPX platform, offers significant AI performance and memory bandwidth improvements, aiming to transform applications like AI coding assistants and video processing. Industry innovators like Cursor, Runway, and Magic are already exploring its potential for accelerating their AI applications.

title: HPE Strengthens Networking Business Through Juniper Acquisition
summary: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) reported third-quarter revenue that exceeded expectations, driven by strong demand in its networking and server divisions, particularly for AI-optimized servers. The company further boosted its networking business through the acquisition of Juniper and reached an agreement with activist investor Elliott Investment Management. While HPE shows investment potential, some AI stocks are suggested to offer greater upside with less risk.

title: 50% Cost Savings: Beamr's AI Tech Transforms Live 720p Sports to 4K Quality Using NVIDIA Holoscan
summary: Beamr (NASDAQ: BMR) announced a demonstration of its real-time AI-powered 4K quality enhancement solution at IBC 2025 in Amsterdam. This technology, integrated with NVIDIA Holoscan for Media, can upscale low-resolution content to live 4K while crucially reducing CDN costs by up to 50%. The solution combines NVIDIA RTX Video Super Resolution with Beamr's Content-Adaptive Bitrate technology for optimized and efficient distribution of enhanced streams.

title: Beamr Breakthrough in Video Tech Boosts Autonomous Vehicle Development
summary: Beamr Imaging Ltd. (NASDAQ: BMR) has seen a stock increase of 10.41% due to positive market sentiment and advancements in video compression technology. NVIDIA has validated Beamr's innovations, which promise a 23–50% improvement in video compression, offering significant benefits for autonomous vehicle development. Despite rising operational costs, Beamr’s strategic partnerships and technological breakthroughs position it as a key player in the autonomous vehicle and machine learning sectors.
authors: Tim Bohen, Ben Sturgill, Ellis Hobbs

title: Beamr to Demonstrate Live 4K Quality Enhancement with NVIDIA Holoscan for Media
summary: Beamr Imaging Ltd. will demonstrate real-time, AI-powered 4K quality enhancement for live events using NVIDIA Holoscan for Media at IBC 2025. This solution efficiently upscales low-resolution content to 4K and then optimizes it with Beamr's Content-Adaptive Bitrate technology, reducing CDN costs by up to 50% while preserving visual quality. The demonstration addresses the challenge broadcasters face in balancing premium quality with cost efficiency for live sports and music concerts.

title: Infleqtion to Go Public Through Merger with Churchill Capital Corp X
summary: Infleqtion, a leader in neutral atom-based quantum technology, will go public through a merger with Churchill Capital Corp X (NASDAQ: CCCX). This partnership aims to accelerate Infleqtion's mission to commercialize quantum products, supported by over $540 million in gross transaction proceeds including $125 million in incremental financing. The combined company will operate as Infleqtion and is expected to be listed on a North American exchange under the ticker “INFQ,” unlocking new applications in AI, national security, and space.

title: VIDEO: ETF of the Week: JTEK
summary: This article features a discussion between Todd Rosenbluth and Chuck Jaffe about the JPMorgan U.S. Tech Leaders ETF (JTEK) as the "ETF of the Week." They explore why JTEK, an actively managed ETF with over $2 billion in assets, is outperforming traditional tech-focused funds like QQQ, highlighting its unique approach to investing in "tech-adjacent" companies. The conversation also covers JTEK's holdings, including Nvidia, Snowflake, and Robinhood, and its role as a growth component in an investor's portfolio.

title: The U.S. government is taking a stake in Intel. It’s rare — and it has some risks
summary: The U.S. government, under the Trump administration, has taken a rare 10% equity stake in chipmaker Intel, converting previous grants into ownership. This unprecedented move outside of a direct economic crisis is driven by competition with China and the global race for artificial intelligence, aiming to bolster domestic high-end microchip manufacturing. While analysts see Intel (INTC) as the U.S.'s best bet in this sector, concerns remain about potential political pressures and inefficiencies stemming from government involvement.

title: Is the iShares Semiconductor ETF Worth Investing in for the Long Haul?
summary: The iShares Semiconductor ETF (SOXX) has outperformed the S&P 500 over the past five years, driven by its focus on leading semiconductor companies involved in AI. While providing access to top tech stocks with growth potential, the ETF is not highly diversified and carries significant volatility due to elevated valuations and a high beta. For growth-oriented investors comfortable with short-term volatility and a long-term outlook, SOXX could be a solid investment.

title: Wilk Jason, CEO of Dave Inc., sells $1.5m in shares
summary: Jason Wilk, CEO of Dave Inc. (NASDAQ:DAVE), sold 7,557 shares of Class A Common Stock for over $1.5 million on September 4, 2025. This transaction follows a significant surge in Dave Inc.'s stock and a strong second-quarter earnings report that surpassed analyst expectations. The company also recently increased its share repurchase authorization.

title: Tech Investors Are Choosing SOXX Over SPX — Here’s Why
summary: The iShares Semiconductor ETF (SOXX) is gaining favor among tech investors over S&P 500 tracking funds like SPY and VOO, despite SOXX having higher management fees and a lower dividend yield. This preference is driven by SOXX's concentrated exposure to the high-growth semiconductor sector, which has led to significant share-price outperformance compared to the more diversified S&P 500 funds over the past five years. While SOXX is considered riskier due to its concentration, it offers investors the opportunity for enhanced tech-fueled growth in their portfolios.

title: Analysts Offer Insights on Technology Companies: Gitlab (GTLB) and Nvidia (NVDA)
summary: Analysts from Bank of America Securities and Phillip Securities have issued bullish ratings on Gitlab (GTLB) and Nvidia (NVDA) respectively. Gitlab received a Buy rating with a $72.00 price target, while Nvidia was also rated Buy with a $185.00 price target. The consensus for Gitlab is a Moderate Buy with a 25.6% upside, and for Nvidia, it's a Strong Buy with a 23.4% upside.

title: Should Savvy Investors Be Watching the Dan Ives ETF in 2025?
summary: The article discusses the Dan Ives Wedbush AI Revolution ETF (NYSEMKT: IVES), which invests in artificial intelligence stocks and is inspired by analyst Dan Ives' research. Launched in June, the ETF has appreciated by 11% and now manages over $500 million in assets, suggesting it could be a valuable addition to a savvy investor's portfolio in 2025 for broad AI exposure, especially for those who prefer ETFs over individual stock picking.

title: Guidance da Broadcom decepciona investidores apesar do crescimento em IA
summary: Broadcom's revenue forecast for the current period, despite significant growth in AI-related sales, failed to impress investors who anticipated a greater boost from the AI boom. The company projected fourth-quarter sales of approximately US$17.4 billion, slightly above analyst estimates but below some higher expectations. This conservative outlook comes after a period of strong stock performance and amid intensified competition in the AI semiconductor market.

title: Saba Capital Management, L.P. sells abrdn Life Sciences Investors (HQL) shares for $197k By Investing.com
summary: Saba Capital Management, L.P. sold 14,083 shares of abrdn Life Sciences Investors (HQL) common stock for a total of $197,725 on September 2, 2025. Following the transaction, Saba Capital Management retains a significant stake of 2,968,623 shares in the company. HQL, with a market cap of $406 million, offers an 11.9% dividend yield and has maintained dividend payments for 30 consecutive years.

title: Nvidia Just Went Quantum—And ETFs Are Scrambling To Catch Up
summary: Nvidia made a significant quantum computing move by participating in a $600 million funding round for Quantinuum, a Honeywell-owned company, signaling strong confidence in quantum technology's commercial viability. This investment, alongside other major players, reinforces Nvidia's hardware development towards quantum-ready workloads. While pure-play quantum computing investments are scarce, ETFs like Defiance Quantum ETF (QTUM) and broader innovation funds offer investors indirect exposure to this evolving sector.

title: Dell, HPE reap revenue gains from AI server demand surge
summary: Dell and Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) have reported significant revenue increases driven by the surging enterprise demand for AI-optimized servers. Despite economic uncertainties, both companies saw substantial growth in server sales, with Dell's server and networking segment revenues rising 69% to $12.9 billion and HPE's server segment revenue increasing by 16% year over year. The demand is fueled by enterprises upgrading aged infrastructure and moving generative AI pilots into production, with forecasts indicating continued high investment in AI hardware.

title: SoFi bets on AI with new Agentic AI ETF as sector faces valuation doubts
summary: SoFi Technologies has launched a new Agentic AI ETF (AGIQ) with a 0.69% expense ratio, aiming to provide retail investors with exposure to advanced AI companies. This ETF tracks the BITA U.S. Agentic Select Index, covering 30 U.S.-listed firms involved in agentic AI. The launch comes amid increasing market skepticism about AI sector valuations, although demand for AI investments remains strong, leading to a crowded market of AI-focused ETFs.

title: Nvidia backs $85M round for AI search startup Exa
summary: Exa Labs Inc., a startup specializing in an AI search engine, has successfully raised $85 million in a Series B funding round led by Benchmark, with participation from Nvidia Corp., Y Combinator, and Lightspeed. This investment, valuing Exa at $700 million, will be utilized to expand its hardware infrastructure, particularly its graphics card cluster, and to scale its indexing and processing capabilities. Exa's technology enables AI models to efficiently browse and extract information from the web, supporting various enterprise AI applications.

title: SoFi unveils Agentic AI ETF amid rising skepticism over AI valuation
summary: SoFi Technologies has launched its first Agentic AI ETF (AGIQ) in almost two years, tracking 30 U.S.-listed AI firms including Nvidia and Deere, with a 0.69% expense ratio. The launch comes amidst growing skepticism regarding AI market valuations and overcrowding in the AI-tracking ETF sector. SoFi aims to provide retail investors with easy access to the evolving AI landscape, despite concerns voiced by some analysts about market saturation and potential overvaluation.

title: CHAT: A High-Risk, Speculative Buy On The AI Infrastructure Supercycle (NYSEARCA:CHAT)
summary: The article rates the Roundhill Generative AI & Technology ETF (CHAT) as a speculative Buy for high-risk, multi-year investors seeking exposure to the AI infrastructure supercycle. While CHAT has shown strong returns and bullish momentum, it carries structural risks due to high concentration in tech, elevated fees, and reliance on inflows. A dollar-cost averaging strategy on pullbacks and tiered profit-taking are recommended to manage the inherent risks.

title: T. ROWE PRICE RELEASES NEWEST EPISODE OF CEO PODCAST SERIES
summary: T. Rowe Price has released the latest episode of its CEO podcast series, "The Angle," featuring an interview with Citi CEO Jane Fraser. Hosted by T. Rowe Price's Chief Investment Officer Eric Veiel, the discussion covers Citi's strategic focus, the economic outlook, and innovation in the banking sector. This marks the seventh episode of the series, which explores timely topics shaping financial markets.

title: As AI Becomes Increasingly Physical, Consider THNQ
summary: This article highlights the transition of Artificial Intelligence (AI) into more physical applications, emphasizing robotics as a significant growth opportunity. It suggests the ROBO Global Artificial Intelligence ETF (THNQ) as a way for investors to gain targeted exposure to firms building AI infrastructure and applying AI, particularly those involved in the physical AI ecosystem. The piece underscores the massive market potential in securing the multitude of future robotic and AI devices.

title: CHAT ETF Surges 49.9% in 1Y – AI Infrastructure Boom Powers $53 Price
summary: The Roundhill Generative AI & Technology ETF (NYSEARCA:CHAT) has gained nearly 49.9% over the past year, outperforming other AI-themed ETFs, driven by the multi-trillion-dollar CapEx cycle in AI infrastructure. The ETF, which focuses on pure-play AI infrastructure, closed at $53.17 and is heavily concentrated in tech, with NVIDIA, Alphabet, and Astera Labs among its top holdings. Despite its strong performance, the fund faces risks due to its concentration, high expense ratio, and potential energy grid bottlenecks.

title: Sprinklr’s (NYSE:CXM) Q2: Beats On Revenue, Full-Year Outlook Slightly Exceeds Expectations
summary: Sprinklr (NYSE:CXM) reported strong Q2 CY2025 results, beating Wall Street's revenue expectations with 7.5% year-on-year growth and a non-GAAP profit significantly above consensus estimates. The company also raised its full-year revenue and adjusted EPS guidance, indicating an optimistic outlook despite a slight miss on next quarter's EPS guidance. Sprinklr's customer acquisition efficiency remains a challenge, but management is encouraged by customer engagement and upcoming R&D innovations.

title: Intel Ousted From Dow Jones By Rival Nvidia
summary: Intel, a microprocessor manufacturer with a significant presence in Oregon, has been removed from the Dow Jones Industrial Average after a 25-year run, replaced by rival Nvidia. This change reflects Intel's struggles in the AI-powered chipmaking market and its recent financial losses, while Nvidia's market value has surged due to demand for AI accelerator chips. The move by S&P Global aims to ensure the Dow Jones more accurately represents the semiconductor industry.

title: Analog Devices Gandeng NVIDIA Jetson Thor untuk Robot Humanoid Generasi Baru
summary: Analog Devices (ADI) dan NVIDIA berkolaborasi untuk mempercepat pengembangan robot humanoid dan autonomous mobile robots (AMRs) menggunakan NVIDIA Jetson Thor. Kolaborasi ini menggabungkan kemampuan ADI dalam sensor, kontrol gerak, dan konektivitas dengan performa komputasi AI dari Jetson Thor. Tujuannya adalah untuk mendorong robot berbasis penalaran dari simulasi ke penerapan dunia nyata, mendefinisikan ulang standar robotika dengan kemampuan fisik dan penalaran yang lebih canggih.

title: Tech Valuations Surprisingly Accommodating
summary: Despite the significant returns of the Nasdaq-100 Index and the Magnificent Seven stocks, the overall tech sector currently trades at a slight discount to its long-term averages, supported by strong earnings power. The article highlights the potential for AI and cybersecurity to boost ETFs like QQQ and QQQM, with these ETFs offering exposure to both the Magnificent Seven and other promising tech companies. It further suggests that some companies outside the Magnificent Seven within these ETFs offer attractive valuations and long-term growth prospects.

title: ProShares S&P 500 Dynamic Buffer ETF (FB) Stock Price, Holdings, Dividend Yield
summary: This article provides a detailed overview of the ProShares S&P 500 Dynamic Buffer ETF (FB), including its current stock price, dividend yield, and key holdings as of August 31, 2025. It highlights the ETF's top five holdings, which include NVIDIA, Microsoft, Apple, Amazon, and Meta Platforms, and also presents various performance metrics and fundamental data.

title: Marvell Technology: Be Greedy When Others Are Fearful (NASDAQ:MRVL)
summary: Marvell Technology experienced an 18.6% stock drop following a weaker-than-expected Q2'26 earnings report, but this is seen as an overreaction. The company posted strong 58% Y/Y revenue growth in Q2'26 and a robust outlook for Q3, positioning it favorably within the AI and Data Center CapEx landscape. The stock is currently trading at a discount, offering an attractive entry point for investors seeking AI-driven growth.

title: iShares MSCI World ETF: Tech-Riesen im Fokus
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF is heavily concentrated in tech stocks, with its top 10 positions comprising over 25% of the fund's volume, including giants like NVIDIA, Microsoft, and Apple. Despite recent market fluctuations, the ETF has seen an 11% increase year-to-date and continued inflows, indicating investor confidence in developed markets. However, this tech focus also makes the ETF vulnerable to sector-specific setbacks.

title: QQQI ETF: 13.7% Yield and 30% NAV Growth Outshine QYLD, JEPQ
summary: The NEOS Nasdaq-100 High Income ETF (QQQI) has demonstrated superior performance since its January 2024 launch, offering a 13.78% trailing twelve-month yield and 30.52% NAV growth. QQQI differentiates itself from competitors like JEPQ and QYLD through a tax-efficient strategy involving selective covered calls and reinvestment of option premiums, allowing for both consistent income and capital appreciation. The ETF's heavy tech concentration, coupled with its ability to capitalize on market volatility and Section 1256 tax treatment, makes it an attractive "Buy" for income-seeking investors amidst elevated market valuations.

title: The calculator company that’s also a semiconductor giant
summary: Texas Instruments (TI), widely known for its graphing calculators, is also a significant player in the semiconductor industry. The company, co-inventor of the integrated circuit, now primarily focuses on analog and embedded semiconductors used in various applications from cars to healthcare. TI is making massive investments, including a $60 billion plan to build new fabrication plants in Texas and Utah, and is partnering with Nvidia for AI infrastructure.

title: Hedge Fund and Insider Trading News: Ken Griffin, Warren Buffett, TCI Fund Management, Armistice Capital, Match Group Inc (MTCH), Donegal Group Inc (DGICA), and More
summary: This article provides a roundup of recent hedge fund and insider trading news involving prominent figures like Ken Griffin and Warren Buffett, and firms such as TCI Fund Management and Armistice Capital. It covers various market activities including stock bets, hedge fund performance, and insider buying/selling in companies like Match Group Inc (MTCH) and Donegal Group Inc (DGICA). The article also highlights an investment opportunity in an AI stock believed to outperform NVDA.

title: Mike Philbrick's Past Picks: Sprott Uranium Miners ETF, Global X Canadian Oil & Gas Equity Covered Call ETF & Invesco S&P 500 Equal Weight Index ETF
summary: Mike Philbrick, CEO of ReSolve Asset Management, discusses his past stock picks, which include the Sprott Uranium Miners ETF, Global X Canadian Oil & Gas Equity Covered Call ETF, and Invesco S&P 500 Equal Weight Index ETF. The article highlights these specific investment choices and provides context from his role at ReSolve Asset Management. It also features a recording of his analysis on how these picks are currently performing in the market.

title: This ETF Streamlines AI Investing
summary: The Invesco Top QQQ ETF (QBIG) offers an efficient way to invest in mega-cap artificial intelligence stocks, holding key companies like the "Magnificent Seven" and Broadcom. Despite its concentrated portfolio, QBIG covers various AI segments, allowing investors to capitalize on the sector's growth without individual stock picking. This approach helps mitigate risks associated with the evolving and often complex AI investment landscape.

title: Should You Buy the Low-Cost ETF With 62% Invested in "Ten Titans" Growth Stocks?
summary: This article examines the Invesco S&P 500 Top 50 ETF (XLG), which has a significant 62% allocation to "Ten Titans" growth stocks, an expansion of the "Magnificent Seven" that includes Broadcom, Oracle, and Netflix. The ETF offers concentrated exposure to mega-cap growth companies, outperforming other funds due to this focus, despite slightly higher expense ratios. Investors seeking to maximize exposure to these dominant growth stocks may find XLG a worthwhile choice, though it carries increased volatility due to its concentrated nature.

title: Richtech Robotics Inc. Launches New $100M ATM Offering
summary: Richtech Robotics Inc. has launched a new "At The Market" (ATM) offering, allowing it to sell up to $100 million in Class B common stock. This agreement, effective August 28, 2025, replaces a previous one and designates Rodman & Renshaw LLC and H.C. Wainwright & Co., LLC as agents, with Rodman serving as the exclusive sales agent for 12 months from May 16, 2025. The company's Class B stock (RR) currently holds a "Buy" rating from analysts with a target price of $3.00.

title: Eaton Vance Fund Appoints New Chairperson
summary: Eaton Vance Tax-Managed Global Buy-Write Opportunities Fund (ETW) has announced the appointment of Scott E. Wennerholm as its new Chairperson. Wennerholm will serve a four-year term, succeeding interim leader Susan J. Sutherland. This appointment comes after the passing of the former Chairperson.

title: Alibaba's Mixed Earnings Highlight Opportunities in AI
summary: Alibaba reported mixed financial results for Q2 2025, with revenue slightly below expectations but net income significantly exceeding forecasts due to strong cloud division growth driven by AI demand. The company is actively investing in AI, including developing its own chip to replace Nvidia's, presenting opportunities for investors through specific ETFs like KBAB for direct exposure or AVEM for diversified emerging market access. These developments highlight Alibaba's strategic pivot towards AI as a key growth driver amidst evolving trade relations.

title: Agilent Technologies, Nvidia, Snowflake
summary: This article details revised ratings and price targets from Wall Street securities analysts for various US-listed companies, including Agilent Technologies, Nvidia, and Snowflake. Key highlights show increased price targets for Nvidia and Snowflake, reflecting positive analyst sentiment. The report provides a comprehensive list of these revisions, offering insights into recent analyst actions across diverse sectors.

title: Nvidia Isn't the Only Way to Profit From the AI Boom
summary: While Nvidia has shown incredible growth and dominates the AI chip market, its stock is highly priced for perfection, requiring flawless performance each quarter. For investors seeking broad exposure to the AI boom without over-reliance on a single company, the Invesco PHLX Semiconductor ETF (SOXQ) offers diversification across 30 major semiconductor companies, including Nvidia, at a lower expense ratio. The insatiable demand for advanced semiconductors suggests the entire sector is a promising investment avenue, with many companies demonstrating strong performance and more attractive valuations than Nvidia.

title: Could O'Reilly Automotive's (ORLY) Aggressive Buybacks Signal Enduring Confidence or Missed Investment Alternatives?
summary: O'Reilly Automotive's (ORLY) stock recently hit an all-time high, driven by an aggressive share repurchase program that has reduced outstanding shares by 24% since 2020 and management's optimistic outlook for future sales and profit margins. While buybacks reinforce investor confidence, the article highlights the ongoing risk of increased tariffs and supply chain disruptions potentially impacting product costs and gross margins. Analysts' fair value estimates for ORLY show significant divergence, reflecting varying perspectives on these risks and future performance.

title: ProShares Debuts 2x Daily ETF for Equal Weight S&P 500
summary: ProShares has launched the ProShares Ultra S&P 500 Equal Weight ETF (URSP), offering 2x daily leveraged exposure to the S&P 500 Equal Weight Index. This new ETF aims to provide even exposure across companies within the S&P 500, contrasting with traditional cap-weighted approaches. URSP will invest in derivatives and equity securities, rebalancing daily to track the index's performance.

title: Nvidia Earnings Live: Results Come in Slightly Above Wall Street Expectations; Stock Slips in Extended Trading
summary: Nvidia reported Q2 results slightly above Wall Street expectations, with revenue soaring 56% to a record $46.7 billion, but data center revenue and lower-end guidance for the current quarter fell short of estimates, leading to a 3% stock dip in after-hours trading. Investors are closely watching CEO Jensen Huang's comments on the company's outlook, China business, and next-generation product pipeline, particularly the forthcoming Rubin platform and the potential $50 billion China market opportunity. Despite these mixed results and ongoing China trade policy headwinds, analysts remain overwhelmingly bullish on Nvidia's long-term prospects due to strong AI demand.

title: Beamr Imaging Ltd. to Showcase Advanced Video Compression Solution for Autonomous Vehicles at IAA Mobility 2025
summary: Beamr Imaging Ltd. announced it will showcase its advanced video compression solution for autonomous vehicles (AV) at IAA Mobility 2025, from September 9-12 in Munich. The technology, validated by NVIDIA, significantly improves compression efficiency by 23% to 50% compared to existing machine learning workflows, reducing operational costs and enhancing development cycles for AV companies managing large datasets. Beamr's Content-Adaptive Bitrate (CABR) technology optimizes video quality while preserving crucial visual cues for AV models, addressing critical infrastructure challenges.

title: Nutanix Reports Fourth Quarter and Fiscal 2025 Financial Results
summary: Nutanix, Inc. reported strong financial results for its fourth quarter and fiscal year ended July 31, 2025, with 18% year-over-year revenue growth and substantial free cash flow. The company added over 2,700 new customers and strengthened partnerships with AWS, Pure Storage, NVIDIA, and Google, while innovating its cloud platform. Nutanix also provided an optimistic outlook for the first quarter and full fiscal year 2026.

title: CHAT and SOXX: The 2 Growth ETFs That Could Outperform VOO Over the Next Decade
summary: This article highlights two technology-centered growth ETFs, CHAT and SOXX, as potential outperformers against the Vanguard S&P 500 ETF (VOO) over the next decade. CHAT focuses on AI-forward companies, boasting significant returns despite higher fees, while SOXX provides strong exposure to the semiconductor industry, showing superior long-term growth compared to VOO. Both ETFs offer concentrated investments in rapidly expanding sectors, positioning them for substantial future growth.

title: NVIDIA Announces Financial Results for Second Quarter Fiscal 2026
summary: NVIDIA reported strong second-quarter fiscal 2026 results with revenue of $46.7 billion, up 56% year-over-year, driven by record Data Center revenue of $41.1 billion. The company's Blackwell Data Center revenue significantly grew, and NVIDIA announced a new $60 billion share repurchase authorization. NVIDIA also provided an optimistic outlook for the third quarter, projecting revenue of $54.0 billion.

title: Aehr Test Systems Announces Wafer Level Burn-in and Test Application Evaluation Order from Leading AI Processor Supplier
summary: Aehr Test Systems (NASDAQ: AEHR) received a purchase order from a leading AI processor supplier for a wafer level burn-in (WLBI) application evaluation. This paid evaluation includes a custom WaferPak high-power fine-pitch 300mm wafer contactor and production WLBI test program development, aiming to validate Aehr's FOX-XP production systems for high-performance AI processors. The evaluation program, expected to take three to six months, will compare WLBI with traditional package-level burn-in to demonstrate cost savings and improved yield by identifying failures earlier in the manufacturing process.

title: Super Micro Computer, Inc. (SMCI) Up 7.4% Since Jim Cramer Said “I’m Not A Beleiver”
summary: Super Micro Computer, Inc. (SMCI) has seen its stock rise 7.4% since Jim Cramer expressed skepticism about the company. Despite an initial cratering and a prior auditor resignation due to accounting impropriety allegations, SMCI's shares surged following an announcement about offering NVIDIA's Blackwell products and assurances regarding its earnings report filing. Cramer acknowledged SMCI's potential but highlighted concerns about its accounting practices, suggesting other AI stocks might offer better returns with less risk.

title: Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. (AMD)’s Shares Are An Example Of Volatility Since Cramer Said It Was Okay To Buy
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) shares have experienced significant volatility despite Jim Cramer's earlier endorsement. After initial gains, the stock saw a substantial drop, only to rebound strongly, driven by increasing AI bullishness and the belief in AMD's growing role in the AI chip market. Cramer reiterated his positive outlook on the company, citing strong products and leadership.

title: Broadcom Inc. Partners with NVIDIA to Integrate Advanced AI Technology into VMware Cloud Foundation
summary: Broadcom Inc. announced a partnership with NVIDIA to integrate advanced AI technology, including NVIDIA Blackwell GPU architecture and high-speed networking, into VMware Cloud Foundation (VCF). This collaboration aims to empower enterprises and cloud providers to scale AI model development in private clouds while preserving VCF's operational reliability. Key benefits include support for latest GPUs and networking, enabling efficient processing of generative and physical AI applications, all while maintaining core VCF functionalities such as vMotion and High Availability.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang Was Dubbed 'Godfather of AI.' The Company Is Betting On These AI Stocks
summary: Nvidia, an AI chipmaking giant, also strategically invests in other AI companies, as revealed in its quarterly SEC Form 13-F filings. Key holdings include CoreWeave, an AI cloud computing provider, Arm Holdings, an AI chip designer, and Applied Digital among others. These investments highlight Nvidia's broader strategy within the artificial intelligence sector beyond its core chip manufacturing business.

title: NYSEARCA:VUG ETF Climbs to $460 Near Record Highs on AI Growth and Earnings
summary: The Vanguard Growth Index Fund ETF (NYSEARCA:VUG) is trading near its all-time highs at $460, driven by the strong performance of mega-cap technology stocks, particularly those benefiting from AI and cloud expansion. The ETF's outperformance is attributed to robust earnings from its top holdings like Nvidia, Microsoft, and Alphabet, with a forecast of further upside supported by anticipated Fed rate cuts and continued economic growth. While its concentration in a few large names presents a risk, VUG's low expense ratio and historical returns make it a compelling allocation for long-term growth investors.

title: Shelton Capital To Launch SEPI ETF, Betting On Options-Income Boom
summary: Shelton Capital Management is launching the Shelton Equity Premium Income ETF (SEPI) on September 8th, entering the growing options-income ETF market. Unlike many competitors, SEPI will use an active strategy of selling covered calls on individual big-cap stocks to balance income generation and upside potential. This new ETF aims to attract income investors with its blend of option premiums and dividend distributions, capitalizing on the increasing popularity of actively managed derivative-income strategies.

title: Industry Leaders Transform Enterprise Data Centers for the AI Era With NVIDIA RTX PRO Servers
summary: NVIDIA announced that leading global enterprises, including Disney, Foxconn, and SAP, are adopting its new RTX PRO Servers to accelerate AI, design, and simulation applications. Powered by the RTX PRO 6000 Blackwell Server Edition GPU, these servers enable a shift to AI factory infrastructure without a complete data center overhaul. The technology offers breakthrough performance and flexibility, supporting diverse enterprise AI workloads and accelerating work in areas like digital twins, simulation, and business intelligence.

title: NVDA Earnings, AI Hype, and Cybersecurity Trends
summary: This article discusses key technology trends, including NVIDIA's upcoming earnings, the ongoing AI hype, and the growing importance of cybersecurity. It features insights from Ivana Delevska of Spear Invest, manager of the Spear Alpha ETF (SPRX), highlighting investments in AI, cybersecurity, and space technologies. The article touches on investor concerns about an AI bubble and the challenges of investing in the nascent space sector.

title: Gaming Giant GCL Acquires 30-Year Tech Distribution Powerhouse Ban Leong Technologies in Asia Push
summary: GCL Global Holdings (NASDAQ: GCL) has completed the compulsory acquisition of Ban Leong Technologies Limited through its subsidiary Epicsoft Asia, leading to Ban Leong's delisting from the Singapore Stock Exchange on August 26, 2025. This acquisition integrates Ban Leong's extensive technology distribution network across Asia, including partnerships with over 50 global brands, into GCL's gaming ecosystem. The move aims to create significant synergies, new revenue streams through gaming hardware and content, and expands GCL's market presence in crucial Asian markets.

title: 3 Reasons to Sell LBRDK and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: This article advises investors to sell Liberty Broadband (LBRDK) due to lackluster revenue growth, significant cash burn, and a short cash runway creating potential for shareholder dilution. Despite a cheaper entry price, the authors express low confidence in LBRDK and suggest looking into their top software and edge computing picks as better investment alternatives.

title: Tesla’s Stock Is in Trouble, but This Fund Manager Sees a Comeback in 2026
summary: Despite Tesla's stock being down 19.8% in 2025 due to declining sales and CEO Elon Musk's controversies, fund manager Joe Dennison of Virtus Zevenbergen Innovative Growth Stock Fund expects a comeback in 2026. Dennison believes the increasing role of autonomous vehicles, AI, new affordable models, and Tesla's strong fundamentals will drive its recovery. The fund has owned Tesla shares since shortly after its 2010 IPO and views it as a leader in AI, robotics, and sustainable energy, not just a car company.

title: Lambda Builds AI Factories with Supermicro NVIDIA Blackwell GPU Server Clusters to Deliver Production-ready Next-Gen AI Infrastructure at Scale
summary: Super Micro Computer, Inc. announced that Lambda has deployed a broad portfolio of Supermicro GPU-optimized servers, including NVIDIA Blackwell based systems, to expand its AI infrastructure and deliver high-performance systems to customers. This collaboration aims to build large-scale AI factories for training and inference, utilizing Supermicro's advanced liquid-cooling for energy efficiency. The initiative, first launched in Columbus, Ohio, provides enterprise-grade AI compute solutions to the Midwest region.

title: NVIDIA Blackwell-Powered Jetson Thor Now Available, Accelerating the Age of General Robotics
summary: NVIDIA has announced the general availability of its NVIDIA Jetson AGX Thor developer kit and production modules, designed to power advanced robotics and physical AI. Powered by Blackwell GPUs, Jetson Thor delivers significantly higher AI compute and energy efficiency than its predecessor, enabling robots to have real-time, intelligent interactions. Industry leaders like Agility Robotics, Amazon Robotics, Boston Dynamics, and Figure are among the early adopters, praising its capabilities for running powerful AI models at the edge.

title: Does Fed Rate Cut Hints Reinforce the Bull Case for Nelnet (NNI)?
summary: Shares of Nelnet (NNI), an education finance company, rose after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell hinted at potential interest rate cuts.
